name: Persiflage
description:
From the designer:

The game that has certain elements of such well-known games as dominos, liar's dice and bridge but with new limitations placed on the tiles and on the procedure. The game is played on a board having seven hexagonal areas of the same size, each being subdivided into six equilateral triangles of the same size, and thirty-six tiles of the same size which are shaped to overlie and fill the equilateral triangular areas.

The seven hexagonal areas are arranged such that one is in the center and the others are distributed around it, each having one side contiguous with the side of the centrally located hexagonal area and two sides which are contiguous with two other hexagonal areas. The tiles are formed in six groups, each group having a different distinctive surface marking which can be used for bidding and playing procedures.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Mob Boss
description: A simple roll and move game, where the objective is to be the first to be "The Boss". Just don't get whacked!

name: Goofy's Balloon Party Game
description: From Whitman and Walt Disney Productions, this 1975 children's game is won by the first player to play all of their balloon discs onto the balloon circles.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Rebels in the White House
description:
One of the Great Campaigns of the American Civil War series modules.

This one covers Jubal Early's 1864 invasion of Maryland. The game uses the maps from Here Come the Rebels and Stonewall Jackson's Way.

This module is found in The Skirmisher #2.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Pop Corn
description:
Pop Corn is a fast-playing dexterity game.

In a round, each players pop the popcorns. Popcorn token fall in the table center, and some will pop, other will not.

Then each player haves 15 seconds to collect the Popcorns on their cards to collect points as fast as they can, but they must be careful, as each useless popcorn gives penalties.

name: Det Store Indianer-Spil
description:
Det Store Indianer-Spil (The Great Indian Game) is about gaining control of the opposing player(s) village, by having more Indians in the village than the owning player.

The same goes for the different areas of land, where it is possible to take control of each segment by having more Indians in the segment, denying the opposing Indians access to the area.

The game features both roll and move rules as well as fixed movement rules. The game is also playable with and without cavalry, and with 2-4 players.

Note:
I've investigated this game rather heavily, and as far as I can tell it is from before 1962 (where it appears in a Toy-maker's Guild anniversary catalogue)
However, the publisher no longer exists, and the owner of the publishing toy company died in 1991, leaving little to no traces to follow.
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Dice, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Duke of Rutland's Chess
description:
This game was invented by John, third Duke of Rutland in 1747.

The game is played on a checkered board with 10 rows and 14 columns. In addition to the normal pieces of a chess game, a player has two crowned rooks, a concubine, one additional knight, two additional bishops, and six additional pawns.

The concubine has the combined moves of rook and knight while the crowned rook can move as a rook or can go one square diagonally.

name: Pit Green
description:
Pit Green is about 12cm high and a very precise Micro Golf Game.

This modern relative of the 'TIPP-KICK Soccer' opens for golfers and non-golfers a new perspective on the noble sport.

Home Page: Pit Green

name: Vietnam
description:
Vietnam, March 1965. The new bombing offensive "Rolling Thunder" cannot cut the Ho Chi Minh supply route. The U.S. High Command sets up a commando operation for destroying a bridge in a vital point of the supply route. 14 men will try to cross a trap-infested jungle, destroy the bridge and, what's more difficult, return alive...As soon as the commandos are discovered, Vietnamese reinforcements will arrive in mass and swamp the small group, that will have to run to save their lives.

As the last step of the set-up, the Vietnamese player writes secretly the situation of the traps spread in the jungle on an specially designed roster sheet.

The commandos can move in several speeds, the faster they travel, the lesser the chance to discover the traps. But time is limited, the bridge must be reached before dawn.

Game scale: individual soldiers, weapons and traps.
Can be played using 1:72 scale miniatures instead of cardboard counters.

Components: one 120x120cm full color mounted mapboard in four 60x60cm sections, a 76-page rules manual with historical notes, 600 counters, ammunition rosters and other play aids, game box.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Destination New York
description:
A game of taxi driving through New York. It's a rather random process of collecting fares, avoiding fines, and other such mishaps, while visiting many of New York's tourist destinations.

One of many in the "Destination" series.

name: Royal Netherlands Navy
description:
A 23-page supplement adding the Royal Netherlands Navy (RNN) and ABDA ships to General Quarters (Third Edition). It includes the RNN Surface Combat Charts, ship logs for both RNN and ABDA, formation cards for Dutch aircraft and three scenarios. There's also an article about a hypothetical British battle cruiser in Dutch service.

The scenarios are:


Brawl in the Badung Strait (ABDA vs. IJN 1942)
Battle of Borneo (RNN vs. IJN 1942, what-if)
Running the Gauntlet (RNN vs. IJN 1942, what-if)


The supplement is only available as an electronic document (PDF).

Expands:

General Quarters (Third Edition)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Boilers and Breechloaders
description:
"Being in the Main a Rules System for Miniature Colonial Naval Wargames, ca. 1860-1914 A.D."

Miniature wargame rules for coastal and riverine warfare for the colonial period. Intended to be used with The Sword and the Flame rules but can be played as a "stand alone".

name: The Sword in North Africa
description:
A The Sword And The Flame variant for the French Foreign Legion in North Africa. Includes organization charts for the French and Arab/Bedouin as well as additional rules.

Expands:

The Sword and the Flame


Expanded by:

The TSINA Event Deck
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Turn Order: Random
publishers: And That's The Way It Was...

name: Napoleonic Scenarios 3: The Glory Years 1800-1809
description:
The third volume in a series of Napoleonic scenarios. Designed for General de Brigade wargame rules but generic enough to be usable with other systems.

The scenarios included are:


Marengo, Part I: The Austrian Breakout (1800)
Marengo, Part II: The Blooding of the Consular Guard (1800)
Marengo, Part III: Desaix's Counter Attack (1800)
Haslach-Jungingen: The Kaiserliks Strike Back (1805)
Austerlitz, Part I: Attack on the Pratzeberg (1805)
Austerlitz, Part II: Attack on Stare-Vinohrady (1805)
Austerlitz, Part III: Attack of the Russian Imperial Guard (1805)
Auerstädt: Davout Against the Odds (1806)
Friedland: Ney's Attack (1807)
Eggmühl: Charles vs. Napoleon (1809)


Also included is an appendix with new rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Octacompass
description: Octacompass is a two-player strategy game that uses an eight-sided die to determine which direction your pieces can move. The die is labeled with the 8 directions of the compass which determines the direction your piece can move. You can 'bounce' piece off the edges of the board allowing for much more flexibility in controlling your piece movements. Octacompass is a mix of strategy and probability which makes for a truly unique two-player gaming experience.

name: Ancient Warfare Redux
description:
“Battle between ancient armies. Each figure represents a general, camp or unit of troops. Victory: You win if you destroy your opponent’s General or 8 of his units. A Camp counts as 2 units.”

Chits or miniatures are used to represent the combat units. The game is played on an 8x8 grid (or chessboard) to represent a small battlefield. Each army consists of a General, a Camp, and eleven other units. Each player places his units on his back two rows. Units may not stack. The players draw from a deck of cards and use their hand of cards to initiate movement and combat, and to defend against attacks.

name: Geonosis Arena Skirmish
description:
“Board & card game for 2 players. Battle between Jedi knights & Federation allies on Genosis. Takes place in the Star Wars Universe (Episode II). Each figure represents a Hero, Jedi, Creature or Unit of Troops. Victory: The game ends after you go through the deck twice when Yoda and the clone trooper gunships arrive. The player who has killed the most opposing units wins.”

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the combat units. There are ten Jedi units, twenty-two Federation units, and three Creature units.

A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw a hand of cards from a common deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, or defend. The Creatures in the arena are not allied with the Jedi or Federation. Either player may cause Creatures to Move or Attack by playing Creature Cards.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Durable Goods
description: “Economics Game. Players buy raw materials, manufacture products, and then sell them. Each player starts with $50 and no raw materials or products. Raw Materials Deck: The decks consist of 80 cards or chits. The deck contains 20 each of the following raw materials: Wood, Plastic, Metal, Fabric. Manufactured Goods Deck: Also called Durable Goods. Use chits or cards to represent the following manufactured goods: Houses, Furniture, Cars, Appliances, Clothing. Objective: Be the first player to accumulate $500.”
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: DECiMiX
description:
DECiMiX is a game where the aim is to be the player scoring the most points at the end when all tiles have been placed.
There is a pool of tiles in the centre of the table, and each player has a hand of 5 tiles. Each time a tile is placed, the player draws back up from the pool.
On each turn a player can play as many of their 5 tiles as they feel is advantageous - each tile played must adjoin a piece already on the board, and the numbers in each triangle of the tiles must add up to a total of 10.
Scores are made for completing squares of 4 pieces, and should be added to the players score tally as soon as the square is completed.

name: America's History: Multicultural Contributions to America ‚Äì Colonial Times to Reconstruction
description: This is primarily a trivia game. Players move around the board answering questions. The player with the most correctly answered questions wins. A set time period is used to determine when a particular game is completed.

name: Panzerschlacht
description:
Panzerschlacht- Das Spannende Brettspiel:

Tank Battle - Exciting Board Game

The map consists of a rectangular board with three color squares (representing terrain and impassable areas) and starting lines. The units consist of two sizes of tanks (small and large), both made of wood.

Each player has 10 small tanks and 8 big tanks. The tanks may move diagonaly in every direction. The small tanks have a moving range up to 6 spaces, while the big ones may move up to 4 spaces. Immediately after moving, the tanks may shot at an enemy tank. Shooting is only permitted straight ahead in the direction of the enemy encampment. The small tanks have a firing range of exactly 3 spaces, the big ones can shoot at tanks that are 3 or 4 spaces ahead. The dark green spaces can't be moved on, but can be shot over. When a tank is hit, it is removed from the game. If a tank neglects to shoot at an enemy, it may be removed by the enemy player. A tank, which has a friendly tank in the space in front of it, is protected from beeing shot at. If a tank reaches the enemy encampment, it reverses it's direction and attacks from the back. This makes a pincer tactic possible. The player who destroys the whole tank force of his opponent wins the game.

name: Don't Talk to Strangers
description:
"A new comprehensive game for an old problem!!!"
Don't Talk to Strangers - An educational game featuring Agent 911 for children, parents, grandparents, and, teachers. From People who care.

Ages 4 - 8

Equipment: game board, 6 playing pieces, 1 die, a deck of over 100 question & answer cards, and, 6 "Winner Awareness" certificates.

Purpose: Agent 911 has been created out of concern for the safety of children. "Don't Talk to Strangers" provides a simple and interesting way to learn the basic safety rules that are so necessary in today's society. Agent 911 encourages you to use "Don't Talk to Strangers" as a means to opening communication with children, to discussing family safety plans, and to establishing rules for the prevention of unhappy or tragic situations.

Object: Roll die, answer questions about child safety, move playing pieces around the board, be the first to return "Home Safe A Winner"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The British Army Tactical Wargame (1956)
description:
The British Army's take on operational wargaming from it's OR experience in WWII and Korea. It was designed to explore the potential of theatre nuclear weapons in hypothetical battles of the early Cold War era.

At its core is a recently de-classified set of rules by Lt. Col. Field found by Bob Cordery in the UK National Archives, and is published with suggested amendments and augmentations for the wargamer by the publisher, John Curry.

It uses a "kriegsspiel" format with a central umpire (controller) to implement the rules and feed relevant information to two sets of players. The umpire is there to provide information and implement the rules, not make his own assessments.

It works with orders given on an hourly basis to units on a 1:50,000 scale map or terrain model. Units are armour, infantry, artillery and engineers in battalion squadron and regimental sized units that operate, broadly, in 2km map squares. Combat resolution is probability driven and focusses on the need for TIME to plan co-ordinated assaults in attack or increase defence strength by preparing and digging in. One of the main purposes of the wargame was to allow officers to experiment with tactical nuclear warfare.

These are playable rules, but also a work of reference about operational warfare between 1940 and 1970.

Obtained from www.wargaming.co
categories: Korean War, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Armies of the War of Spanish Succession and the Great Northern War
description:
Army lists for Gå På miniature rules. With these army lists the players can re-fight early 18th century battles of the Great Northern War, the War of Spanish Succession, the Russo-Turkish War of 1711, the Jacobite Risings of 1715 and 1719, and the Hungarian Revolt.

A total 30 separate army lists are included. Some of them are variant lists of a same nation. The lists include some uniform information and suggested reading.

Expands:

G√• P√•: Wargame Rules for the Age of Marlborough, Eugene, and Charles XII ‚Äì Core Rules for 1700-1739
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Osbo
description:
Players share a pool of identical dice, each face of which shows a component of a Celtic knot work design. Each player starts with one die placed in their design. On each turn a player rolls one dice for each player, and adds one of those dice to each player's design. Designs are constrained to fit inside a 5x5 grid. When no more dice can be placed the game ends, and the player who has the single longest path with the most crossings wins.

Osbo may be played on-line at gamerz.net:

http://www.gamerz.net/pbmserv/List.php?Osbo

Full details are at the designer's web site:

http://cameronius.com/games/osbo
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Mayan Metropolis
description:
"Tile Laying game for 2+ players. Mayan City Building Theme. Victory: Score the most points by the end of the game. The game ends when all pieces (tiles) are placed or discarded."

The game is played on an 8x8 grid. A custom deck of cards and a set of tiles both depict monuments, buildings, and locations. There is a corresponding tile for every card. A random selection of cards are placed face up and the players take turn choosing cards. Once all the cards have been chosen, the players gather the pieces corresponding to their cards and take turn placing tiles on the board.

Points can be earned each time a tile is placed. The number of points depends on several factors, including the number of spaces adjacent to the tile which are occupied and whether there are plazas or causeways adjacent to the tile. Points are also earned for surrounding other tiles and filling in zones of the board.

name: Imperious
description:
"Board game for 4-8 players. Players control ancient civilizations."

The components include a map of the Mediterranean world divided up into 50 to 100 territories, different colored sets of population and city chits for each player, and a custom deck of 105 cards made up of equal numbers of the following seven card types: War, Culture, Population, Religion, Technology, Government, and Trade.

Each player starts with ten population chits in a starting territory at least five spaces from the starting territories of the other players. Each player also starts with three cards, which may be freely traded during a Trade Phase. A player's hand of card grows as the player gains more cities and population. Cards must be played to perform certain types of actions: Destroy, Grow, Convert, Colonize, Disperse, and Build.

"Victory: The first player to occupy over 50% of the territories with his chits wins."
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Wolf Pack
description:
"Card game. Deck of 90 cards. Simulation of U-boat attacks vs allied shipping during WWII. One player is the wolf pack, the other is the allied convoy." The custom deck includes six types of cards: Target, Detection, Attack, Evasion, Water, and Discard.

The Wolf Pack player wins if six Transports are destroyed. The Convoy player wins if four U-Boats are destroyed.

The game is available to download and was also published in Strategist #337 (April 2000).
categories: Card Game, Nautical, Print & Play, World War II
publishers: Strategy Gaming Society, Warp Spawn Games

name: Pixie Wars
description:
"Long Ago in the Land of Faerie there was a war between the Sprites and the Pixies. Board & card wargame for 2 players. One player is the Pixies and the other is the Sprites. Each figure represents a single faerie (unit)."

The game is played on a chess board or grid. There are eight different types of terrain: Clearing, Thorns, Water, Great Oak, Thick Growth, Magic Circle, Aerial Roots, and Forest.

Chits or miniatures to represent faeries. Each side has four types of units: King, Mage, Knight, and Warriors. Each unit type is rated for hit points, magic, melee, ranged attack, and poison. The players share a custom deck of cards. Card play is used to determine when units can move, defend, and attack.

"Victory: You win if you kill the opposing King."
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Alexander the Great's Campaigns
description:
A book on the campaigns of Alexander with detailed information on pay scales, organization, logistics and march rates to help the miniature gamer recreate an accurate tabletop campaign.

" This book includes what is probably the most detailed and accurate account of Alexander as a military commander so far published as well as all the information on march rates, logistics, pay, loot, sieges, armament, organisation and other related factors required by wargamers.

It describes the troops of Alexander's own armies and their opponents, their tactics and weapons and how these altered to meet changing circumstances. As well as being a tremedously exciting and stimulating read, the book is thus an essential reference source, at once of immense value to Ancient wargamers and food for thought to serious historians." (from the dustjacket)

name: Jenga: Oakland Raiders Collector's Edition
description:
Take the Raiders™ to the top!

Play Jenga® a fun new way – with Oakland Raiders blocks and Raiders dice that add excitement to the game! It’s the same great game with a Raiders twist. Build your tower with Raiders black and gray blocks. As the tower builds so does the difficulty. Custom Raiders Jenga rules make the game even more challenging and fun! Roll the dice and make the play… “Touchdown” reverses the direction of play; “Interception” allows you to remove one black and one gray block and the “Raiders Shield” means you pick another player to remove and stack any block. The last player to remove a block without tumbling the tower wins the game.

name: Legends of The Track
description:
Legens of the Track - 1,500 Metres

Legends is our third simulation of the classic track event. First came The Metric Mile, much played both solo and as a multi-play and postal game. Legends is an 'eye-in-the-sky' game, the user is 'looking down' on the track with no more involvement than rolling the dice, consulting the Charts and keeping the Race Control Sheet up-dated. A few years ago Legends could not have been published, the demand was all for 'involvement' games, where the user's input had a definite effect on the outcome. The Sport of Kings, with its many small decisions all affecting the final outcome, is typical of that genre.

The brief for Legends was for a non-involvement ATG simulation with races playable in 10-12 minutes, accurate as far as any mixed-era simulation can be, providing enough detail and stats. (split and final times) to keep the hard-core replay gamer happy and with a system that needed a minimum of book-keeping. With a simple but effective Track Display, one hundred ATG athletes who will run their races in the way they usually ran them in real life (but with ability to change race 'plans' if you wish) with times geared to 2007 standards, pace-makers, 'fast' and normal tracks, weather effects, race 'quality' effects and fitness levels.

Legends will be an ideal vehicle for solo campaigns, enough 'going on' to keep the interest at a high level, fun to run races, and the chance to run a full season incorporating Grand Prix meetings, Olympics (or World Championships), world-record attempts and with a few minor meetings flung in to keep the mix flexible.

--description from the publisher
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Race, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Orion Emperor
description:
This Orion Emperor is 4X game designed in the spirit of Master of Orion series for PC. The players take roles of leaders of the different races and factions and start to develop their newly founded space empires via exploring the space, making political decisions, managing of their parliament and preparing against all the possible encounters the game provides and of course against the other players who happen to share the same interest to rule the whole galaxy.

The essence of the game is your own parliament which needs constant management by strong leader to make sure the parliament makes the right decisions for the future of your empire. As your power and respect grows during the game, with careful planning your empire's parliament suddenly is making just the decisions their strong leader wants...but then also starts to happen the first contacts to other players which surely will open a can of worms of new challenges.

Orion Emperor (play test name: Master of Orion IV) has been under development for 2 years. The newest release is the 4th edition of Orion Emperor.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Exploration, Political, Space Exploration
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Zimmer's Baseball Game
description: This game was produced in 1893 and only 10 copies are known to have survived to the present day. It is one of the most sought-after baseball board games. In the game, players "swing" a miniature baseball bat affixed to the board to strike a ball.

name: Valley of the Dinosaurs
description: A spin and move board game for Ages 7 - 12. Comes with cardboard cutout players, spinner, board, and rules. Based on the Hanna-Barbera cartoon series of the same name. The object of the game is to help the Butler family make it safely across the valley to the caves.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric

name: Nova Glory
description:
Nova Glory is a boardgame of starship fleet combat. It uses a unique mechanic so the playing pieces do all the record keeping for you. Large fleet battles play quickly and the space map tiles allow for easy placement of various terrain features such as asteroids and planets. There are four races in the game each with their own back story and distinctive play style. Strategy cards simulate lucky shots or other special situations that add an element of surprise to the game. The turn sequence keeps both players involved throughout the entire game. Game includes several scenarios in addition to basic straight up fleet duels. Rules are easy to moderate to learn.

Publishers website:www.NovaGlory.com
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Star Strike Vessel Compendium #2: Pursuit Class
description:
This is an expansion for the board game Space Master: Star Strike and Space Master: The Role Playing Game. It includes stats for 32 different space vessels like MMACs, cutters, gunboats, TMACs, destroyers, cruisers, blockade runners and free traders. Also included are 3 optional pods for payload pallets, 2 adventures for Space Master: The Role Playing Game, 11 scenarios and mini-adventures for use with the included ships and 65 full-color counters.

This expansion was produced in 1989 by Iron Crown Enterprises.

Expands:

Space Master: Star Strike
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Chester Gump Hops Over the Pole
description: Chester Gump Hops Over the Pole is a spin and move game by Milton Bradley. The object is to get from Washington to Moscow by encountering and overcoming obstacles and detours along the way.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Decoder
description:
Decoder is so quick that you should think of it as a "warm up" game rather than a game to entertain you for a whole evening. It's simple to play, quick to explain and is a good ice breaker to get everyone into a 'gamesy' mood.

The game includes fifteen images and the idea of the game is to guess the phrase depicted by the image.

Free game here: http://www.amherstlodge.com/dirtycheats/fbg/downloads/games/...

name: 'Boats 'n' Coots
description:
This is a self-published expansion to Richard Berg's Confederate Rails. In addition to further loads and contracts, players are now forced to deal with the interference of Confederate Generals Braxton Bragg and Joe Johnston as they lead the South into defeat. To complicate matters further, there is now interference from Richmond as well as a Navy that believes that it has greater need of your scarce resources than your railroads.

With Confederate Rails available again from Richard Berg by inexpensive email print and play, the designer has once again made this available as well.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Rug Amuck
description:
RUG AMUCK
Ahtnam's Flying Carpet Marketplace has experienced an unexpected magical surge, which has caused the neatly piled flying carpets to run amuck.

The players, representing apprentice carpet riders, attempt to impress Ahtnam by organizing the showroom before doors open for business.

RUG AMUCK is a matching game where players are attempting to match pairs of flying carpets. The player who matches the most pairs will impress Ahtnam and be named the Master Carpet Rider. Just pay close attention to the carpets that all look somewhat alike, and don't forget to watch your back.

Rug Amuck includes:
48 flying carpet tiles (24 pairs)
5 apprentice pawns
1 die
5 player summary cards
1 rules sheet

Rules sheet includes 3 methods of play ranging from friendly to cut throat.

name: New World Disorder: Zombie Apocalypse!
description:
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE! adds bloodthirsty zombies to your New World Disorder: urban skirmishes in a dark future games. Pit swarms of zombies against existing crews, but pay heed--your fallen comrades will rise and turn on you when least expected. Even loot cars and other areas for lost and hidden gear.

Available in PDF format, and as a Printed Set with full-color paper miniatures and cardboard counters.

Expands:

New World Disorder: urban skirmishes in a dark future
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies

name: Pleasure Island
description:
From the box:

Players move their game tokens through the tropical Island full of romance and passion. Each square holds its own adventure. As your tokens land on the squares, you and your lover must perform the activities listed. If a player lands on either a Pleasure Chest or a Prisoner of a love square, he or she must draw a card from the corresponding card pile and perform the activity listed on the card. Once the activity is completed , the card is returned to the bottom of the deck and play continues. The player that completes the game first, by landing on the "X", can choose to keep the game going by selecting two cards from each pile and performing the activities.

Contents: 2 Game Tokens, 1 Game Die, 22 Pleasure Chest Cards, 22 Prisoner of Love Cards & 1 Game Board

name: Luftkampfspiel des Adler
description: Published in 1941 by Der Adler, the Luftwaffe (German Air Force) illustrated magazine, this easy children game see the two players sending their aircraft to bomb enemy targets. No need for a die - a spinner in the corner gives the random number for movement. This is a little game similar to richer boxed games from the same period as Adler Luftkampfspiel and Adler Luftverteidigungsspiel.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jump Force: Alpha
description:
From the publisher's website:

The Year: 2357 AD
Human beings from the planet Earth have expanded into the far reaches of space. For over 100 years, humanity has explored, colonized and expanded civilization on new, unpopulated planets and has made no contact with any sentient forms of life... Until now!

Recently, an outpost on Copernica Prime has ceased to transmit regular communications with Earth. Probes show no sign of survivors but return signals of some form of advanced Cybernetic beings. Damage to the colony leaves no doubt a violent struggle occurred and the colonies put up a fight.

Your orders: Deploy a small force, gather intelligence, search and destroy. The force deployed ... Jump Force Alpha!

Game System:

Solitaire action where by the Human Forces player plans his assault on the captured colony and executes his move. The play of the Robotics player is generated by programmed moves. Robotics automatically respond to the Human players moves and Robots move towards the closest human and attack.

Object of the game is determined by the type of mission mounted. Before the Human player may enter the colony settlement, the perimeter fence must be breached. Once breached, the alarm is sounded and the Robots begin to deploy and move.

Human player must execute the mission, leave no marine behind and return to the carrier transport to get off world and win the game.

name: Cheshire Ring
description:
The Canal Age and the Industrial Revolution that birthed it produced several new transportation systems, one of which was a circular canal network known as the Cheshire Ring. Narrow boats were pulled around the ring carrying stone, coal, and iron for use in development of the landscape. The boatmen were paid for delivery and paid the expenses of the trip from this amount. One of the largest expenses was tolls, which were set not only on the amount of goods but also the type of goods carried. Clever but unscrupulous boatmen soon learned that by mixing loads they could fool the toll keepers to help reduce their expenses.

Each player owns two narrow boats and use actions to move their cargo from one market to another along the canal. As they move through the toll houses (the signature Stratamax colored dice), the house owner must be paid. It is up to the toll house owner to decide whether to take the toll offered or use an action to inspect the load in case the boatman is trying to rip him off. If caught in a deception, the boat owner pays a fine. However, if the boatman was honorable then the toll house owner gets a penalty for the time and delay caused.

name: Mad Labs
description:
Mad Labs: The Maniacal Mix-N-Match Game of Monstrous Mayhem

As rival mad scientists, you compete to create the most powerful horde of monstrosities to rule the countryside. No! The entire province! No! The world! Bwa-ha-ha-ha!

Through out the game you will play monster Body Parts from your hand to the table. Each part has a unique ability or power. Once a monster is complete (has one of each Body Part) it can start using these powers for you to help you achieve your goals. Each monster is worth a certain amount of points. Incomplete monsters (monsters under construction or MUCs) are worth negative points. If a player starts his or her turn with a set amount of points in their army of monsters he or she wins the game.

name: Sol Invictus: The Copernican Wars
description:
War has spread throughout the solar system, with factions using gravimetrics, atomics, and psionics to aid troopers as they invade and conquer planets to gain supremacy.

Star Fleet is fractured, Earth Command has become a vast telepathic neural net, and the asteroid belt is prey to teracorporations who parley with the Interplanetary Space Stations for peace.

In the midst of it all, an alien artifact mysteriously appears beyond the dwarf planet Pluto.

It is time to conquer the solar system in wars of the future.
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Solar Racers
description:
A space race card game for two or more players. Each player controls a space ship. The first ship to travel 100 Astronomical Units wins the game.

The game uses a deck of sixty-five cards. There are four types of cards in the deck: Propulsion, Difficulty, Breakdown, and Repairs. Players advance by playing Propulsion Cards. Difficulty Cards can be played to negate specific Propulsion Cards. Breakdown Cards can be played on opposing players. A Breakdown Card stays in effect until it is repaired with the appropriate Repair Card.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Spelljammer
description:
“Battle between Good & Evil in the SpellJammer Universe. Based on the AD&D RPG by TSR. Card game for 2+ players.” The players form fleets of ships and attempt to control Locales.

Each player must play as good or evil. They players use a deck containing eight types of cards: Locales, Ships, Monsters, Equipment, Crew, Characters, Events, and Combat.

The winner is the player who controls the most Locales when the deck runs out.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Down in Flames: Air Umbrella Over Dunkirk
description:
Air Umbrella Over Dunkirk is an extension module to the "Down In Flames"-Series - Volume 1: The Rise of the Luftwaffe game by GMT.

The British Expeditionary Force was facing total annihilation after the lightning campaign waged by the Germans in France and the Low Countries. Deciding to rest the Panzer divisions, Hitler entrusted Goering's Luftwaffe with the mission of smashing the British evacuation at Dunkirk. The already thinly stretched RAF had to provide an air umbrella to protect the stream of ships plying the English Channel. Although the British lost the equivalent of six squadrons of fighter aircraft plus a large number of ships sunk or damaged they managed to evacuate over 300,000 Allied soldiers, including the bulk of the BEF.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: A las Barricadas!: La Guerra del Rif
description:
War Storm Series presents a free A las Barricadas! module, La Guerra del Rif (1920-1926) (The Rif War).

In this first print & Play free module, we try to represent the special characteristics of this unknown war. Some special rules change the A las Barricadas! v2 engine. This first scenario includes one overlay, 71 new counters, specific rules and a ammo chart.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: 1897Large
description: An 18xx game. Map covers: Northern Kanto area, Japan
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation

name: The Defence of Duffer's Drift
description:
Lt. Backsight Forethought has been left at Duffer's Drift with a simple task. Prevent a Boer detachment from crossing the river. He has 50 men, good and brave, to do the deed. Through a series of dreams he goes from failure to success. Play the game and you will learn as well.

The Defence of Duffer's Drift is a war game with role-playing elements based on Chris' Engle's Encounter Matrix Game rules. The game includes a reprint of Captain E. D. Swindon's book, a classic of Boer War strategy (Swindon went on to serve as a Major General in World War I).

The game board and pieces are hand-made and include the maps from Swindon's book.

From the box:
ROLEPLAYING: Good
COMPLEXITY: High
SOLO PLAY: Fair
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Imperial Guard II
description:
Imperial Guard II is a set of fast-playing Napoleonic era miniatures rules, for use with 15mm or 25mm miniatures.

The rules are supplied in a 25-page softcover digest format, in a ziplock bag, with 3 letter-size combat charts.

This is a sequel to Little Soldier Games' 1976 effort, Imperial Guard.

name: HipBone Games
description:
"The HipBone Games are board games in which players link one fact or idea with another, claiming points for each link."

The game is played on a board made up of ten spaces connected to one another by lines. A variety of boards with varying layouts and connections are available. Current boards include Psyche's Board, Tenstones, WaterBird, Pentagram/Mercedes, and Circuit Board.

Players take turns writing "ideas" into vacant spaces on the board. In competitive play, players score points "by claiming links between the idea in their own move and the ideas already in play in those positions on the board connected to it by the lines of the board in question. A link can be any form of association - similarity, opposition, cause-and-effect, metaphor. Fanciful links may be made and enjoyed - or hotly contested."

"The HipBone Games are based on the concept of the Glass Bead Game described by Hermann Hesse in his Nobel-winning novel, Magister Ludi. They are foremost among current attempts to bring Hesse's game concept into implementation."

name: The King's Caste
description:
The King's Caste is a modified Tarot deck that was designed to answer this question: What if European Chess were a card game?
It is compatible to any Standard Card game, or Tarot Card game, yet there are subtle differences that allow for wider range of game play/design.

The 86-card deck contains the following:

16 cards in each of the four French suits (spades, hearts, diamonds, and clubs):
10 numbered cards:
8 pawns (value 1–8, #1 is hashed)
2 bishops (value 9–10, #10 is hashed)

6 face cards:
2 rooks (one hashed)
2 knights (one hashed)
1 queen
1 king


22 trump cards
I–XXI
0
categories: Card Game, Game System, Print & Play

name: The gift increase of Haruhi Suzumiya
description:
Japanese home-brew

Translated from the box back:
"I'm telling you, we're here for the win! I won't allow one single loss! I HATE to lose!"
In this game, players take the roles of characters in "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya", and tries to fulfill his/her victory conditions all the while trying to figure out who plays who. Let Haruhi win, conceal your identity, see through your opponents' plans and live out the events in the SOS group.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: The Berenstain Bears Giant Card Game
description:
From the back of the box:

"The object of play is to collect the four members of the Berenstain Bear family (Mama, Papa, Brother and Sister Bear) and their matching hats.

The begin play, shuffle the cards and place them face-down in the center of the table. The top card is turned face-up and placed in a separate discard pile. Decide who will play first. The first player selects the top card from either the draw or discard pile. If the selected card is a Berenstain Bear, the player takes the card and places it in front of him. If the card is a hat or WIND card, the player places it on the discard pile. Play passes to the left with the next player selecting a card from either the draw or discard pile.

As players collect members of the Berenstain Bear family, the may "cap" each character with the appropriate hat. For example, on his first turn a player draws a Brother Bear card. On a later turn he draws Brother Bear's baseball hat. He may then "cap" Brother Bear by placing the hat card on the Brother Bear card. If a player draws a hat but does not have the character that matches it, OR if the character already has his/her hat, the card must be discarded. Note that some cards feature two hats. Players may choose which hat, if any, to use and "cap" the appropriate bear. Once a character is "capped", the hat may not be removed unless it is blown off by a WIND card (see below).

If a player draws a WIND card, he may blow one hat off any of his opponents' cards. The hat and WIND cards are then placed on the discard pile. A player may not remove a WIND card from the discard pile.

The first player to match all four Berenstain Bear characters with their correct hats wins the game.

name: Roadkill
description:
From the Publisher:

"Most hunters use stealth, sharp instincts and a loaded rifle to claim their prize.

Not You.

You prefer the loud thundering of diesel engines.

You live for that look on your prey's face as it glances up and sees nothing but headlights and bumper.

You aren't the only one either.

It's the National Roadkill Championships and the best are here to test their wits and cars against one another.

Happy Hunting."

Also requires d4, d6, d8 and d10 to play.

name: Picco Contrario
description:
A memory game another way round:
Instead of looking for a match, an opposite must be found as quickly as possible: round and square, short and long, heavy and light. Who can find the most pairs?

contents:
20 Picture cards depicting 10 opposite pairs
Instructions

name: The Exploits of the French Resistance
description:
The game follows The Exploits of the French Resistance during WW2. It is a 2 player game of bluffing and deception. Each player selects his squad by dealing "X" amount of cards and then selecting only one, he continues until his pack is exhausted, he now has his squad. It may be good, as it is hand picked, but is it the best he would have liked?

After each player has selected his squad the squads go to work. The Resistance player knows what his objective is, it is up to the German player to discover this and to ensure he has enough troops to stop the Resistance from being successful.
categories: Bluffing, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: The Rigelian Wars 2146-3705
description:
The Rigelian Wars 2146-3705 represents the series of wars fought between the expanding Rigelian Empire and the collapsing Altair-Mizar Dynasty.

The game consists of a series of "mini-games" which are referred to as "wars". Each of these consists of an indefinite number of turns. Separating the wars are special "peace periods" during which construction of new ships and redistribution of forces takes place. The turns within the wars consist of movement and combat phases.

Rigelian Wars is an amateur early DTP (mimeograph) that contains a 4 piece (8.5 x 11) map, two strips of unmounted counters, and 6 pages of rules. Three scenarios, low-complexity, fairly standard wargame mechanics, production, warp (and hyper-warp) movement, ground units, and a Cobalt Bomb that destroys everything in the target hex!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Rally Point Volume 1: Axis Minor Special Study
description:
Rally Point Volume 1 is theme based Advanced Squad Leader scenario pack from the publishers of Schwerpunkt. All 10 scenarios focus on actions that contain Axis Minor units, so you can get more use out of Armies of Oblivion.

RP1 Ferenc Jozef Barracks - Hungary January 12, 1945
Romanian units attacking a Hungarian unit in Budapest.

RP2 Kerepesi Cemetery - Hungary January 11, 1945
Russian Pioneer unit attacking a Romanian unit with supporting Stug IIIGs in Budapest.

RP3 Varismajor Grange - Hungary January 22, 1945
Hungarian infantry and assault guns counterattack Russian units in Budapest.

RP4 Transylvania 6-5000 - Romania September 19, 1944
Hungarian infantry and assault guns attacking Russian units and T-34s outside of Lippa Transylvania.

RP5 The Horvath Interlude - Russia January 18, 1943
A Hungarian motorized battalion attacks Russian infatnry and armor units outside of Alexeyevka.

RP6 Cadets and Cadre - Romania September 17 1944
Hungarian armored division attacking a hill defened by Romaina infantry and at guns.

RP7 Romanian Hammers - USSR October 26, 1942
Romanian mountain divsion with assault guns attack Russian infantry units outside the town of Nalchik.

RP8 Well Taught - Austria April 12, 1945
SS Panzer Grenadier units attacking Soviet and Romanian infantry and armor outside the town of Hohenruppersdorf.

RP9 Shelling the Sivash - USSR April 8, 1944
Russian infantry and armor, supported by partisans, attack a mixed unit of Romanian and German infantry and armor in the Crimea.

RP10 Slovak Salvation - Ukraine November 8, 1942
Ukranian partisians attack units from a German/Slovak security division outside the village of Lojev.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Land of Psymon
description:
Psymon is a psycho therapeutic board game, designed to teach the basics skills of cognitive restructuring therapy to children Ages 8 - 14.

From the publisher's website:

Each of the 10 "bad" Psymon ("psychological monsters") represents a negative thinking pattern and common cognitive distortion. Players learn about their modes of attack and strategies for defending against them. The 6 "good" Psymon exhibit the positive cognitive-behavioral skills that defeat negative thinking habits. Players earn points by identifying the good and bad Psymon at work in the situations described on Think cards.
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Imperial Stars
description:
A cardgame of starship combat

Each player picks one of the four races. Shuffle the action cards and deal 7 cards to each player. The remainder of the action cards form the Draw Pile.

Ships are placed in a battle-line in front of the player. Adjacent ships assist when defending against fighter/bomber attacks. The maximum number of ships on a battle-line
is three.

Each ship card represents an individual capital ship. The card contains all the ratings describing the capabilities of that ship.

Turn Order:
1. Repair
2. Activation or Deployment
3. Attack Phase
4. Defend
5. Resolve Damage/Boarding Actions
6. Discard (up to 2 cards)
7. Draw (back up to 7 cards)

Free game from Zero Radius Games:
http://www.zeroradiusgames.com/downloads.html << link is not working.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Bonaparte
description:
Bonaparte is a card game for 2 players, which simulates the Napoleonic Wars, where one player manages a French armies of Napoleon and the other administers the British armies of George III.

The game consists in the administration of cards that represent military units and officials, where each battles occur between 2 armies, combining strategy, power of unit and dices.

The battles depends on the type of card, its military force, the strength and influence of the official card, all together define the outcome of battles, therefore, the game requires strategy in the selection of officers and troops to the fighting.

Every battle the winners compute the Points of Victory and add strategic choices for the next fight.

The Card Game is Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: A Cloud Across the Land: Battle of Chancellorsville
description:
From the publisher:

A Cloud Across the Land: Battle of Chancellorsville will be the first title in a series of American Civil War regiment/brigade level games. There are 6 progressing scenarios, which enable the play of either single aspects of the 3 day battle, or the complete battle. There are basic, advanced, and optional rules enabling the wargamer to play the game at the level of complexity he finds best suited. The advanced rules include command and control, constructing and dismantling of fortifications, special cavalry rules, attacking/combat modifiers, advanced unit step losses, special combat capabilities for Berdans sharpshooters, and morning / evening combat modifiers [The "Has Your Coffee Kicked In Yet?" Rule] that can be introduced singly or as a unified set of rules.

Optional rules deal with repairing / employing captured artillery, using a mounted cavalry attack, unit morale, concealed units, terrain values, and using variable leader values (ever wonder what would happen if a good leader had a bad day, and a bad leader had a good day?).

Contains:

one 22 by 34 inch map
500 die-cut back printed counters
rules booklet
6 scenarios
charts and tables cards
two dice -- one blue, one gray
boxed

name: End of Days
description:
From the publisher:

Doomsday Scenario
Date‚Ä≠: ‚Ä¨1966

The height of the Cold War‚Ä≠, ‚Ä¨the early days of the Space Race‚Ä≠. ‚Ä¨International astronomers discover a massive asteroid hurtling towards the inner solar system‚Ä≠...‚Ä¨and an eventual‚Ä≠, ‚Ä¨inevitable collision with Earth‚Ä≠.‚Ä¨

Your job‚Ä≠: ‚Ä¨
1‚Ä≠.‚Ä¨ Build rockets to get a chosen few of your people safely to Mars
2‚Ä≠.‚Ä¨ Sabotage the projects of your enemies
3‚Ä≠.‚Ä¨ Do not start a cycle of retribution that results in the extinction of humanity

End of Days is a tongue-in-cheek tactical card game for 3-6 players, where you have to cooperate and trade with the same people you're trying to sabotage and leave behind, in a Machiavellian cross between a game of Chicken and Russian Roulette.

Suitable for Ages 12 and up, and takes half an hour to over an hour to play, depending on the number of players.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Check Your 6! Falcon of the Duce
description:
Falcon of the Duce: is a scenario and campaign book for the popular Check Your 6! Air Combat and Campaign Rules. This book contains 16 historical scenarios for recreating the aerial campaigns of Italian Ace Franco Lucchini from 1940 to 1943. The scenarios can be played individually or linked to form a single campaign.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain historical background information including insight into the the battles involving Lucchini. The book also includes a campaign map and bibliography for further reading.

Aircraft Statistics: this book contains statistics for 23 aircraft featured in the campaign in aircraft statistics for Check Your 6!! .

Table of Contents


Campaign Introduction
References
Axis and Allied Aircraft Statistics for Check Your 6!
Campaign Rules
Scenarios (16)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Rekushu
description:
Rekushu (semi-transliteration of "Rectangle" into Japanese) is a territory game played on a square board.

Players take turns placing their stones on empty intersections trying to form the vertices of rectangular regions. A rectangle that doesn't have other stones or claimed territory in its interior can be claimed by a player. The object is to have the majority of claimed cells when the board fills up.

name: Surf Game
description: In this game you are a famous Brazilian surfer and must be the first to surf five points in order to win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Winning Edge
description:
The Winning Edge

This is a U.S. Army artillery training device that uses a question-and-answer trivia game format.

It appears to have been printed in the late 1970s or early 1980s.

Category titles include MOS/Specialty, NBC, Fieldcraft, Crew Served Weapons, and Uniforms. Players must also complete FFE (Fire For Effect) missions and TOT (Time On Target) missions by answering questions when landing on these spaces.

Includes a colorful game board, 12 decks of question cards, 6 plastic cannon playing pieces, scoring pins, dice, and a plastic storage tray.

Designed for 2 to 6 players or teams.

name: Katro
description:
A mancala game.

From Mancala World:
http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Katro

"Katro is played by the Betsileo people in Fianarantsoa in the southern highlands of Madagascar. The game was described by the Dutch mancala researcher Alexander Johan de Voogt during an extensive field study in 1998. The board is usually dug in the earth and the players, mostly adult women and men, are often surrounded by a curious crowd of spectators.

Rules:

Katro is played on a 6x6-board, a very unusual size for a mancala game. Each player owns one half (upper or lower) of the board.

Initially there are two stones in each hole.

You must start your move in the outermost row of your side which has a non-empty hole. Singletons can also be moved.

Moves are multi-lap. As in four-rank Mancala you only move on your side.

If the last stone is dropped into a non-empty hole, all contents are picked up and are distributed one by one in the following holes by continuing in the same direction.

If the last stone of a lap is dropped into a non-empty hole which is directly opposite to a non-empty hole of your opponent, all the contents of his hole are captured. His stones and the contents of your own hole are then distributed in a new lap starting in the next hole on your side. The following conditions must be met to effect a capture:


As long as you have a non-empty hole in your innermost row, you may only capture from your innermost row. When your innermost row is empty you capture from your central row, if this row is also empty, you capture from your outermost row.



You may only capture opponent's stones from his innermost row as long as there are still non-empty holes. If these holes are all empty you may capture stones from your opponent's central row. If this row is also empty you capture opponent's stones from his outermost row.


The game is played in a boustrophedon manner. The direction of play is either (see notation below) abcdefghijklmnopqrfedcbalkj or alkjihgrqponmabcdefgh.

Notation

a b c d e f
l k j i h g
m n o p q r
M N O P Q R
L K J I H G
A B C D E F

Players are not permitted to pass a move.

The game ends when a player has no move. The player who moved last is declared winner."

name: Kisolo
description:
Kisolo (also called Cisolo in Kasai) is a mancala type game played by the Luba, Lulua and Songye in the southeast of the Democratic Republic of Congo. Initially there are three seeds (makombo) in each hole.

If a player cannot capture, he starts his turn by emptying one of his holes and then distributes its contents one by one counterclockwise into the following holes. When he can't capture (see below), he makes a new lap by distributing the contents of the hole following the hole in which he dropped the last seed in hand. The move ends when the last hole is followed by an empty one. It is either possible to capture before the actual move starts or during a move.

If, at the beginning of a turn, two inner holes (one from each player) opposite to each other contain seeds, the enemy seeds of the opposite hole and, if there are any, of the enemy hole of the same file behind it are picked up and then distributed counterclockwise on the own side. The first seed must be put into the hole which effected the capture. This kind of capturing is compulsory, but the player is free to decide from which holes he captures when he has more than one choice.

If the last seed falls into a non-empty hole and the following hole is in the inner row and contains seeds, the contents of the opposite enemy hole in the opponent's inner row are captured and also the seeds in the outer enemy hole just behind it. Again, the captured seeds are distributed on the player's own side, starting in the hole which effected the capture (that is, straight opposite the captured holes).

The player who captures all seeds of his opponent's inner holes is declared winner, no matter how many seeds his opponent still has in his outer row. The game is a draw, if a move doesn't end. Perpetual sowing occurs, for instance, if empty holes alternate with holes containing one seed, when at the beginning of the turn, no two inner holes opposite of each other have seeds."
publishers: (Public Domain), Fratelli Fabbri Editori  (Fabbri Editore), Geoludie

name: Miss√∫md√†likoi
description:
Missúmdàlikoi is a large-unit, board war game set on M.A.R. Barker's world of Tékumel. It was published in Volume 2, Issue 1 of Seal of the Imperium, a publication of Zottola Publishing, Inc. (www.zotpub.com). The rules for the game appear on pages 132-199 of that issue.

Rules for two scenarios are included: a two-player Salarvyáni offensive into Tsolyánu and a 2-4 player Tsolyáni invasion of Salarvyá.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Sad√©qa
description:
A mancala game. From http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Sad%C3%A9qa:

Sadéqa is the generic name for mancala games known in the southwest of Ethiopia and nearby Sudan.

This particular variant is played by the Jimma who live in western Ethiopia. It was described as Sadéqa V (Game 84) by Richard Pankhurst, who stated that it used to be a popular pastime at the court of Abba Jifar. While the king had wooden boards called bolo sadéqa, boys simply dug holes in the ground, and women were not allowed to play the game at all.

Rules:

The game is played on a board of 2x10=20 holes. Initially each hole contains four seeds.

Seeds (lon) are distributed counter-clockwise, one by one, in a multi-lap fashion into the following holes until the last seed is dropped into an empty hole, a warana ("speared") or an opponent's hole containing exactly three seeds thus making four (a warana). A move may begun from any hole of your own side, except a warana.

A warana can only be made on the opponent's side and is said to be owned by his creator.

When the last seed falls into a warana that is owned by his opponent, he captures it and another seed of that warana. If the warana was empty, the player captures only one seed. In any case the player makes a bonus move by starting from any hole of his side which is not a warana.

The move ends if the last seed is dropped into an empty hole, creates a warana or falls into a warana which is owned by the player.

Passing is not permitted as long as there is a legal move.

The game ends when all remaining seeds are in warana, i.e. neither player has a legal move left.

Each player has as many points as he has captured seeds and has seeds in his warana at the end of the game. The player with most points wins.

Strategy:

A warana is an important mean of winning the game - or losing it! Often it is hard to judge whether they help you or your opponent more. Usually, it is good for you to create a warana only if it is located in your opponent's first three holes."

name: Adji-boto
description:
A mancala game. From Mancala.Wikia.com:

Adji-boto ("pebble boat") is a mancala game which is played by the Saramaccans who live on the upper Saramacca river in Suriname. The Saramaccans are a tribe of Bush-Negroes which was formed by escaped slaves. The first field study on the game was conducted by the American ethnologue Melville J. Herskovits (1895-1963) in 1928 in the village of Beidotti. The game resembles mancala games known in Benin, West Africa.

The game is used to entertain the dead during the ten-day period preceding burial in the kre wosu, or house of mourning. The play is only carried out during the daylight hours because in the night the yorkas, or ghosts of the dead, would come and play with us and eventually carry away our spirits.

The boards are only carved by old widowed men because this is a serious issue. They are made in two shapes, those having straight tops, and those in which the tops are curved. A village should have both types, so that if a person was fond of one kind of board dies, the people can play for a time on the other and there will be a lessened danger of his ghost coming to play with them. Although the Bush-Negroes are fine wood-carvers the Saramacca boards are of the roughest. This is because of the sacred character of the game which is not one which can be hurried in playing. It must entail some effort and even pain to bring it to perfection.

Rules
Adji-boto is played on a board called adji-bangi ("pebble stool") that consists of 2x5=10 holes. In addition, each player has a store called boto ("boat") at his right hand.

Each hole contains 10 stones called adji ("pebbles") at the start of the game.

Each turn a player distributes the contents of one of his holes, except one stone that remains in the hole, one by one, in consecutive holes in an anti-clockwise direction.

In the first ten moves of the game all of the ten playing holes must be played.

It is only permitted to play a hole which contains at least two stones.

It is not allowed to pass a move unless a player has no legal move left.

If the last stone ends (kaba) in a hole which precedes another hole or a continuous chain of holes that contains one, three or five stones (including any sequential combinations), these stones are captured and put into the player's boto. It is possible to capture on either side of the board. The only exception is the opening move in which nothing is captured. If a Bush-Negro captures he says: "I eat your children!" (Mi nyam yu p'kin kaba!)

The game is finished when both players can't move.

The remaining stones are captured by the player on whose side they are.

The player who has won most stones is declared winner. It is said that "the loser is killed!" (a kiri mi kaba!).

If both players captured the same number of stones the game is a draw.

name: Sprawl
description: In Sprawl, players buy cards to add to their individual cities. The cards represent city blocks that advantage the players in different ways. Some cards earn players money (which score at the end of every round except the last), some are strictly population (which are only scored at the end of the game) and others are a combination of the two. Price is determined by the rolling of dice, more dice are rolled with every round as the game progresses. The winner is the player with the most populous city at the end of the 5th round of play. The game involves bidding, tile placement and big pay-offs each round.

name: Trivia Fever
description:
Trivia Fever is a simple trivia game designed to be played with or without an Apple II.

If used with your Apple, then it takes care of picking questions and answers. If you use the book, then the players have to choose the questions using a spinner and keep track of the scores on the provided scorepad.

It was also released for the Tandy Color computer.

name: Dogger Bank II: Battlecruiser Action in the Great War
description:
Published in Panzer Digest Naval Special 2008 Supplement.

This is a complete wargame covering battlecruiser action during the Great War. The original design appeared in Panzerschreck Magazine #5 and this edition is a modified and expanded version.

This is a simple two-player game of dreadnought tactics. This second edition is a refinement of the original game and employs the "Advanced" combat tables used in the Dreadnoughts & Battlecruisers system, more ships and more scenarios.

Scale ship counters, which need to be cut out, are maneuvered directly on the table top and moved into firing range where combat may occur.

The first scenario is called Dogger Bank. Others include Falklands 1914, Battlecruiser Action 1916 and Goeben vs. Cruisers, plus DYO possibilities.

name: Superheroes and Supervillains
description:
This is one of the "paint and play" games published by Heritage, USA. The kit includes eight 25 mm metal cast miniatures, primer, paints, painting guide and adventure game rules.

The superheroes in the set are known as "The Knights of Justice". They include The Crimson Crusader, Donarr, Hornet, and Dragonflame. The supervillians from "The Syndicate of Terror" include Doctor Death, Pyro, Behemoth, and the Black Scorpion.

Each figure possesses seven attributes: Speed, Climb, Agility, Fire-power, Range, Strength and Endurance. Each figure also has special abilities in keeping with their super-heroic (or super-villainous) persona. Dice are used to resolve melee and ranged weapon combat. Rulers are used to measure figure movement.

name: Second World War at Sea: Imperial and Royal Navy
description:
From the original Avalanche Press website entry:

When Austria-Hungary dissolved in November 1918, the remnants of her once-proud fleet scattered among the victorious Allies, with most of the warships cut up for scrap within a few years. Had the empire somehow survived the Great War, through diplomatic or military means, she would have entered the crisis of 1939 as a considerable force at sea.

Imperial and Royal Navy is a Second World War at Sea supplement exploring the possibilities of this alternate history. It has everything you expect in a naval game supplement: scenarios, ship data sheets, and playing pieces.

The supplement includes ten scenarios, or separate game situations, based on battles that might have been waged by this unlikely fleet. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Bomb Alley to enjoy most of the scenarios, and Eastern Fleet, Arctic Convoy and Bismarck to play all of them.

Imperial and Royal Navy was originally sold exclusively via PDF download. In 2011 a printed edition with die-cut counters was published. The supplement will be re-implemented in 2014 as SWWAS: The Habsburg Fleet, adding more ships and a set of scenarios aligned with the Second Great War at Sea story arc.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Redemption
description:
Redemption is a satirical look at the Catholic Church. Players take turns traveling the paths of Grace or Sin while gaining chips for Mortal Sins and Grace points. Sin Cards and Grace Cards randomly chosen can either help or hinder you.

The game includes pieces for up to 4 players.
1 gameboard
20 red Sin Cards
20 yellow Grace Cards
80 pieces of play money
420 red and yellow grace chips
A rather humorous back story and designer notes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Trick-taking

name: Kuala
description: Kuala has the object of building a tower of five elements height and is played on a 49-cell board. Pieces initially are arranged as shown in the photo. If a piece is standing in front of an opposite man and the cell beyond is occupied by a friendly stone, it may jump on this friendly stone. A stone standing in front of a hostile piece and the cell immediately beyond being empty may capture the enemy piece like in Laska. A column sandwiched between two hostile pieces becomes immobile until one of the two stones is captured.

name: Kitchen Panic
description:
A racing game of skill and speed. Use your chef to pick up balls to fill your pan. The first person to get 5 balls in their pan wins.

For children 5 and up.

name: Alphabet Runner Cards
description:
FREE-PRINT-PLAY: 14 Unique Free Alphabet Cards.

Alphabet Runner® cards are versatile and easy to use.
The cards are used to play fun games such as Snap, Pairs and a Word game.

Alphabet Runner® has received the Good Toy Guide Award 2006, Best Family Game UK Games Expo 2007, The Best Innovation Finalist 2006 and IAB Small Outstanding Business Finalist 2007.
With five years on research and development and having had a stand at the UK Toy Fair for three years and The Educational Show NEC.
The Alphabet Runner® 2007 UK Championship Tournament was held at the UK Games Expo.

The cards can be downloaded in pdf file absolutely free. Print two A4 pages and cut out the cards and then laminate to feel the full effect.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Memory, Print & Play, Word Game

name: The Sword and the Flame: Event Deck
description:
This is a set of 48 event cards for The Sword and the Flame miniatures game, 30 of which are unique. There are events for the British side as well as "Natives". Some of the cards are titled "Universal Misery" and contain events affecting both sides. The cards cover reinforcements and low ammunition, but also include more exotic occurrences.

A sheet explaining the use of the cards in a game is included.

name: Megadeal
description: Megadeal is a business game for 2 to 6 players aged 10 and over. Players take turns to throw the dice and move around the board obeying the instructions as they go. Players can decide to buy property or invest in an enterprise opportunity. Property enables the player to collect rent. Enterprises can either succeed or fail. The first player to gain wealth of £1,000,000 is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Mr. Lincoln's War
description:
Regimental level miniature rules for the American Civil War. Does not require rebasing, works with any miniature scale.
Designed originally for 15mm. Two spin-offs from original: War against George III (AWI Period) Mr. Polk's War. (Mexican American War) In design now using same system: The War of James the First.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Arena DeathMatch
description:
From publisher's website:

Welcome to Arena Deathmatch!

Avatars of War: Arena DeathMatch is a 28mm miniatures game that depicts the bloody clash between two or more bands of heroes facing off on the floor of the arena, in front of a raucous crowd that is thirsty for action, violence and death. This deadly contest is known as a deathmatch.

The most powerful heroes among the mortal races are known as Avatars of War--heroes chosen by the Gods of War themselves. These Avatars, in addition to being fierce combatants, are able to draw upon the silver of divinity within their souls for the power to expand their already awesome combat abilities.

In Arena DeathMatch, each player controls a band of Avatars of War as they face off on the arena floor in front of a cheering (or jeering) crowd.

The perils of the Arena stand against you: traps, hazards and even savage beasts stand between you and your opponent. The door to the Arena opens, and the shouting crowd is eager to see their favourite heroes fight to the death. Will they be cheering your victory...or your death? There's only one way to find out!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Brew-HaHa
description:
Brew-HaHa - The Official Beer Nutz Comix Game by Wild Wigout Comix Game Boards.

A wonderful handmade silk-screened board game created by underground comic artist Wayno in the mid 1990s for the now extinct Scairy Hairy Toys which was previously located in San Fransisco, Ca.

To play the game you need a case or three of cheap, cheap beer, shot glasses, and the song Rubber Biscuit by The Chips (easily found on the web)....

The object of the game is to out-drink your opponents while moving your drunken game piece around the board and staying conscious yourself. The winner of the game is the last one standing and/or resisting the urge to throw-up especially when dancing and singing along to the great hit song "Rubber Biscuit" performed by The Chips circa 1956. Yes, anytime a player lands on the Rubber Biscuit space everyone has to jump up and shout Rubber Biscuit, Rubber Biscuit!!! while dancing to the song. Any player returning their cheap beer rental via the porcelain god is immediately disqualified and is banished to pass out in the bathtub.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game

name: Melee Pack II
description:
From the Southern Cal ASL Club web site:

Melee Pack II has six scenarios, with a little something for everyone! We take you to the steppes of the Crimea, the jungles of Ecuador and the heart of Stalingrad. We’ve got vehicles of all description waiting for you to shift into gear; from a trio of AVREs to a quartet of ISU-122s to a
lone StuIG 33B to a T-60 conga line. We give you battles between titans, from Assault Engineers fighting Assault Engineers to Dogfighting Air Support. Our scenarios range from tournament-size to super-size. Like things simple, without all those tanks and guns and things? We’ve got you covered! How about a complex challenge you can sink your
Grognard teeth into? Take two, their small! Wanna fight on the Red Barricades map? Done! Did I mention the AVREs? Did I mention the Firefly backing them up? Bam!

Melee Pack II also contains a set of our wildly popular Scenario Cheat Sheets! If you haven’t seen one before, a Scenario Cheat Sheet depicts vehicle and gun notes based on the forces involved, the date and any special rules. What you wind up with is a sheet of information specially tailored for each vehicle and gun for that scenario. It saves us a lot of time looking up rules and we hope you’ll find them useful also. Melee Pack II is packed with great ASL...you’re gonna love it!

The scenarios are:

July 5, 1941
Border, El Oro Province, Ecuador:
Peruvian regulars of Agrupamiento del
Norte have crossed the border trying
to push along the coast of southeastern
Ecuador. An Ecuadorean Border
Detachment has taken up defensive
positions in the dense jungle, ready to
block the invaders’ path.

June 6, 1944
Juno Beach, Normandy, France:
The AVREs, Shermans and men of the
26th Assault Squadron and 79th Armoured
must break through the entrenched
positions of the 736th Regiment.
Of course there is also the little
matter of the minefield, the shattered
bridge, the stream and the pillboxes.
MP8: CRATER LAKE

December 18, 1944
Rocherath, Belgium:
Dietrich’s 12th SS Division must capture
the Elsenborn Ridge and only the
village of Rocherath stands in his way.
Can the troopers of the American 2nd
Division and 744th TD Battalion hold
their positions against this powerful
combined arms SS force?

April 12, 1944
The Crimea, Russia:
The 4th Ukranian Front has assaulted
the Crimea from the north, forcing the
German 17th Army to hastily retreat
towards Sevastapol. Can the 49th
Mountain Corps’ landsers hold their
line in the steppe until the men of the
10th Romanian Infantry pass through?

November 11, 1942
Stalingrad, Russia:
Operation Hubertus’ push for the
Volga has been blunted. Russian
tanks and troops, including Assault
Engineers, have been ordered to
counterattack. Unfortunately, German
Assault Engineers and assault guns
have been sent in to renew the attack.

May 14, 1942
Nepokrytaia, Russia:
The Soviet offensive toward Kharkov is
threatened. Strong German forces
have struck the 38th Army’s flank. Despite
excellent air power, the Germans
of the 211th Regiment and the 3rd Panzer
Division find themselves facing
evenly matched forces at Nepokrytaia.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Pro Tennis Game by Rod Laver
description:
This is a simple singles tennis game. In the beginner's game, after rolling a single die for the serve, players alternate rolling a pair of dice to get one of 21 possibilities for their shot, continuing until one is missed. In the advanced game, court position is taken into account, and players each get a special weakness card, but all the action is still driven by the dice.

The game was one of six in RGI's Play the Pros series.

A significantly modified version of this game was published as part of Sports Spectacular.
publishers: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC

name: Chevauchee:  Rules for Battles with Medieval Miniatures
description:
During the 100 Years War between France and England, bands of soldiers from both sides launched raids into enemy-held territory, burning, pillaging, and slaying as much as possible before opposition could be mounted in strength. This practice, known as Chevauchee, is the inspiration for this game of medieval and Renaissance warfare. Designed for fun and playability, Chevauchee is perfect for novice and veteran gamers alike and offers a basic set of man-to-man combat rules, expanded optional rules, and a special system for simple siege warfare. It can be played with almost any appropriate miniature figures, each of which can use whatever weapons it is armed with and is equipped with whatever armor the model wears, eliminating paperwork and speeding play. Each turn represents 20 seconds of action. Essentially, combat is resolved with 3d6 rolls (with modifiers) versus a target number. There is no set size for a playing area. Distance is measured in inches. The game works best with 1/72 scale or 1/35 scale figures. 50 pages.

Table of Contents:

5 Introduction
7 Basic Rules
21 Optional Rules
33 Siege Rules
46 Glossary

name: Miner
description:
You’re a miner. You want to make enough money to live the easy life. If you work hard and save up enough money then you can retire and leave the working to other suckers. But beware, life in the mine is hard. There are thieves and hazards all over and you must be ready to deal with them in order to get ahead.
