Each ship can fire up to 2 space away and Combat includes the concept of Leeway, drifting on the tide as combat occurs, leading to some chance as a players ship may run aground or collide with another. Ships can be boarded and even attacked by the forts shown on the map.

This is a game of maneuver where advanced planning is key and the effects of tide and wind drive the game.

An outstanding example of Naval Miniatures play from the 1930s.

name: The Adventures of Dick and Virginia
description:
Give Your Best Advice

Dick and Virginia are a couple that suffer from a plague of sex and relationship problems. As their closest and most trusted friend, they have come to you for advice. Will your great advice help this couple keep it together through thick and thin or will an opponent swoop in with their two cents and become the couple's closest confidant? It takes critical thinking and an open mind to help this troubled couple. Find out how well your advice is received and how other players handle sex and relationship quandaries.

Directions:
Shuffle the deck and place face down. The first player draws the top card and gives advice to the fictitious couple. If another player wants to challenge the advice given, they may. The other players vote on the best advice and the winner gets the card. Each card is worth one point.

When a player collects five cards a round is complete. Depending on the number of players the amount of rounds changes. Once all rounds are complete the player with the most cards wins.

name: Hakkefuda
description:
Ôº®ÔΩÅÔΩãÔΩãÔΩÖfuda is a Japanese game based on the Yi Jing (I Ching) Ba Gua (Pa Kua) figures.

The box contains 139 cards total and includes a deck of 8x8 trigrams and all 64 hexgrams of the Yi Jing series. Each deck includes two blank cards. There are seven reference cards included for the games playable with the two decks. A small gameboard is included.

From the back of the box, translated from Japanese:

'Hakkefuda is a set of original game cards that takes for its motif the eight trigrams (Gua) used in fortune telling and Feng Shui. It is possible to play several card and Hanafuda style games.

"Gua" were invented in Ancient China, representing all things and phenomena through the two fundamental ideas of yin and yang, one could say they are the first digital inscriptions. The Ba Gua represent the fundamental attributes of all things through three yin-yang lines: they represent "heaven", "earth", "thunder", "wind", "water", "fire", "mountain", and "spring".'

The box contains rules for three games, entitled "Taikoubou" (Â§™ÂÖ¨Êúõ - The Great Duke's Hope), "Houshinhakkejin"(Â∞ÅÁ•ûÂÖ´Âç¶Èô£ - Signet God Ba Gua Formation), and "Hakkaken"(ÂÖ´Âç¶Ââ£ - Ba Gua Sword)

name: World's Greatest Villain
description:
So, you want to be a villain? The best? In Century City, it's not so easy. You've got to gain reputation, find gear, and plot nefarious schemes. Note of warning, though – trust no one. Villains don't share, and a host of others will stand in your way. Overcome these obstacles, though, and you can establish yourself as the greatest criminal mind of all time!

World's Greatest Villain is a fast-paced, competitive card game. Collect and equip gear, complete schemes, sabotage your opponents as you gain reputation, all so you can establish yourself as the top in your profession.

World's Greatest Villain is designed for 3-6 players, ages 12 and up.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Classic BattleTech: Technical Readout 3075
description:
In November 3067 the Second Star League disbanded. The Word of Blake - a splinter group of ComStar - had been on the verge of joining in fulfillment of ancient prophecies. Denied their dream, the Blakists sought to preserve the Star League against the follies of the Houses, but its fanaticism manifested this noble goal as the Jihad: a horrific war that has pitted every faction against each other and even themselves. Against such an anvil, new cutting edge machines of war are marched into the fire. The discovery of an ancient Hegemony Memory Core graphically showcases the desperation of the conflict, as primitive 'Mechs not seen on a battlefield since the dawn of 'Mech production over half a millennia ago once again appear.

Classic BattleTech Technical Readout: 3075 provides a comprehensive look at the latest machines of war debuting during the Jihad: from 'Mechs to battle armor, Support Vehicles to DropShips and more. In addition, a complete "Age of War" section covers the Terran Hegemony and each of the five Great Houses during the Age of War, including the very first BattleMechs produced by each faction and how such machines are starting to appear once more. Each military vehicle is illustrated in detail, accompanied by a description of its history, capabilities, game stats, and some of the unit's most famous pilots.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Level II
description:
Level II is a fast paced skirmish miniatures game, set in the future.
In the year 2222 mankind manages to devastate their home planet.
Nuclear fusion as well as manipulation of genes have become daily buisiness in this harsh world ruled by corporate groups.
Journeys to Mars have become possible and science is about to find a way to travel to the stars.

One of Level II's biggest strengths is, that it consists of a ruleset only. No miniatures come with this game!
This way a player may pick any of his miniatures and calculate their point costs referring to the extremely well elaborated and very fine tuned equipment list.
There are rules for about everything that has ever set it's metal or plastic foot on a futuristic war-torn gametable:
Humans, aliens, different kinds of humanoids, tough races, weak races, robots, androids, crafts, cannons, artillery, sabotage, special ammunition, cybernetics - everything you could wish for.
Even the equipment table basically covers everything "out there" - maybe you'll have to substitute sometimes some weapons (like a boltpistol with a common pistol), but you will be able to work with everything that you might find in the hands or at the belt of your miniature.

The rulebook covers the basic rules as well as experts' rules and campaign rules.

Even though Level II is designed for small scale skirmishes with only a couple of individual fighters per side, the rules don't prevent you from playing large scale combats as well.
In that case however players should have only a few different troop types, to keep combat simple.
For example on the one hand you could get about 50 - 100 light weighted fighters for 1000 points, but if you really spice them up, you may field less than 10 tough guys for the same value, too.

Level II uses an unique command system:
The army of a player is divided into several groups (one at least!) consisting of a number of fighters depending on the faction they are fighting for.
Each group gets one command (e.g. "advance"), represented by a chit placed at that group's position. Depending on that command, each fighter of that group may take up to two different actions (mostly moving + something different, like e.g. taking aim).
In order to change that command, certain conditions have to be met (roll versus a certain value with modifiers according to circumstances like e.g. groupleader killed or minimum distance not met) - if the roll fails the command is either changed later or even not at all.
Specialits may act according to their specialities whenever the player sees fit.

Level II plays very realistically: Most weapons kill an unarmoured human with one hit - just as in real life. This way you will have to be very careful with about everything:
How are you going to spend your points?
Where and (even mor important:) how are you going to move your fighters?
This way, Level II is a very tactical skirmish game where the skill and the experience of a player garantee a victory instead of lucky dierolls.
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling

name: Foundry Miniatures Compendium:  Pirates to Darkest Africa
description: Contains miniature wargame rule sets, painting guides, and terrain building advice for: Pirates in West Africa, The Land of El Dorado (Aztecs), Darkest Africa (including a campaign), Greeks, Roman/Barbarian Skirmishes, and Gladiator combat. 96 pages in full color.

name: Chek-ro
description:
Rules excerpt:

OBJECT OF GAME
There are two distinct and different ways to win the game. The first is by getting five of your tokens in a row consecutively. Second way is by capturing ten of your opponent's tokens.

RULES FOR PLAY
One player selects all the tokens of one color. The second player takes all the tokens of the other color. Players choose for first play. The starting player places a token on one of the four circles reading, START. Tokens are not moved from spaces once they are placed on board. Play then alternates between players who then place tokens anywhere on the board. (However, to work out successful patterns of play, do not place your tokens too wide apart. By concentrating your tokens in definite areas, you will be better able to fulfill the objective of the game–5 tokens in a row.) Your 5 tokens must be placed consecutively in a vertical, horizontal or diagonal row. If you succeed in accomplishing this, you are declared the winner. The other method of winning is to capture ten of your opponent's men. A capture is performed by surrounding two of your opponent's tokens by placing two of your tokens one on each side of his. If a player places his tokens in a position so as to become out-flanked, he loses the out-flanked pair of tokens to his opponent. When a capture is completed, the captured tokens are removed from the playing field and placed in the "CAPTURED OPPONENTS" area of board. In this way, both you and your opponent can readily see how the game is progressing. Five pairs (10) of captured opponents constitute a win. Included in the set are more tokens than are necessary to complete the game. However, it is possible that a game could be played out without anyone winning. In this case, the game ends in a draw.

Chek-ro is similar to ninuki-renju and Pente

name: H-ring spel
description:
The object of the game is to strike 15 (either red or green coloured) rings into two of the four pockets by using a 26 inch cue. The cue is used to aim a large black ring at the coloured rings.

In the two player version each player has to eliminate one colour from the board into pockets of the same colour as the rings. The four player version is a two-team game. Players take turns in cueing. The player or team to succeed first in removing their rings from the board wins.
The goal in the single-player version is to remove the rings from the board in as few turns as possible.

There is a certain similarity between the H-ring Spel, American Carrom and Korona.

name: Perfidia
description:
A shadow hangs over the Kingdom. Goblin armies are amassing on the horizon, and the King's Seer receives a vision that two of the his closest companions are plotting a betrayal. Will the Kingdom be able to withstand the invaders and expose the traitors, or will it fall into ruins?

Perfidia is a card game for two players. One player will play as the Kingdom, and the other is known as Traitor. The game is centered around eight characters, two of which are chosen secretly by the Traitor player. Victory requires clever card management and use of characters, as well as deductive and bluffing skills to predict the traitors!

-C. Wade McKenzie, Designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Tsushima: Naval Wargame Rules For Pre-Dreadnought Actions 1880 - 1906
description:
These rules are quick and simple to play providing a very fast and bloody game in the period 1880 to 1906. The scale is 1 nautical mile to 10cm. The rules incorporate weather, spotting, minefields and allow for both written orders or sequential movement.

The gunnery system takes account of the ranges, penetration and damage by specifying the dice that are rolled to attack in a given situation. Torpedo, Mine and Ramming attacks are resolved using similar mechanisms, so there is a consistent feel throughout the combat system.

In line with the style and intention of the rules, armour has been standardised for each class of vessel (of which there are ten covered). Guns have been grouped into 9 classes following the same philosophy.

There is a fleet list covering the significant vessels of 10 nations in this period with 130 vessels. A simple conversion system allows you to quickly put together the game data you need to fight a battle.

Counters are provided to enable you to sit down and play both an introductory scenario and Tsushima-style encounter between Russian and Japanese fleets

(Publishers Description)

name: Saucer Scramble
description: From the box, "Chase 'em as they spin... catch 'em fast to win! Alien antics fly high in this outer-space, spin-out-of-control game! As the flying saucers launch from the spaceship, they soar into the air and whirl in gravity-defying acrobatics. Your mission is to catch them in your nets before they land. So get ready to run around and act spacey!"

name: Harbinger
description:
A cooperative or competitive fantasy role-playing board game, the goal of which is to bring about or stop the Armageddon that will destroy the kingdom. The alignment of the characters chosen determines if the players will fight for or against the Great Evil that threatens to destroy the land.

Players explore the modular map board, revealing tiles as they go. Gameplay is primarily driven through adventure cards in which monsters are fought, treasure is found, quests are solved, and clues are uncovered that can narrow down the identity of the Great Evil. The climax of the game occurs when the identity of the Great Evil is revealed and the final battle is fought which will determine the fate of the Kingdom.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Mad Scientist!
description:
"Greetings, I am Doctor Milton Perfidious, anarchist and terror to the civilized world. You have been selected as the top of your class to create things beyond your wildest dreams and to cause chaos in a world that shuns us and calls us MAD! Today’s lesson will be in giant monster creation and the instigation of a rampage in said monster. Now if you would please turn to page 13 in your text books..."

In Mad Scientist! you play the role of a mad scientist hell bent on the destruction of the civilized world. Players will create giant monsters with spare parts around their "lab" and use them to battle other players’ monsters and to destroy or protect locations. The player, who wreaks the most havoc, destroys the most locations and wins the most monster battles will be named the victor. There are also special Degrees in mad science that can be earned throughout the game and they give you special skills that other players do not have access to, as well as actions you can take to foil your fellow mad scientists’ plans.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Alla v√§gar b√§r till Rom
description: Players move their pieces across an abstract grid, with lines of varying orientation and/or curvature representing different forms of transportation. The goal is to reach Rome in the centre of the board. Movement is executed using randomly dealt cards which empower players to move a certain number of steps or using a certain means of transportation.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Twilight Vigilance
description:
Twilight Vigilance: A chance to experience the many challenges of the Cold War while attempting to contain the spread of communism.

Solitaire game of the Cold War, using VPG's States of Siege card driven mechanics, first seen in Israeli Independence.

The player is embroiled in the Cold War and must stop the Communist overthrow of the United States. The player allocates national resources to different budgetary areas, including Military, Diplomacy, Espionage, Technology and Economy. The correct balance must be maintained in the face of different events drawn from the deck.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Victory Point Games

name: Trial of Grandis
description:
Intro
It is a time of wizardry and power. In the esteemed Academia Magicas, novices from the House of Elementas shall be given their final test: Trial of Grandis. As a Chief Apprentice of your Noble House, you shall lead a quartet of novices through a maze of primordial elements on the ancient Fields of Grandis to earn your Elementor ranks and stand as honoured Magi of Magicas.

Basic Mechanics
- Your objective is to win as much Victory Points (VPs) as possible, while striding through each terrain square to reach the end of the field.
- The Trial ends when all terrain squares at the finishing line are occupied.
- Each Player begins with 5 cards in his/her hand and draws 2 extra cards at the start of turn.
- Each Player may conduct a maximum of 3 movement/actions with his/her playing cards during a turn.
- Each Player can hold as many cards as he/she can in hand at the end of turn, but beware of the thief.

Cards
- There are 2 types of Cards that can be drawn from the draw deck: Scroll Cards and Action Cards.
- Scroll Cards are used for basic movement to each terrain square (see movement)
- Action Cards are special magic scrolls with extra spells such as VP Thief, Revive Mana and etc that can be used to your advantage.

Movement
- The Field of Grandis is a land of power, with terrains warded by elements that bars entrance from those who do not wield them.
- Fire, Ice, Thunder and Poison Wards of varying degrees protect each terrain.
- To stride the fields, you must be proficient in utilizing the Elementas Scrolls (Cards) to calm the elements of each terrain.
- You can move straight or diagonal to the adjoining square by casting your Scroll Cards according to the element and number of scrolls required. e.g. A square guarded by a Level 2 Fire Ward can only be entered by casting 2 Fire Scrolls (cards).

Victory Points
- The field is divided into sections, each section of terrain squares with their own VP value, ascending to the highest VP value at the finishing squares.
- At game end, only the VP value of the terrain squares occupied by each of your Novices is accumulated.
- VP Points can also be earned by performing the Lock Spell (see Lock Spell)
- Player with the most accumulated VPs wins the game.

Lock Spell
- When 2 or more Novices move into the same terrain square, the latest Novice to arrive at the square automatically performs a Lock Spell on the Novice(s) before it.
- Novice under the Lock Spell cannot perform any movement or action until the spell-caster moves away from the square OR the spell is broken with a Lock Breaker action card.
- There is no limit to the number of Novices occupying a square; the last Novice to enter a square will always be the spell-caster.

Trial of Grandis is a strategy card + board game with a minimum luck factor in drawing cards.

Free downloadable files (print & play game board, rules of play, etc) will be available soon.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Racing

name: Octagons
description:
Octagons is an abstract boardgame from the family of connection games. The rules as given in New Rules for Classic Games are: The game uses an Archimedean grid with halved octagons (resulting in irregular hexagons). Both players take turns making moves. On his turn, a player can either fill in one half of an octagon or two squares.

The first move can be swapped by the pie rule. The player who forms an unbroken connection between the edges of his colour wins. Draws are not possible.

name: Ye Mean and Mighty
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Ye Mean and Mighty is a motley collection of noblemen and villains, coach-boys and servants, soldiers and swashbucklers, ready for use in Gloire! This book contains over 50 pre-generated characters and their stories, for use by players or GMs in designing their own scenarios. Use Ye Mean and Mighty to inspire you to your own acts of heroism!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Remember Limerick! The War of the Two Kings: Ireland, 1689-1691
description:
from the Red Sash Games website:

Remember Limerick! (RL!) is the seventh volume of Red Sash Games' Lace Wars series, and opens a new subject, the Nine Years War, sometimes called the War of the League of Augsburg, Toward the end of the 17th Century, at a time when Europe is consumed by war, the powerful Catholic dynasty of the Habsburgs, and the Pope, have formed an unnatural league with the Protestant states of northern Germany, and with the Prince of Orange, de facto ruler of the Netherlands, against their coreligionists, the French. They oppose the overweening ambitions of the Sun King, Louis XIV. To augment the strength of the League, William, Prince of Orange, has taken advantage of popular dissatisfaction with his father-in-law, King James II, to engineer an armed coup and take over the government of England. This will help fill the coffers of the League and ensure that England does not ally with France.

But the English throne brings with it the governance of Scotland and of Ireland. While some in these countries welcome the Glorious Revolution, many do not. Especially is this so in Ireland, where a small Protestant minority lords it over a helot population of Irish and Anglo-Irish Catholics - an Ascendancy secured only a generation before by the swords of Oliver Cromwell's men and still maintained by force of arms and by force of English Law. In the last years of King James' rule, his Deputy, Richard Talbot, Earl of Tyrconnel, has worked hard to overturn this Cromwellian Settlement, stuffing the Administration and the Army with Catholics. The Protestants are afraid.

King James, abandoned by many that he trusted, including his own family, suffers a nervous breakdown and leaves England for France, determined to devote the rest of his life to religious pursuits. But his cousin, King Louis, points to Ireland as a place where a fallen monarch may retrieve his fortunes. Tyrconnel and the new Irish Army, and a picked brigade of veteran French, will enable James to drive his son-in-law from the British Isles - and incidentally, force Dutch Billy to withdraw much of his army from the Low Countries, where the French hope to gain much in the next few campaigns. The last Irish "rebellion" lasted eleven years....

name: Contractor
description:
Contractor is designed for up to six players who bid for jobs, buy equipment and compete for supremacy. Like real life, the winner avoids bad situations, capitalizes on opportunity and eventually makes the most money.

A contractor's duties go beyond digging holes, moving dirt and putting up walls. The success of contractors is decided by many factors: union and employee relations, land and property costs and equipment purchases and breakdowns. Encounter the daily woes of a contractor as you struggle to keep ahead of bad weather, employee situations, and most of all, your competitors.

Players move tokens around the board and work on their jobs when they land on a Workday space. Each job is divided into ten phases. Each time you complete a phase, the bank pays you one-tenth of your bid price. You earn rent money in two ways: when the equipment you own is required on other player's jobs, and when other players land on your equipment space. The player with the most money wins.

Description taken from the game box and instruction booklet.

name: Jazz King
description:
Tagline:
"Hoping to use your eye for putting the right musicians together and counting on a bit of luck finding the right venues, you set out to create an empire of glitzy nightclubs, headline bands, and swinging music. The city is wide open. Welcome to Jazz King."

Jazz King is a Print & Play game of set collection and area control. In order for a player to place a venue on the board they must collect the necessary musicians to fill the venue. The more control a player exerts over a city block, via venues, the more points they earn.

Print & Play Components:
Game Board
Venue Tiles
Musician Cards
Event Cards

Additional Components for play:
84 playing bits/cubes (21 cubes in four colors).

name: The Battle of Modder River
description:
This is a game about the November 1899 battle during the Boer War. A British force marching to relieve the siege of Kimberly ran into a force of Boers dug in along the banks of the Modder River and suffered heavy losses. The Boers were eventually outflanked and withdrew to another defensive position.

This was an amateur wargame published in Great Britain during 1981 by Yorkshire Games.

name: Snelrekenspel
description:
The game-master throws the three blue dice. The numbers on these dice are the target number. Then he/she throws the six white dice and turns the hourglass over. The other players now have to add, subtract, divide and multiply and try to approach the number of the blue dice using the numbers on the white dice.
The company logo of Nationale Nederlanden counts as 100. Each number can only be used once.
It is allowed to use pen and paper. The players get 6,5,4,3,2,1 points. If the blue number is reached the points are doubled. Then the next player is the game-master, untill every player has been the game master.
The player with the most points wins the game.

Contents:
- 3 blue dice
- 6 white dice
- 1 hourglass + base

name: Spiritual Gifts
description:
Spiritual Gifts: the Card Game is a frenzied card game for 3-9 players. Each player is dealt a hand of seven cards of various spiritual gifts. The game starts, and each player will hold out cards that he/she wants to swap and shouts out the number. Players swap equal numbers of cards back and forth until someone has all seven copies of one particular spiritual gift.

Great for Sunday Schools, Youth Groups and Family Game Nights. Part of the Sporadic Games Educational Line.
Re-implements:

Pit

name: The 2010 Election
description:
THE 2010 ELECTION is a two-player light game about a single election campaign in mainland Great Britain. It is based on the principle that parliamentary boundaries and demographics, as well as party policy, determine elections. Policy may influence the floating voters, but all parties depend on their partisans whose loyalty is not a matter of electoral logic but of passion. You take your supporters where you find them, heavily concentrated for Labour and widely spread for the centrist parties. Psephology is as important as media hype.

The game uses tile placement and area control mechanisms, and there is a random tile draw phase at the end to handle floating voters.

The game is a PDF production, and covers the 2010 Election. Expansion sets will cover historical elections. A set of Liberal Party and Social Democratic Party markers is included for that purpose.

name: Regenbogenland
description:
Who finds the way to the gold?

Everybody knows that at the end of the rainbow there is a pot of gold. But only the magicians of the Wichtel know how one goes over the rainbow. These magicians look all the same, many are friendly and helpful, some, however, are nasty and deceptive. Who finds the magicians who show the way to the end of the rainbow? This small game collection with 5 different games, is a treasure in itself.

name: Castillion
description:
This 'new and exclusive' game from 3M comes in a box with three other classic strategic games: Go-Moku, Go and Backgammon.

The box bears the title:

Games of logic from 3M : THE PROBLEM SOLVERS

From the rules:

The game of CASTILLION is played on a board of 14 x 14 squares with both players starting with 24 counters - or soldiers.

The object is to capture your opponents's castle (the corner square) and return safely to your own with his fortune - the stake money.

The box contains the rules, boards and pieces for all four games.

Inside box cover:

Games of logic from 3M : THE PROBLEM SOLVERS

"He thinks too much: such men are dangerous" - Julius Caesar, Act I.
For once we cannot agree with Shakespeare.
For us at 3M, and for you, our customer, thinking is how we earn our bread and butter.
When we don our thinking caps at 3M we seek new concepts and new improvements in magnetic media for computers. As hardware manufacturers think up ways to extend the boundaries of data processing science and techniques so we are making available, today, tapes and discs suitable for use on tomorrow´s computers.
We are solving such problems as head-to-disc interferences, and the attraction of air bone contaminants by static build up. You might call us "The Problem Solvers".
This box holds the first of a fascinating series of games selected for their unique blend of mental challenge and strategic contest.
Subsequent games will be produced as matching sets to be kept in this box. The numbers being prepared are strictly limited so these sets are likely to become a sought-after collectors´ item - particularly since some of the games are available from no other source.
We hope you enjoy them.
Computer Products 3M.

name: Ambitions
description:
A simple roll and move board game with over tones of game of life. before they start, players work out their winning criteria in terms of Fame, Wealth and Happiness. Then players move around set tracks on the game board in an effort to achieve the result.

Inspired by Careers

name: Na kury!
description:
Players take role of Reksio (famous polish cartoon dog), Kurator or ≈ªabba, construct space vehicles and collect hens that appear on planets. They throw dice to move their vehicles around the galaxy, landing on planets and battling between themselves.
Player who first gather 40 point win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Duel in the Dark: Window / Wilde Sau
description:
Promo Expansion published in "Manoeverkritik" Issue 36 (4th quarter 2007), the Club Magazine of the GHS (Gesellschaft fuer historische Simulation e.V.).

Window represents british anti-Radar measures (aluminium foil), Wilde Sau is the name for the usage of German Day Fighters against Night Raids over by bombing illuminated german cities.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Retro Pak II
description:
Scenario Pack Contents

•10 scenarios (8 + 2 bonus)
•Cover Sheet
•Back informational sheet
=7 European and 3 Pacific theater scenarios. These are older out of print Critical Hit scenarios that have been reworked and updated. This is the second of a series of reworked, updated and renamed scenario packs.

One of the Pacific scenarios is set Malaya, another is in Burma and the last one in Bataan, Philippines all three are battles of 1942. One scenario is set in Tunisia 1942. One of the East Front scenario is in 1941. The rest of the scenairos are set in the Eastern or Western Front in 1944-45.

As with all scenario packs this is not a complete game, Ownership of Beyond Valor, Yanks, West of Alamain/For King and Country, Gung Ho, Code of Bushido as well as Geomorphic boards Deluxe a, b, d, g, 5, 17, 19, 32, 33, 34 and 37 is required.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: The Irregular Miniatures Rule Box 6/2mm Napoleonic
description:
A set of wargames rules for playing with the 2mm miniatures sold by "Irregular Miniatures", these rules are Irregular Miniatures in-house rules for playing Napoleonic miniature battles.

The smallest element under the players control is the Brigade, with each player typically controling an Army. Orders are issued by dispatching order-carrying figures from a Command figure, when the order-carrier reaches the designated unit it may carry out the new order.

Each unit has only two statistics, these being strength ( number of men ) and CP ( Cohesion Points ).

All of the usual Napoleonic formations and structures are covered by this small set of rules which come on a set of cards. Each card covers one phase of a turn with examples on the back.

A division sized battle can be played in 30-45 minutes.

name: Jericho
description:
Jericho, a strategy game for 2 players

OVERVIEWNumber of players: two.

Average duration of a game: thirty minutes.

Game Board: one octagonal board consisting of two by thirteen (2 x 13) squares and two by thirteen (2 x 13) triangular squares at the edge of the board.
Pieces: sixty-three consisting of two by twenty-five (2 x 25) cylindrical pieces of 5 different sizes and colours.
13 monoliths ("Trumpets").



HOW TO PLAYAt the commencement of the game, the board is empty and each player stores his/her 25 allocated pieces on the side. The starting player places one piece on either his/her territory, (the 13 squares in front of him/her) or on his/her opponent's territory (the 13 squares in front of the opponent). Both players then take turns placing pieces on the board. Once on the board, the pieces remain in the some place throughout the whole game. Towers are consisting of single pieces or several pieces piled on top of each other.



THE TOWERSThe Towers are built with a minimum of one and a maximum of 4 pieces. Each piece in an individual Tower must have different sizes and colours. The Towers belong to the player whose territory they are built on. A player can for example choose to place a Tower on his/her opponent's territory to undermine the strength of the opponent's Towers: this Tower belongs to the opponent.



THE CONFRONTATIONSTowers confront each other when they are aligned, whether diagonally or frontally. There can be 7 frontal alignments and 6 diagonal ones. When one player has got 2 of his/her Towers on a same alignment, only the strongest one can enter a confrontation.
If none of his/her opponent's Towers are aligned with his/hers, then there is no confrontation. An individual Tower can be involved in 2 different confrontations simultaneously, (one on a diagonal, the other on a frontal alignment). Both confrontations are then solved separately. In order to solve a conflict, the strengths of the Towers need to be assessed.



HOW STRONG ARE THE TOWERS?The strength of a Tower depends on the size of its highest piece. The pieces can have 5 different sizes, hence the strength of a Tower can vary from I to 5. Whatever its number of pieces, only the highest will account for the strength of a Tower. For example, a two-piece Tower can win over a four-piece Tower. There is however one exception to this rule: one-piece Towers will always lose to higher Towers. When the highest pieces of two confronting Towers are of equal strength, then the piece that comes immediately under it is assessed and so on until the confrontation is resolved.



THE MONOLITHS ("TRUMPETS")Monoliths are used to visualize which of the 2 players (at any stage in the game) has got the upper hand. Each time a player wins a confrontation, he/she is given a Monolith to position on his/her side of the board, on the triangle corresponding to the alignment where the confrontation just took place. The monolith remains with the player as long as he/she is a leader. However, if the opponent gets the upper hand then he /she is given the Monolith to place on his/her side of the board. When there is no obvious leader, the monolith is removed altogether from the board.
A Tower can be involved in two different confrontations, hence a player can win, or lose, 2 Monoliths at once.



HOW TO WIN?The player who wins his/her seventh monolith and does not lose it over to his/her opponent in the immediate next turn, wins the game.



THE ASYMMETRY RULEA player cannot copy the move of his/her opponent by positioning immediately after him/her an identical piece (same size and colour) on the same alignment and at a same level of an identical Tower. At least one of these parameters must differ.

name: Conquistadores
description:
Athens, Carthage, Egypt, Phoenicians, Persia, Rome ... great empires dominating at different times of the known World, the Mare Nostrum. so named by the Romans, but that would have happened if everyone had been powerful at the same time? The empire that dominates the most valuable territories will be the World Conqueror.
Conquerors is a card game for 3-6 players in which, players are faced with their armies to conquer major territories and get treasures. At the end of the game, the player who wins the most points wins.


Atenas, Cartago, Egipto, Fenicia, Persia, Roma...grandes imperios dominadores en distintas épocas del mundo conocido, el Mare Nostrum así denominado por los romanos, pero que hubiera pasado si hubieran coincidido todos en su máximo esplendor. El imperio que domine los más valiosos territorios será el Conquistador del Mundo.
Conquistadores es un juego de cartas para 3 - 6 jugadores, en el cual los jugadores se enfrentan con sus ejércitos para conquistar los territorios más importantes y conseguir tesoros. Al final del juego, el jugador que gane el mayor número de puntos será el ganador.
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting

name: Polemos: Risorgimento
description:
User Summary:
Polemos: Risorgimento is a free to download miniature ruleset supplement to Polemos: Franco-Prussian War covering the Italian Wars of unification.

Two sizes of games are presented. The Risorgimento Fratelli d'Italia focuses on smaller scale actions with corps sized forces. One base of miniatures is to represent an infantry battalion of approximately 500 soldiers. For players who prefer army scale games Risorgimento Feldzeugmeister is the other part of the game. In Feldzeugmeister one base of miniatures represent brigades, approximately 2500 soldiers in the case of infantry.

The game is available from Baccus6mm in the U.K.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: "The World Turned Upside Down": The American War of Independence Battlefield Rules & Campaign System
description:
The latest release in the Real Time Wargame series of miniatures rules.

This set covers the American War of Independence, and includes both Campaign & Battlefield Rules.

As before, the rules are designed for 10mm figures, but can be used happily with 15mm or larger.

The battlefield system uses an unusual point to point movement system, and fate cards.

In keeping with the series, the game emphasises command and control, friction, and period specific detail.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation
publishers: Real Time Wargames, Realistic Modelling Services

name: Hexone
description:
A strategy game for 2 players, 10 years old and more

By properly placing your pawns,
You will generate chain reactions
That will destroy all your opponent's pawns!
Except if the opposite happens...

Goal of the game
Remove all of your opponent's pawns.

Game components
A 19-hexagons boardgame
35 pawns, one side white, the other side black.

Game mechanism
The player who starts the game is randomly determined.
The first player places one pawn of his color on an hexagon he chooses on the first circle (the circle of 6 hexagons around the central hexagon).
The opponent places a pawn of his color on another hexagon of the first circle.

From now on, each player will place a pawn of his color on his game turn by applying the following rules:

a player cannot place a pawn on the central hexagon,
a player cannot place a pawn on a hexagon on which there are already 1 or 2 opponent's pawns,
a player can place a pawn on an empty hexagon if it touches a hexagon on which he already has 1 or 2 pawns,
a player can place a pawn on a hexagon on which he already has 1 or 2 pawns.


Explosion
If, at the end of his turn, a player has 3 pawns on the same hexagon, an explosion happens: the 3 pawns are distributed in a Y shape on contiguous hexagons, and pawns that may have been on covered hexagons before the explosion now belong to the player.

Chain reaction: successive explosions
It is possible (and it is even the good way to win!) that, after this first explosion, other hexagons have 3 pawns or more of the player's color. The player must proceed with the explosions until there is no more hexagon with 3 pawns or more, or until there are no more pawns from the opponent (he has won in this case!).


The player must start with one of the hexagons having the most pawns on it (it is possible that there are 4 pawns on the same hexagon).
After each explosion, if there are still possible explosions and pawns from the opponent, go back to step 1!


End of the game
The game ends when a player has no pawns left on the board. His opponent is the winner!

name: Olympic Field Hockey
description:
Using a derivation of the system premiered in Kings of Pools Waterpolo, Olympic Field Hockey (subtitled Running with Sticks over Grass) is fast play statistical replay game on Field Hockey, with data for replaying all Olympic Tournaments from 1948 onward, both men and women.
To resolve each game you need only a couple of dice rolls, so you may replay an entire tournament in less than an hour.
For each match, compare the attack and the defense values of both teams, and roll two six sided dice for each, to get the final result of a match. But there is also the "infamous" Third Die, a 10 sided die whose result may dramaticaly alter the result of the match, making a win by an underdog team at least possible, even against the best of the best.

name: Canvas
description:
Canvas is a connection game which bears a slight resemblance to the game of Amazons.

Canvas is played on a base 7 hex hex with its edges colored to designate ownership of the sides.

Objective: The objective of Canvas is to create a chain of your own stones and painters connecting your two opposite sides of the board

Gameplay: Starting with white, players alternate moving their painters and placing stones. On a player's turn he may move a painter in a straight line in any of the 6 directions any number of spaces. When the painter has finished moving, the player must either place a stone of his color on an adjacent space to the painter or he may transmit the stone to any space adjacent to a contiguous chain of stones of his own color (not other painters of the same color) that the painter touches. Painters may move over any number of stones of either color but may not land on a space occupied by a stone. Painters are not permitted to move over each other. Moving a painter is not mandatory but placing a stone is. A player cannot divide the moving and placing phases between two painters. A player must pass if he has no legal moves on his turn.

The pie rule is used to make the game fair.

name: Peekaboo
description:
From the back of the box:

"Winnie the Pooh Peek-a-boo is an entertaining memory game for very young children. Children from the age of three can play along. Peek through the holes and try to remember which of the covers hide goodies belonging to Pooh's friends.

Collect the most cards and win the game."

Theme: Winnie the Pooh theme with pretty much all of the main characters involved.

Game-play: The game starts with 30 tiles all open (!). Then the 6 covers, which all have 1-3 peek holes in them, are place over 6 of the tiles, and the person placing them names the tiles. Then the next player starts, throwing a die with 6 colors, and guessing what lies under the tile with the cover of that color.

Goal: To get as many guesses right as possible. Each correct guess gets you that tile. The player with most tiles at the end of the game wins.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Balkan Wars
description:
From the introduction of the rules set:

"These rules were written in response to requests to provide a simple, fast-play set of wargames rules to fight the table-top battles that arose in the BALKAN LEAGUE MATRIX GAME (see Wargames Illustrated 66). The rules are intended to be used with 15mm model miniatures (although they can easily be adapted for use with other scales) and owe much to the work done by Phil Barker and Richard Bodley-Scott in De Bellis Antiquitatis, Chris Kemp in Not Quite Mechanised, and Tim Price in Simple Combat Resolution Using Dice (S.C.R.U.D.) (see WI64)."

Game uses 6-sided dice. Some sort of casualty marker needs to be supplied by the players, along with miniatures and terrain.

GAME SCALES

Ground Scale
1mm = 5m (1:5000)
1cm = 50m (1:5000)
1m = 5kms (1:5000)

Time Scale
The sides take alternate bounds or turns
1 bound or turn = 1/2 hour
A pair of bounds or turns = 1 hour

Figure and Vehicle Scale
1 model figure = 250 real soldiers (approximately)
1 model vehicle or artillery piece = 24 real vehicles or artillery pieces
1 stand = 1 battalion-sized unit (approximately)

Rules set appear in Wargames Illustrated #78 (March 1994)
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: ‰πùÂ∑û‰∏âÂõΩÂøó (Kyushu Sangokushi)
description:
Kyushu sangokushi (The three realms of Kyushu) covers the battles of the three major clans of the Kyushu island, during the Senkoku period.

Three scenarios are included in this game. "Battle of Mimigawa" and "Battle of Okitanawate" are short scenarios for two players. "Kyushu Sangokushi" (Battle of the three clans in Kyushu) is the campaign scenario for three players.

Each players control one or more clans. The clan's combat units are organized into troops.
The game repeats the game turn decided by the scenario. There are four action stages in each game turn. The number of stages where each troop can act is decided by commander's activation ability. In the action stage, each troop selects one action. The actions that can be selected are movement, field combat, siege, moral recovery, reorganization and replacement.

The victor is the player who receives the most victory points. The victory point are awarded by the control of a castle and the destruction of enemy units.

SCALE:
each hex of map is roughly 6000 meters. Each game turn represents one week of real time; each combat units about 1000 soldiers.


Game Journal edition: contains additional scenarios and counters for Hideyoshi Gunki.


This is a game of the "Sengoku Gunyuden" series.

name: Paradise Plunge
description:
Two groups of friends meet while vacationing on a tropical island. While relaxing at the local tiki bar, they enter into a friendly wager. They will take to the skies, and each team of friends will race through the tropical skies, plunging by parachute back to the island. The last group back to the tiki bar buys a round for everyone.

Paradise Plunge is a game of strategy for two players who must assemble their teams in the air and reach the island and the tiki bar before their opponents. Players begin with their teams of parachuters spread across the tiles that make up the sky over the island. Each turn, a player may move one of their parachuters, "play the wind" by rearranging the tiles in a row or column according to direction of the wind as marked on the tiles, or rotate one or two tiles so that the wind on those tiles points in a different direction. Movement is complicated by the fact one player may push an adjacent player in the direction of the wind, but may not separate groups of three or four of the opponent's parachuters. The winner is the player to move all four of their parachuters to adjacent tiles with one of those parachuters on or adjacent to the island tile.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Witch Hunt
description:
Witch Hunt is a casual party game in which a mob leader incites panicked townsfolk to lynch suspected witches. Can you survive this brutal hysteria? Can you find an actual witch?

Players take turns as leader of the mob and get to make a creative statement like "Witches wear plaid" or "I hear witches are afraid of dogs" to cast suspicion on their friends. The other players vote and someone is lynched. Players are never eliminated from the game though; the goal is to end with the least deaths. A lot of the fun is in crafting a clever statement that won't backfire on you.

name: Kigetsu
description:
Prepare for a great journey into the Japan of myths and legends...

Description from the Designer:

"Kigetsu is a semi-cooperative game which tells the story of the founding gods of Japan - the kami in ancient times. The action takes place into two different worlds: the celestial world, represented by a Taiji (Yin Yang); and the terrestrial world, represented by a map of Japan. The players represent kami and their mission is to give life to the earth. To achieve this, they will play counters, which represent vital energy (ki), in the two different worlds.

Each player can play one counter par turn, but they have cards which represent shintai, that is to say temporary incarnations. With them, they can gather and spread more energy into the world. Furthermore, at the end of the game, the most powerful kami wins, that is to say, the player who gained the biggest number of shintai - or cards.

By playing counters on the map of Japan, the players will spread the vital energy to the terrestrial world. Each city that is attained brings extra cards to the players and unlock new cards. The game actually finishes when the all the map of Japan is covered with counters. However, the players fail their mission if they finish the stack of cards before that point.

By playing counters on the Yin Yang, the players enter the celestial world and challenge the dark powers, which may be helpful to restore the balance of power if counters are scarce. The Yin Yang is a secondary board inside the game box, which contains an ultraviolet lamp : when turned on, this lamp reveals the symbol of a moon on the counters, which was invisible before. The ki thus changes into kigetsu, "moon energy", which allows to start a cosmic-scale battle."
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Mathino
description:
From the publisher

For less than the price of 1/2 hour of tutoring, your child can master all their basic math skills...and enjoy it way more.

Mathino is the ultimate math card game. Using math operations, capture the cards on the table with the cards from your hand. Players can change the values of the cards on the table on their turn, but watch out, someone else can change it to something that will let them capture that stack by the end of the round.

Mathino lets anyone sharpen their mental process by looking ahead a few moves to capture cards. It's a perfect math tutor and can be played by nearly anyone.

Operations used in the game can be determined based on player age and skill level and include:

-Matching shapes and colors, counting for the very young
-Addition
-Subtraction
-Multiplication
-Division
-Squaring and Cubing
-Square and Cube Rooting
-Sum of the Digits

name: War Rocket: Space Battles in the Atomic Age
description:
From the Hydra web site:

War Rocket is a fast-paced miniature space combat game set in the retro sci-fi future of the 24th century. The brave Galacteers fight to protect mankind from sinister alien forces. Will you command a fleet of Galecteer rockets or choose the forces of the domineering Valkeeri, the brutal Imperium of Marduk, or the enigmatic Zenithians?

You can play a game of War Rocket with fleets of 10-20 ships in less than 90 minutes with minimal use of tokens and absolutely no paper record keeping!

The 78-page War Rocket rulebook also includes 8 scenarios with specific objectives to encourage tactical decision making and narrative campaigns.

The rules also include advanced rules include special actions such as boarding and ramming, space stations, and space objects such as planetoids and asteroid fields.

Rocket customization rules allow you to upgrade your rockets with options such as force fields, lucky pilots, and disruptor beams. You can also use these rules to create your own new fleets.

name: Sage
description:
Sage is an abstract strategy game which plays like Hnefatafl.
It is played using a chinese chess board and pieces. The game starts with two equal armies of eleven pieces facing each other across the river - the Sage piece begins high in her tower, waiting to descend upon the battlefield.

Any piece may capture by sandwiching opposing pieces vertically or horizontally.

The aim is to score six points. These are achieved by moving your pieces into the river and off the board. The biggest tactical question is how soon you wish to move your pieces off the board - if you send too many off the board with an inadequate defence, your other pieces will be surrounded, but if you leave it too late, your opponent will slip off the board unchallenged.

The game is fantasy themed; with Immortal sages, swift apprentices and soaring skyships. It is set on Quiet Mountain, an experimental island of scientific sorcery that has pushed the bounds of its esoteric lore too far - tearing Reality apart in a catacalysmic disaster. The first Sage to leave Quiet Mountain will be able to reach the Empress and blame their counterpart for the disaster!

name: Karchis
description:
Karchis is in addition to Pachisi. Karchis includes funny cards to add more action, fun and interaction to the game.
Bombs, traps and tricks will appear in the game!
Discover a new meaning for Pachisi!

Each player starts with 4 cards in his hand. During a turn, you draw a card at the beginning of turn, roll the die and then usually be discarded cards.
Depending on the card, you can play at one time or another. There are cards to change the roll, cards to put traps in boxes, cards to hinder other players, ... There are a variety.

The winner will be the player to go with one of his chips to the goal box. There are also many more varieties of game.

Some sample letters are:

Daltonism: The player moves a pawn of another color.
Dyslexia: the player moves in the opposite direction
Conga: the player moves all his chips at once.
Bomb: a bomb placed in the box where it is placed and roll a dice. The result will be the number of boxes to move each turn until you find a pawn. Then exploded and killed all pawns around.

The game incluye:

120 cards
4 Bomb Marker
4 Trap Marker
Rule Book
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Racing

name: Dunn-Kempf: Battle Guide to Simulation
description:
User summary:

A modern warfare wargame, intended to be used with 1/285 miniatures and terrain tiles, developed and adopted as a training tool by US Army from 1977 to 1997.

The scale is one inch to 50 meters. A curtain is suspended half way down the playing area to simulate fog of war, and can be moved forward or backward depending on the knowledge of the terrain of the opponents. The game is normally played with three of four players per side and an impartial controller. Opponent teams take alternate turns, going through a sequence involving, in that order, artillery fire requests, previously requested artillery fire resolution, direct fire, movement. Combat is resolved by dice rolls on probability tables. The game uses two six-sided dice of different colors, to generate numbers from 11 to 66.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation
publishers: John Curry, lulu.com, United States Army Engineer School

name: Think Tank
description:
Yet another packaging of Guggenheim/Categories.

A spinner determines what five categories and the five initial letters will use. The players have three minutes to complete their grids. When time has elapsed, each player may choose any square on one's grid for a free ten points. Players, then, compare answers. Ten points are scored for each unique answer. Each player scores five points for each duplicated answer. There is no penalty for illegal or no responses.

The player with the most points is the winner.

One interesting note: the game's catalog number is 666.

name: Professor Noggin's History of Art
description:
Learn to appreciate the highest achievements of civilization. Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions about the history of art.

Card topics include:
Leonardo da Vinci
Michelangelo
Sculpture
Painting Techniques and Materials
The Renaissance
Italian Renaissance
Rembrandt
Monet
Picasso
Impressionists and Post-Impressonists
World Architecture
Ancient Greek and Roman Art
Ancient Egyptian Art
Mary Cassat
Byzantine Art
Baroque
Rubens
American Art
Canadian Art
Modern Art
Musee de Louvre
Art Museums of the United States
Andy Warhol
Who Am I?
Name This Masterpiece

name: SPAZIO PROFONDO/OUTER SPACE
description:
SPAZIO PROFONDO/OUTER SPACE is a science fiction game of exploration, colonization, war and conquest in deep space; it is a cross-over of the first edition of Twilight Imperium and of Conquest of Paradise from GMT taking elements from both.

It is a fast and easy game to play and learn, it is good to introduce new players to wargames or for a one-session evening.

The game includes:

Easy to understand Rules
240 Megahexes used to build the map
Nearly 800 front-back counters including troops, colonies, planetary defences, warships, explorer and more
27 Random events cards
Charts and tables for easy play
The game system is based on Kevin McPartland Conquest of Paradise (GMT) fantastic game.


Currently the game is in Italian only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Mutation
description:
This is a strategic dice placement game for 2 - 4 players. Each player takes the roll of a strain of bacteria in a petri dish, and begins to mutate and grow their strain in an effort to be the biggest.

Every turn you roll two D6 spotted dice, and then place one of these on the board according to a set of simple rules. Do you extend your strain or do you focus on breaking apart an opponents? Do you risk expansion into a contested portion of the playing area or do you focus on strengthening, but not lengthening, your strain? Every turn has interesting and strategic decisions to be made all from a simple roll of two dice.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Teekessel im Quadrat
description:
From the publisher:

A compact collection of card games about and with homonyms, so-called "Teekessel / Teapots". The cards show 240 photos which display everyday views as well as extraordinary motives and perspectives. The players try to discover the "Teekessel" in the pictures and to combine the cards according to certain rules.
The complexity of the games varies from easy to difficult. They provide challenges as regards perception, quickness, knowledge, wit, creativity and language competence.

The games have been designed for cross-generational playing. They can be played within the family as well as in the contexts of language teaching and creativity training. So far Teekessel im Quadrat is available only in German.

name: Wicked Wickets
description:
Wicked Wickets is a cricket based table game suitable for the whole family, cricketers and non-cricketers alike, and can accommodate anything from two to twenty-two players. The game involves selection, bowling, batting, and active fielding, allowing for short over fast action games through to the complex realms of strategy found in test play. Although, like with cricket itself, the basics are simple and easily learnt, it will inevitably take a lifetime to master.

No prior knowledge of cricket is needed to play the game which is suitable for the whole family and up to 22 players. In essence the side that scores the most "runs" wins, though selecting the right players, the order they play, and where they are positioned all affect the outcome of the game. The basics of Wicked Wickets are really quite simple; the bowler throws the ball, in this case the red ball shaped die, and the batsman "hits" it by throwing the buff bat-shaped die. Adding the scores together shows how far the ball goes using the long flight measure. If the batsman's score is higher than the bowlers, the ball "flies" in the air; if the bowler's score is higher than the batsman's, then it is struck along the ground. The yellow counter and dice are used to show which direction the ball goes. The short pace measure is simply used to measure the distance players move and the green die is mostly used for fielding. The game cards give the individual abilities of the players affecting how and where they are used. However, as with most games there is often more to it than first meets the eye. --From the publisher

Official website: http://www.boadiceasbackyard.com/

name: Heavy Gear Fighter, Booster I Card Set
description:
A set of 12 new cards which expands the Heavy Gear Fighter base game. According to the description when published, these card are more powerful than those in the regular deck. The theme is power and performance, thus the name Booster

The 12 cards are:
* Multi (in three colors)
* Enhanced
* Explosive
* Malfunction
* False Alarm
* Heavy Rocket Pod
* Extended Range
* Tactical Linkup
* Nitro Charger

Two copies of this set was included in the periodical White Wolf Inphobia issue 52.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
publishers: Dream Pod 9, White Wolf Entertainment AB

name: Azad
description:
The game Azad is based on Ian M. Banks novel "the player of games".
Each player tries to get civilisation points with his tribes by building villages, towns and a metropolis. Each tribe has to earn ressources to support the villages and build new tribes.
Depending on the area the tribe moves, the attributes (power, movement, ressources) of each tribe changes and each player has to take a look at the enemy tribes and defend their own territory, before they take control of your ressources and cities.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Civilization, Fighting, Novel-based, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Network and Route Building

name: Combat Command: World War II Skirmish Rules for 25mm Miniatures
description:
Combat Command is a fully playable set of rules that allow you to fight larger skirmish actions of World War II in four hours or less!

Only 18 pages of core rules, all writen in an easy to read style, backed up by over 140 pages of table of organization and equipment data - including airplanes - for all major nationalities!

Scale: one figure equal one man, one weapon, or one vehicle.

name: Squadron Strike: Ship Book 2 ‚Äì The Three Face War
description:
The setting of the Posthuman Diaspora Goes to War! Squadron Strike allows you to build any ship from any universe; the home grown setting for Squadron Strike, introduced in the boxed set, gets an expansion with 15 more ships, plus registration benefits as the Japanese, Russians and Rhodesians slip into the posthuman conflict, where through mirroring one another, they go from war as a hobby to war as an avocation, carefully bound within rules of conduct, and monitored for compliance, and run by war ministries in a near post-scarcity society.

Also includes 3 more Ship Control Cards for the game.

(Publisher blurb)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Decisive battle! A Baoa Qu
description:
This is web-published tactical level space combat wargame based on "Mobile Suit Gundam", is a famous Japanese robotec animation. This game represent final battle between Earth Federation and Zeon Dukedom at Space Fortress A Baoa Qu in TV series episode 42 and 43.

Player control Space Fleet of either Earth Federation or Zeon Dukedom. Each units represent 4 space warships or about 10 to 15 mobile suits.

Turn order decide by chit-pull system. Each force has two activation chits and there are two non-activation chits, but each turn pulled only four chits. So activation order is very randomly. Combat resolve is used fire power CRT and two six side dice.

A victor is decided by the destruction of fortress units and capital ship units.



Official Homepage (Japanese text only)
http://mk2kpfb.html.tv/index.php?%E6%BF%80%E9%97%98%E3%82%A2...
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Schnuffi, wuff!
description:
The game consists of a special die and a set of tiles. These depict things that dogs do (sniff, pee, run, etc.). In the basic game, the children take turns picking up a card and acting out the action. Then they can keep the tile. At the end of the game, the player with most different card colors is the winner.

In a competitive variant, the players take turns rolling the die. A player rolling a dog symbol can pick up cards and act out the pictures and keep the tiles until another player rolls the dog symbol. The player with most tiles at the end of the game is the winner.

(user summary by HilkMAN)

name: Paradox
description:
This is a very strange card game. In the deck are 8 cards of this values: +1,+2,+3,+4,-2,-3.
Shuffle the deck an everybody gets 4 cards. Turn over the deck and do what the card says. If it is a positive card you as many cards from this deck. If it is a negative card you discard that number to the discard pile and add the negative card. When the deck runs out turn over the discard pile and go on. When all card are in the players hands, all positive cards count negative and the negative cards count zero.

name: DataMan
description:
DataMan is an space themed educational game that comes with a "DataMan calculator", 12 cards and 4 dual sided boards. Each of the 12 cards are printed with sepecific instructions that explain how to set up the the "calculator" for differant games.
The four boards generaly feature a geometric play area as well as instructions for more complicated games.

The DataMan story is generally based around three characters: DataMan, Commander NumberFun and AntiMath. DataMan is a small robot designed by Commander NumberFun who is a ruler of a far away planet. AntiMath is an "Evil wizard from a dark star who has a mysterous power to cloud the minds of his victims and steal away the fun and excitement of mathematics."
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Electronic, Math, Science Fiction

name: Vehicular Homicide: Core Rulebook
description:
Vehicular Homicide is a turn based combat game for two or more players set in a world where civilization has been reduced to gangs of nomads and fuel is the most powerful resource. The game allows players to create and control one of several different types of vehicles, from motorcycles to locomotives and everything in between. Vehicular Homicide gives players complete control over the creation of their vehicle. Players can create an existing vehicle from popular media or one from their own imagination. The possibilities are endless. The object of the game is to destroy the vehicles of the opposing gangs.

Vehicular Homicide is a standalone game that can also be used as an expansion for any other Toy Battle System game.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Transportation, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Gryps Campaign
description:
This is self-published strategy level wargame based on Japanese TV animation "Mobile suit Z Gundam" & "Mobile suit Gundam ZZ". This game cover three-way struggle with Titans, AEUG and Axis Zeon.

A player manage a treasury, assigns it in the development of the weapon, and the military operations.
A game purpose is control of important cities more than enemy factions at the end of the game.
The turn order of the military operations depends on a chit-pull system. The performance of the weapon and pilot's and captain's ability influence a battle greatly.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Tug of War
description:
PDF-print only game created by David Simpson (under the name Knighthawk Games, distributed with the assistance of Dilly Green Bean Games on DriveThruRPG). The game features a printable board and printable cards. The game requires 2 dice of each of the following types: 2 4-siders, 2 6-siders, 10-siders, and 1 marker to represent the progress.

The game revolves around opposed rolls between 2 players, with the marker moving in favor of the winner.

The game ends when the marker moves to the player's goal.

Currently available at:
RPG NOW http://www.rpgnow.com/product_info.php?products_id=87803
DriveThruRPG http://rpg.drivethrustuff.com/product_info.php?products_id=8...;filters=0_0_0_1300

Retails for $1.75
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: P.H.D.
description:
PHD is a unique game of words in which a player earns points (credits) by using imagination, creativity, and knowledge of words. To win the game, a player must initially obtain 80 credits and then be the first player to successfully fulfill the requirements of one of the four P.H.D professors.

From the back of the box:

"P.H.D. is the hilarious and stimulating game of words and definitions that lets you match wits with your opponents or face the word challenge of the board. Be crafty, deceptive, creative and imaginative. Bluff with the right answer or deceive with the wrong one. Be as cunning as you like. Or be perceptive enough to overcome the challenge of the board. You win both ways.

P.H.D. is easy to play and no one can monopolize the game, even if they've memorized the entire dictionary"
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move, Rondel, Voting

name: Bonjour la France
description:
From the rules:
The goal is to earn maximum points judiciously revive France as a puzzle. The board represents the hexagon National (without DOM but with Corsica!). The game consists of many pieces of the puzzle of departments, as well as tokens indicating the prefectures or departmental specialties.
Initially each player draws 5 counties, 10 prefectures and 10 specialties, and each poses its puzzle pieces and a cache behind chips individually. In turn, the players put pieces in the correct spaces beginning with peripheral places (or coastal) and can put together non-coastal places provided they are placed adjacent to the already in place spaces. Thus France will fill the edges toward the center.

A player may ask the prefecture or the specialty in the corresponding space, provided he/she has needed token and collects extra points. If the player can not ask any evidence, he filed a reserve one of its departments and takes one back into the pile. After playing, the player takes all the puzzle pieces or chips in the pile that the number had (the reserve is used when the original deck is empty).
One space on board alone is worth 10 points (and one prefecture alone or in a specialty only), a department with his or her specialty prefecture reported 50 points, 30 points for the prefecture and the specialty, and finally 100 points by asking the 3 elements of same department. The game stops at the laying of the latter department. A penalty of 10 points is imposed for any pawn prefecture or specialty kept on hand.
The highest total wins.

name: It Counts to Win
description:
Another self-print game from David Simpson (Tug of War).

It Counts to Win is an abstract game of dice, numbers, strategy and probabilities. Players roll dice and place them in either their pots, or other players' pots. Players attempt to make a total of '15', but beware, if you exceed 15, you'll have to start all over again, and your fellow players aren't going to let you make your 15 so easily. Players can either build their points or cause other players to bust by managing the dice rolled.

Every time a player makes 15, they score a point. First player to acquire 5 points wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Educational, Math, Number, Print & Play

name: House Liao: The Capellan Confederation
description:
From the back cover:

"Maximilian Liao offered Anton Marik two things: his daughter in marriage and the assassination of Anton's brother, Captain-General Janos Marik. To win the throne, Anton agreed, and the Free Worlds League plunged into a devastating civil war...

His work done, Maximilian Liao just sat back and smiled.

Although perceived as the weakest Successor State, House Liao's Capellan Confederation is still a wily, treacherous, and formidable foe. Ruthlessly dominated by the cunning Maximilian Liao, the Confederation schemes to pick up the pieces of the shattered Inner Sphere and declare itself leader of a new Star League.

From their tremendous library containing the knowledge of the universe, ComStar has compiled this dossier on House Liao and the Capellan Confederation. Included are dozens of full-color illustrations depicting Confederation personalities, daily life, and military regalia. Classified documents on Confederation armed forces, the Warrior Houses, military structure, and political intrigues are also provided. In addition, the large history chapter stretches from Franco Liao's unification of the Confederation to Maximilian Liao's devious plotting to control the Inner Sphere.

The rulers of the other Successor States do not consider Liao a threat - Maximilian Liao just sits back and smiles."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: BattleTech: ComStar
description:
From the back of the book:

"As the Star League was dying on the eve of the Succession Wars, the House Lords agreed on one final action. At the suggestion of General Kerensky they appointed Jerome Blake as Minister of Communications and charged him with repairing the damaged HPG network. This would prove a momentous decision.

Within a few short years after Kerensky's Exodus, Blake and his followers had seized control of Terra and declared themselves neutral in the coming conflicts. The newly-named ComStar evolved into a pseudo-religious organization, with Blake as its divine founder, that positioned itself as the keeper of technology and the preserver of humanity's future.

For nearly 300 years, ComStar watched as the Succession Wars ripped apart the Inner Sphere and technology was lost, waiting for the day when they would step in to save humanity from a new dark age. But the 31st century changed all of that.

This sourcebook presents the history and inner workings of ComStar, including the devastating schism that struck the sect in the days following their victory over the Clans at Tukayyid."

User comment:

This sourcebook is largely background detail provided in much the same format as the earlier background books such as House Steiner: The Lyran Commonwealth or The Periphery although it runs up to 3055 rather than 3025. This sourcebook includes details of the Nexus, Raijin and Grand Crusader 'Mechs, which were reprinted in the BattleTech Technical Readout: 3058.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Non-Stop Safari
description:
Non-Stop Safari is a 2 to 4 player print and play board game submission to the 2011 Global Game Jam. Players take on the role of rich financiers who send hunters on safari to find valuable animal pelts. Only the rarest pelts will fetch the highest price, and you can’t get more rare than extinct! By hunting a species to extinction players can guarantee a high return on their precious pelts. Oh, and watch out for poachers, unless of course, they’re working for you!

The object of the game is to be the player with the most money by the end of the game. The game ends immediately after the third species has gone extinct. All pelts of this species are sold off as usual and then money totals are counted.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Worker Placement

name: Killzone 2
description:
Killzone 2 is a cardgame made by a fan of the Playstation 3 game called Killzone 2. It's a two player game, for free on the web. One player takes control of ISA (human) army, the other player is Helghast. The goal is to destroy enemy. There are two 63-card decks. In the first round, every players draw 6 cards. If they have at least 2 basic cards (soldiers and shock troopers), the battle begin.In each round, player draws one card and heals character for 10 points. Every round you have 10 Action Points and you can use them to:

-attack
-place basic character in spawn point
-evolve character (example= soldier can evolve to any V1 character [medic, saboteur etc.] or in soldier v2)
-place vechiles
-equip weapons, tools
-use tools

You can have:

1 Active Character
5 Spawn Point Characters
Vechile, Weapon, Tool

If enemy haven't got any characters on spawn point or in active character place, you win!
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: Bottle-caps
description:
Bottle-caps is a traditional game originating from the beginning of 20th century. It's probably the ancestor of the Pitch Car game. It uses crown bottle-caps to simulate a race. In its early days it was a cart race, now it usually is a car race. It can be played on a table, on a floor or outdoors.

Players start from making the race track. Depending on the environment they may draw it on a big sheet of paper, arrange it using available objects like books, boxes, tools, etc, draw it with a piece of chalk on a flat surface, or even cut it with a knife on the ground. For some game events the tracks were specially designed and made of gypsum.

Then each player takes his or her bottle-cap, and puts it at the start line. To make the caps heavier they are usually filled with candle wax, gypsum, plasticine, clay, or even lead (for outdoor races only). The race begins then and the players - in appropriate order - finger-flick their bottle-caps towards the finish line, avoiding their "cars" getting out the track or stopping on trap areas that require players to go back, miss a turn etc.

name: BattleTech: Objective Raids
description:
From the back of the book:

Objective Raids is an indispensable resource for BattleTech and MechWarrior players, providing current listings of units and industries on worlds along the border of the Clan occupation zone.

A discussion of the tactics for conducting raids, two representative industrial floor plans, and a reference guide for locating the manufacturing site of any BattleMech, vehicle, aerospace fighter or component is also included.

User comment:

This sourcebook is an expansion for MechWarrior and BattleTech, although it's slightly strange in that it offers nothing by way of rules, and not much by way of fluff. It's essentially a battle- or campaign-building resource, that works very well with Hot Spots and the Mercenary's Handbook: 3055 in two different ways.
