Firstly, it provides an updated military roster for the Successor States, the three major Periphery realms and the clans, the first such major update since the BattleTech: 20 Year Update.

Secondly, it includes locations for every major defence industry plant, anywhere. If you want to know where PitBan 320 engines are manufactured, this book can tell you. Not just aircraft, vehicles and 'Mechs, but every major component. That actually adds a surprising amount of depth for a campaign, because it gives good background reasons for staging raids, slash and burn attacks and the like. It's also not difficult to work backwards using other sourcebooks to place those industry sites in their correct realms at various points in history, so the book can work well with the older House books for games set before, during or after the Fourth Succession War.

This book's no longer in print, but it is available as an electronic download from the current licence holder, and as this isn't a book you'll need out on the tabletop on a regular basis like a main rulebook or the Technical Readouts, it's one that doesn't suffer from staying in electronic form.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Stock Car Championship Racing Expansion Pack
description: This expansion for The Stock Car Championship Racing Game adds a cardboard strip of track, more rules, a pad of race sheets, and three chase cards to the basic game.

name: Freebooterz
description:
Freebooterz is a Rogue Trader expansion describing the Space Orks of the Warhammer 40000 universe.

The 148 pages book includes army lists for three ork clans (Death Skulls, Evil Sunz and Bad Moon) and several types of Ork Freebooterz, as well as painting and building tips, special Ork characters and new war machines like the Traktor Kannon or the Bubble Chukka.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: BattleTech: Chaos March
description:
From the back of the book:

Chaos March gives players the information they need to run games and campaigns in the troubled Sarna March. The Guide to the Chaos March offers players an up-to-date look at the many factions and employment opportunities on the planets in the area, including first-person accounts of the real situations. Chaos March also includes new rules and equipment for BattleTech and MechWarrior, and a chapter describing Outreach, the ideal starting point for a Chaos March campaign.

User comment:

This sourcebook filled the need for an area that could be used in campaigns that didn't feature the Clans, but also wasn't another "fight the Periphery Bandits" scenario repeated over and over. The location of the Chaos March within the Inner Sphere makes it ideal for use with factions from all of the major Houses, and the book offers lots of plot hooks and ideas. It also introduces several new vehicles, including possibly the most dangerous helicopter in BattleTech history.

This book's probably of most use to those who want to create battles that involve any major or minor faction wanted, want to use Level 2 technology, and don't want to be limited to scenarios linked to the period between the war of 3039 and the Clan invasion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Iron Tyrants
description:
A Miniatures Game of Massive Robotic Mayhem

Iron Tyrants is a tabletop miniatures game of massive robotic combat. Each player will field a squad of tyrants, giant walking robots armed to the teeth with cannons, rockets, and lasers in an attempt to dominate the battlefield and crush his opponent under his metal heel. Sometimes, victory may mean simply being the last player with tyrants left standing, but a variety of scenarios are provided featuring a range of victory conditions so that every game is a completely different experience.

A full campaign is also included. The campaign will have players fighting for one of three factions over control of Gateworld Atropos and the future of the Allyrian Sector. Rules are included for the variety of environs on the gateworld such that the gateworld's weather and conditons bring the battlefield to life.

The system is d10-based and features several areas of resource management leading players to balance risks versus rewards with nearly every decision on the table. The key behind this is the Overload mechanic in which a tyrant may be pushed well beyond its normal capabilities but at great risk to both the machine and the pilot. Players also have a limited supply of Tactics Dice which are used both in determining initiative and in activating special abilities provided by unique commanders. Gameplay is filled with difficult decisions in which every choice has a consequence.

The game was intended to be played on a tabletop filled with terrain but hexmaps may also be used without issue. All game measurements are made from a 1-inch round base so units may be represented by any appropriate miniature. In the very near future we will be releasing printable miniatures for each tyrant in the game.

It's a game about tough choices. It's a game about resource management. Most importantly, it's a game about giant robots blasting the hell out of each other across the torn landscape of the future.

name: Exquisite Rivalry
description:
Now all of Count Hogarth's children have come of age it is time for them to prove themselves independently. The Count has given each of them a small sum of his fortune to invest in building their own settlement.

The settlements must be filled with pleasure, be plentiful and ruled with an iron fist of power. Without all of these elements it will not be exquisite and if it is anything less than exquisite you will be banished, deep within the cellars of the Count's castle never to return again.

Only one child shall be the Count's future successor and you better make sure that it is you.

Exquisite rivalry is an auction game of 3 to 4 players based in a medieval setting. Players compete to bid on different elements to improve their town. The winner of each round getting first pick of the cards and the loser collecting the most gold in return.

The winner is the player who has managed to gain the highest majority in two out of the three elements required to impress Count Hogarth: Pleasure, Plenty and Power

name: En Pointe Toujours!: Blind√©s fran√ßais au combat 1987-2008
description:
Blindés français au combat 1987-2008 (French Armour in combat 1987-2008) is an expansion, only available in French, for En Pointe Toujours V: Afrique contemporaine, fifth module of the En Pointe Toujours! series.
En Pointe Toujours V: Afrique contemporaine was published with Vae Victis 80.

This DTP expansion includes one countersheet, three sheets of terrains, historical notes, twelve scenarios and one campaign.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Leap Frog
description:
Leap Frog is a children's game for two players. The board contains a grid, representing a lilly pond.

Each player has five lilly pad counters, which are moved around the pond according to the roll of a die. In addition, each player has four frog counters, which start on opposite banks of the pond.

The object of the game is to move all four frogs to the other side of the pond - but you're only allowed to jump to a location that contains a lilly pad. Frogs are allowed to "leapfrog" over lilly pads which contain another frog (as long as there's an empty lilly pad on the other side).

The first player to successfully move all four frogs to the opposite side of the board wins the game.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zaunk√∂nig
description:
In Zaunkönig, players start the game by seeding each space on the beech game board with one or two of the 130 rings made from German cherry wood.

On a turn, a player places a number of rings on the board as determined by the die roll, with the player deciding where to place them; if a player creates a tower of four rings, that tower is dismantled, with one piece going in each of the adjacent orthogonal spaces. (If a ring would fall off the edge of the board, the ring is placed on the opposite side of the tower.) If another four-piece tower is thereby created, that tower is dissolved as well. For each four-piece tower a player creates, he receives a ring from the supply.

At the end of a player's turn, he places one of his colored marbles on a tower. If a ring would be placed on this tower, the marble's owner collects it instead. The game ends when the ring supply runs out, and the player with the most rings wins.

name: Battles of the Northwest Rebellion
description:
(from the company website)

In 1885, western Canada is rocked by the specter of rebellion. Louis Riel, who had fled to the US following the Red River Rebellion in 1870 had been called back by the Metis of Saskatchewan to make their case before the federal government. The result was the Northwest Rebellion, which started with the Battle of Duck Lake in March and ended with the Battle of Loon Lake in June. In the meantime, 5,000 government soldiers covered thousands of kilometers and fought four pitched battles against various First Nations and Metis opponents. Fish Creek was a meeting engagement that caused the government forces to re-evaluate their strategy against the Metis. Cut Knife Hill was a reconnaissance in force, which almost cost the government a "Custer" like tragedy. Frenchman's Butte was an assault on a prepared position designed to free hostages and capture the hostiles of Big Bear's Cree band. Each was a near run affair, and each was a battle of the Northwest Rebellion. Each game is grand tactical in scale, with units representing companies (or their equivalent) per unit (10 men per strength point), and each hex represents approx. 100 yards.

The game includes the following 5 battles, each with it's own map and counters.


Fish Creek - April 24, 1885
Cut Knife Hill - May 2, 1885
Duck Lake - March 26, 1885
Frenchman's Butte - May 28, 1885
Loon Lake - June 3, 1885

name: Wings of War: Rain of Destruction
description:
Wings of War next planned expansion kit with heavy fighters and two-engine bombers for the Second World War and the Spanish Civil War.
Bf.110, Beaufighter, Ki.45, Pe-2, Do.17, He.111, B.R.20 and B-25 would have been featured in several sub-variants, with color schemes of different nationalities.
It should have been released in 2011. NG International stopped operating when the product was ready to be printed.
Some of the airplanes included then became miniatures. He-111 and B-25 as Wings of Glory: WW2 Special Packs, Beaufighter and Bf.110 as Wings of Glory: WW2 Airplane Packs. Rules are in the Wings of Glory: WW2 Rules and Accessories Pack.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), NG International Srl.

name: Fleets
description:
"FLEETS is a fleet-scale combat game simulating tactical warfare between fleets on a squadron level. Players can take command of fleets as small as a frigate group to as large as an entire battlefleet! These three units contain the rules, the pieces, and the charts needed to play the basic game."

A game design concepted and constructed in the span of a week, FLEETS was one of my senior project designs from CSU East Bay in 2009. It is currently undergoing testing, balancing, and mid-level development and I'm seeking a publisher.

FLEETS is an abstract game of space warfare with fleet numbers measuring into the hundreds. Not quite a board game but not quite a miniatures game, FLEETS straddles both lines and is simple enough to complete a session in under a half hour. Several expansions are planned once it takes off.

name: MILITARIA: Military History Quiz Game
description:
The game is a card game on Military History, where six questions are on the one side of a card and the appropriate answers on the back side. The questions are colorcoded into six categories:

1. Up to 1200 A.D.
2. The 18th and 19th Centuries
3. Naval History
4. Aviation History
5. Personalities
6. General Knowledge

There are three ways to play MILITARIA (from the box):
1. The cards can be used purely as a reference for a Military History Quiz with questions chosen at random.
2. Each player can attempt to answer all the questions on one card for 1 point each. Should they reach a certain level of correct answers on this card, then they continue their turn by answering the next card also.
3. The cards can be used in conjunction with any comparable TRIVIAL game.

The box contains 200 cards with 6 questions each.

name: 4 Letter Word
description:
A simple fast paced party game. Players use cards to build sets of four letter words.

Each player draws a card from the deck in an attempt to play a word. To play a word the player takes cards from his hand and places them face up covering the previous word to create a new one. The player can use as many cards as needed but Words may only consist of exactly four (4) letters and at least ONE letter must be used from the previous word.

Points are awarded the number of letters used and the complexity of the word.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Atlantis: The Lost Empire
description:
A card game to 2-4 players when they assume roles of explorers looking for the road to the lost city of Atlantis.

Firstly, each player draws a Mission card (Mision cards) that would tell players what cards they can play depending on the color of the card.

In each turn, a player can play, discard or save one of their 4 cards.

The goal is to complete 6 steps, from card number 1 to 6.

The first player to do that is the winner.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mug Book: The Game of Street Crimes
description:
After establishing their rank, based on the running score accumulated during previous games, The players read the Crime Report which is the scenario for the players to solve. Using the supplies given, the players race to solve the crime and make an arrest. Points are scored or lost depending on performance.The object is to win enough games to move up through the ranks to become Deputy Police Chief.

The game is packaged in a thick plastic pouch and contains:
- Rules
- Mug Book of Criminals
- Crime Scenario Book #1
- Directory
- Time Sequence Chart
- Map of the City

The game seems to have been, shall we say, inspired by Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective by Sleuth.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: EIC League
description:
EIC League is a tactical combat / RPG crossover that is completely customizable. You add your own dice and playing field to the EIC League rules that you download, and you are ready to go.

Every player is assigned the same number of credits (a budget) that they have to spend to buy and customize their units.

Players design units (either bipeds or tanks), equip them with the 7 ratings they need (body material, attack, defense, power, speed, detection & ECM), then outfit them with weapons, shielding, and special movements. After the units are completed, they pit their team against one or more opponents. The game is like chess on steroids!

The infinite combinations of weapons, movements and defenses against the other team's weapons movements and defenses makes for a unique playing experience each and every game.

Unit design can take up to 2 hours for first time players, and play time can range anywhere from 30 minutes to 4 hours. The object of the game is to obliterate the opposition and collect credits for rewards. With those credits, you can buy more units or upgrade your existing units through the roof.

Strategy is the key to winning. Do you use a bunch of fast and light units or just work with a couple of super strong slow units, or go with a mix of everything? Depending on what you do and what each opponent does, you can battle for hours or you can make a fatal mistake and have things end very quickly. No two games are alike!

name: Fair Trade: A Game of Competitive Coffee Cartels
description:
Fair Trade: A Game of Competitive Coffee Cartels is a light economic game simulating supply and demand in the fair trade market. Players make contracts with growers, sell coffee to their market, and improve their operation in order to satisfy the cravings of addicts the world over.

On each turn a player does the following:

1) Draw three coffee cubes from a bag containing equal amounts of coffee cubes. Add them to the demand meters in the center of the board.
2) "Make contracts" with growers from the four corners of the world by moving each grower marker up or down on the contract grid in front of you.
3) The growers then grow coffee. Each player draws one cube for each region he/she has contracts with. The amount of contracts made for that region as well as the type of cube drawn determines how much coffee you get.
4) The player has the option to advertise specific types of coffee, thus potential increasing demand for their stock.
5) Players then may sell their coffee, making more for coffees in higher demand. Selling coffee reduces demand for that coffee in their region.

Because there is a set amount of cubes in the bag, players must balance supply and demand to stay on top.

Fair Trade: A Game of Competitive Coffee Cartels is the first in a line of "Green" games by I-55 Games (a non-profit publisher aimed to provide workplace re-entry training in St. Louis). These games are all hand manufactured and made with almost entirely re-purposed material.

name: Anima Tactics: Saint Astraege
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Saint Astraega is the youngest person ever sanctified by the church. Often called the Saint Child, her control over the Tarod Arcana gives her unprecedented powers to assist her companions in battle.

Mystic - Light Church - Level 40

The Holy Priestess (Magic, Effect) - Retire two negative State counters from one friendly unit within Astraega's Control Zone.

The Temperance (Magic, Effect) - One friendly unit within Astraega's Control Zone recovers 1d10 Life Points.

The World (Magic, Effect) - One friendly unit within Astraega's Control Zone gains immunity to all damage until the end of the turn. The World doesn't prevent the loss of Life Points caused by Sacrifices.

The Star (Magic, Effect, Reactive) - This skill nullifies up to 10 damage points from a single attack to a friendly unit withing Astraega's Control Zone.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Anima Tactics: High Saint Elienai
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Elienai is the most great and powerful of all the saints of the Church. For centuries, her mortally wounded body has been entombed in suspended animation in the depths of the sacred city of Albidion, while she projects her soul across the world of Gaïa to save it from destruction.

Leader Mystic - Light Church - Level 65

Innate Skills: Initiative, Flight, Intangible.

Superior Presence: Elienai’s Control Zone is 12 inches.

Essence: Elienai Recovers 2 Life Points at the beginning of each Recovery Phase.

Hand of God (Magic, Effect) - All friendly units within Elienai’s Control Zone may throw an additional dice each time they Attack or Dodge (normal or special) and chose the highest result.

Threads of Destiny (Magic, Effect, Reactive) - This skill nullifies the effect of one Gnosis Point used by an enemy unit within Elienai’s Control Zone. Threads of Destiny should be activated when the enemy player declares the use of the Gnosis Point, but before rolling any dice.

Vision (Magic, Effect) - Automatically detect any hidden units within Elienai’s Control Zone.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Anima Tactics: Odin Goldsmith
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Many say that there are people born with a special talent for war. With his almost seven and a half feet of height, chiseled musculature, and unbreakable spirit, Odin Goldsmith proves this maxim true. Over thirty years he has been present in every documented conflict and involved in hundreds of secret special operations. Today, at forty-six years old, he continues being the perfect soldier, an unstoppable fighting machine.

Mystic - Samael - Level 50

Innate Abilities: Critical Mastery.

Chain of Blows: If Odin causes a Critical Hit when he Charges or Attacks, he makes an additional free attack on the same target immediately after the first attack resolves. These additional Attacks may cause more attacks due to the Chain of Blows rules.

To the Limit: If Odin has 10 or less Life Points he recovers one additional Action in the Recovery Phase. If Odin has 5 or less Life Points he recovers 2 additional Actions instead of one.

Magnum (Ki, Attack) - Roll two dice and keep the highest result.

Whirlwind of Swords (Ki, Attack) - Affects all enemy Units within 2 inches of Odin. This attack is not affected by the Chain of Blows rule.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Money Go Round
description: Family business game which reuses many of the ideas from Monopoly. The theme is a trip to the fairground, and players travel around a figure of eight shaped track landing on various spaces, which include actions such as finding 10p on a park bench, or missing a bus, as well as the various attractions which can be bought and will then earn admission fees from other players landing on them. If a set of related stalls are bought then the admission goes up, and advertising chips can be bought to further increase admission costs. The Fair Manager's Office replaces Jail and so on. All the money is in small numbers of £ and p with realistic card coins and paper notes, making it a useful game to teach children to deal with money too.

name: Sea of Vowels
description:
The game contains two decks of vowel cards, one for long vowel sounds and one for short vowel sounds. Only one of the decks is used during each game, as chosen by the players. There is also a gameboard consisting of spaces with the vowel letters a, e, i, o, and u.

On each turn, the player draws a card from the deck of vowel cards. The player says the name of the object on the card, then advances to the first space that matches the vowel on the card. To stay there, the player must say another object with the same vowel sound. Other players may give hints if the player cannot think of one. If they fail to name another object with the same vowel sound, the player must move back one space. The vowel deck also contains advance or penalty cards that move a player forward or backward along the gameboard. A player does not need to say an object when landing on a space due to one of these cards.

The first player to reach the treasure chest by advancing along the path and drawing a vowel card with an o sound (the letter shown on the treasure chest) wins the game.

An alternate rule set allows for team play using the same gameplay, but no hints are allowed in this version.

name: Anima Tactics: High Arbiter Arkeid
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Arkeid, The Angel Judge, is one of the greatest powers of Gaïa, and a key piece in the structure of the Azur Alliance. Hiding to the world that she is even a human being, she combines her incredible abilities of battle with a unique talent to summon luminous companies. Her power is such that she is even capable of altering reality, generating loops in time and space to exchange the position of people.

Leader Warrior/Mystic - Light Azur Alliance - Level 85

Summoner Level: 1
Affinity: Light

Innate Abilities: Initiative

Light Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack) - Distance (16 inches).

Dynasty of Light (Ki, Attack) - +2 Attack / +3 Damage.

Heaven's Breaker (Magic, Ranged Attack) - Distance (16 inches). +2 Damage. If this attack hits its target, then all Characters within 2 inches of the target character also suffer the Attack.

Final Wish (Ki, Attack) - +2 Damage. Final Wish affects all enemy units within 3 inches of Arkeid.

Light Shield (Magic, Effect) - A friendly Character within Arkeid's control zone gains Lv. 2 Shield.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Anima Tactics: Claude Valmore
description:
Publihser Blurb:

Claude Valmore, a former member of the Cerberus Division, is now one of the most enthusiastic champions of the Azur Alliance. A devout follower of the Arbitrator Arkeid, who he considers a beacon of hope for Gaïa, this intrepid fighter is ready to prove that his inhuman endurance can only be matched by his determination.

Warrior - Light Azur Alliance - Level 45

Vermilion Parry (Ki, Dodge) - If the dodge is a success, the attacker suffers Seal Lvl 2.Effect 15.

Counter of the Cross (Ki, Counterattack) - Attack +4 / Defense -2. By using this Counter, Claude may counterattack even if he failed to dodge the attack.

Absolute Defense (Ki, Effect, Reactive) - This ability may only be activated during the Maintenance Phase. Counterattacks become free actions for the rest of the turn. If an enemy unit engaged in hand-to-hand combat with Claude try to escape, Claude perform a free attack against it before it rolls for the escape.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Anima Tactics: Empire Agent
description:
Publihser Blurb:

The Empress' Hand agents are the elite of the Heavens Order, people who have put their power at the service of Elisabetta Barbados and her dream.

Warrior - Light Empire - Level 20

Agent: Empire Agents are not unique characters and you may include 1 for every 150 Levels in an Empire Party. For example, a party of 300 levels could include up to two Empire Agents.

Master Attack (Ki, Attack) - +4 Damage

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Anima Tactics: Macbeth
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Appointed by the Queen of Spades to destroy darkness no matter the form it takes, Macbeth is the newest of the Knights of Azriel. Just over a year ago his physical body was destroyed while protecting Lillian Virgil. Despite this, Macbeth’s spirit carries on as a large suit of armor manifesting quasi divine powers. Macbeth has put these powers and his dedication to the light at the service of the Girl Empress of Abel.

Warrior/Mystic - Light Empire - Level 55

Innate abilities: Damage Resistance, Immunity (Doom)
Destroyer of the Unholy: Macbeth's Attacks against dark units use his secondary Damage value.
Aegis: Macbeth uses his secondary Defense value against Ranged Attacks.
Immortal Breath: At the end of each Maintenance Phase, Macbeth or a friendly Unit within his control Zone gains Healing Lv1

Consecrate (Magic, Effect, Reactive) - A friendly unit within Macbeth's control zone gets +1 Attack, +1 Defense and +1 Resistance until the end of the turn. Limit: Once per Turn.

The Sword of Azrael (Ki, Attack) - This attack affects all enemy units within 2 inches of Macbeth.

Soul of Light (Ki, Attack) - +2 Damage. If this attack destroys an enemy Unit, Macbeth cannot lose Life Points for the rest of the Turn.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Anima Tactics: Hiro
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Hiro was a slight boy who always dreamed of becoming a "Hero of Justice" whose wish has amazingly become a reality. After suffering a crippling and horrific accident, Wissenschaft researchers subjected Hiro’s body to a ridiculously large dose of Process. Hiro was reborn with abilities to match his wildest dreams. Now, convinced that he is part of a secret society that seeks to protect the world while operating from the shadows, he has no qualms about using his superhuman prowess to further the aims of Wissenschaft. Along with the other crows, the "Ranger Avengers" as he calls them, Hiro stands ready to safeguard Gaia, at least in his own mind.

Warrior - Light Wissenschaft - Level 50

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Anima Tactics: Arias Vayu
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Queen of the Winds, Lady of the Sylph, Stormbringer... many are the names that the Arias Vayu, the higher class of air elemental, are known by. Like lesser demigods, these creatures only walk Gaïa when called by the most powerful of summoners. Able to control the weather over the whole world there powers are fearsome indeed.

Mystic - Light Summon - Level 50

Innate Abilities: Flight, Intangible, Ranged Attack 16 inches.
Blades of Air: Arias Vayu's Attacks ignore 1 point of their target's Armor.

Elemental Crystals: Arias Vayu is accompanied by four elemental crystals that must be placed in contact with her base when she is summoned to the board. The crystals move independently during Arias Vayu's activation as flying units with Speed of 12 inches and a Control Zone of 4 inches. The crystals cannot take any other action than to move and are immune to negative states. They may be the target of any attack, in which case they have a Defense of 8 and 1 LP. They can be engaged in Hand-to-hand combat, though any unit that wants to withdraw from combat with them can do so without needing to Escape first. A crystal is destroyed if it suffers any damage, and they all will be removed when Aria's Vayu leaves the game for any reason.

Elemental Crystal (Magic, Effect) - Put an Elemental Crystal on the board within Arias Vayu's Control Zone. This ability only allows the replacement of already destroyed crystals. It cannot allow Arias Vayu to have more than 4 crystals on the board at once.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Illuminati: Unconstitutional! Promo Card
description:
This is a give away card distributed at conventions or by buying from Warehouse 23 (SJ Games' online store).

By playing this card you can cancel an NWO just played and, if you also control the Supreme Court, you can replace the cancelled NWO with any NWO of the same colour, or choose not to replace it at all.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Anima Tactics: Jerome
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Jerome, the second member of the Three People in the Abyss. In devotion to his sister, Jerome gave up his position as the heir of his clan to follow Hel into exile. Like their leader Dead Moon, he is working with the Azur Alliance under the orders of the High Arbiter Aizen. As a born warrior, Jerome has inherited the ancient combat skills of his family and has combined them with the pirate queen personal style, which makes him a particularly deadly foe.

Warrior/Prowler - Dark Azur Alliance - Level 40

Innate Abilities: Infiltration

Stealth (Subterfuge, Effect) - Jerome becomes Hidden. Upkeep: 1

Mark of Death (Subterfuge, Attack) - +3 Attack / +3 Damage. This skill can be used only if Jerome is Hidden.

Maw of the Leviathan (Subterfuge, Effect) - Target unit inside Jerome's Control Zone loses 1 action point and may not move this turn. Effect 15.
Limit: 1 per turn.

Hell Wave (Ki, Attack) - -1 Attack. Hell Wave affects all enemy units within 2 inches.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Anima Tactics: Deadmoon
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Deadmoon, also known as the Pirate Queen or the Lady of the Blood Moon, is the young leader of the Three Lords of the Abyss. After becoming one of the most feared pirates of the Interior Sea, the fame of her abilities became so legendary it attracted the attention of Matthew Gaul himself, who put her to service aside his companions. Now she uses her control of Darkness and the night to achieve the aims of her lord and her own.

Warrior/Prowler - Dark Azur Alliance - Level 55

Innate Abilities: Critical Mastery

Shadow of the Moon (Magic, Effect) - Enemy units 6 inches or further may not draw Line of Sight to Deadmoon. Upkeep: 1

Lunatic Malice (Ki, Attack, Effect) - +5 Attack. If Lunatic Malice causes any damage, the target suffers Blind Lv. 2. Effect 15.

Lunatic Sickle (Ki, Ranged Attack) - Distance (16 Inches). If the attack hits, Deadmoon may make a free second attack against an enemy unit within 2 Inches of the original target.

Lunatic Void (Magic, Effect, Reactive) - Deadmoon recovers 4 LP. This ability may only be used if a unit within her Control Zone uses a magic ability.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Anima Tactics: Valis Ul Del Vilfain
description:
Sylvain Princess Valis Vilfain is one of the most exceptional agents employed by Wissenschaft. Trained by the best teachers of her race over centuries to become the ultimate weapon of the Elven people, none can equal her mystical might. She provides Wissenschaft with a mystical teacher without peer.

Neutral Wissenschaft Optional Leader Mystic Warrior - Lv. 55

At 6 | Dm 4 | Df 9 | Ar 1 | LP 14 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/5

Summoner Level: 2
Affinity: Light, Dark, Void

Equipment: Valis may have up to 2 Advantage Cards assigned to her.

Battle Summoner: While Valis is engaged she doesn't have to pay a character's cost to Summon to summon it.

Kadru: If Valis' melee attack causes damage, the unit suffers poison Lv. 2 Effect 15

ooo - Shesha (Ki, Attack)

+ 5 Attack

ooo - Arjuna (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance 16 inches. +1 attack / +2 damage

ooo - Nux (Magic, Effect)
Choose either Magic, Ki or Subterfuge. If an enemy unit uses an action of the chosen category within Valis Control Zone, their cost increases up an action point. Upkeep: o

oooo - Naga (Magic, Effect)
All enemy units within Valis Control Zone suffer poison Lv. 2 Effect 16

Princess the of Arias

Optional Leader
You can use these skills card when Valis is set up. Valis get +5 levels, gets all the abilities on this card and is the Leader.

Poisoned Beings: Summoned monsters which have been called by Valis obtain Valis' ability Kadru.

o - Meister Aria (Magic, Effect)
A friendly unit within Valis Control Zone receives one of the following bonuses:
Until end of the round, all attacks by the friendly unit ignore the armor of the defender.
The ranges for walking, running and charges for the friendly unit increases by 4 inches.
The next escape action of the friendly unit in the current round succeeds automatically.
The next seek action of the friendly unit in the current round succeeds automatically.
Until end of the round the friendly unit receives +2 defense.
This ability does not affect Gears, unless they are controlled by Reist Ebersbacher.
Limit: Once per round.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Shamu and his Crew, Protect Our Seas Game
description:
From the back of the box:

"Go on an ocean voyage with Shamu and his friends!

Get ready for a spectacular journey where you will help brng Shamu's friends to safety! In this exciting game, you'll have fun as you learn about some of the dangers that face our friends who live in the seas. Dolly Dolphin is caught in a net and Pete Penguin is atop an iceberg. Baby Shamu has been beached and O.P. Otter us in an oil slick. But help is on the way!

Roll the die and send your Shamu mover across the ocean floor to the danger spaces. Once you get there, you'll be able to resuce Shamu's friends. Save them, thn move them to the dock before going onto the Funship. The first Shamu there wins!"

Features a 3-D game board.

Published in concert with Sea World.

name: Alchemy
description:
Alchemy is an "exploration and resource management game for 2-3 players." Players use alchemy ..... Combine different color powders to gain special abilities, or find the best trading routes to maximize your profit. Players score victory points on gold, unused workers, and magic spells (the amount of victory points is somewhat variable since alchemy can be applied to the items to adjust the point values).

All quotes are taken from the designer's website.

name: MLB Trade Up
description:
MLB Trade Up is designed for two teams, the game is played with a custom set of baseball cards, categorized with five point rankings.
Kids manage their teams of all-stars and compete against their friends to build a powerhouse lineup. Initially kids are randomly dealt a full line-up of cards.
These cards are comprised of top MLB players arranged in 7 power ranks based on actual MLB statistics. The initial hand contains a full lineup of players, and each team trades up their players by successfully answering questions and completing a series of DVD challenges.
This enables each team to build a stronger team each turn. With teams built, players then face off in the ultimate trading card all-star challenge, the head-to-head World Series game begins on the MLB Trade-Up Stadium Game board.
Winner takes all!

Features over 60 MLB all-star baseball cards, board with field and scoring, 2 Gold Glove defensive strategy cards, and DVD with MLB highlights of all-stars.

Some of the challenges teams will face:
• Ground Rules - Play games about baseball rules facts and lingo.
• Mascot Match Up Learn fun facts about team mascots!
• Word Jam Solve puzzles and Trade Up for better cards!
• World Series Play for the pennant.

List of Contents:
• Interactive DVD with Games and Challenges
• 52 Custom MLB Trade Up Baseball Cards
• Game Board
• Video of MLB Superstars
• Two Defensive Strategy Cards

name: Rapid Fire!: Campaign Guide ‚Äì Operation Market Garden September 1944
description:
Covers the allied attempt to take the Rhine bridges at Arnhem and the attempt top relive them. Gives full game maps of the terrain over which the campaign was fought as well as army list of all the units involved. Also provides a full list of the equipment used stated for Rapid Fire 1st edition. It can be fought as a campaign pr as individual scenarios and included a large Arnhem scenario that covers only the fighting if 1st Airborne division.
It also included a number of rules modifications.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Lawn Mayhem
description:
In the small town of Greenfield everything seems nice and quiet. The inhabitants are enjoying the summer and many of them sit around eating and drinking in their gardens. But suddenly something breaks the silence. The noise comes from old Mrs. Olsen’s - it sounds as if a whole car park was just started up. What is going on?

The situation is actually pretty simple: Old Mrs. Olsen is a lawn mower enthusiast and she is just tired of looking at her neighbors’ beautiful lawns and trimmed hedges while her own garden has been overgrown for years. Now she wants to relive the time when she could race her lawn mowers around the garden. To accomplish this she has hired some of the supposedly nice kids from the neighborhood. The youngsters don’t really all want to help, but she offers them money for the grass and weeds they can mow, and she finds a mower in her collection that matches each of them.

The goal of the game:
The players play one of the kids and compete with each other to mow the most grass and weeds while avoiding the flowers. At the same time they try not to run down the old woman, her cat or the other kids. The player who earns the most money (victory points) wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Trifix
description:
This game was handed out to all participants of the mathematical kangaroo competition 2011 in Germany from 5th grade on. The rules are identical to the well known card game SET but uses different cards.
The game consists of 81 round (!) cards showing one of 3 different shapes (triangle, tetragon, pentagon), quantities (1, 2 or 3), colors (blue red and orange) and fillings (full, empty or structure). Each possible combination is represented on one card. Cards will be laid out in a 3x4 grid. Simultaneously the players are looking for a 'trifix', a set of 3 cards where in each of the four categories (shape, quantity, color and filling) all 3 cards are all alike or all different. If one trifix is found the player gets this and the cards are replaced from the deck. Then play continues. Winner is who has found the most trifix at the end.

name: Paperclip Railways: UK Games Expo
description:
Bonus station card. Base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

It is included at the rear of the UK Games Expo 2011 programme.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Confusion the card game
description:
Confusion is a card game for 2-5 players. It is a every man for himself trick after trick game. Players main goal is to be the first to empty their hand. Players play one to six card melds to attempting to win tricks. All the cards have a primary value but also have secondary purposes. Since a card(s) can only be played on a lower value card(s), winning tricks with high cards and secondary purposes of cards allow players to lead a new trick with their low value cards. A game consists of hands scored on the order in which players empty their hands.

Players can be dealt in or out as the game or social situation requires. All players have equal hand sizes to start each hand. Game play changes with the number of players playing the game (even though the rules and scoring are the same) since all the cards are dealt out each hand and depending on the number of players each player will have a different hand size even though they have the same number as all others playing that hand.

A game for a new player would take about 20 minutes from start to finish. Despite the name the game makes more and more sense as you play since many of the secondary purposes of cards are actually very intuitive. The game consists of 45 cards 4 suits and 2 un-suited cards.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Party Game

name: Leaping Lillypads
description:
A strategy game as players guide their Frog on a gourmet buffet across the lillypads.

In this simple strategy game, each player plays a Frog with his own special menu of what tastes good on the pond. He moves his frog in large or small movements across the lillypads, snapping up insects as he goes. The trick is in only getting the insects you like more than the ones you don't like. Each Frog has his own special secret diet, you don't know what each frog is after. Be careful, predators surround the pond looking for a meal of frog.

The simple mechanics can be learned in minutes by children and adults alike. Play is quick and intuitive, setup is fast with variable board setup to change the game every time. Random menus for each frog ensures uncertainty about other players intentions and strategies.

The game includes rule expansions to challenge experienced gamers and those who become experienced with the game.

Designed as Print n' Play, they game can be produced in either a high or low quality finish.

Available July 2011.
categories: Animals, Educational, Environmental, Math, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Captain's Log #2
description:
CAPTAIN'S LOG #2 features the short story and scenario, REFINER'S FIRE, by James Ashauer. The story details the Romulan attempt to destroy the Gorn Heavy Cruiser Reptilicon as a prelude to an invasion of the Gorn Confederation. The decisive battle occurred at the Gorn/Federation border. The Scenario allows up to four players to recreate this climactic final battle.

The second feature of CAPTAIN'S LOG #2 is "Who's Who in the Star Fleet Universe." A brief background is given on the key people who are involved in the continuing creation of the STAR FLEET BATTLES gaming system.

CAPTAIN'S LOG #2 also includes the new Impulse Movement Charts for 8, 16, and 24 Impulses and three new Command Cruisers: The Gorn Allosaurus Rex, the Hydran Lord Marshal, and the Romulan Superhawk.

Over twenty new scenarios are included in CAPTAIN'S LOG #2. Some scenario titles are: "Mutiny on the Demonslayer," "A Question of Franchise," "Ambush!," and "The Rain of Terror." Also included is the Campaign Game "The Expedition" which allows players to recreate the Hydran attempt to drive through the Klingon Empire.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Horsefeathers
description:
Horsefeathers is a bluffing-and-betting dice game requiring only twelve 6-sided dice, a dice cup, a handful of tokens, and a box of poker chips in order to play.

Players roll one die each turn and add it to the dice that are already in the center of the table. These dice are grouped by number. When there is one die of a given number (say, one 6), it is referred to as a "single"; when there are two dice of a given number (say, two 3s), they are referred to as a "double"; there can never be three dice (a "triple") of the same number in the center of the table.

When players roll their die, they conceal it under the dice cup and then declare its value. If, however, the number rolled would create a triple, then the player must call it something else. The player must lie.

Other players can challenge the declaration by calling "Horsefeathers." If the rolling player was lying, then the challenge is successful and the challenger takes a token from the center of the table; the lying player is out of the round. If, on the other hand, the rolling player was telling the truth, then the *challenger* is out of the round.

The goal in each round is to be the last player standing -- that player gets the pot of chips.

Play continues in this fashion until the last token is taken. The current round is finished, payouts are made based on any token discrepancies, and then the chips are counted. The player with the most chips is the winner.

If you want to give it a try, the rules can be found on the game's homepage, http://boardgameforge.wordpress.com/horsefeathers/.

name: Supervivientes
description: This game board is based on the TV show "Supervivientes" (The Spanish version of "Survivors"). The board depicts some islands were the players must gather food and resources to survive. The game has two phases. In the first, there are two teams competing. In the second, the members of the winning team must compete between them to be the one and only survivor left, the winner.

name: Heist
description:
Heist is a competitive game with cooperative elements that has only one winner. You and other professional thieves have been hired to infiltrate a secret facility and loot the Executive Vault. As part of the agreement, you can keep anything else of value you discover along the way.

Thieves spend actions and each build a hand of skill-boosting Equipment cards used to overcome such obstacles as Bounty Hunters, Exploding Aerial Drones and Killer Robots. The game is highly social, and players will frequently work with (or double-cross) fellow thieves to advance through the building. But ultimately you’re in it for yourself ... despite what you may have told anyone else.

If any thief loots the Executive Vault and escapes the building, then the thief with the most total loot is the winner. But in an unusual twist, if you're caught as a thief, you're not out of the game. Instead, you "flip" and become an informant working for the authorities against the other thieves. If all the thieves are caught, then the informant with the most "credibility" gains immunity from crimes committed and wins.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Recicle: Tempos de Crise ‚Äì Stock Market expansion
description:
Stock Market, the first expansion to Recycle - Critical Times, adds new ways of making money and turning them into victory points.

As the society awareness about the relevance of recycling grows, industries have to develop the ability to absorb the huge amount of material collected to be recycled. It is now time to make investments in those industries!

COMPONENTS
1 Stock-Market board
30 stocks cards with six of each kind of material
Rulebook

This expansion also adds some rules adaptations from the original game.

name: Party Alias: New Cards
description:
Expansion for the word explanation Party Alias game.
This adds 200 new cards to the game when you are tired of all the base game cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Junior Alias: New Cards
description:
Expansion for the popular children game where you have to explain pictures to other kids.
This expansion adds 150 new pictures for kids to explain. Adds 2 new teams as well.

PS! This expansion is for the older version of the Junior Alias.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Crusade
description:
This is an abstract strategy game for two to four players based on a checkers theme. A spinner is employed for movement. Moves are made in a straight line, forward, backward or sideways, but not diagonally. The point of the spinner corresponding in color to the player's knights indicates the number of moves the player may make.

The object of the game is to get as many knights as possible into any of the other players' castles, and also to score by capturing the opponents' knights. A capture may be made by a player spinning a number that will land his knight directly in a space occupied by an opponent's knight when not on the gold field or in a castle. Knights may be passed or jumped at any time but they are safe from capture on the gold field or in a castle.

The winner is determined by the score of points. For each knight captured the player scores five points. For each knight moved to opponent's castle the player scores 15 points. The game can be played to conclusion, even though one or two players may be eliminated.

name: Flipping Crazy
description:
Flipping Crazy is an Othello (or Reversi if you prefer) like game that uses a hexagonal board for play. Players place and move pieces in an attempt to have the most of their own color on the board.

Players can expand from current piece locations, or move already played pieces 2 spaces away. Players take opponents pieces by being adjacent to them.

When no more moves can be made, the player with the most of pieces on the board wins.

name: Zodica
description:
Zodica is a trick taking card game for 3 to 6 players. The deck has 5 suits (Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn and Neptune) with twelve cards in each suit (1 - 12). Thirteen of the cards also picture a sign of the Zodiac. The object of Zodica is to try to avoid capturing Zodiac cards while also trying to go out before your opponents.

Game play consists of dealing out all the cards, then passing cards to an opponent and then playing tricks. Players are required to beat a trick if they can, but they want to avoid taking points. At any point, if 4 (or more) Zodiac cards have been played on a trick, an alignment has occurred. The player who played the 4th Zodiac card immediately wins the trick and takes the lead.

The first player in a round to go out in a round gives all cards that they have taken to the last player to go out in the round.At the end of each round, players score points for each Zodiac card they have taken (or received from going out last). The player with the lowest score wins.

name: Election Night
description:
The titanic struggle between Red & Blue in 21st century American politics is recreated in all its glory in Election Night, a board game that allows players to feel the roar of the crowds, experience the steely-nerved debate appearence, and enjoy the satisfaction of a political campaign well fought.

To begin the game, players decide what their stand will be on the issues: either leaning to the left, rolling to the right, or sticking to the center on each of five issues: the Economy, Social Issues, the Military, Taxes and the Environment. These positions influence where they can hope to win votes. The more right-wing they are, for example, the easier it will be to rally voters in the South and Frontier states; if they choose a centrist platform, the more likely that Swing State voters are to join the cause.

Each turn, players choose whether to campaign, claiming votes ahead of the election; strategize, directing the flow of the contest in their favor; or advertise, swaying voters with a carefully crafted message. And no two games will likely be the same, as cards-in-hand suggest paths to follow and the constantly changing News Cycle shines a fickle light on one of fifteen possible issue positions, meaning that timing and clever play are everything.

The game simulates the modern American presidential campaign, with a home-stretch, flip-flops (and resulting attack ads), gaffes during debates, red-meat speeches, polling, "fire-in-the-belly", "robo calls" and much more. All cards appear in both the Democratic and Republican player's deck, the two sides are evenly balanced, and the electoral map is tuned to the latest census numbers that will be in place for the 2012, 2016 and 2020 elections.

name: Bankroll
description:
"A lifetime of fun, finance and fortune."

From the instruction manual:

Players go around the board in three tracks according to the throw of 2 dice. The outer most track (yellow) is the starting Low Income Bracket, the middle (green) is the Medium Income Bracket, and the inside (orange) track is the High Income Bracket. When a player has the required amount of savings in the Bank, he can progress from one income bracket to a higher one by advancing through the DOOR to Opportunity. Money can be earned by receiving a salary every Pay Day in increasing amounts depending on the player's degree of education, and also by investing in real estate and skill in managing general finance. Players have fascinating experiences in banking, savings and loans, interest, insurance, studying in school, receiving scholarships, and in general going through a full lifetime from childhood to retirement. The first player to acquire the necessary amount of savings in the bank and real estate reaches "Retirement" and wins the game.

name: Babylon 5 Wars: Wars of the Centauri Republic
description: Hundreds of years before Babylon 5 was built, the Centauri Republic was known as the "Lion of the Galaxy," controlling dozens of worlds and dominating its region of space. While the people of Earth were still launching space shuttles, the Centauri fought a war with another Galactic power, the Orieni Imperium. Two starfaring nations could not be more opposite in their goals and politics, and conflict between them was inevitable from their first meeting. When the Orieni War finally began, it would change the face of the Galaxy forever! This book includes a complete history of that war, including backgrounds, maps, technology, and over 40 different ships used during the conflict. 92 pages. Showdowns-8 and Variants-6 will support this product.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: American Muscle Challenge: General Motors Edition
description:
From the rule book:
Be the first player to completely restore their muscle car.
Players travel the board buying, selling and swapping car parts. A player has completely restored their car when they have collected all twelve parts inventory cards as listed in their car's parts book.

With a vaguely Monopoly feel to it it American Muscle Challenge is played by traveling the game board with dice rolls in order to acquire parts to build their respective muscle cars. Game play consists of; following the instructions on the squares, choosing to play a "Muscle Card", swapping parts with players, challenging the other players as well as Corvette Ken, who is a player controlled NPC who runs the Custom car shop (the banker) to dice based drag races in the center of the board for cash and car parts.

The Board has Squares for buying parts, buying insurance cards, racing Corvette Ken, or racing players squares. There is a "Go To Garage" square (go to jail), "Violation" (income Tax), as well as "Lose a Turn", Take a "Muscle Card" (Community Chest), Take a "Corvette Ken Card" (Chance), The "Drive In" square (Free Parking) and the receive "$1000" square

Muscle Cards allow a player to dictate terms of a parts deal and have cards such as "NO Deal" or "Free" that allows you to take a part. A muscle card that forces you to purchase parts may require that you sell back parts you own to the custom car shop at half value if you can not afford the part listed.

Corvette Ken Cards are played against opponents to cause them financial loss. Money lost in this way is put under the "Drive-In" square and won by the next person to land there similar to the house rules for Monopoly's "Free Parking"

Insurance Cards protect players from "Corvette Ken" cards

The First player to finish acquiring parts and upgrading his muscle car is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tugboats!
description:
Help Cargo Ships from Red Rabbit Rentals, Blue Bonnet Boating, Purple Pirate Parcels, and Green Gremlin Groceries into port by playing Tugboat cards that match their number or company.

During gameplay you play Tugboat cards from your hand into your Tug Line in order to score Cargo Ships. You can score a Cargo Ship two ways; by playing 3 tugboats of the same company as the Cargo Ship, or by playing three tugboats that equal the number on the Cargo Ship.

The first person to score 3 Cargo Ships wins!

name: Panzer Grenadier: Power of the East
description:
Power of the East is a supplement for the Panzer Grenadier system based on the battles waged between Japan and the Soviet Union in 1938 and 1939. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Guadalcanal, Eastern Front, Road to Berlin, Sinister Forces and Infantry Attacks: August 1914 to enjoy all of the scenarios. There are 12 scenarios, including large tank battles, based on the actual battles of these conflicts.

Power of the East is sold exclusively via .pdf download.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: The Victory Day
description:
"Throughout the entire war I participated in many large scale operations but the upcoming battle for Berlin was special, it couldn't be compared to anything before it. The front-line had to get through the highly defended echelon zone starting from Oder and ending with the highly fortified Berlin".

So writes the Marshal of the Soviet Union Georgy Zhukov about the assault on Berlin . For four years the Great Patriotic War continued. Millions of soldiers, thousands of tanks and planes – the entire might of USSR , Great Britain , France and many other countries were sent to battle. In the end fascist Germany was defeated.

The strategic card game “Victory Day” is dedicated to the last period of the war when soviet soldiers assaulted Berlin and completely broke the German forces. Each player takes on the role of a division commander. He has command over different units: infantry, armored vehicles, artillery and aviation.

Each unit has a historic counterpart – so for instance each rifle company in the game is a counterpart of real life divisions, platoons of KV tanks and T-34s, batteries of “Katusha” rocket launchers, squadrons of LA-7s and Tu-2 and so on. All in game characteristics were done keeping in mind the actual abilities of the historic counterparts. By using special “tactical cards” you can use different assaults, tactical maneuvers and psychological effects. Throughout the game, players simulate different actions of their divisions: charges and break through, artillery support and aerial bombings, organization off defenses and blocking enemy troops.

All units in the game and all game events are shown as cards. Each card has an image of the unit, it's characteristics and abilities and also a text – usually it's a quotation from a historical novel or memoires, or some information on the current unit. All illustrations on the cards are done from actual black and white photos done during the war by using computer technologies.

Booster packs containing new cards have been released for “Victory Day”. Players can add any of these cards to their decks by purchasing the booster packs sold separately. This way, players can make their own unique decks by adding new cards to it. Depending on the cards in the deck victory may be easier than before. It's more important to have a balanced deck fit for different situations then just by adding strong cards. But both players need to have an equal amount of cards in their decks. It is also not recommended to have more than 60 cards in the deck.

There is also a mmo game based on “Victory Day” – “The War Online”

Victory Day” the board game is based mostly on “The War” CCG. This way, players can further customize their decks by using cards from “The War” CCG. This way they can combine lots of different tactics, use an assortment of squads and platoons and even simulate historical battles from World War 2.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
publishers: Rightgames RBG SIA, Stolitsa Design Group

name: Mathematrix
description:
Theme: Mathematrix is a fun and fast mathematical thinking game, which use creative spatial logic for drafting and laying tiles on common table in effort to outsmart other players.

Object of the game:
The object of the game is to be the first to reach 50 points on the score track.

Mechanics:
Game is played in turns. Players first drafts their tiles and put them on table trying to make as much shapes as possible, in line with their mission card. Every shape bring you some points according to their difficulty. To spice some thing there is also 7 special cards for every player, which can alter tiles position of other players. But be careful opponent can also use your tiles on table to score points according to their mission cards.

name: Tierisch auf Zack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Welcome to the hurly-burly of the animal world wood championships. Bright brains, body control and concentration are needed. There are many different ideas for running, jumping, and waddling games, as well as a lot of mooing and miaowing, aiming at targets, and making combinations. Above all, a lot of fun!

Tierisch auf Zack, part of HABA's "Fex" line of games, includes rules that increase the level of difficulty of the exercises, for example, standing at attention in the first round, coordination training in the second, and perhaps sprinting in the third.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Sports

name: Pizzeria
description:
Pizza Kingdom is an economic-style boardgame that involves the building of a Pizza Kingdom within a fictional city. The players need to manage their expenses and commodities to meet customer demands and earn revenue. The winner of the game is determined by which player has the most money at the end of the game.

Game involves purchasing locations, purchasing/selling pizza ovens, hiring/firing managers, and secret bidding for a market to gain commodities.

name: Tigacti
description: Tigacti is a geography game in which the players have to locate places on a world map. The active player draws a card which contains a location (like the Giseh Sphinx, for instance) and then places a transparent round disc on the world map, centering it where s/he believe the thing is located. Then an semi-circular marker is placed around the disk to show where it was placed and the disk is removed. The card is now turned around and reveals which quadrant of the board it belongs to. The quadrants are card-sized, and the cards show a cross with the precise location. Afterwards, the disc is put back on top of the cards - it contains concentric rings which mark how far the player was off. Points are scored depending on how close the player guessed the location.

name: Words of Wisdom: The Game
description:
In Words of Wisdom: the Game 2-10 players compete against one another to be the first to get rid of all the cards in their hands. Each player begins with 7 cards from one of the 2 decks and must attempt to play his cards to a community board. The board is divided into 2 sections, and players must play cards only to their designated spaces on the board, only when adjacent to other placed cards, and only into 1 section per turn. Players may choose to (or may occasionally be forced to) draw simultaneously from both the Book Deck (which has more of the same cards that were dealt initially) and the Providence Deck (which enables special placements). Some cards are setbacks when drawn, while others allow opponents to save each other from the setbacks (and benefit themselves in the process.)

The game can be played in either of 2 ways. The Standard Version contains a few extra cards which force play to the board and which create blockages on the board that can be removed only through cooperative effort. This extra layer of complexity provides opportunity for cooperative play and additional strategy which is not available in the much simpler Family Version of the game (which is better suited for children and casual gamers.) In addition to removing a few cards from the decks, the Family Version allows for a different ending to the game: where the Standard Version is resolved in a Discard Phase that awards victory to the lowest scorer, the Family Version is won simply when any player goes out, having played all their cards on their turn.

Words of Wisdom: the Game has an overtly Biblical theme. The numbered board spaces represent the 66 books of the Bible, and the cards in the Book Deck represent individual books of the Bible. The cards in the Providence Deck channel Bible-based occurrences such as Trials, Miracles, Prophecies, and Parables. Nevertheless, the theme is as light and non-intrusive as the game play is: the rules state that no familiarity with the Bible is necessary to play, enjoy, or win the game. Likewise, there are no specific teachings or stories told through the game itself. If the game attempts anything spiritual, it is only to familiarize the players with the names and order of the books that make up the Bible.

name: Slim to None: The Campaign Along the Slim River, January 1942
description:
“Heedless of danger and of their isolation they had shattered the division: they had captured the Slim Bridge by their reckless and gallant determination.”

--Lt. Colonel Arthur Anderson, 155th Battery.

Slim to None is a war game simulation of the battle along the Slim River in northern Malaya. In January 1942, the 11th Indian Division was sent north to contest the Imperial Japanese Army's advance from their landing beaches on the Kra Isthmus.

However, the Japanese 5th Infantry Division, supported by the 4th Armored Regiment struck first in the early morning hours of January 7th at the Cluny Rubber Plantation and at the town of Trolak, just north of the Slim River. The Allied forces were caught unprepared by the sudden Japanese combined arms offensive, with units scattered along 19 miles of road north of the Slim River, and with little to no weaponry by which to oppose the Japanese armor. Worse still, the Japanese infiltration tactics through jungle terrain the Allied commanders believed to be impenetrable, led to the Allied battalions being repeatedly outflanked and forced to retreat.

The Japanese success here would eventually take them all the way to Singapore. Can you do better?

GAME COMPONENTS

7 page rules booklet
One 11" by 17" map
165 single-sided, un-mounted counters


The game can be played solitaire as well as with an opponent. The game is part of the Blood and Steel series of games from High Flying Dice Games.

name: TC Tennis Expansion Kit 1: World Class Women
description:
World Class Women

From VPG's first and successful sports game, TC Tennis, designer Terry Coleman brings us it's first expansion: World Class Women. This first ever expansion of TC Tennis gives players a chance to pit 24 of the finest female tennis players in history against each other, in the same fun, fast-playing format as in the parent TC Tennis game.

With plenty of new players and strategies involved, make your way to the top and become a World Class Tennis Champion!

Note: This Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of TC Tennis to use it.

Game Data:

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 3 on a 9 scale
Unit scale: Individual tennis players

Game Components:

• One Expansion #1 Rulesheet
• 20 Strategy cards
• 24 Player cards
• 8 single-sided square markers

name: Kings Plate: Classic
description:
In Kings Plate, based on the traditional Japanese chess game Shogi, the player's goal is to checkmate the opponent's king.

To do this, you must use the various units in your army, with each unit having different abilities in terms of movement and special actions. Players can create their own armies from the pieces included in the game, thus forcing them (and their opponents) to rethink their strategy each game.

The "Classic" edition of Kings Plate comes with a plastic game board and metal pieces.

name: Hell on the Margin
description:
Generic Sci-Fi wargame aimed at divisional level forces and playable in an evening.
Figures are mounted on bases that represent platoons and are activated by a command point system resulting in a simple and quick flowing game concentrating on high level tactics rather than individual weapon stats.
Rules and organization tables are included for two human and two alien forces models for which were available from Irregular Miniatures in the UK.

name: LeCoque's Intrigue
description:
This is self-published Strategy level wargame based on Japanese TV animation "Fang of the Sun Dougram".
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fang_of_the_Sun_Dougram
This game cover independence war of planet Deloyer.

One player control planet Deloyer's peoples and other player control Earth Federation. Both players manage event card deck and military operations.
A game purpose of Deloyer player is achive to true independence, and Federation player is crush of independence movement.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hexagon Grid

name: Fame by Frame
description:
Theme: Fame by Frame is a board game tucked in by the very veil of the seventh art, in which the players enjoy both the comfort and the privileges of being in the director's chair. Hiding behind pseudonyms inspired by the finest names of the director branch, their goal is to make the best movie possible, overshadowing the competition and ensuring their place on the boulevard of the famous.

In their quest for forming the best movie crew possible, they are assisted by a group of Agents using their own unique ways to collect actors and introduce their employer to various cinematic equipment.

Goal: Every player has the same goal--to have the most valuable movie crew at the end of the fifth round. The team's value is measured by calculating the points on the actor and cinematic equipment cards.

Game-Play: Players use various value Agent cards to get the best actors and equipment for their movies. Actor and equipment cards have victory points that determine the winner of the game, as well as special traits which can be used to help your agent get even more actors during the game.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Whiz Bang
description:
From Zillions of Games


Rapid advancements in artillery during the late 19th and early 20th century meant that when Word War I broke out, the nature of war would be changed forever. That war marked a shift from the infantry charge of old to the modern artillery barrage. Pieces ranged from small mortars to powerful Howitzers. The larger, more complex the ordnance the more soldiers it required in the gun crews to properly fire it. These pieces usually shot expoling shells - called 'Whiz-Bangs' by the troops.

This game recreates the trench warfare of the first World War. The grey field in the middle is 'No Man's Land' - the deadly wasteland that existed between the two sides trenches. The first player to safely get a Soldier across No Man's Land and into enemy territory wins.

Soldiers attack by firing shells. The direction and range is determined by how many Soldiers are working together. Two Soldiers connected in a line can attack up to two spaces away in the direction that their line is aimed at. Three Soldiers in a line can attack up to three spaces away, and so on. A lone Soldier can attack any neighboring space. When an attack is made, none of the attacking Soldiers are moved. The opponent's captured Soldier is removed from the board.

A Soldier can move one step in any direction. A line of Soldiers can be shifted one space in the direction of their line.

name: Pocket Quiz: Antike
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice answers. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Ancient World" and the questions are about that era.

name: Pocket Quiz: Astronomie & Raumfahrt
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Astronomy & Astronautics" and the questions center around these topics.

name: Pocket Quiz: Mehr Allgemeinwissen
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "More General Knowledge".

name: Pocket Quiz: Eisenbahn
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Railroad" and the questions are about that topic.

name: Pocket Quiz: Kriminalliteratur
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice answers. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Crime Fiction" and the questions are about that topic.

name: Budapest Pack
description:
This pack provides 18 Advanced Squad Leader (ASL) scenarios covering a variety of actions in the Budapest campaign in Hungary during WWII. The 18 scenarios include a good variety of scenarios from large to tournament sized.

Included also are two new boards; FE 1 is a rural board with some farms, a gully and some small hills; FE 2 is a city set on a hill. The boards are on heavy card stock and each comes in two pieces that connect along the Q hex row.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Mistral: The War of the Austrian Succession at Sea-Med Theatre 1739-1748
description:
Mistral is the first of a set of naval games from Red Sash Games; a series called Sea Lords.

Mistral covers the War of the Austrian Succession at sea, plus the concurrent War of Jenkin's Ear. Though relatively unknown, these conflicts, raging from 1739-1748, comprised the first "world war". The primary naval actions took place in three theatres: the English Channel and Bay of Biscay, the Caribbean, and the western Mediterranean. Forces also clashed in India, along America's eastern seaboard, and in the Pacific. Each of the other games covers one of these theatres. Mistral covers the western Mediterranean, where Spain tried to keep her lines of communication open to her army in Italy, and France's Toulon Fleet continually harassed the British.

Mistral is a two player strategy game. You command either the British or Bourbon (French and Spanish) fleets. Orders are handed down to you from your Admiralty, and you must try to fulfill them within the framework of the wider war, which is represented by a set of events. Your opponent will have orders of his own to fulfill, but with his spare forces he will be attempting to foil your plans. Success will earn you Prestige (victory points), and may even have an impact on the land campaign. You must decide when and where to commit resources, where to feint and where to strike, organising your "sail" (ships) into squadrons, and your squadrons into flotillas commanded by leaders (commodores and admirals). Maintaining sufficient forces at "battle readiness" is critical, but very difficult, since ships constantly suffer wear and tear – a battle may be won and the campaign lost. Scenarios are one year (16 turns) long, playable in 3-4 hours (the number of counters in play is quite small). The campaign game consists of a number of years pre-chosen by the players. A special campaign scenario allows the players to link Mistral with its companion Lace Wars game – Queen's Gambit.

name: Summit Showdown
description:
The aim of this word game is to find words that fit into a specific topic and comply with either being a "High" or "Low" word. With A=1 and Z=26 every word that you come up with will score you a certain amount of points.
There are 5 topics and and you have a minute to come up with an answer for each, either an answer with as many letters towards the end of the alphabet to score you most points; or a short answer with letters towards the beginning of the alphabet. After the time has run out you go through topic by topic,
you decide whether you answer is unique, an answer that no-one else has chosen; then you think if your word is the highest or lowest depending on which was chosen at the beginning of the game. If you choose to move onto the "Showdown" you can then text in the number to find out your words score. You can, if your good at maths work out the number yourself.
