The winner of the showdown gets 20 points, if you had a correct answer but didn't go into the showdown you get 10; and if you didn't think that you had a unique answer but it was still a right answer you get 5 points.
After 5 rounds, totaling 20 minutes you work out your overall score and the winner is the player with the most points.

name: imd-spelet
description:
imd-spelet is an abstract game, but with a loose word description, or rather inspiration of todays internet usage.

The game-play is based on placing and moving tiles according to dice throws, the goal is to catch the opponent's tiles. It use four tiles as two sided dice with the values 0 or 1 to create binary numbers. The dice are thrown in a decided order to create a number between 0000 = 0 to 1111 = 15.

The game is published as the cover of an educational catalog connected to the IT, media and design (imd)-program at Södertörn University, Stockholm, Sweden.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Specimen
description:
"Gamer Geeks, this game is going to rip you a new one, in a good way!" - Father Geek

"Overall, this game is just phenomenal. It brings a fresh type to the table top and hours of replayability. I cannot wait to be playing the finished product in my living room." - Demo Player Richard Nava

"I'm not a game player in general and I was surprised how much I got into (Specimen), playing the first time. I was PISSED when my flamethrower was going to be used against me. PISSED. And I was thrilled for the player next to me when she went for a move that was balls out ballsy…these guys are the real deal…FUN STUFF, FOLKS!" - Demo Player Rebecca L

SPECIMEN is a two-player card-driven board game that pits a group of human astronauts against a predatory extraterrestrial life form.

Each turn comprises four action rounds, where each player can perform one of several possible game actions. The Monster's movements are hidden from the Crew player behind a game screen, and the Monster's location is only revealed when the Monster attacks...or if the crew is lucky (or unlucky) enough to find it!

At the beginning of play, a mysterious specimen in the cargo hold has been let loose as a result of the damage caused by a meteor collision. This SPECIMEN is in an embryonic stage and evolves throughout the game, becoming more difficult to kill as the turns progress. In addition to attempting to kill the crew, the monster can also destroy sections of the ship, forcing the human players to divide their efforts between defense and structural repair. The monster can win the game by either killing all seven members of the crew or damaging enough sections of the ship that it breaks apart. Adding the destruction of the ship as an alternate victory condition allows for varied strategies on the part of both players. The human player can use tools to effect repairs, construct weapons and trackers to hunt down the monster…or ultimately blow up the ship if all seems lost.

The SPECIMEN player constructs his/her monster from a selection of 25 different attributes (offensive, defensive, or special abilities), providing new and different threats to the human player each game. This constantly changing monster, combined with 90 event cards driving game play, allows for infinite replayability. No two games should ever be the same.

name: Memeopoly
description:
Memeopoly is a fun social drinking game which isn't complicated and doesn't require you to memorize or agree upon the rules.
The object of the game is simply to have fun with your friends and have a few drinks. You are able to quantify a victory by choosing to play with certain rules.



How to play:
Draw a card.
Do what the card says.
Discard the card.
Next Player’s turn.



The game ends when you run out of cards or find a special “Win” card near the end of the deck.
The text on the cards range from taking drinks, listing categories of objects, attempting physical feats, speaking in funny accents and deck manipulation.

There are several different ways to play including mechanics of hand management, point accumulation and just playing for the sake of playing the different cards.



Game details:
Players 3-10.
Age Range: Drinking age and upwards.
Duration: 30min to 2hrs depending on player count and number of cards.
Complexity: Easy to play, no complicated rules. Remove certain cards to customize gameplay.
Decks: Available in decks of 52 cards, every card is unique with a unique rule. Currently two decks are available.




More info:You can try the game, download the print and play version of the game for free, or purchase a deck from games official website.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: 2012: Godswake
description:
...It is the year 2012, and the world is indeed coming to an end.
It’s been almost half a year now, and while many try to continue their normal way of living, others began to center their lives around these events, apostolating religious theories about the end of the world, or using the chaos to their own advantages. It is pretty obvious to everyone that there won’t be long before something big happens, although what that will be, or what the meaning of all this is, noone knows.

Godswake is an Adventure game set is the near future (or if you read this after 2012, an alternate Earth) when apparently the world is falling apart, but in a very unexpected, mythic, supernatural way. The characters – represented by the players – race against each other to get their hands on an allegedly extremely powerful relic amidst the chaos, with what they may not only be able stop the destruction, but also to assume a god-like power for themselves. However, it is a very hard task: the dangers lie not only in the natural catastrophes caused by the troubled matter of the Earth, but also in the insanity of people trying to deal with the coming of the apocalypse, in the rivalry of others who have the same goal in mind and in the appearance of supernatural events and creatures that have only lived in people’s imagination before. During their adventures the characters will probably travel around the world, visit exotic places, lead expeditions into relentless wildernesses in search for helpful minor Artifacts, face surprising Adventures and venture into disaster-ridden places all other people are running away from.

Card traits and game mechanics (such as Character Personalities that affect the outcome of adventures they have) all strive to keep the game as thematic as possible, while being simple and straight-forward at the same time. The game tries to keep a short playing time for an adventure game, while still being epic and memorable.

The game has been influenced by many sources ranging from Indiana Jones (regarding exploration in exotic places) and James Bond movies (high tech gear, daring action scenes), through the Supernatural tv-series (with the “ongoing apocalypse” setting), Hellblazer comics (giving it the darker tone, people with mystical powers, occult and magic), to the Stalker concept by the Strugatsky-brothers (regarding the whole weird zone called the Unknown, where the rumored relic lies). The mood of the game may feel like a mix of all of the above: quite dark and mature, but without resorting to graphic violence or vulgarity; a bit thought-provoking, but not taking itself too seriously.

The game uses lots of cards – around 350 in all – and many tokens as components, aside from a game board.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Mythology, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Circuito "Asfalto Violento"
description:
Race Car
Circuito "Asfalto Violento" ("Violent Asphalt" Track)

It is entertainment for all ages, that only depends on the ability of each participant, without dice or roulette of any kind.

In this game, which is developing an exciting car race, you have similar situations to those of a true world championship.
Can compete from 3 to 6 participants.
Each participant chooses a team, that is 3 cars of the same color.
Each participant in turn moves the three cars 6, 5 and 4 steps. You can choose which auto advances 6, 5 and what that 4.
Additionally, if a car ends after another one, it can move 3 more steps (unless the track is blocked).
The first ten cars to complete the required number of turns obtained scores: 10 points for first, 9 for second and so on. The player who accumulates the highest score for his team es the winner.

name: Writer's Block
description:
Last Friday, at a local pub, you met up with some of your best mates. They’re like you: artist types, broke, kind of smelly. You tell them of your plan to write a hit sci-fi story and suddenly it catches fire! You rush home to your flat in an inspired haze and start writing that million-dollar story: The one about a bunch of Martians and a time machine. One week later, you return to the pub buzzing with excitement. Just as you are about to fill them in, Susie arrives boasting about her new tale, “Doomsday: The Martian Shrink Ray.” Moments later, Frank counters with a different story: “The Robot Toxin.” It would seem that your friends have all got the same idea. Happily, you laugh through the night comparing, modifying and sharing ideas. As Steve pours another round, a friendly wager arises: Who can write the best science fiction story in five weeks time? Looking down at your beer-stained draft, you toss twenty-dollars into the pot. This one’s in the bag, your pals don’t stand a chance. . .

This is a game of draft building. Each turn, players will add and subtract cards from a shared deck. Then, players will draft cards from this deck. After players have chosen a set of cards, they will take turns playing them. In a turn, players can choose to either discard cards (in order to save ink), or to spend ink to play cards (developing plot-lines). The plots players develop will then influence the next weeks workshop, as they help players to add and remove cards from the shared deck.
categories: Card Game, Novel-based, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: National Park
description:
In this game, you are managing a fictional National Park in the U.S. your goal is to build improvements into the park that attract more visitors. Unfortunately, more visitors bring more problems and nature is always trying to reclaim the land. Every round you will build you park and accrue visitor points, while one of your opponent's will take nature's revenge and another opponent will play the unruly visitors who will damage the park. At the end of every year, a visitor assessment is performed for each of the improvement categories and the number of visitor points you have accumulated in each category that will come to your park the following year are assigned. This is also the number of improvement points that you will receive that year to improve your park.

At the end of the last round, you tally up all of the visitor points you have accrued and receive bonuses for having the majority in each category. Highest score wins.
mechanics: Action Points, Network and Route Building, Simulation

name: Nitroplus Card Masters
description:
This game is a re-themeing of Dominion; a collaborative title of Dominion and Nitro+. Featuring new illustrations by the original artists from Nitro+, the game plays exactly the same as Dominion: each player construct their own deck from a common pool of available cards, and the person with the most victory point wins at the end.

Features 491 cards, consisting of titles from all Nitro+ games.

Nitro+ titles:
Phantom of Inferno, Vampirdzhija Vjedogonia, Kikokugai - The Cyber Slayer, "Hello, world.", Saya no Uta, Angelos Armas, Jingai Makyou, Hanachirasu, Dra+KoI, Deus Machina Demonbane, Gekkou no Carnevale, TRE DONNE CRUDELI, Sumaga, Chaos;Head, Sumaga Special, FullMetalDaemon MURAMASA, FullMetalDaemon MURAMASA Janen Arc, Steins;Gate, AXANAEL, SoniComi

Together with guest titles of:
BLASSREITER
Fate/Zero
Guilty Crown
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Space Man 2 Man
description:
Miniature rules for tactical scale.
Science fiction infantry battles.

Space Man-2-Man was designed to reproduce large scale, tactical level Science Fiction miniature battles. The scale of the game is 1" equal 6 feet and each 'turn' for a combat group taking from 30 seconds to a few minutes. The game is designed with 25mm figures, but should be easy to covert the charts, movement rates and playing surface size to suit another scale if necessary.

name: GB Racers
description:
GB Racers: The Ultimate Car Racing Board Game (Second Edition)

Strap in for the ride of your life in this fast-paced Formula 1 simulation board game.

Appleton Games proudly presents GB Racers (Golden Ball Racers), a fast-paced game inspired by F1 Racing. This exciting new F1 Racing board game infusing the ‘Appleton Way’ a sporting chance of success for everyone, every time.

You can play as 1 player using all 6 teams of 12 cars, or up to 6 players combined using the historical GB Racer cards. Also experience the unique GB (Golden Ball) 20 sided dice and other special features.

GB Racers board game is for 1 – 6 players, where you have 2 racing cars each and must get 77 points or more to win the GB Championship. This you do by picking up points for both cars during several GB Grand Prix races. Each race takes 12 – 20 minutes to complete & there is an average of 4 – 5 races per championship.
The overall time averages just over 1 hour.

Features
For 1-6 players
60 minute playing time

Safety Warning
Warning! Not suitable for children under 36 months due to small parts

Technical Details
Item Weight 1.204 Kg
Product Dimensions 44cm x 32cm x 5cm
Our recommended age: 7 years and up
Item model number PS8318
Main Language(s) English
Number of Game Players 1-6
Assembly Required No
Batteries Required? No
Batteries included? No
Shipping Weight 2.0 Kg
Delivery Destinations: Visit the Delivery Destinations Help page to see where this item can be delivered.
Date First Available 2011
Date Second Edition Available November 2018
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Punch game
description:
Japanese version of Mahjong for children.
Goal of the game is to collect 3 sets of 4 tiles, and say Punch!
Tiles have pictures of animals.

Later versions Ponjan/Pom Jong (by Anoa, later trademark of Tomy) and Donjara (by Bandai) the goal was to collect 3 sets of 3 tiles. Games have minor differences in how points are counted, but essentially the rules are same. New versions usually have pictures of animation characters, but there are other versions like one with girls from idol group AKB48.

name: Ancient Rules
description:
This is a set of rules designed for use with 6mm or 2mm strips of figures, though other figure scales could be used if desired. Two different basing systems are suggested: 1) where units are comprised of multiple strips with strips being removed when casualties are taken, or 2) units are made of 1 or 2 strips, with unit strength tracked with a roster or with casualty markers.

Units are defined in terms of battlefield purpose (battle unit, auxiliary, skirmish, and other), and unit grade (elite, veteran, average, and raw).

name: Corner Kick!
description:
From the publisher:

Developed over four years by the Father and Son team of Bob and Jeff Wiltrout, "Corner Kick!" is an innovative yet elegantly simple and straightforward game that produces not only games equal to the energy and excitement of the real thing, but even the elements of tactics and strategy that give it depth.

The rules have been extensively play tested and enjoyed at Conventions such as HistoriCon and Cold Wars for years, and they are now ready for you!

Besides the basic rules, there are extensive Designer's Notes which help explain the theories applied, and show how the actual tricks--some dirty!--of the game apply to the table top as well.

Playable with miniatures in several scales now available from a growing list of providers, the rules come with the full particulars of how to build your own "Pitch," Movement Sticks, and other accessories.

Two card stock Goal Cages for self assembly are provided with the book to start you off, as well as Team Rosters and a form for a play-by-play Game Record to note Stoppages and major events--a unique permanent history of your games and good times! A set of color Deflection Templates are included as well for determining where wild shots go, ricochets off the Goal frames, etc.

There is also a "Cheat Sheet" holding some 90% of all that's needed to play the game without having constantly to reference the rulebook. The 8.5" x 11" book itself is 62 pages, with three of full color photos of games and miniatures. Figure and other resources are provided to help fans of the "The Beautiful Game" get started immediately.

To quote from Bob Wiltrout's Introduction, "In our experience, people who play this game once play it again and again. In three years of play-testing, nobody has ever played Corner Kick and walked away saying, “This just doesn’t feel like soccer.” And I’m betting you won’t be the first.

You’re going to enjoy this!"

name: Rum Run
description:
It’s the 1920s. There’s prohibition and... sadness. The townspeople cry out for an unsobering savior! You don’t know the first thing about brewing, but there’s rumor about of secret distilleries deep in the forest. If only you could find them, you could caravan back these barrels of liquid joy and become the pride of the town. That is, if the other would-be heroes don’t get to them first. Do you have what it takes to claim that oh-so-coveted title, Regent of Rum?

If you like dominos, and you like mancala, then you'll love The Rum Run! At its simplest, this game entails building roads from the town center, acquiring barrels, and bringing them back. At its most strategic, you'll be at constant warfare with other players; racing them to distilleries, breaking their roads, building over them, and stealing their barrels. Be prepared to think not one or two, but six or seven moves ahead!
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: 2149'ers
description:
In the year 2149 a new gold rush has begun. This time the mineral rich lands are in the asteroid belt just beyond Mars. You and your fellow prospectors have gone in together on a Martian Processing Plant and you've each bought a mining ship to begin harvesting the riches of the asteroid belt. Although you may have bought-in together, you have no intention of sharing your riches with your competition.

This is a competitive game of resource collection and market management for 2-5 players. Each of you will manage your fuel, cargo, and the market to gain the most credits and win the game!

Players send their rockets to different asteroids around Mars and mine materials to sell on the Earth Resource Exchange. Players must keep a close eye on the size of their cargo hold, the fuel in their tanks, and actions of the other miners.

As you collect these materials, the other miners will know where to go to get them and you have to make strategic choices to decide where you will place your rocket and any revealed materials. Players trade materials in for credits, which they can use to buy upgrades and fuel for their rockets.

name: ASL Comp: Road to Bataan
description: Welcome to the ON THE ROAD TO BATAAN, a historical VARIANT module that depicts the fierce fighting for the Abucay/Mabatang Line from 11-15 January, 1942. Situated on the on the Bataan Peninsula, this position ran through Mauban on the coast of Manila Bay (east side) to Mabatang on the coast of the South China sea. ON THE ROAD TO BATAAN contains eight scenarios, all playable on the historical map included. You also receive a set of Special Rules and two copies of the new die-cut counter sheet (a total of 269 color die-cut counters) with Philippine Scouts SMC/MMC, new SW, etc.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: ASL Comp: BoB Normandy
description:
Welcome to the BoB NORMANDY, a map-based VARIANT module that depicts the fierce fighting in the Bocage by the 101st Airborne Division on D-Day and beyond. BoB NORMANDY contains eight scenarios, all playable on the new map included. You also two copies of the new die-cut counter sheet (a total of 269 color die-cut counters) with 101st AB SMC/MMC, new counters for M5A1 trailers (such as the one they carried John Wayne around in during the film, "The Longest Day"), some extra counters for the HB3 crowd, a new German truck type, etc. All in all, the 101'st Screaming Eagles depicted in the film "Band of Brothers" and the seminal unit history, "Rendevous With Destirny" will literally drop off the sprue on to your Normandy battlefield ... and you can be sure we'll pump out more scenarios to follow Winters, Guarnere, Toy, Talbert and company ... as they move on to new battlefields from Market Garden to the Bulge.

In addition to your 8 scenario BoB NORMANDY set, you'll also receive an additional 2 FREE BONUS scenarios, playable on the new map PLUS another FREE BONUS set of 2 Brécourt Manor scenarios PLUS the large-hex Brécourt Manor historical map. What's more, you'll not only get all this FREE gear but you'll get it at a special price for a limited time only (and see above for the Priority Mail postage-only deal you can take advantage of).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Callaway checkers
description:
A checkers-family game played on a 4x8 board. Each player has twelve pieces and the object is to force one's opponent to capture all one's pieces.

Callaway checkers was invented by LeMar Callaway in a dream in 1996 (reference: "He's got game", Ellyde Roko, The Virginian-Pilot, August 3, 2003.) It is described in U.S. patent 6588753.

name: Anima Tactics: Maria
description:
Maria, or the Puppet Master as she is known to many, is the most frightening of all the Church’s agents, with the possible exception of the Bearer. With her amazing ability to control the remains of Memitim, she turns the forces of darkness in on themselves.

Dark Church Warrior/Mystic - Lv. 60

At 5/7 | Dm 6/8 | Df 8 | Ar 5 | LP 25 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4

Innate Abilities: Damage Resistance, Immunity (Doom) .

Death Incarnate: Maria gets +3 Attack when making an attack against an enemy unit with 5 LP or lower.

Soulhunter: Choose an enemy unit at the beginning of the game. Maria uses her second Attack and Damage attribute when making any attack against the chosen unit. If Maria destroys the chosen unit she recovers 15 LP and you may choose a new target.

Death Puppets: If Maria destroys an enemy unit, that unit isn`t remove from play as normal. Instead, the destroyed unit returns to play under your control. The unit returns as it was before it was destroyed (Actions points, states, etc) However, if the unit takes damage for any reason, it is removed from play. If a Character that was destroyed by this ability is still alive at the end of the game, it is considered a causality for the original player.

ooo - Death Scythe (Ki, Attack)

+ 2 Attack, This attack hits all enemy units within 2 Inches of Maria.

ooo - Shadow of Death (Magic, Attack)

+ 5 Attack.

name: Biomechanical Dino Battles
description:
In a distant future the Terran Emperor keeps the masses entertained like the Caesars of Ancient Rome did: Panem et Circenses – Bread and Games. Instead of gladiators facing each other, genetically engineered and biomechanically enhanced dinosaurs fight in the Great Battledomes of the Empire for ultimate domination.

Biomechanic Dino Battles: The Deckbuilding Game is an action-packed, combat-centered deck-building game for 2 to 4 players. Players try to knock out three opponent dinosaurs by building and optimizing their decks, fielding Biomechanic Dinosaurs, plotting Strategies, activating Items, and using Combat Cards. The game features an unique economy and resource system based on the three different types of Combat Cards: Attack, Evade and Defend.

While the game rules are simple and easy to pick up, the game offers tremendous strategic depth and complexity.

name: Phlanxz
description: Phlanxz is a tile based strategy game for 2 to 4 players that uses a unique scoring mechanism called ‘Phlanxing’. Phlanxing allows the player to score pips of a certain color between 2 pips of the same color in a horizontal, vertical or diagonal direction. The players will take turns playing tiles to the board, Phlanxing and/or scoring with the tile played. The player will then place a scoring piece on the pips they scored that turn. The last round of the game is signaled when a player uses their last scoring piece or when a player draws the last tile from the supply. At the end of the game, players will total up the points from their scoring pieces, gaining bonus points by creating patterns on the board (line, cross, triangle and square) with their pieces. The player with the highest score wins!

name: Sprite
description:
Sprite is a simple game for 2 players that can be played with a Series: Shibumi set. It uses a n×n set of stacking spheres in 3 colors (4×4 is recommended, but larger sets can be used).

A 4×4 set, for example, is a pyramid of 30 marbles:

4×4=16 on the first layer
3×3=9 on the second layer
2×2=4 on the third layer
1×1=1 on the fourth layer

The board (n×n) starts empty.

Players take turns placing 2 balls, one at a time.

Players score points based on the number of balls of a certain colour that the ball just placed touches.

The score is tracked as a difference between the players.
The player with more points when the pyramid is complete is the winner.

Detailed rules can be found in the "files" section.

Sprite was designed in response to The Shibumi Challenge geeklist: Winners announced!.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: Anima Tactics: Tiamat
description:
"Unique" is the best way to describe Tiamat, the youngest of the four 7th Heaven Knights that serves Elisabetta Bardados. A lazy womanizer, but with a god like talent for fighting is also another way. Making him sit up and take things seriously is the last thing his enemies would ever want.

Neutral Empire Optional Leader Warrior/Prowler - Lv. 60
At 6 | Dm 4 | Df 10 | Ar 2 | LP 15 | Re 10 | Mo 12/16 | AP 3/5
Innate Abilities: Initiative
Cancer: Tiamat can make melee Attacks on targets within 4 inches of himself. Charges are not affected by this ability.
ooo - Awe of the Forgotten (Ki, Attack)
This attack rolls 2 dice and keeps the highest. If this Attack causes damage, its target suffers Seal Lv. 1. Effect 16.
oo - World of Wires (Ki, Effect)
Move an enemy unit within Tiamat’s Control Zone 4 inches in the direction of your choice. This ability can be used to move Characters Engaged in Combat. Effect 15.
o - Wires of Destiny (Ki, Effect)
Tiamat gains Haste Lv. 3. Limit: Once per game.
His true power…
Optional Leader: You may choose to use this skill card when you include Tiamat in your group. If you do, Tiamat gets +5 Levels, has the abilities on this card, and is a Leader.
Perfect Defense: While Tiamat hasn’t moved during a turn, all Ranged Attacks that target him automatically miss and no roll is made for them. Once Tiamat has moved during a turn, this ability won’t have any affect until the beginning of the next turn.
ooo - Starlight Romance (Ki, Effect)
All enemy units within Tiamat’s Control Zone suffer Paralyze Lv. 1. Effect: 15.
Limit: Once per game.

name: Anima Tactics: Iosara
description:
Mystery accompanies each step taken by Iosara, only the Empress or possibly her advisors know any of the true details relating to this enigmatic entity. Even Iosara’s gender is not conclusively known. The only thing that is for certain is that Iosara’s swords appear wherever it is necessary to fight for Elisabetta’s dream.

Dark Empire Warrior - Lv. 50
At 5 | Dm 5 | Df 9 | Ar 2 | LP 15 | Re 10 | Mo 12/16 | AP 3/4
Innate Abilities: Immunity (Doom).
ooo - Crystal Fire (Ki, Ranged Attack)
Distance 16 inches. If this attack causes damage, the target suffers Slow Lv. 1. Effect 15.
ooo - Death Bringer (Ki, Attack)
+4 Damage.
oooo - The Three Fates (Ki, Attack)
Iosara makes three consecutive Attacks. If the first causes damage, the target suffers Seal Lv. 1, the second causes Blind Lv. 1, and the third attack causes Doom Lv. 1. Each of these states cause a separate resistance check vs. Effect 15.

IOSARA Unborn
Specter: If Iosara is reduced to 0 or less LP, it becomes a specter instead of being destroyed. While a
specter, Iosara becomes Intangible, cannot recover LP through any means, and is removed from play if it takes any damage.
Wandering Shadow: Iosara is not deployed normally at the start of the game. At the beginning of each Recovery Phase roll a die, on a 9+ you put Iosara with all its Actions Points anywhere on the board that is not within 2 inches of an enemy Unit. When rolling for Wandering Shadow, apply the following modifiers:
•+1 for each game turn that has passed.
•+1 for each Unit that has been eliminated from Iosara's party.
Power Absorption: When Iosara destroys an enemy Unit, choose a Magic or Ki ability from the Unit. Iosara gains a copy of that ability. Iosara uses the ability as though it was on its card. All costs, benefits, and drawbacks of the copied ability remain the same. Iosara may only copy one ability at a time, so if later in the game it destroys another enemy Unit it may copy a new ability replacing the old one or retain the old one.

name: Anima Tactics: Griever
description:
Griever, The Destroyer of the Eternal Flames, is a living myth. Personal guardian of the Empress, this unstoppable man is no mere normal being; he is an ideal made flesh. Son of Baphomet, the last praetorian that guarded the Giovanni dynasty, Griever was trained to be the final weapon of humanity, a man that can face both gods or devils with his own hands.

Neutral Empire Leader Warrior - Lv 70
At 6 | Dm 6 | Df 9 | Ar 3 | LP 20 | Re 10 | Mo 6/10 | AP 3/5
Innate Abilities: Critical Mastery.
Indomitable: If Griever suffers Damage in hand-to-hand combat, he recovers an action point. This is limited to one Action Point per Turn.
ooo - Scar of the World (Ki, Attack)
+4 Damage. Roll two dice and keep the highest result.
ooooo - End of the World (Ki, Attack)
Griever makes four consecutive attacks against the same target.
oo - Defensive Stance (Ki, Reactive)
This ability may be used in the moment in the Recovery Phase ends. During this Turn, Griever may Dodge any attack as a free action without spending Action Points.

name: Pennant Race
description:
The tabletop baseball game for Japanese professional baseball. This game customized to fit Japanese style baseball based on APBA Pro Baseball.

The game mainly affected by batting ability, and sometimes affected by pitching and fielding ability.

Players manage one of twelve baseball clubs. If skilled players, one game can be completed within 10 minutes.„ÄÄTherefore, not only single game or short series of few games, you can play a full regular season of a year.

This game first published in 1984 with 1983 season's data. And, has been published continuously until 1990.

name: Anima Tactics: Clover
description:
Warrior, officer… and more than human, Clover is one of the five original Black Sun seekers who found the Book of the Dead more than a decade ago. Transformed by his contact with the forces of unstoppable power contained within that fell grimoire, he is neither dead nor alive. As the member of the Delacroix family most suited to military command, Clover is now the leader of Black Sun’s security forces, the largest private army on all of Gaia.

Neutral Black Sun Leader Warrior - Lv. 70
At 6 | Dm 6 | Df 10 | Ar 1 | LP 18 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/5
Superior Undead: Clover may be considered Undead at his controller’s discretion. So for effects that benefit him he may be considered Undead, whereas for effects that hinder him he will not be considered Undead. Clover doesn’t suffer from the Uncontrollable rule or have an Influence value.
Inhuman Force: If desired, any of Clover’s Attacks can cause Throw.
Focus: Once per Turn, Clover may give +2 to one of his Attack or Dodge rolls.
ooooo - Prometheum (Ki, Charge)
After this Charge is resolved, Clover may make up to 2 additional Charges, moving up to 4 inches for each, automatically Escaping from combat where necessary.
o - Everlasting (Magic, Reactive, Effect)
Clover loses all of the Action Points he has left, recovers all his Life
Points, and gains Shield Lv. 1. Limit: Once per game.
oo - Neokinesis (Magic, Effect, Reactive)
Clover gets Haste Lv. 2. Limit: Once per game.

name: Anima Tactics: Kingsley Warlock
description:
Kingsley Warlock is one of the CEOs of Black Sun, as well as one of the most trusted agents of the Delacroix family. Master of both the sword and the darkest arts, he uses his control over the undead to greatly increase Black Sun’s, as well as his own, influence.

Dark Black Sun Warrior Mystic Controller - Lv. 50
At 5 | Dm 6 | Df 8 | Ar 1 | LP 16 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Guidance Points: 2
Blood Magic: Whenever Kingsley uses one of his Magic Abilities he loses 1 Life Point.
ooo - Curse of Damballa (Magic, Attack)
If this attack causes damage, the target suffers Blind, Seal, Slow, and Doom all at Lv. 2. Effect:16.
ooo - Tonnere Diable (Magic Ranged Attack)
Distance 16 inches. -1 Damage. If this Attack causes damage the target suffers Poison Lv. 2. Effect:16.
o - Attzan (Magic Effect)
Until the end of the turn, enemy units that are more than 8 inches away from Kingsley can’t draw Line of Sight to him.
o - Ogoun (Magic Effect)
Until the end of the turn, whenever an enemy unit causes Kingsley damage, they lose an amount of Life Points equal to the damage caused to Kingsley. If Kingsley dies as a result of the damage dealt to him, then this ability will not cause the unit that dealt the damage to lose Life Points. Effect 14.

name: Anima Tactics: Raziel Archetypum
description:
The ultimate necromatic weapons, Raziel are terrifying undead knights created by combining Black sun's scientific research with the power of the Book of the Dead. Each a masterpiece of death and destruction, just one can lay waste to whole armies with its fell blades.

Neutral Black Sun Warrior Undead - Lv. 45+
At 5 | Dm 6 (8) | Df 8 | Ar 4 | LP: 16| Re 10 | Mo 6/10 | AP 2/4
Influence: 2 Uncontrollable: 9+
Availability: Raziel Archetypums are not unique, and you may include 1 for every 150 levels available to your Party.
Raxxor: Whenever a Raziel Archetypum causes a Critical Hit, it uses its secondary damage attribute for that Attack.
Dead Eyes: The Razael Archetypum gets +1 to Seek rolls.
o - Finishing Claw (Ki, Attack)
-3 Damage. This Attack can only be used after the Raziel Archetypum resolves a successful basic Attack or Charge. This Attack is not affected by the Raxxor ability.
ooo - Sweep (Ki, Attack)
+2 Damage. This Attack effects every Enemy Unit engaged with the Raziel Archetypum.

RAZIEL ARCHETYPUM Modifications
A Raziel Archetypum may be given up to two of the following upgrades, increasing their base Level by the amount noted.
•Dual Raxxors Level: +5
The Raziel Archetypum's Finisher Claw no longer suffers -3 damage, and benefits from the Raxxor Ability.
•Indestructable Level: +5
The Raziel Archetypum gains +10 Life Points, +1 Armor, and the Damage Resistance rule.
•Retractable Finger Claws Level: +5
The Raziel Archetypum gains the following Skill.
ooo - Retractable Fingers (Ki, Ranged Attack)
Distance 12 Inches. -3 Damage. If this Attack causes damage the target is moved in a straight line, ignoring any interfering units or terrain, to contact with the base of the Raziel Archetypum. This ability is not affected by the Raxxor Ability. Effect 15
•Spectral Body Level: +10
At the End of each Maintenance Phase roll a die. On a 6+ the Raziel Archetypum is intangible until the end of the turn.

name: Anima Tactics: Raziel Nk-X
description:
The ultimate killing machine, the most powerful necromantic weapon ever created… After a decade of investigation and iteration, the researchers at Black Sun have been able to develop the Raziel Nk-X, the zenith of all their experiments. With unequaled skills and powers, nothing in the world is able to face this fearsome new model of undead knight.

Neutral Black Sun Warrior Undead Optional Leader - Lv. 60+
At 5 | Dm 8 | Df 8 | Ar 4 | LP: 20| Re 10 | Mo 6/10 | AP 2/4
Influence: 2 Uncontrollable: 9+
Availability: Raziel Nk-X's are not unique, and you may include 1 for every 300 levels available to your Party.
Unstoppable: A NK-X that reaches 0 LP or less is not eliminated from the game, instead it becomes unstoppable. While in unstoppable state the Nk-X is immune to damage and applies a -2 modifiers to its Attack (however it is still vulnerable to effects and negative states). At the start of each recovery phase roll a die. With a 3+ the Nk-X is removed form the game. If the Nk-X ends the game with 0 LP it counts as a casualty for Victory Points.
Raxxor Zero: Whenever the Nk-X kills an enemy unit it recovers one LP for each 5 levels the killed unit was worth. For example, a lvl 35 enemy would make the Nk-X recover 7 LP. This ability allows the NK-X to leave the unstoppable state.
Dead Eyes: The Razael Nk-X gets +1 to Seek rolls.
o - Exterminator Claw (Ki, Attack)
-4 Damage. This Attack can only be used after the Raziel Nk-X resolves a successful Basic Attack or Basic Charge. This Attack is not affected by the Raxxor Zero ability.
ooo - Nova (Magic, Attack)
This Attack effects all units within 2 inches of the Raziel Nk-X.

RAZIEL NK-X Modifications
A Raziel Nk-X may be given up to two of the following upgrades, increasing their base Level by the amount noted.
•Dual Raxxors Level: +5
The Raziel Nk-X's Exterminator Claw no longer suffers -4 damage, and benefits from the Raxxor Zero Ability.
•Indestructable Level: +5
The Raziel Nk-X gains +10 Life Points, +1 Armor, and the Damage Resistance rule.
•Spectral Body Level: +10
At the End of each Maintenance Phase roll a die. On a 6+ the Raziel Nk-X is intangible until the end of the turn.
CROSSRAIKER
A Raziel NK-X can be upgraded to a Crossraiker, choosing one of the options below. Additionally this gives the Raziel-NkX +5 Levels, makes it a Leader, and removes the Uncontrollable ability from them.
Anubis: Anubis is a Controller and has 2 Guidance points.
Thanatos: Thanatos Attack is increased to 6 and it gains Critical Mastery.
Pluto:Pluto recoverys one additional Action Point per turn. If Pluto's attacks deal damage, the target suffers Blind Lvl 2 Effect 15.
Osiris: While Osiris is Unstoppable it doesn't apply the -2 Attack modifier and is only removed from the game on a roll of 5+ at the beginning of the Upkeep Phase.
Hermes: Hermes gains the Initiative ability, and its speed is increased to 12/16.

name: Anima Tactics: Type 012 Hunter
description:
The Hunters are powerful, beastly, necromantic weapons made by Black Sun. They are a deadly combination of strength, brutality, and supernatural speed.

Neutral Black Sun Prowler Undead - Lv. 35+
Att 4 | Dam 5 | Def 9 | Arm 3 | LP: 20 | Res 10 | Mov 12/16 | AP 2/4
Availability: Type-012s aren’t unique and you may include 1 for every 150 levels available to your party.
Innate Ability: Damage Resistance
Modified Claws and Jaws: Attack made by the Type-012 ignore 1 point of the targets Armor.
Dead Eyes: The Type-012 gets +1 to its Seek rolls.
Regeneration: The Type-012 recovers 3 Life Points at the beginning of each Recovery Phase.
Primary Rabies: Whenever the Type-012 takes Damage, it must make an Uncontrollable check.
Berserker: While out of control, the Type-012 gets +1 Attack and +1 Damage.
ooo Coil (Ki, Charge)
+2 Damage, This attack causes Throw. While the Type-012 is out of control, it will always use this Charge instead of the Basic Charge.

Type-012 Modifications
A Type-012: Hunter may be given one of the following upgrades, increasing their basic Level by the amount noted:
Type-012a Viper Levels: +5
Whenever an attack made by the Type-012a deals damage, its target suffers Poison Lv. 2 Effect 17.
Type-012b Deathseeker Levels: +5
The Type-012b gets Open Movement and doesn’t require Line of Sight to declare a Charge against an enemy Unit.
Type-012c Regenerating Levels: +5
The Type-012c recover 6 LP instead of 3 at the beginning of each Recovery Phase.
Type-013 Advance Hunter Levels: +10
The Type-013 recovers an additional Action Point per turn, and no longer has the Primary Rabies ability.
In addition to one of the above options, the Type-012 may also be given the following upgrade, increasing their basic Level by the amount noted:
Final Protocol Levels: +5
When the LP of the Type-012 reaches 0 or less, remove it from the game as normal and replace it with a marker the same size as it base. At the beginning of the next Action Phase, before any Character is activated, make an attack (6 ATT 6 DAM) that effects all Units within 3 inches of the marker. Remove the marker after the attack is resolved.

name: Justice League of America Aquaman Game
description:
Players must get from the Start space, lower left of the board, to the Finish space, lower right of the board. To move, a player spins the spinner and moves to the next space with the same colour that he has just spun. Then he draws a card and obeys the instruction.

If you land on the space next to the cross-bar (The track is a large letter A, so has to have a cross-bar). This is a short cut but if taken, the player does not use the spinner. In this case, he moves one space at a time until he is out of the short-cut. Of course, after each move of one space, he must still draw a card.

The winner is the first to reach the Finish space.

name: Anima Tactics: Adolf Brunner
description:
The monster that responds to the name of Adolf Brunner, known as "Loki" among members of Les Jaeger, is a cruel supernatural scientist who has corrupted his own body in exchange for power. He has earned the position of captain of the special forces of the Azur Alliance with his intelligence, cruelty and gift to manipulate the souls of his enemies. With little loyalty other than to serve his own interests and curiosity to experiment, Adolf Brunner is a truly repulsive creature.

Dark Azur Alliance Mystic/Prowler - Lv. 45
At 4 | Dm 2 | Df 8 | Ar 1 | LP 13 | Re 10 | Mo 6/10 | AP 3/4
Innate Abilities: Initiative
False Demise: If Adolf loses all of his Life Points, on a roll of 6+ place a marker at his current location. At the beginning of the next Turn place Adolf back on the board within 4 inches of the marker with 1 LP. You cannot activate this ability if it has already been used or if it is the last Turn of the game.
oo - Snake Blood (Magic, Effect)
An enemy Unit within Adolf's Control Zone suffers Poison Lv. 2. Effect 16.
oo - Obscuritas (Magic, Effect)
An enemy Unit within Adolf's Control Zone suffers Blind lv. 2. Effect 16.
oo - Essence of Corruption (Magic, Effect)
An enemy Unit within Adolf's Control Zone suffers 4 points of Damage. Effect 15.
A part of Team Puppet Master along with Frey and Freya

name: Anima Tactics: Frey
description:
Adolf Brunner’s twin daughters, Frey and Freya have been raised as living weapons whose sole purpose is destroying Adolf’s enemies. Inheriting bestial spirit power from their mother Tuan Dalyr and modified with enhanced physical abilities due to their father’s experiments, they are terrifyingly inhuman predators. Frey and Freya aren’t driven by evil and cruelty, sadly depravity and death is all they have ever known.

Dark Azur Alliance Prowler - Lv. 40

name: Anima Tactics: Freya
description:
Adolf Brunner’s twin daughters, Frey and Freya have been raised as living weapons whose sole purpose is destroying Adolf’s enemies. Inheriting bestial spirit power from their mother Tuan Dalyr and modified with enhanced physical abilities due to their father’s experiments, they are terrifyingly inhuman predators. Frey and Freya aren’t driven by evil and cruelty, sadly depravity and death is all they have ever known.

+3 Damage. Freya can only use this Charge if she is Berserk. If this Charge deals damage to an enemy Unit, remove 1 Berserk counter from Freya.
A part of Team Puppet Master along with Adolf and Frey.

name: Anima Tactics: High Arbiter Aizen
description:
There is no power in the Azur Alliance greater than that of High Arbiter Aizen, the Arbiter of Shadows. To most who meet him in battle, he is death incarnate. This ancient creature absorbs the power of all those he has defeated, becoming a vessel full of souls lost in the dark.
Dark Azur Alliance Leader Warrior/Prowler - Lv. 90
At 6 | Dm 4 | Df 10 | Ar 3 | LP 16 | Re 10 | Mo 12/16 | AP 3/5

Master Murderer: If Aizen kills a character with an attack while hidden, he remains hidden instead of being revealed by that attack.
Stealing Shadows: During the Upkeep Phase, Aizen can replace his Special Abilities with the Special Abilities of any Character that that he has previously destroyed. At the beginning of subsequent Upkeep Phases, Aizen can continue to have the Special Abilities of the dead character, or can revert to his own Special Abilities.

This Attack can only be used if Aizen is Hidden.

+6 Attack.

Influence Zone: 12 inches

name: Anima Tactics: High Arbiter Alastor
description:
High Arbiter Alastor is the Arbiter of Demons, the Dark Master of the War. There are many names for someone who has forgotten his own. As a high power under the direct command of the High Archon, Alastor has been unleashed upon the world to destroy the pillars than sustain it.

Move one friendly unit within Alastor's Influence Zone 2 inches. This does not count as a Movement. Motum may not be used more than once on the same Character in a Turn.

A friendly Unit within Alastor's Influence Zone makes a free hand-to-hand Attack.

name: Impede
description:
IMPEDE is a abstract strategy game in the spirit of Go or Checkers.

Goal: Position 4 of your pieces in a straight, connected row before your opponent.

Gameplay: Players take turns moving one of their pieces to an adjacent, unoccupied space in an attempt to get 4 pieces in a row before their opponent. Play is a balance of offense and defense, positioning pieces for later traps, blocks, and offensive pushes.
publishers: Enigma Nexus, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Anima Tactics: Kirsten
description:
The beautiful and silent assassin of Les Jaeger, Kirsten is an enigma. Gifted with the ability to throw any object as a lethal weapon, she is a sinful angel of death on the battlefield.

Neutral Azur Alliance Prowler - Lv. 40

At 5 | Dm 3 | Df 9 | Ar 0 | LP 12 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4

Vodka may only be activated when an enemy unit declares a charge against Kirsten. At this moment, and before the enemy unit moves, she may make a Ranged Attack against that unit.

Ranged Attack (16 Inches). Kirsten makes two consecutive attacks. Each attack must be against separate targets.

Kirsten moves 3 Inches. This movement may be made even if she has already moved this Turn. Limit: Once per Turn.

A part of Team Les Jaeger along with The Colonel, Kyler and Reindhold.

description:
Some people born with innate aptitudes for arts… and others for death. However, in Colonel's own words, there are very few able to perform assassination as a fine art. Kyler is one of those chosen ones. Remodeled using Lost Logias and turned into a psychotic killing machine, this Les Jaeger agent has become one of the most prominent killers in the whole world.

-1 Attack / -2 Damage.

name: Anima Tactics: Maximo Ligori
description:
The colossal Ligori, personal executioner of the High Arbiter Alastor, is a personification of war. This unstoppable killing machine has roamed the greatest battlefields of Gaïa, as one of the most powerful fighters of the Azur Alliance.

Dark Azur Alliance Warrior - Lv. 45

At 5 | Dm 8 | Df 8 | Ar 1 | LP: 20 | Re 9 | Mo 6/10 | AP 2/4

ooo - Executor Gale (Ki, Attack)

name: Anima Tactics: Reindhold
description:
Lord Alfred Reinhold, descendant of one of the oldest and most influential noble houses of Togarini, is one of the most important members of Les Jaeger. Gifted with powerful psychic powers, this old man is able to move mountains with the power of his mind.

Neutral Azur Alliance Mystic - Lv. 45

At 5 | Dm 3 | Df 8 | Ar 1 | LP: 13 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4

Distance (16 inches). +1 Damage. Throw.

Reindhold may displace an unit inside his Control Zone up to 4 inches. This skill can not move a unit engaged in Hand-to-hand combat. Effect 15 (against enemies only).

A part of Team Les Jaeger along with Kirsten, Kyler and The Colonel.

name: Boh√™me 1618
description:
This 2 players wargame will be included in VaeVictis magazine.

It covers the event of summer 1618 during which the Bohemian parliament faced the power of the Habsbourg emperor. Armies will face each others to battle for the control of Bohemia and the competition of influence will also take place in the different regional Diets to join a side.

Each player controls armies (composed of cavalry, infantry and artillery) under different generals. These armies will receive orders to conduct operations aiming at controlling or pillaging territories, destroying enemies or besieging cities.
Each player tries to control the largest amount of towns in Bohemia and particularly the capital Prague.
Combats and sieges are resolved with a roll to hit system using a d6. At the end of fights some of the routes units can be rallied, some are lost and some might potentially switch side.
Both sides also have resources they they can spend to supply armies or influence votes in regional diets to obtain their supports.
Random events will also affect the campaign such as snow, pillages, uprising or political shifts.

This is an operational level game with 108 counters and requires just a few coins (pennies will do) and a d6.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Anima Tactics: Covel
description:
Covel Dhanyata is not only one of the greatest summoners in all of Gaia, he is also a link with the spirit of the Fallen Angel Jigoku no Kami. Sometimes mortal, sometimes the avatar of a god, this man travels the world imposing his divine will over every supernatural creature that crosses his path.

Neutral Samael Optional Leader Mystic - Lv. 35
At 4 | Dm 2 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP 12 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/5
Summoner Level: 2
Affinity: Light, Dark, Void
Master Summoner: When Covel pays a Character’s Cost to Summon, he pays 1 Action Point less. This ability cannot reduce a Character’s Cost to Summon below 1 Action Point.
Superior Presence: For the purpose of placing a Character Covel has Summoned on the table, Covel’s Control Zone is 12 inches.
ooo - Dark Star (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance 16 inches. +1 Attack / +3 Damage.
oo - Empowerment (Magic, Effect, Reactive)
A Covel's Summon in his Zone of Control gain +2 Attack or +2 Defense until the end of the turn.

COVEL Jigoku no Kami’s Avatar
Optional Leader: You may choose to use this skill card when Covel is in your party. If you do, Covel gains +25 levels, has the abilities on this card, and is a Leader.
High Summoner: As the Avatar Covel’s Summoner Level increases to 3.
Undaunted: Covel doesn’t lose Life Points due to Shock Checks.
Divine Presence: During the Recovery Phase put a Bind Point on one of Covel's Summon within his Control Zone.
Immortal Avatar: When Covel’s Life Points are reduced to 0, you may destroy a Character summoned by Covel within his Control Zone instead of him. If you do Covel recovers all of his Life Points.
Enhanced Dark Star: Dark Star’s Action Point cost is reduced by one point.

+6 Attack / +8 Damage. This Attack can only be used at the end of the Recovery Phase. Place a Devastation marker in a location that Covel has Line of Sight to that is within 20 inches of him. Once every character has completed their Activation during the Action Phase, Covel makes a single Attack against all units that are still within 4 inches of the Devastation marker. Remove the marker after the Attack.

name: Anima Tactics: Dinah
description:
The Fallen Angel Dinah, one of the Supreme leaders of Samael, is a legend among legends. Bestowed with godly powers and carrying within her soul the combined power of light and darkness, she is a positive power who seeks a better future for Gaia.

Light Samael Mystic Leader - Lv. 70
At 5 | Dm 5 | Df 10 | Ar 0 | LP: 15 | Re 12 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/5
oo - Blessing (Magic, Effect)
All friendly units within Dinah's Control Zone get +1 Attack and Defense as long as this ability remains in effect. This ability may be channeled through Lucera.
Maintenance: o
oo - Darkness Veil (Magic, Effect)
All enemy units within Dinah's Control Zone suffer Blind Lv1. This ability may be channeled through Umbra. Effect 14.
oo - Energy Projection (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance (16 inches). This ability may be channeled through either Lucera or Umbra. If it is, then its Distance is halved.
ooo - Devastation (Magic, Attack)
+4 Attack. Dinah makes a single Attack on all units within 3 inches of either Lucera or Umbra. After resolving it, the spirit that was used to channel Devastation is removed from play.
oooo - Reality Fold (Magic, Effect)
Dinah trades positions on the board with either Lucera or Umbra. Dinah may take up to three friendly units within her Control Zone with her; these Characters are placed in base to base contact with Dinah after the switch in positions. This ability may be used to remove Characters from Hand-to-hand combat.
Limit: Once per game.

DINAH Guardian Angels
Divine Being
While Dinah is in play her controller gets one additional Gnosis point per Turn.
Umbra and Lucera
Dinah has two spirit guardians that will be deployed when she is. They are Umbra and Lucera. These are no more than extensions of Dinah's will with no attributes other than Speed. They cannot be damaged in any way (or removed from the game by other character's abilities) nor can they take any Actions other than to move. Umbra and Lucera are removed from play if Dinah leaves play. If an enemy Character wishes to occupy the same space as either Umbra or Lucera, the spirits are moved up to 1 inch (into an open area) by their controlling player to vacate the space. Umbra and Lucera move freely and independently during Dinah's activation as Intangible units with a Speed of 12 and a Control Zone of 4 inches.
Spiritual Link
Dinah can channel some of her magic abilities through Umbra and Lucera. When she does this Dinah is considered as being in the same position on the board as her spirit guardian. If she tries to channel an ability through a spirit guardian that is not within 16 inches of her (measures are taken after declaring the ability activation), the ability has no effect and that spirit guardian is removed from play.
Angel Guardian
If Dinah would be removed from play for any reason, roll a die, if you roll a 6+ Dinah remain in play with one Life Point. If Dinah is not removed due to this ability then remove one of her spirit guardians from the board. Dinah may only use this ability if there is at least one spirit still in play.

name: Anima Tactics: Nahimana
description:
Nahimana is the daughter of the Fallen Angel Mo'ôhtavo'nehe, the preeminent Jayán in recent memory. Having inherited many of her father’s qualities, she is an honorable and proud warrior who fights with such ferocity that she has earned the nickname “Princess Blood” among her fellows in Samael.

At 5 | Dm 6 | Df 9 | Ar 1 | LP 20 | Re 9 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4

Distance 12 inches. If this Attack hits, Nahimana may make a free Ranged Attack against another enemy Unit within 2 inches of the original target.

Remove all negative States from Nahimana, then she suffers Berserk Lv. 3. This ability can be used even if Nahimana is currently suffering from a negative State that wouldn't normally allow her to use abilities, such as Paralyzed or Seal.

name: Spook
description:
Spook is a game that can be played with the Series: Shibumi game system. It uses the 4×4 board, 15 red, 14 black, and 1 white ball.



RulesThe board (the haunted castle) starts empty.

A Visit to the Haunted Castle

Two players, Red and Black, take turns placing one ball of their colour either on an empty board hole or on a 2×2 platform. Starting with Red the pyramid is built up until in the last turn Black places the white ball (Spooky the ghost) on top.

Then Red makes the first move of the second phase of the game.

The Getaway
(To be played in candlelight.)

On their turn a player must either


remove a ball (of any colour) to drop Spooky or
remove a free ball (of any colour) which is orthogonally adjacent to Spooky and move Spooky there. If possible this move may be repeated arbitrarily removing additional balls of the same colour.


Only if no move is available then


if Spooky is isolated he must be placed orthogonally adjacent to any ball on the board or on a platform,
otherwise one unpinned ball of the opponent must be removed (a ball drop may occur),
only if there are no unpinned opponent balls, the active player must pass his turn.


As usual, pinned balls (supporting more than one ball) may not be removed.

Aim

The player who has no more balls of their colour on the board wins the game.

name: Anima Tactics: Alessa Raincross
description:
As one of The Crows of Wissenchaft and armed with Lost Loggia weapons, Alessa has become a prominent agent of Lucanor Giovanni. Thanks to the powers that she has received through continuous experiments and magical implants, her aim and physical aptitudes have become truly inhuman.

Goethia is the most modern of the Combat Gears developed by Wissenchaft. Using the science of the Lost Logias, this artifact of destruction is capable of devastating entire armies with its powerful technomagic weapons.

Unique Pilot: The same Pilot cannot be selected more than once in the same party, regardless of the Gear he is in.

Edgard Ivanesku - Lv. +0
Recharge: 2

In her own words, Veronica Cortes is the best thief in Gaïa, and nothing is going to stop her to prove it to everyone. Gaining inhuman physical skill thought The Process and an incomparable six sense, her subterfuge skills are simply beyond the imagination of anyone.

A powerful wizard from Lannet who is in fact, working for the Magus Order. Akio is trying to merge the oriental foundation of magic with the knowledge of the Order to expand his own skills.

Special Dodge. +5 Defense.

name: Anima Tactics: Kagemaru
description: Kagemaru, the immortal shadow, is the legendary master of the Asakura ninja clan. This incredible fighter has come to the old continent, for the first time in his life, to establish contact for his clan with the organizations fighting for supremacy there.

name: Anima Tactics: Kujaku Hime
description:
Kujaku is one of the princesses of the Asakura clan in Lannet and
descendent of the goddess Michirokami. After accidentally releasing one of the Orochi seals, the young princess fled from her House in an attempt to atone for her fault. She wanders distant lands in search of some power which could stop the awakening of the Dark Aeon.

Light Wanderer Warrior -Lv. 50

A part of Team Kujaku Hime & Takanosuke along with Takanosuke.

name: Anima Tactics: Li Long
description:
Li Long, master and adoptive father of the Pao brothers, has initiated the search of his missing disciples after discovering the cause for the ir travel to distant lands.
Of course, he also finds this opportunity a great chance to test their skills against the warriors of foreign lands.

Neutral Wanderer Warrior - Lv 50

name: Anima Tactics: Shinobi
description:
Shinobi are elite assassins said to come from the Eastern island of Varja. Ruthlessly trained in ancestral ki techniques, as well as the darkest arts of infiltration and concealment, these shadowy killers dedicate their entire existence to their lords.

Dark Prowler - Lv. 20+

If taken as part of an Organization Party, then Shinobi count toward the number of Agents of that Organization allowed in a Party. For example you could include 1 Shinobi and 1 Azur agent in an Azur Alliance Party of 300 Levels, but not up to 2 Shinobi and up to 2 Azur Agents.

The Shinobi recovers one more Action point per turn. Lv: +10

000 Kagetorii (Subterfuge, Run)

name: Anima Tactics: Takanosuke
description:
Takanosuke is the son of Kage Yagura, the head of the great clan Asakura ninjas.
Childhood friend of princess Kojaku, he has being ordered to bring her back to the main house by any means, but after discovering her fate, he has decided to go along with the princess in her quest to halt the awakening of the Dark Aeon Orochi.
Takanosuke, whose veins flow the blood of a war Kami, has mastered the power of the Void Eye, a fearful power which enable him to absorb all live around him.

Neutral Wanderer Prowler - Lv. 45

At 5 | Dm 3 | Df 9 | Ar 0 | LP: 12 | Re 10 | Mo 12/16 | AP 3/4

oo - Stealth (Subterfuge, Effect)
Takanosuke becomes Hidden.
Upkeep: o

oo - Kage (Subterfuge, Dodge, Escape)

+ 1 Defense. If Takanosuke successfully defends the attack, he may automatically escape combat and use Action Points to move as a Reactive Action.

oo - Kage Shuriken (Subterfuge, Ranged Attack)
Distance (12 inches). +2 Attack. If Kage Shuriken causes damage, target unit suffer Lv1 Paralyze. Effect 15. This skill can be used only if Takanosuke is Hidden.

oo - Techu (Subterfuge, Attack)

+ 3 Attack / +3 Damage. This skill can only be used if Takanosuke is Hidden.

ooo - Void Eye (Ki, Effect)
Takanosuke targets an enemy unit within 12 inches. Target unit and all friendly or enemy units with 3 inches from the target suffer Lv1 Slow. Effect 14. Takanosuke may not use Void Eye while engaged in Hand-to-hand combat.
Dificulty: 4+

name: Axle Tribes
description:
From Publisher Website

Axle tribes is the game of automotive combat set within a post apocalyptic world. Please note, that this is a game for the gamers - it is not for profit, nor will it ever be. In addition, the rules will literally be shaped by the players - each new edition will contain rule changes and additions that are suggested by YOU. Please feel free to jot down any ideas as you play and submit them to the Drunk Dwarves webmaster.

And without further delay - we present our first published game: AXLE TRIBES.

The Earth has been blighted. Long ago an event, the great end, turned the world as we knew it into a smitten landscape of broken glass and twisted jungles of metal rod. All that was green and blue, has been reborn in hues of dead browns. The air tastes bad - and it's hard to believe we were ever meant to live here.

Between the endless stretches of waste there are monstrous cities ruled by powerful land lords, where the land still clings to life. But if you live there, you live their way - or not at all. That's why many of us band together and try to survive in the wastes of the bad lands - among the mutant freaks and the harsh ever-present sun. The Axle Tribes rule this land, that is - everything left worth ruling. The Axle Tribes fight, they fight over food, water, and the parts needed to make and maintain our steeds. I am a warrior, my steed is my life, and the life of my tribe.

Game Description Notes

This free set of miniatures rules is meant to be played with Hot Wheels (or similar) model cars on the table top. (Serious players often customize their vehicles with weapons, armor-plating, etc.) Both players control a Tribe and each is allowed to build a set amount of vehicles (called Steeds) to fight it out.

Players work within an agreed upon dollar cap to create a variety of vehicles. Various weapons and vehicle upgrades make each Steed more distinctive, but also add to the cost. The game progresses in Turns. (During a Turn each vehicle is activated once.) Vehicles may move, fire, etc. when activated.

Ten-sided dice are used as a randomizer to decide control rolls, to hit rolls, etc. Maneuvers are based on 45 degree turns. There are special rules for collisions. Each steed has its own record sheet where damage is recorded. Printable counters are included to help track damage and speed.

The victory conditions of the game are left up to the players. A total destruction match in which only one side is left standing is the simplest way to play.

name: Dungeon Twister: Traps
description:
Dungeon Twister: Traps, the first expansion for Dungeon Twister / Dungeon Twister: Prison, comes packaged in four blister packs with storage space for the components available in the DT: Prison box. The blister packs will be released roughly once a quarter.

Each blister pack of Dungeon Twister: Traps includes a pair of new rooms, four new figures (two per side) of two new characters, new items, and assorted markers for the characters and rooms.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Munch
description:
Munch is a game about giant space monsters breaking into our dimension to eat worlds. Monsters also munch each other when they meet while floating through space.

Five Rainbow stashes of Looney Pyramids are required for two players to play. An additional Xeno stash allows up to four players. The game is played on a 6x6 board.

Players take turns placing worlds on the board. At any point players can unleash one of their monsters from their army to the board. Monsters continue to move on the board until they run out of worlds to munch or until they get munched themselves.

The goal of the game is to collect the most worlds, with single-colored trios scoring highest. The player with the highest score from trios and single worlds at the end of the game wins.

name: Dis ton mot
description:
"Say your word!" in English.
There are 48 cards with a letter. The cards are dealt among the players, face down in front of them.
In his turn, the active player will return the top card of his pack and place it face up on the table. Then he will propose, in less than a minute, a word with the letter of the card. He look at his cards to find other letters for this word, if one letter still missing, he moves to the next player and look at his cards for this latter. If any other player has a valid proposal, the unfortunate active player must not only take the card he has returned, but all the cards on the table of previous rounds and puts these on the point deck!

In the end, when all the cards were played, the game ends, there are points on the letters we have collected, and whoever has the least is declared "Grand Winner"!

name: C Koa
description:
The object is to guess a thing or an object using your 5 senses.

There are 3 steps to guess:
1) You choose the direction you want to know the index (eg smell).
2) You become aware of the index (eg I feel good sea air).
3) You are attempting a proposal on the matter to be discovered (eg a hook).

If the answer is correct, you win the card as a point. If the answer is wrong, choose another step to guess and so on. But beware, once an index revealed, all players can make a proposal. You must be the smartest and fastest!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Party Game

name: Symbol
description:
The object of the game is to Scribe to the other players guess a word, phrase or title with 40 symbols available.

One player as The Scribe gives to guess a word, phrase or title with 40 symbols available to other players.
All other players the decoders, observes the task for 1 minute and can make as many proposals as they want.

When a word, phrase, or title is found, the Scribe and the smart decoder both score 1 point. The winner is the one with the most points at the end of the game or he who first reached the number of points set at the start.

name: Zombies & Zeppelins
description:
The year is 1922. A pandemic is sweeping the globe. At first, scientists believe it to be yet another wave of the Spanish Flu. In the disease’s early stages, patients present with high fever, vomiting, and weakness. Quickly, the Spanish Flu theory comes under scrutiny. Patients all report having been attacked. Where the disease spreads violent crime seems to inexplicably rise. As outbreaks skyrocket, several studies conclusively prove the disease in not the dreaded Spanish Flu; it is something much worse. Late stage symptoms are found to include death, reanimation, superhuman strength, and an insatiable craving for human flesh.

After precious few years of peace, the nations of the world are returning once more to the trenches, united against a common foe. In Zombies & Zeppelins, 2-4 players lead the forces of humanity against hordes of the undead. Together, players must attempt to clear the numerous infested cities around the world. Should they fail, mankind will be swept away in a tide of the damned.

Zombies & Zeppelins is played on a game board depicting a map of the world which has been divided into 25 regions. The game uses a card-driven system to determine both the spread of the undead and humanity's military capacity. Player's must carefully manage their meager resources in combating the undead. Through clever maneuvering of their infantry, armor and artillery, and a little bit of luck, players might just be able to avert Armageddon.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Aion: A Game Of Serpents
description:
Aion is a strategic game of tile laying for two players based on the ancient symbol of the Ouroboros or Aion. The Aion is a powerful alchemical symbol of rebirth and represents the infinite transmutability of matter. During the game, players will play tiles representing alchemical runes and materials to the board while trying to form looped serpents to score points.

Aion was the winning entry of the Ottawa jam site in the Concept category of the 2012 Global Game Jam.

name: Wizard's Museum Construction Kit
description:
Wizard’s Museum is a quick-to-play game of tile placement and set collecting for two to five players. During the course of a game, players take on the role of wizards in competition with one another as they try to build the best and most well-ordered museum of magical artifacts, all while sabotaging the efforts of their friends and colleagues.

Players manage a hand of tiles, drawing and playing a single tile each turn across their own and their opponents collections. Each tile features a magical artifact in its center and four magical gates on its edges. Tiles are played to match the edges of their neighbors, but points are won and lost by matching -- or failing to match -- artifacts. Will you add to your museum or disrupt your neighbors?

name: Œ§Œë ŒúŒëŒìŒôŒöŒë Œ†ŒïŒ§Œ°ŒëŒîŒôŒë
description: ΤΑ ΜΑΓΙΚΑ ΠΕΤΡΑΔΙΑ (MAGIC GEMS) is an abstract board game that three players try to through pass 10 gems to the other side of the board by dice rolling. The player who first takes all his gems to the other side is the winner.

name: Metre Litre Gram Game
description:
The Metre Litre Gram Game is the fun way to learn metric.

The game consists of a playing board, six player tokens, two dice, five decks of cards (metre, litre, gram, chance, and exam), a rule sheet and a sheet that explains the metric system.

The path on the board is in the shape of the letter m, which stands for metre. The left leg has metre questions, the middle section has litre and temperature questions, and the right leg has gram questions. After rolling the dice the player takes the larger of the two dice and moves their token forward and takes a question card from the appropriate stack. If the player answers the question correctly their token remains on that square. If the player is incorrect the player moves backwards the smaller number of spaces. If the player rolls doubles their token is moved forward the total of the two dice, and moves backwards the distance indicated on one die in the case of an incorrect answer. If the player lands on a square the same colour as their token, a chance card is drawn. On some spaces an exam card is drawn. A player cannot move again until an exam question is answered correctly. The first player to travel the board wins.

name: Grosse kleine Welt
description:
An educational game about the WTO and how global economy is working. The two ressources chosen here as examples are cotton and coffee. The players play different countries (Vietnam / Kamerun / USA / EU)with different starting conditions. They invest money ("oro") into their own economic engine (and organize their domestic economy) and buy and sell the products on the global market. After two rounds (each containing 5 phases), there is a "minister`s conference", where players discuss and negotiate about different game rules, that will be valid until the next conference.
There are also event cards and negative reactions of the people like "strike", when the domestic economy is not organized well.
Winner of the game is NOT the one with the most money in absolute terms, but who has best developed his country relatively to the starting conditions.
The game was designed by a young woman as her "high school diploma / exam thesis" in Switzerland and was further developed and published by the "EvB" (Erklärung von Bern / Bern Declaration) and distributed by Murmel Spielwerkstatt.

name: Sacramentum Gladiatorum
description:
Sacramentum Gladiatorum is a game recreating gladiatorial combat in the arena in ancient Rome.

Turns are played simultaneously by players. In the first step, they will plan the move or the action for each gladiator. In the second step, they will reveal their orders and apply the results.

Combats are also planned using counters to determine where the gladiator will hit his opponent and how he will protect himself.

The location of hits is then reported to the part of the body chosen and general vitality of the gladiator will decrease.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Squad Seven II: Le spectre d'Imhotek
description:
Second game in the Squad Seven saga.

This time the adventure takes place in the great desert of northern Sudan. The Squads explore the mysterious ruins of a temple buried under the sands in order to find the fabulous treasures, but also something else ... may be evidence that we are not alone in the universe and it may already be among us. Clues are hidden on the game cards.

Players choose their squad and enter the desert and take the turns to reveal cards, which may show treasure or various dangers. Many cards require the player to shoot a target or run round the table before a scream is heard on the soundtrack CD. If they fail, they lose a member of their squad.

The player who recovers the most treasure wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Card Game, Print & Play, Real-time

name: Victory Spark
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.




Japanese Collectible card game.

The game objective is about a player who order the character card to try to knock down the opponent's character and much as possible.

Each side of battlefield in the game have a Character in the front. That zone called as "Ring". And up to 3 supporting character behind. That zone called as "Bench". Only a main Character in the "Ring" can attack the opposing character that also in the "Ring". Each attacking requires to rest a supporting character in the "Bench" (like Magic the Gathering's Tapping). The damage is commutative until the attacked character are knocked down. Knocked-down character is remove to the zone called "Retired zone" and then immediately put the card from the top of the deck to the "Ring" face up, solve its effect before next attacking. The winner is a player who can make the opponent reaches 10 character in the "Retired zone".

Card type in this have only one type, the character card.

Constructed deck consists exactly 50 cards.

name: Original Edition Delta: Book of War
description: A miniatures game that, on a statistical basis, faithfully replicates the results of combat in the Original RPG on a mass scale (with each figure representing 10 troops or 1 hero). To resolve attacks, each figure in a unit that is eligible to attack rolls a D6 against a target number to determine if it inflicts casualties on the opponent. A unit receiving casualties must then succeed in a morale check or rout. Rules are provided to convert troops and heroes from the Original RPG's statistics to Book of War. Magic rules derived from that game are also included.

name: Mafia: New York
description:
ESPAÑOL

"MAFIA: Nueva York" es un juego de cartas altamente estratégico, en el que cada jugador guía los designios de una de las cinco familias mafiosas de Nueva York. Ambientado en los años 40, las Familias deberán pugnar por el control de los negocios (tráfico de armas, prostitución, apuestas ilegales, ...) que se encuentran repartidos en los dominios de los cinco barrios de Nueva York (Queens, Manhattan, Bronx, Staten Island y Brooklyn). Cada Familia tendrá un objetivo principal a cumplir durante su partida, y varios secundarios que le darán la posibilidad de mejorar su familia.

Por medio del dinero y los Puntos de Respeto podremos ir haciendo crecer nuestra familia (capos, soldados), que a su vez controlarán los dominios y negocios que su familia tenga en su poder.

El equilibrio estratégico entre la defensa de nuestras posesiones y la conquista y asalto de nuevos dominios será la clave del juego, que no se ve libre de un cierto efecto "suerte", ya que los ataques, defensas y ciertas acciones requeridas por las variadísimas cartas de Evento nos llevarán a realizar tiradas de dados.

El objetivo final del juego es cumplir los requisitos establecidos por una carta de objetivo principal que se nos entregará al comienzo de la partida, pudiendo cumplir además tantos objetivos secundarios como seamos capaces y que nos aportarán Puntos de Respeto adicionales.”

ENGLISH

"MAFIA: New York" is a highly strategic card game, in which each player leads one of the five mafia families from NYC. Set in the 40s, the families have to fight for the control of their businesses (arms trade, prostitution, illegal gambling...), spread around NYC's five neighborhoods (Queens, Manhattan, Bronx, Staten Island and Brooklyn). Each family has a main goal to achieve during the game, and several secondary objectives that can make the family improve.

By means of money and respect points, each family can increase its members (gangsters, soldiers), who will help control the domains and businesses their family owns.

Strategic balance between defense of one's possessions and the conquest of new domains will be key to the game, but chance will also take part in it, as attacks, defense movements and several other actions required by many event cards will make us throw the dice.
