The final goal of the game is to fulfill the requirements set in a main goal card given out at the beginning of the game, and achieving in addition as many secondary objectives as possible, which will bring us additional respect points.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Mafia, Print & Play

name: Radical School Hours
description:
User summary

A home-made Japanese card game, based on the so-called "dating simulators". Players compete for the attention of six girls, each with their own events related to them, and the player with the most events scored at the end wins. The game consists of general events, special events and activity cards. Players start with a deck of activity cards and some general events, though none are kept as a hand, but instead drawn one at a time and played. Each turn, a player can choose if he wants to gain a certain girl's special event card to add to his deck, or if he wants to gain as points the events he'll play. It's a matter of keeping in mind what you have in your deck and relying on luck enough to get them in the right order.

Translated box back
A game distilling the sweet-and-sour (or so 'tis written) romantic memories from fictitious school days. Players try to impress the different heorines, and gradually build their own decks with the memories they prefer!

Love or dislike… put into words there is no end to it.
My radical days keep going on and on (pun from a famour dating sim).
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck

name: Modern Naval Conflicts: GIUK 1980s Expansion / Falklands Conflict
description:
This Expansion adds 200 new and updated unit data sheets (on CD-ROM) for NWS "Modern Naval Conflicts: 1970s" game to cover the USSR, UK, and USA for the 1980s period, as well as adding unit data for Argentina and UK for the 1982 Falklands Conflict. The Expansion also includes two new thick paper gloss map panels (each 11" x 17") that cover the Falkland Islands and Argentine coastal areas so that you can create and/or play scenarios that can range over the entire Falklands theater.
The Expansion includes a 20 page Rules Manual that has two sections: the First section adds new, expanded and advanced rules for MNC that add new depths of realism to the game, as well as accounts for advances in technology that occurred during the 1980s time frame. The Second section of the manual covers the 1982 Falklands Conflict, with geographical and related information (as well as rules specific to the Falklands Conflict) needed to plan, create, and play scenarios for the Conflict. This section also contains information about different types of missions that each side performed during the Conflict to help players create their own scenarios. Each mission type also includes a historic 'starter scenario' that demonstrates a typical version of that mission.

The Expansion also includes a new sheet of 280 die-cut counters, with new counters for missiles for red and blue sides, and adds sufficient counters to add a third side (green) to play, which can be used for the Argentine side in Falkland scenarios, or perhaps as a minor navy in a GIUK battle.

Website: http://www.navalwarfare.net/mnc.html
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Nautical

name: Pasterze
description:
Shepherds is a 2 players game (with 4 players variant) in which players try to catch 3 (of 9) sheep. They try to do it with one... dog. The first who do it, is a winner.

Each player has a set of cards. Players (alternately) play a card and move the dog to try herding the sheep into their pens. Cards have values from 1 to 5, which represent exactly how many spaces the dog must move.

The used card is discarded. If a player runs out of cards, all of that player's discarded cards return to their hand. At the end of the dog's movement, the player places a pen in his color on the dog's final square.

Players take turns one after the other in this way until the game ends.

name: Pirate Hunter
description:
Pirate Hunter is a push-your-luck dice and card game with opportunities for player interaction. Players compete to capture pirates by rolling dice against a challenge number shown on each pirate card.
Players must manage their dice pool carefully while taking just enough risk to stay ahead of the others.

The more pirates a player captures, the more risk their dice will be lost to Davy Jones along with the plunder accumulated that round.

Some rolls give dice, some rolls send dice to Davy Jones! In a pinch, players may call for the aid of another player and then negotiate a settlement for the assistance. But be careful, those lending aid are also putting their dice at risk.

Will you keep your plunder in your hold and risk the roll with fewer dice or use it to buy back dice and risk not having enough plunder to win in the end?
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: WordHound
description:
The Game of WordHound is played by two to four players. The Object of the game is to make an answer belonging to the category in play from the letters on your letter rack.

During your turn you draw letters from the letter bag, one at a time, until you draw a letter you want to keep. When you keep a letter, your turn is over and you pass the bag to the player on your left. Letters you don't want are placed face up on the letter board where they may be taken by other players. Letters you keep are placed on your letter rack.

The first player to make an answer using all the letters on his or her rack wins the round. The winner scores two points for each letter in his or her answer, plus a bonus equal to the number of the round being played. Other players score one point for each letter in their partial answer if every letter on their rack is used in the partial answer. Players score zero points if there are any unused letters on their rack when the round ends.

An answer may consist of one or more words and may be singular or plural. Blank tiles may be used as any letter and are scored as a letter. Spaces between words and other punctuation are assumed and do not affect scoring.

The player with the highest score after six rounds of play wins the game.

name: Spandrel
description:
Spandrel is derived from Spaiji, and is a three-player game designed for play with a Shibumi set. It uses a 4×4-holed board, and balls in three colors (white, black, and red).

Rules: The 4×4 board starts empty. The players, White, Black, and Red, take turns placing one ball of each color (yes, all three colors) in a contiguous, touching chain on the growing pyramid. The balls can be placed on board holes and/or on top of 2×2 platforms. The three balls can go on the growing pyramid in any orientation, as long as one of the three balls touches the two others.

Aim: The player with the largest group of connected balls of her color when the pyramid is full wins. In case of a tie, the last player in turn order wins (i.e. Red beats Black beats White in a tie).

name: Poland Crushed
description:
Having spent the plunder gained from taking over Czechoslovakia a year earlier to further build up the Wehrmacht, Hitler decided it was time for the next step in his Lebensraum plan to reshape Europe. With his new round of threats and bluff failing, Hitler has decided that there is no other alternative than to send in the Panzers!

In Poland Crushed the players take on the role of the German or Polish High Command. Since Poland’s survival is unlikely against the combined might of the German and Russian war machines, they are in a race against time. The German victory is judged on their ability to overwhelm Polish resistance before the Soviets move in for their slice.

As well as the historical scenario and numerous variants, players are encouraged to experiment with what was probably Poland’s best
historical hope of survival - the Southern Stronghold scenario where the army tries to hold onto the region bordering its friend, Romania.

name: High Command: Europe
description:
On September 1st, 1939, the German forces launched the invasion of Poland, unleashing the most devastating conflict in human history. Six years after, the war had come to engulf dozens of nations all over the planet, becoming a true World War.

High Command: Europe is the first game in the High Command Series by Academy Games, a system that brings unique mechanisms into the Second World War setting and that will confront the players with the tough decisions that theatre commanders had to face during the conflict.

In HC: Europe one player leads the Axis forces, trying to make good their early head start and occupying the most vital areas in Europe before the Allied player is able to reverse the tide. Players will have to mobilize and strengthen their armies whilst gathering the resources that are the lifeline of their war effort.

The action-selection mechanism provides for a fast and tense experience, with multiple avenues to consider and no downtime between turns. Also, unlike most wargames, HC: Europe uses no dice, charts or counters.

The game comes with short scenarios so that players can acquire a good grasp of the system, but even the full campaign can be played in less than three hours.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Academy Games, Inc.

name: The Shadowstone Saga
description:
The Shadowstone Saga is a fantasy/sci-fi war-game. It is set on a dying world, orbiting a morose, purple sun - a sentient star watching life fade away. The Eternal Empire has banished the shadow of death and outlived most other life on this world; the price they have paid for eternity is their flesh. After an epoch of stagnation, the birth of the prophetess Mantra heralds a threat to this Eternal Order. Driven by her creativity the Young Realms are formed; born out of the clash of arms. They seek to restore humanity to its former creativity, even at the price of regaining their mortality.

The game can be played in two ways. The battle engine can be used for individual contests between two players, using armies selected with the games points system (for balanced battles). These battles are fought on a grid, using counters for pieces and are resolved using D6. The game uses a system of statistics which represent the abilities of each regiment.
In addition to these random battles, there is the opportunity to play the full Shadowstone Saga campaign, which is more like an RPG - only one where you run an empire, as opposed to a single character! This is played on a larger 'overview' map of your Empire, and will utilise the battle engine when armies clash.

The goal of the game is to overcome your opponent. In addition to straight out brawls, there are objective-based missions, headhunting missions, breakout missions, and even missions where the intention is to intentionally lose a battle without your opponent suspecting your motives (the campaign map creates all manner of intrigues!).

--------

"Having fulfilled their destiny, the Phoenix Knights were granted independence, and left to safeguard the empire in their own manner. Phoenix stones were built in their honour; huge monoliths that dominated the landscape like mountains, forever breathing clouds of bone-white smoke (which could be cloying to those who lived near them) to purify the air.
Decades came and went, then centuries, then a millennium, and then millennia. The other civilizations surrounding the Eternal Empire, rivals and allies, old friends and ancient grudges, slowly started to die out. And as for the wildlife of the world, that too started to dry up and die, and the world became more and more inhospitable, as the balance of life and death was grossly upset.
Although they were free from mortality, the bodies of the eternal folk were still subject to rot. At first no one really noticed, then the younger ones grew into wrinkled bodies quite soon, and then skin started to peel, everyone had a smaller appetite, flowers blossomed later in the year and perished earlier – but no one talked about it, for it was happening to everyone. After a huge span of time (beyond the count of calendars, for these eternal folk started to lose track of the passing of years) they had lost their flesh, leaving nothing but their skeletons and their sentience.
A child had not been birthed since the slaying of the last Shadow Knight an aeon ago, and not a single law had changed for an epoch, and so the order of the Eternal Empire persisted, still ruled by the benevolent High-King Druidainh. The art and culture of the Eternal empire had not progressed, and the lives of its people were a constant repetitious cycle, devoid of any excitement. The bards played the same old songs, which had long since fallen out of relevance, being endlessly repeated until every word became a cliché. The word humanity was losing its meaning, there was no nature to oppose itself too but for the long-living fungal blooms in their benign forests, the gnarled trees, and the older scaled-species who spent most of their time in dozing slumbers.
Obscure wars broke out between barbarians and the borderguards, but these were easily quelled, and so governance of the empire required less and less innovation until it was merely a matter of course. The peasants tilled farms of dust, the merchants bartered between themselves, as if they were playing a pointless game. The beast-tamers snoozed beside their wyverns, the spell-callers animated their artificial creations (the dragon-like Draemh) and rode their backs over still nights, lost in their own dull thoughts. The royal philosophers had found all of the answers to life and sat idle, the astronomers stared up at the same old stars, now convinced that they never moved but sat perfectly still like the monks in their mountain retreats..."
categories: Fantasy, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Tj√∂rn-Monopol
description:
This is a version of Monopoly, based entirely in the Swedish translation (using Stockholm streets) of the game that was patented in 1935 by Charles Darrow and released by Parker Brothers.
The gameplay is similar to Monopoly.

In Tjörn-Monopol the streets are instead places/harbours along the cost of the island of Tjörn, one of Sewdens largest islands and a summer holiday paradise. Instead of house upgrades the owner of a harbour upgrade the pier of the place to more and more luxurous versions. Instead of money the economy is handled using cases of fish of differen kinds. The board is designed in a marine manor and the cards texts are rewritten ti fit the theme, as pieces used for movement.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Quick Quest: Hero Pack 1
description:
A new hero joins the fight, bringing with him new challenges to face and treasures to win!

Quick Quest: Hero Pack 1 adds a Paladin to your roster of heroes.

Fight Fanatics, Seekers, and the dreaded Oathbreakers on your way to face the Cult Leader!

Swap out one of the four heroes using the color coded dots and shuffle the new cards in or use five heroes and continue the adventure to dungeon level 12!

This is an expansion for Quick Quest. It is not a stand alone product.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Cravache d'or
description:
Players can buy racehorses sold at auctions and also bet horses if the race begins.

Money is won by good bets or by owning the winning horses.

For racing each horse moving is determined by rolling two dice.

Players with the most money at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling

name: Dark Age: Genesis
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Genesis welcomes you to the world of Dark Age, where different armies and factions battle for survival against each other and the planet itself. Dark Age: Genesis is a scaleable skirmish level game based on the dark images of BROM designed for 2 or more players with approximately 10-20 models a side.

The rulebook contains 150 pages of pure excitement! Imagine the harsh environments of Samaria, learn about the rise of the Forsaken and read about the rich history of the Dragyri.You will get the core rules, two comprehensive Forcelists, unit cards, templates and extensive background information... Everything you need to startplaying Dark Age. Are you ready for something dangerous?
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Dispatches from the Bunker #34
description:
A magazine dedicated to Advanced Squad Leader. This issue has an article on churches, tournament review and preview, Tactical Tips and perspectives on five scenarios. Also included are five scenarios:

DB094 The Trail to Hell Again - This is a re-release of DB019, the scenario has been updated and covers action on Bougainville in 1943.

DB095 Spare the Pagoda - A British infantry company supported by Sherman tanks advances into Mandalay during the Burma Campaign of 1945. The Japanese infantry supported by infantry guns is determined to stop them.

DB096 Land Sharkey - Operation Goodwood had erupted the preceding day and the Ulster Rifles came under fire from a church in a village astride the Escarville - Troam Road. Can they clear the threat being raised to the British flank?

DB097 Hold the Brickworks - After repeated attempts we see the final push by elements of the 10th Panzer Division trying to wrest control of the Brickworks from the 8th Argyles. Will they succeed in the face of stiff British resistance?

DB098 Sandbanks of the Volga - As Operation Hubertus erupted one of the objectives in the Red Barricades Ordnance Factory was to clear the fuel farm on the banks of the Volga. Can it finally be taken from the determined Russian defenders?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Majo x Majo
description:
User summary

A Japanese 2-player combat card game. Each player chooses two of nine witches, that all have their unique combination of spells, and take turns drawing cards from a deck consisting of 6 types of mana. Players build up their mana pools by playing "towers" (stacks) of cards from their hands, and can then activate these towers to unleash the spells of one or both of their witches.
Damage is represented by drawing cards from the mana deck; if two identical cards are drawn the pair dies.

Translated box blurb
When the stars align in the sky,
the witches prepare
for a battle of life and death

name: D√©lir'phone
description:
You make phone call trying to place 3 secret words in this call! Your opponents must guess these?

In his turn, the active player draws "situation" card
eg "You are a surgeon and you tell your last patient that You forgot a wire coil in her belly" or "Your boss calls and You must explain why You did not go to work this morning".
The player reads it aloud.
Then he draws a "secret words" card with six words, each in one color. He throws three special chips that give him the 3 words to use in his turn.

Once the player knows of the situation and the 3 words, he starts the phonecall using his 3 "secret words". The goal is for him that his opponents don't guess this words. Phone call lasts 80 seconds.

For each word player scores a point if nobody guesses it. Opponents score a point for each word they guess.

Player who reaches to 25 points first is the winner

When a player reaches 25 "cat Points", the game ends and that player is declared "Grand Winner".
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Dark Age: Apocalypse ‚Äì Forcelists
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Saints battle for dominion over forsaken Samaria, and creatures both more and less than human vie for power! The Dark Age Force Lists Book is the only tome you’ll need to command any force on this ravaged world. 356-Full Color pages, complete with Stats, background and Art for every faction, this beautiful hardcover book is required reading for any would be warlord, and a great way to understand the grimly beautiful universe of Dark Age!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: VINDALOO: Four Battles from the 2nd Anglo-Maratha War
description:
VINDALOO - Four Battles from the 2nd Anglo-Maratha War is a game emphasizing easy, quick play that focuses on the unusual features of this area of history virtually untouched by the hobby but truly rich in gameplayer goodies.

VINDALOO simulates the battles of the 2nd Anglo-Maratha War in India (1802–1805), in which Major General, The Honorable Arthur Wellesley (later the Duke of Wellington) had field command in the Deccan (the center of the subcontinent) against the huge forces of the Marathas , the largest independent empire in India, under the Scindia rulers of Gwalior and the Bhonsle rulers of Nagpur and Berar, complete with the a massive artillery corps, plus the equally important battles in the northern, Hindustan where the troops of the East India Company were under the oft-unappreciated General Lake; all of which was part of the almost subconscious, ongoing efforts of the British, in the guise of their East India Company, to gobble up an entire continent and civilization.

Much of the game system will be familiar to any wargamer. There is no set number of turns, and this is not Igo-Hugo gaming. Variable activation of commands, based on leadership quality, is the baseline. The usual fire/move then shock mechanics are all there.

VINDALOO includes all four battles of the 2nd Anglo-Maratha War: Assaye and Argaum, in the Deccan, and Delhi and Laswaree in northern Hindustan. Wellington considered Assaye the toughest battle in which he ever fought. (And readers of Bernard Cornwell’s first three Sharpe books will find this familiar territory). Each of these battles is on it's own map, at 120 yards per hex, with combat units being half-battalions (well, two counters for a full battalion). The Marathas have lots of artillery. Good artillery, too… according to Wellesley “… the finest brass ordnance I have ever seen.”
Each battle has its own opening maneuvers, along with heavy barrages of cannon, followed by gritty hand-to-hand combat. There is plenty of opportunity for cavalry charges, especially if the Maratha player can activate his massive cavalry compoo (brigades). And all in very unusual settings with heretofore unseen terrain, such as the 8-10 foot high elephant grass that covered most of 2 of the battlefields.

As an added attraction, the game plays equally well solitaire.

Each copy of VINDALOO will contain:

4 game maps (two - 22"x34" and two 17" x 22")
Two full counter sheets
Rules Booklet Approximately 24 pages
Battles Booklet Approximately 20 pages
Two Charts and Tables cards
1 10-sided Dice

name: The Arab Israel Fleet
description:
The Arab Israel Fleet is a contemporary game of naval warfare taking place in Middle East, focusing on Persian Gulf and Iran.
Time Scale :
- 8 hours per turn
- 80 km per hex.

The players maneuver war ships, submarines, aircrafts, amphibious war ships and cargos on a map covering near East, Caspian Sea and Black sea.

The game reuse rules from Victory Games Fleet series, but includes new weapons as missiles, grond lauched ballistic missiles, SAM, cruise missiles
There are also new rules regarding submarines, Aegis ships, anti-missile defence systems, long range air-to-air missile,

The game can be linked with Arbistan Fleet.

More Information:

The game includes 10 scénario, from very simple to more complex ones:

1/ To the Small Sea ( Caspian Sea )
2/ Gaza Express
3/ Trade Raiders
4/ Asad at Bay
4.1/ asad at Bay Another
5/ High Road
6/ Go to Suez
7/ Second Try
8/ Israel Stand Alone
9/ Doing Holocaust

name: Shifty
description:
Shifty Homepage at the Designer's Site

Shifty is a square board connection game, where the goal is to create a chain of orthogonally and/or diagonally connected stones between two opposite edges of the board.

The unique feature of Shifty is that on your turn you must either place a stone orthogonally adjacent to at least one friendly stone or you must move any friendly stone, by a chess queen's move, to any empty intersection orthogonally adjacent to fewer friendly stones than the intersection it started on.

As a result you must often forego adding a stone to the board, and instead "shoot" a stone already on the board to a strategically key spot. This sharpshooting dynamic is the source of the game's strategic interest.

name: Fireball Forward!
description: Fireball Forward is an innovative rules set for re-creating company-scale engagements in WWII using tabletop miniatures from 15mm to 28mm scale. The game is easily learned, fast-playing, and above all it emphasizes story elements of the battle so that the narrative which emerges has a natural feel of a historical written account. Attention is focused on active units, and the full story of each activation is followed until a natural break point is reached, similar to the end of a paragraph in a historical memoir. The game turn has no fire phase, rally phase, etc., but instead, active units may fire, move, rout & rally in any order as needed to develop their plan. Non-active units play an important role at all times, looking for opportunities to derail the active plan. Fireball Forward is playable on a kitchen table in one evening, and it's designed to challenge players with realistic tactical choices, resulting in a satisfying game for everyone.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Who Took the Apple?
description:
Who Took the Apple? is a cardgame played backwards in time.

The goal of the game is to take an apple which is placed under a bucket. Players "pre program" their actions, like in Space Alert or Roborally, but cards are played backwards in time: First card played will be last action happening.

In the second phase of the game, all players go through their actions to resolve what actually happened. Some actions might be impossible to carry out which creates a paradox. These cards are ignored in order to restore space/time logic. Players have to maintain multiple possible game states in their head in order to successfully play.

name: Paperclip Railways: London on Board
description:
Promo station card for Paperclip Railways. The base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

This Promo card was given to players at the London on Board games club.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Dragon Dogfights!
description:
A Game of aerial Dragon Combat! Use your dragon to fight others in 3-D aerial action. Anywhere from two to ten players can engage.

The game takes place in the air surrounding a floating castle. Teams of 5 dragons each (chromatic on one side, metallic on the other) square off in battle to decide who takes possession of the floating Castle and the immense treasure within!

The basic game starts with each dragon's player rolling a d10 for initiative. Highest roll goes first, ties roll-off.

Movement then commences, allowing each dragon to move 18 inches, curving or turning at will. Facing is not taken into account.

After movement, each dragon may attack (either with breath weapons or by melee if in range) or defend.

Attacking with breath weapons have a 9 inch range, and automatically hits any target within range. The target takes the 1d8x10 hp, and may save for half damage (all of the dragon stats are listed on a stat sheet that was included). Breath weapons may be used three times per dragon per game.

For melee attacks, the dragon must be within base contact. The dragon rolls a d20, and hits on a six or better. damage is recorded against the targets hp.

If a dragon is out of range, it may Defend, allowing it to strike any dragon that comes into attack range, even on another dragon's turn (used to counterstrike when an enemy dragon moves into range).

Dragons are defeated when their HP are reduced to zero. The first team to destroy the other, wins.

Advanced rules allow for dragon individualization, age categories, distinct breath weapon types, better Thac0 or ht points, immunities, riders, etc.

name: Heroes of Feonora
description: Heroes of Feonora is an RPG Board Game designed for players of all ages. It begins in a bustling village alive with activities set in a colorful world of humor and mystery. The inhabitants of this world have unique backgrounds and personalities. Some of them might even be persuaded to join up with a player character, bringing valuable skills along with them. In order to succeed the group will need to work together as they make preparations for the perilous journey ahead. Earn Copper Pieces by taking on part-time work at the local bakery, helping townsfolk with their quirky troubles, fishing and more... Of course, those with a more daring personality will find there is plenty of coin to be made catching dastardly Criminals or seeking out fame and fortune in the Fighter's Fighting Guild. Recruit Companions, find a trusty Mount and gather supplies. But don't delay, for once the Town Timer runs out the group must set out at last ~ into dangerous wild lands of Feonora. How well did the group prepare? You'll soon find out as the party encounters hostile foes or interesting characters looking to barter and trade. Search for hidden treasure and get swept into unplanned Side Quests. Good teamwork is vital for those wishing to reach the ultimate, harrowing Final Encounter, which will require a different strategy altogether depending on the Story. Should the group survive the journey and complete the adventure (together as one) they will enter a special phase of the game that will reveal who among them was most worthy of honor and prestige.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Frontiers: Red Skulls Faction
description:
The Red Skulls Faction is a free to print expansion for Frontiers. It was going to be released as official, boxed expansion but the publishers decided against it. It has been posted as free to print on the designers website.

This expansion adds a entirely new faction, the communistic pirates, the Red Skulls. There are brand new units, cards, and artifacts. The new units include, Turrets, Infiltrators, Pirates, Assault squads and more!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Pirates, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Legends of the Ancient World: The Thing in the Lake
description:
Only in the harshest of times, do you take these meager jobs. But now here you are, preparing the dead man for burial before the moon rises. The forest is dark and miserable--regrettable that you are here. You recall your last days in town--the posting in the town square--which led you to the humble home of the carpenter. The pay didn't sell you; it was the pleading look in the old man's eyes. His only son had traveled into the Fenwood Forest to attend to the monastery therein. Few are accepted, and the honor is great. But that was over a month ago, and nothing has been heard since. In the mean time, rumors circulate of a beast run rampant, killing all those who venture into the depths of the forest. A twig snaps, throwing you back into the reality at hand. What lurks in the shadows? Is this only a deer, or Is it the beast?

This is a programmed paragraph-based adventure game with tactical combat. It is very similar to, and compatible with, Melee and Wizard of Metagaming's The Fantasy Trip. Legends of the Ancient World is the fantasy genre series of these games from Dark City Games. Emerald Twilight is a jungle themed adventure in the series. It is designed to play very well solo, but rules are provided to run it more like an RPG with one or more players cooperating to complete the adventure with another player administering the game as a referee.

Battles are fought with counters on a hex map that is included with the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Skirmish Elite: Tanga 1914
description:
From the back of the book:

Skirmish Elite Tanga is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered the fighting around Longido and Tanga in East Africa in 1914. The book includes eleven scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of two campaigns.

Maximum replayability: the Skirmish Elite system features a realistic variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generaic order of battle listing that can be translated into almost any skirmish rule system

Historical Research: this book includes an introduction section that contains background information, theater and battle maps, and souces.

58 pages.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Isla Pirata
description:
With skill and patience, the pirate ship can reach the most distant islands in search of treasure. Help it to find land!

Objective of the game: To take the little ball in the ship, without it falling, to the highest holes, which score the highest points.

How to play: First assemble the ship and the platform with holes. Place a ball inside the ship and move it up, down and to the sides by pulling on the red balls hanging from each end. There are points for the holes: 10, 30 and 50 points,
and this makes it more fun.

Other ways to play:
By using your imagination, you can create other
ways of playing:
- Compete to get the most points, remembering
the points for each hole - let's see who scores
the most.
- Compete for speed. Without the ball falling out
of the ship, see who can get highest, quickest!

name: Brent Crude
description:
‘Brent Crude’ is a two-to-five player game about the oil industry.

Players grow their businesses by purchasing oil fields, pipelines, storage tanks, refineries, and retail outlets. They produce crude oil at offshore platforms and pipe it onshore to sell or store. They ship stored oil to refineries, where it is converted into diesel, petrol, and liquid petroleum gas. Finally, they deliver those refined products by lorry to retail outlets, where they score victory points (with bonus points for previsously-established outlets of their own). Or they ship the refined products to Rotterdam to sell for money.

The value of each good varies according to the rules of supply and demand.

name: Republic City Pro-Benders
description:
Based on the sport as depicted in Nickelodeon's The Legend of Korra, this competitive game allows players to control three benders: water, earth, and fire on two opposing teams.

The game is played in three rounds, with five turns each round. Both sides will attempt to knock other benders out of the ring or to gain the opposing side's territory before the end of a round. However, the match can be won at any time when one side knocks all of the opposing benders out of the ring.

Each bender has its own specialty, ranging from hurling three clay disks simultaneously, blasting an explosive, fiery volley, or shooting a powerful water jet.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: De Wijnkenner
description:
From the box: "Everything you wanted to know about wine but never dared to ask." A route through the wine country full of traps and surprises. Through the challenges you will be faced with over a 1000 different questions about wine, easy, hard and unexpected. The trip will take you through history, France and the rest of the word. It will call upon your ingenuity, logic and general knowledge making it a fun game for all.

The game is a simple roll the dice and answer the question at its basis. There are three colors of questions: mauve (a bunch of grapes) concerning general questions about wine, pink (the letter H) covering a historical question and blue (globe) which is a geography related question. Every correct answer gets you a 'Bravo' card of the relevant color, three of which in turn allow you to enter one of the guilds: Guild of Knights and Epicurians, Commanders of Diogenes and Rabelais and lastly the Globe-Trotter wine tasters. Unless you are a member of all three guilds you cannot win the game, apart from the question boxes there are a few others such as: champagne cork - which acts like a snake and ladders box, Jokers - which allow you to be awarded a right answer even if you don't know it and a few others with specific instructions.

The game is also available in English, German and French apart from the Dutch version. It won a prize in 1992 at the Brussels Eureka meet. Outsiders rate this game as very hard and requiring expert wine knowledge. It is in this sense a totally different game than Connaisseur whose name it resembles.

name: Big Bag of Schwag
description:
Big Bag of Schwag is a set collecting game for 2 to 5 players. Players must try to complete their stash first while trying to thwart their opponents.

Using the familiar “draw one, play one” mechanic, players can work on building their stash as they play Weed card. Or go on the offense and use Action cards to thwart your opponent. Compete to get a full stash of 5 one strain, or collect one of each variety of the 6 strains.

Hassle each other with action cards like “Spider Mites” or try to benefit yourself with one of the Stoner cards. Play Events to change the rules of the game, at least for a while.

In the end the one with the big bag of schwag is the winner!

WARNING: This game features adult themes and has a variant that should only be used after consulting your local use laws.
publishers: IcePack Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Ristorante
description:
Ristorante is a game for 2-4 players where each player is a chef in the kitchen of a great restaurant. Each turn they will serve the customers that arrive in the restaurant, perfect their technique or prepare gourmet menus for the important culinary competitions. However, all of this requires dedication and effort and in order to try and out-cook the other chefs they will have to go to the limit of their physical and mental capabilities.
At the end of the game, the player with the better record will become the acclaimed chef of the Ristorante.

The game is played throughout 5 turns. In each turn players will take actions (prepare the orders or prepare gourmet menus) until all players have passed and a new turn begins. In the even turns, there will be a culinary competition where players will present their best work in order to get points.

name: 1940: Objetivo europa
description: A wargame covering the second world war in Europe. The level is strategic. The goal is to win with the axies or the allies in three different ways: military (destroy all enemy units), technical (control of reinforcement hex) or politic (at the end of 1945 the side who control more cities). There are different scenarios and four levels of complexity. The mechanic is I go you go, first, the axis moves his air units, then the naval units and finally the ground units, after this the allies do the actions. There are rules for weather and politics (very simple). The counters have firepower (attack and defense) and movement numbers,the map has hex for movement.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement

name: Freimaurerei
description:
A two-player game of conspiracy among Masonic lodges in Enlightenment Germany. The Illuminati and the Rosicrucians are trying to extend their control over two principalities. Each player controls a Secret Master in one of the two countries, and they compete to see who can most effectively align the local initiates and their prince with the secret faction they support. (Freimaurerei is German for "Freemasonry." Pronounce it "FRY-mau-reh-rye")

The game requires nine stashes of Components: Looney Pyramid Games, a deck of playing cards, dice, and an opaque bag. The Secret Master is a large opaque pyramid (black for Illuminati or white for Rosicrucian), who may be accurately representing his allegiance, or may have the opposite alignment concealed within. Blue pyramids represent Freemasons, who are further initiated into higher degrees by having smaller pyramids stacked on top of them. Small black and white pyramids are nested inside high-degree Masons to show their allegiance to the Rosicrucians or the Illuminati. Yellow and/or orange pyramids are used as money.

During the course of play, number cards are placed on the table to represent Masonic lodges, while face cards represent the rulers of the countries. Black suits are Illuminati-allied, and red ones belong to the Rosicrucians. Intrigue actions may change the alignment of rulers, make Mason pieces defect, inspire rulers to suppress lodges, etc.

A certain level of development is needed in order to call a stop to the game. At that point, true alignments are revealed and victory points are totaled. The apparent winner may actually be defeated. Bluffing and subterfuge are key to this game.

name: The Prince's Quest
description:
A fairy-tale journey for up to six Princes. It is a familiar Game of Goose type game, where you make your way along the track, obeying special square instructions should you land on one. It does have some innovations. Princes all start on different tracks at first for instance. And it has special rules for negotiating certain paths and, unusually, a river.

The large lithographed board is very nicely illustrated. Sadly, no publisher wanted to identify himself with the game, nor is an artist credited.

The actual rules:

THE NEW GAME
PRINCE’S QUEST
(PROTECTED).
This Game depicts 6 Princes in search of a Princess.
The various experiences of the Princes on their journeys embody the chief events culled from all the best known Fairy Tales.
INSTRUCTIONS.
1.—Any number up to the number of Princes can play. The choice of Roads to be determined by lots.
2.—Players start at the Milestone and proceed, in turn, along their respective roads, according to the throw of the dice.
3.— When a player falls on a division coloured a little heavier than the road, this is either an advantage or penalty, and directions will be found near the illustration bearing the number of the division.
4.— When the end of a Road is reached, the player goes on to the next as indicated on the board.
5.— The Road of Fortune must only be taken when the Fairy Godmother is met with, and must be again left if the division a piece falls on indicates it. The River of Darkness must be left as soon as a Landing Place is touched.
6— If a piece falls on a division already occupied, the pieces change places.
7.— The player who reaches No. 200 first is the winner of the game.

British Manufacture.

name: Brique
description:
IntroductionBrique is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the squares of a checkered board, which is initially empty. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.



DefinitionsThe escorts of a light square are the square immediately in front of it and the square immediately to the left of it.

The escorts of a dark square are the square immediately behind it and the square immediately to the right of it.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On his turn, a player must place one stone of his color on an empty point.

After a placement, if the two escorts of one or more squares are occupied by friendly stones and said squares aren't occupied by friendly stones yet, the player must place a stone of his color on each one of them, removing, where appropriate, any enemy stones already placed there. Note that some squares on the edge of the board have only one escort or no escorts at all. These squares are not affected by this rule.

The game is won by the player who completes a chain of orthogonally adjacent stones of his color touching the two opposite board edges of his color. Draws are not possible.



Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means that White will have the option, on his first turn only, to change sides instead of making a regular move.



NotesTwo like-colored, diagonally adjacent stones parallel to the NE-SW diagonal are always connected through a common neighbor in Brique, so, as in Hex, each square has actually six neighbours, and the board behaves like a rhombus, with one diagonal twice as shorter as the other. Needless to say, however, Brique is not isomorphic to Hex.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: MechaWar
description:
MechaWar is the first title from the One Pound Wargames imprint of Precinct Omega Publishing. The game gives complete rules for building your forces of mighty mech walkers and pitting them in intense tactical combat against your opponent.


Use simple resource allocation to build and customize your force of mechs in minutes.
Play on any flat surface with a few pieces of terrain and any collection of mecha miniatures.
Skirmish-style action with alternating activation, each mech operating independently.
Intuitive combat uses dice to generate both range and accuracy for shooting as well as to resist and repair damage.
Manage your actions to pursue your objective or react dynamically to your opponent's manoeuvres.
Works for scales from 6mm to 15mm.
Includes advanced rules to customize your mechs as engineer, minelayer, commander or assault mechs.
Includes three starting scenarios.


This game eventually evolved into "Horizon Wars" published by Osprey
https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/193700/horizon-wars-scie...

name: Statis Pro Football AFC/NFC Player Cards
description:
An expansion set of player cards only, published separately from the base game each year. Gamers who already owned the base game (which included a full set of cards for a year) could buy the new cards for the previous season, and play the teams without having to buy a base game again.

The package held a set of large perforated sheets for all the actual NFL teams and players, using revised statistical information based on the season passed (so the 1992 published set had the 1991 year stats). Some of the index cards included new rules or clarifications.

The packaging made it very clear that you needed the base game, so if you didn't know what it was about "it behooves you to gently place this package back on the shelf and purchase the complete game".

name: Pointless Wacky Untested Game I Made Up One Afternoon
description:
INTRODUCTION:
Want to play a game that is literally untested, unproven, and that was made up one afternoon for a game contest? You've come to the right place then!

This is a game that makes absolutely no sense, but you may end up having fun anyway, just for spite.

So, roll up your sleeves and let's get started!

DESCRIPTION:
This game is primarily a party or icebreaker game where people take turns to try to complete challenges.

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Be the player with the lowest score at the end of the game

GAMEPLAY:
Players each receive tokens (of 4 varying colors), and then each player takes turns completing challenge cards. If a player is successful, they will generally reduce the number of tokens that they have (which are worth points). If a player fails a challenge, they will gain tokens. Each player is trying to gain the lowest score possible. Challenges are each very unique, and can be physical, logical, luck, or knowledge-based.

GAME ELEMENTS:

Light-hearted gameplay
Players can learn more about fellow players in a fun way
Token point system keeps everyone involved
categories: Card Game, Dice, Humor, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Touhou Shisouroku: Special Expansion Arc (EXTRA)
description:
The third installment of the Touhou Shisouroku, a re-theme of the popular Dominion card game.

This expansion features 16 new kingdom cards taken from Intrigue, Hinterlands, Prosperity and a few from other expansions.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Das Buch & das Leben
description:
A communicative card game in which quotations from the bible have to be put in relation to other texts. The idea behind the game is to show that the bible is still relevant today, to personal life as well as to society and politics.

The game consists of two different sets of cards. One contains quotations from the bible, the other descriptions and aspects of modern life in the form of short texts, messages, promotional slogans etc.

The players have to connect the quotations from the bible on the cards in their hands with the cards from the second set. This doesn't necessarily have to be a literal connection, it involves interpretation and translation into different contexts.
Each player has a hand of five cards with a quotation from the bible, of which he/she has to choose one to go with the current card from the second set of cards. Each player then has one minute to explain why they have chosen a particular quotation, with the aim of "selling" their choice to the other players. The players then vote on the "best" (i.e. most fitting) quotation. Each round, a different player is the "buyer". He/she uses a set of blue chips numbered 1-5 to secretly vote which quotation they consider best, second best etc. The other players use white chips (also numbered 1-5) to guess the buyer's preferences. Players get points for choosing good (i.e. rated highly by the buyer) quotations as well as for guessing the buyer's preferences.
The game ends either after a certain number of rounds, or after a player has reached a certain number of points. The player with the most points wins.

name: Shinobi
description:
Shinobi is a game for 2-4 player, players take turns being Ninja to submerge mazes of other players who need to find out hidden treasures.

Player can set their very own maze with walls, traps and treasures on the map, to keep other player not easily to find the treasures. And into mazes with other players' Ninja at the same time. By moving their own Ninja step by step to find the walls, traps and treasures, fight with other Ninja and samurai guardian.

Players use their own Ninja search other players maze which hide by the maze keeper. Players give the position they move to the keeper, the keeper give players their Ninjas' search result.

The goal of the game is find all the treasures, The fast one find all the treasures is the winner.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Steel Police
description:
Form a gang and fight for dominance over the city. Seize the most valuable districts, search the ruins to gather the precious gambles, make use of your units' special abilities, which are straight from Neuroshima RPG.

Neuroshima Tactics is a miniature wargame in which the players - using 28mm figures - clash among the ruins of the Goddam United States. Each player commands a force comprising of 5 to 12 models in an attempt to achieve certain goals in the allotted amount of time. The game is set in the world of Neuroshima.

Steel Police is elite military formation, descendants of Nave SEALS. Well-geared and protected by exo-armours they are merciless when it comes to enforce the law.This set contains 5 miniatures: 3 Steel Policemen, Col. Callahan and Wardog - a hero.

name: Siege Penguins
description:
In the distant future, Penguins dominate the earth in the east and west, fighting for the supremacy of the earth.

Play is a game for two players divided into attacker and defender.

Players are divided into military forces and King penguins Emperor penguins.

Against the attacking card, do the defense.
A successful attack, you'll earn points according to the card walls.
Defense side, you can return fire so as not to give point to the attacker.

Place the card in the middle of the field three walls.

Player, published from a select My first card of each other. It can be used as a card during a round reinforcements.
One of the card walls, place the card.
The attacking side, select the attack walls. And to publish the card.
Defense side, then defense to expose any of my card was placed.
Remove the card Once the defense to attack. However, if you can not defense, removing the only card the defender.
Once the attacker's card remains, walls have been breached.
The attacker, walls to expose the card when you win, you earn points on the back of the card.

When you are finished, play the next round.

Victory or defeat is as follows.
‚óèIf you won a ten point ahead of the chip within three rounds, is the victory of the attacking side.
‚óèIf the round is over 3, less than 10 point is a victory for the defender.
‚óèDuring a round, three walls when you are exposed by the attack, the attacker's victory.
‚óèIf, during the round, three walls has not been published even one is a victory for the defender.

name: Montezuma's Lost Treasure
description:
In this daring game of adventure, you race through the twisting maze of Montezuma's Treasury collecting artifacts as you attempt to reach the Treasure room.

But beware, each tile you or an opponent lay can twist your path and lead you away from the Treasure. Each tile may reward you with an artifact, but chances are they are laced with deadly hazards that your opponents can trigger through drafting an Event card; crushing walls, pits, spikes, trap doors, shooting arrows, rotating rooms, and a boulder that rolls across the board.

Using your action points, pick up items in your adventure to help navigate past these hazards. Scramble through secret passageways, fight off dangerous creatures, activate secret doors and find your way through pitch black rooms. That map you found might be of help, but chances are the path behind you will cave in.

Even if you can't make it to the Treasure room you might have enough to win if you were able to collect enough Items with treasure points or Artifacts that are scattered throughout the Treasury.

For every hidden door you open, boulder that rolls through the maze, crushing walls that close, spikes that rise, trap door that opens you are impacting another area of the map as you move those tokens to a new area of the map. This might buy you enough time to find an exit with your arms full of riches. First one out watches the Treasury collapse from the inside out, chasing out or trapping everyone else inside!

Balance the Item cards you'll need to get out with the treasure you need to win, because the player that makes it out alive with the most treasure points in their hand wins!



Each players turn consists of 3 steps:
(1) Draft one Event card.
Event cards include triggering specific hazards on tiles (i.e. Arrows, Spikes, Rotating a room, Secret passageways)
and attacking other players through Thieves, Spiders and Rats event cards.(2) Perform 2 of the following actions
Move, Move, Take Item (cards), Play Item card, Rest (raise health by 1), take Treasure cards when in the treasure room

(3) Place new map tiles adjacent to the tiles your token is on.

Game Components


1 Board
12 Artifact Cards
20 Event Cards (12 unique)
38 Treasure Cards
51 Item Cards (10 unique)
1 Die to resolve conflict
4 Player Adventure Markers
4 Player Health Markers
1 Bag
Rules



90 Map Tiles
1 Treasure Room tile
3 Raised Spikes Tokens
4 Door Tokens
2 Open Trap Door Tokens
1 Boulder Token
1 Crushing Wall Token

name: Up to date
description: A quiz game about learning and general education for the whole family. Player draws a card in his turn, everyone else can guess. If someone believes he knows the term suggests he may answer. If answer is correct, he move his game-piece forward on the game board, if not, he movew it back a field. Who reaches first to finish is the winner.

name: George Blanda's Monday Nite Touchdown
description:
from inside box lid:
"George Blanda's Monday Nite Touchdown is a fun game for ages seven through adult. It is also educational as it will help those who are learning to add, subtract, multiply and those who are trying to learn the fundamentals of football. It is played like real football with actual rules and techniques applied."

There are twelve dice total, six each of two colors. Each player has five dice of one color and one of the opposite color, which is his "captain". The board is a cardboard stylized football field with plastic sliders moving back and forth in slots to track the ball position on the field, the first down position, and the current down. Real time is used as the game clock.

In general, the game follows the play of a regular NFL match, with kickoffs (including touchbacks), rushing, passing, touchdowns, PATs, field goals, and punts. Players switch ends of the “field” at the half. Fumbles, interceptions, and even safeties are also provided for. Play consists of both players rolling their dice and comparing the results, with the higher total prevailing.

If a player mis-adds his dice, a 15-yard penalty is assessed.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Time Track

name: The Donner Party: the Card Game
description:
Disclaimer: This game in no way trivializes the tragedy that befell the Donner Party expedition in 1846-1847 but rather is an attempt to recreate the challenges it faced to better appreciate the difficult choices that were made.

In May of 1846 a wagon train left Missouri bound for California, lured by dreams of a new life of wealth and prosperity. The pioneers chose George Donner as their leader, and in an effort to shave 350 miles off the trip they took an alternate route through Utah known as Hastings Cutoff. This turned out to be a mistake, and subsequently the wagon train became trapped by early winter snow blocking the Frémont Pass in the Sierra Nevada Mountains. The pioneers made camp to wait out the winter at Truckee Lake and Alder Creek. Starvation, illness and even cannibalism took their toll, and out of the 87 original members of the Donner Party only 48 made it out alive.

Players each control a family of pioneers with the goal of reaching California. The game starts in November of 1846 with food supplies dwindling and more winter storms on the horizon. Each player receives a cabin and six pioneer dice that represent your pioneers' conditions: Healthy, Lean, Starving, Sick (Dying) or Dead. Each round starts with an event after which players take turns placing their pioneers on action spaces until the Starvation Phase when they need to feed their families with food tokens and heat their cabins with wood tokens.

Player interaction is maximized by the Beg action which takes food or wood from another player and the Desperation action which is how to draw and play Desperation cards that are either beneficial for the player or punish opponents. Some card effects and actions to gain food earn player cannibalism tokens, which penalize a player's score at the end of the game. Periodically during the game a Rescue event occurs and players must choose whether to gamble some of their pioneers on a risky rescue attempt over Frémont Pass or wait until the thirteenth turn of the game when all pioneers left in their cabins are automatically scored.

The object of the game is to deliver as many of your six pioneers as you can to Sutter's Fort alive and minimize your cannibalism token penalty.

"The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few or one." -Spock, The Wrath of Kahn.

"It's fun to get together and have something good to eat at least once a day." -Julia Child

name: Molecularama
description:
Molecularama is a pattern-matching, set-collecting chemistry-themed card game similar to Gin Rummy and Ticket to Ride. Collect and swap element cards to build up molecules and score points.

The game comes with 24 different molecules and 75 element cards. Each player is trying to collect the correct elements to build them. Build six molecules to win the game but beware of attempting to build too many molecules, any unfinished molecules by the end of the game will penalise your score!

There are two modes of play to choose from; play with a secret selection of molecules in your hand where everyone is trying to guess what you're building, or play with a selection of molecule cards open on the table where two people could be racing to build the same thing.

Each molecule card comes with a witty joke or and interesting tid-bit. Remember, if you're not part of the solution, you're part of the precipitate.

name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Field Manual: Core Rulebook Companion
description:
The new Heavy Gear Blitz Field Manual - Core Rulebook Companion is a rules supplement that adds a new and exciting style of game play to Heavy Gear Blitz! This book takes the field test rules featured in the first 3 issues of the Gear UP eZine and revises the Locked & Loaded rulebook sections with new rules flow charts for ease of use and new datacards for the Heavy Gear Blitz! miniatures.

- New Heavy Gear Blitz! rules section layout with flowcharts for quicker game play.
- Scenario generator with army priority levels, terrain, deployment, objectives, and support options.
- New army combat group options, Blitz options, and Field manual TV adjustments for earlier releases.
- New Gear options: Wildcat, Copperhead, Gladiator, and Boa.
- Model perks & flaws, weapon traits & tables, plus a weapon recognition chart.
- Updated datacards from HGB!: Locked & Loaded, Return to Cat's Eye, Shattered Peace, Terra Nova Gambit, Operation Drop bears: Dive!, and Gear UP issues 1 - 4.

Reduced size versions of this new primary 'core' rule booklet come packaged with certain larger miniatures boxed sets.

name: ASL Comp: Orders For The Major ‚Äì The Battle Of Normandy 1944
description:
A game in the ASLComp series by Critical Hit.

Subject: the Allied Operation Epsom (aka First Battle of the Odon), Normandy, France 1944. Centered around battles near the town of Gavrus.

This is a remake of Scotland the Brave I. As such it contains the same original 9 scenarios, and 1 campaign game, with some minor alterations. The game features new map and counter art.

This game allows you to recreate firefights between British and German troops in Normandy 1944, on a tactical scale: individual vehicles, artillery pieces, support weapons, squads and leaders.
The terrain lends itself for a mixture of close quarter battles around villages and bridges, coupled with long range tank duels, due to the relatively flat, open area with little or no hedges (bocage).

Because of the designer's research and availability of detailed sources on the depicted actions, the scenarios have a highly historically informative value, backed by information and pictures of some of the landmarks in the designer's notes booklet.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Reinforcements: A Supplement for Operation Squad World War II
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Reinforcements is the latest supplement for the Operation Squad WWII game. This supplement contains details on new support sections and their weapons as well as many new squads to use in the 5 exciting scenarios which have been especially designed to let you play the game on bigger tables.

From Russian Penal Squads (Shtrafniye Roti) to the infamous Hitlerjugend Volunteers (defenders of Berlin), from American Recon squads (in jeeps) to British Scout squads (and their Universal Carriers)... your games will never be the same again. The Reinforcements supplement is the same price (£18) as the other two Operation Squad books (Operation Squad and Vehicles!) and includes: -
New rules for Mortar and Machine Gun Sections
5 new scenarios – designed for playing on larger tables
New Characteristics
Card Weapon references
New vehicles - including the Churchill & Kettenkrad!
17 New Units:
American Army Recon squad
'All American' Paratrooper squad
US Glider Riders squad
British Army scout patrol
New Zealand 2nd Division rifle section
Scottish rifle section
Royal Marine Commando section
Russian Penal troops squad
Russian Sniper squad
Russian 'Black Death' Naval Brigade squad
Russian Scout squad
German Schnell squad
German Volksgrenadier squad
Hitlerjugend Volunteers squad
Waffen-SS squad
Das Reich squad
German Jager squad
You will need to have Operation Squad WWII and a copy of Vehicles! to use this 50 page, full-colour, softback supplement
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Volk ans Gewehr
description:
Objective: Eliminate or block all opponent meeples
- acting/moving by turns -
First each player is positioning troops (20) and obstacles (trees (17),houses & rivers (15)) upon own side; obstacles block movement.

Movement (transversal/horizontal/vertical) one step like Halma, but own and opposing meeples can be skipped; skipped enemies are removed.

Published during WW II

name: Wooden Wars
description:
Summarized from the Kickstarter announcement:

Wooden Wars is a visual and visceral action battle game, where tactics, good hand-eye coordination and a bit of luck are key! Players command armies of sturdy wooden soldiers against each other using the floor as the battlefield.

Victory is achieved by knocking over all the opposing sides’ forces by firing upon them, with melee action, or by capturing a key objective like the enemy’s flag or a star fort made of blocks.

The rules of engagement are simple. Players can either move units a fixed distance, or fire. Firing consists of tossing small rubber balls at the opponent's forces to knock them over. There is no looking up rules or arguing whether or not someone has been hit or not--the visuals tell it all!

With strategy, tactics, and rubber balls bouncing around with the accuracy of black-powder musket fire, Wooden Wars is bringing war back to the floor!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Miniatures, Napoleonic

name: Frozen Death
description: Frozen Death is Numbskull Games' representation of the Winter War which depicts the Finnish struggle against Soviet expansionism in 1939. A block styled, card driven, dice combat system war game that adds fog-of-war elements to the already brutal climatic elements of the hell on earth that was the Winter War. Finnish resolve was exemplified by the term "sisu" roughly translated as "guts" and the "motti" (chopping wood to kindling) tactics of their elite ski battalions "sissi". Altogether this was a very embarrassing episode for the Soviets from which they only were able to negotiate a victory of sorts because of their over overwhelming preponderance in men and especially equipment.

name: Khalkhin Gol
description: A hex and block style wargame, Khalkin Gol is a little known border incident that escalated to a major battle in Manchuria. Soviet and Japanese tactical doctrine comes to a head at Khalkin Gol in the summer of 1939. This pivotal battle was the earliest example of the blitzkrieg tactics so popularized by the Germans in WW2. Since the Japanese had decisively beat the Russians in the 1902 - 1905 war, they thought it would be easy once again. But, Japanese doctrine was just to stiff and too old fashioned to deal with the realities of modern land warfare in Asia. This battle is recreated in full at the battalion level with a minimalistic rule system. Wooden blocks for land and air units provide a realistic fog of war as only the controlling player can see if their units are armor or infantry, weak or strong, until combat is engaged.

name: Funstir
description:
Funstir, an expansion for Frigiti, plays much like the base game: In a round, the active player rolls all ten dice – seven of which have consonants on all sides, and three of which have only vowels – then creates a word by using at least three dice. (This word cannot be real, and if anyone claims it is, reroll the dice and try again.)

What Funstir adds to the game are marketing slogans, and players are now trying to create brand names to match those slogans, along with an explanatory phrase. Once players read off their phrases, everyone will then each distribute three tokens to the answers they thought best, with one of those tokens going to the player's own answer. (This self-congratulatory vote aids in the scorekeeping process.)

After each person has been the active player once, the game ends and the player with the most tokens wins.
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Scrapyard Warriors
description:
A Family Card Game for Creative Minds

Compete or use teamwork to construct incredible machines and contraptions out of loads of scrap! Five game modes offer unique challenges – Easy, Standard, Crazy, Co-Op, and Sandbox.

Scrapyard Warriors is centered around the Scrap Cards. These are what you use to build your amazing machines and contraptions. Each Scrap Card has color and corresponding point value, located in the lower-right corner of the card: Red = 1 Point, Light Blue = 2 Points, Yellow = 3 Points, Green = 4 Points, Blue = 5 Points, Purple = 6 Points, and Orange = 1-6 Bonus Points.

Bonus Cards cannot be used to construct your machines. They simply add extra points, ranging from 1 to 6. They have a green plus sign in the lower-right corner.

name: Anima Tactics: Lynn Steiner
description:
Publisehr Blurb:

Lynn Steiner is the second daughter of the Steiner house, one of the two main Black Sun families. Raised in privilege to be a leader, pride prevents her from leaving her business to agents and prefers to act directly accompanied by her servants. She is in almost superhuman physical condition, and has access to the largest collection of supernatural artifacts in existence on Gaia.

Artifacts: Lynn can take up to two Advantage cards, whose combined cost is 25 levels or less, without having to pay for these levels.

Natural Born Leader: During the Recovery Phase, you may remove an Action Point from a friendly unit in Lynn's Control Zone and give one Action Point to another friendly unit with whom Lynn has Line of Sight. This ability cannot be used on Undead units.
House Steiner: Whenever Lynn receives damage, all friendly units in her Control Zone gain Haste Lv. 1. Limit: Once per turn. This ability cannot be used on Undead units.
X-Calibur (Ki, Attack) - +4 Attack
Arrow of Destiny (Ki, Charge) - +2 Attack. This Charge allows Lynn to move up to 16 inches, and ignores the target unit's armor.
Mirror Image (Ki, Effect) Lynn uses her second Defence value. Whenever an attack targeting Lynn misses, she can reactively perform an Attack or Charge with no cost against the attacker, even if she had already moved this turn. While this ability is active, Lynn cannot Dodge.
Exaltation (Magic, Effect) Remove a negative status marker from a friendly unit in Lynn's Control Zone to put a positive status marker of your choice on Lynn. Limit: Once per turn.

name: Psyco Gundam
description:
Tactical level wargame based on the anime series Mobile Suit Z Gundam. The game focuses on squad tactics of mobile suits in combat, rather than one-on-one battles. This game is an updated version of Gundam 0080 Cyclops Attack, with updated rules and units from UC 0087 (the Gryps War period).

Players control eighteen-meter armored humanoid-shaped robots called mobile suits.
Each counter represents an individual mobile suit. Data cards explain different units and their corresponding abilities.

Each turn, players secretly select the tactics they will employ per platoon, and then units alternately activate by platoon. Most tactics deal with movement or combat. The winner of the battle is determined by destruction of opposing mobile suits.

The game include some scenarios from Zeta Gundam, but the main draw is a campaign game, with the players having the ability to build and customize units sent into combat. In the campaign game, players also manage their pilots in addition to the mobile suits. The pilots’ abilities can grow through combat experience. Points scored in battle allow for replacement of older and weaker mobile suits by newer models.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Do You Know Your Neighbors?
description:
In Do You Know Your Neighbors?, between 5 and 12 people play the role of a Kind, Wicked or Fickle neighbor.

The object of the game is to resolve enough Situation Cards so that your team's score pile has a total of 15 points. The catch, however, is that you do not know who is part of your team as all identities are hidden. Each resident has a vested interest in the town resolving situations their way. There is strength in numbers, so players must also attempt to discover who among them is working for or against their efforts.

During each round of play, players may question another player with Clue Cards, giving them insight into that neighbor’s identity. Then, splitting into 2 task forces, players encounter Situation Cards with various point values. Kind or Wicked Deed Action Cards are played, like a vote, to resolve a given situation. How everyone responds to these situations is up to them—and it's done in secret!

With enough careful sleuthing, you can figure out who are friends and who are foes. Identifying a player's identity from their Neighbor Card prevents them from identifying others and gives you a bonus. So identify them before they identify you!

name: The Thanksgiving Game
description:
This is a party game designed to be enjoyed by a family during Thanksgiving dinner.

Each player is provided with "Thanksgiving Cards" and writes down what he or she is thankful for this year. Examples include a promotion at the office, a new house, or the USA! A moderator chosen from among the contestants reads each response and the other players attempt to guess who filled out that card. The player with the highest number of correct guesses is declared the winner.

Includes cards, score pads, answer sheet covers, rules, and a storage insert.

name: Pickle
description:
Pickle is an elimination style card game for 2-18 players. A game consists of repeating "hands". A hand consists of "tricks" which may range from a single card up to four card sets from each player. The object is not to end with the highest card. Players are eliminated when they acquire 36 points or if they run out of chips.

The custom The Pickle deck features 16 characters that help players learn the game by hinting at the strength of the card as well as unique play options.

name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers Battling Wager Game
description:
Power Rangers, the evil Rita Repulsa and Lord Zedd have sent out the Evil Space Aliens and Putty Patrol Warriors to destroy Angel Grove. It’s up to Power Rangers to put a stop to Rita and Zedd’s diabolical plan and save Angel Grove before it’s too late.

Players choose their favorite Power Ranger and use their battle die to knock down Evil Villain character pieces by tossing their Battle Die down a Battle Ramp. Players battle each other by placing wagers on how many Evil Villains their Power Ranger will knock down on their turn.

Lighting Bolt Tokens are used by players to place wagers on their Power Ranger. The Tokens are each worth different value amounts to estimate the number of knocked down Evil Villains the player's Power Ranger Battle Die will knock down on their turn.

Battles consist of two players battling on a player's turn. Each will wager using their Lighting Bolt Tokens. The winner of the battle will note how many Evil Villains were knocked down. As an added bonus for when players are going, each round they may place their Power Ranger character piece on the Battle Tray in one of the marked spots. If they are successful in knocking it down on their turn, they'll receive an added bonus if they win the wager.

Game play continues until each of the players have gone, then a round has been done. Players play three rounds. After three rounds players tally up their scores. The player with the highest score is the winner!

name: Mapello
description:
INTRODUCTION

Mapello is a Reversi derivative that includes some special pieces that add new features to the game. These pieces are placed on the board to create a particular board configuration before the main game starts: this is called the setup phase.
A given board configuration may be played repeatedly, with players taking turns to play as black and as white. Since each board configuration will have its own nuances, repeated play enables players to experiment with strategies best suited to each setup.
Alternatively, Mapello can be played in free-play mode. In free-play mode, players take it in turns to setup the board. In order to encourage balance in the setup, the player not setting up the board has the option to play as black or as white (hence to move first or second).

The extra pieces are as follows:
- Walls: They act like the walls of the board border, but placed inside the board. They are immovable obstacles that cannot be played on.
- Bonuses: They reward the player with extra points when captured.
- Jokers (addition by Néstor Romeral Andrés): They are placed on the border and act as pieces of the colour of the player in turn.

By combining these pieces, players can create millions of different boards.

COMPONENTS

- Game board of 10x10 squares. The inner 8x8 board is used for playing, while the border is only used to place the jokers during the setup phase.
- 64 Reversi discs (black/white).
- 8 walls (gray squares).
- 8 bonuses (blue discs).
- 8 jokers (red squares).

SETUP PHASE

Optionally, the players may agree some constraints on the number of each type of piece to be placed during the setup phase. Then, subject to these constraints the setup player places their chosen number of pieces. Walls and power-ups can be placed anywhere on the inner 8x8 area (except on the four centre squares), and jokers can be placed anywhere on the outer 10x10 border. The game commences with an initial 2x2 configuration of black and white pieces in the following diagonal pattern:
PLAYING PHASE

Two players (black and white) alternate turns placing a piece with their colour facing up onto an empty cell of the inner 8x8 board. Black always plays first. Each piece must be placed adjacent to an opponent's piece (either horizontally, vertically or diagonally). Then, all the opponent's pieces that are trapped in a contiguous straight line (either diagonal, vertical, or horizontal) between the newly placed piece and an existing piece of that colour, or a joker, are flipped over to the player's colour. A legal move must case at least one opponent piece to be flipped. If a player cannot make a legal move then they pass.

If a player places a piece on top of a blue bonus disc, they take the disc (this will score 3 points at the end of the game).

The game ends when neither player can make a legal move. Players count the pieces of their colour facing up and add the points of the blue discs. Highest score wins. Over a series of games the first aim is to win the most games. In the event of a tie in the number of games won, the point difference over the set of games decides the winner.

Re-implements:
Othello

name: Plaque Attackers
description:
