When brushing isn’t enough the Plaque Attackers come to the rescue to save your teeth from decay. But this time they really have their work cut out for them as the four plaque leaders are rushing forward for a tasty meal of tooth!

Out last the Plaque Lords attack until they give up and leave for an easier meal.

Plaque Attackers is a dice rolling game where you and your allies work together to stay alive until the survival meter runs out.

name: Ka-pow! The Superhero Team-up Game
description:
Welcome True Believers! Ka-pow is an action-packed card game of super-heroic mayhem. Create a heroic identity, form a superhero team and then battle the worlds super-villains and save the earth.

Each player takes on the role of a superhero, fighting for truth and justice as part of a superhero team made up of the other player’s superheroes. Your team must foil the diabolical plots of a series of nefarious super-villains and in doing so the superheroes will receive victory points based on their contribution towards defeating each super-villain. At the end of the game the superhero with the most victory points is the winner.

As you will see, the superheroes must work together to defeat each super-villain, otherwise the villain will win and all of the players will lose! However, once all of the super-villains are defeated, only one of the superheroes can win the game. Collecting victory points calls for playing the right card at the right time, so you will need to think very carefully about which cards to use each round and how to use your superpowers in order to score as many points as possible. On the other hand, being too selfish in the use of your cards and superpowers may result in a super-villain being able to carry out their diabolical plot, and if that happens everyone will lose the game. It’s a dreadful dilemma make no mistake – but then nobody said being a superhero was going to be easy!

Compete over 3-5 story arcs to be the most heroic Superhero and earn the adulation of the public.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Print & Play

name: 1836: Short Lines in the West Riding
description:
1836 is a railway operations and share trading board game in the 18xx series. Set in a 10 x 10 mile area of the West Riding area of England that had a staggering number of very small railway companies called "short lines", each of which competed very aggressively across duplicative routes.

The core features of the game:

- Highly dynamic track – There are a relatively high number of named locations that can be laid / upgraded in a variety of competitive ways to ensure that the map develops differently each game.

- Evolving trains – Each train type evolves as it is bought; e.g. there are 2* 2+1, 2* 2+2 then 1* 2X (think of it as a mini diesel that can count two cities and infinite towns). The 2+1 is rusted by the first type of four (4+2), 2+2 by the second (4+3) and so on.

- Staged Minor Companies – Minors are available throughout the game, 18 are shuffled and 4 are available in each of phases 2, 3 and 4 (all 12 available privates are visible from the start). Minors convey a benefit (control over a hex, cheaper track etc) and about half are railway companies that can be absorbed along with a "free" train that can be run immediately.

- Loans with Variable Interest Rate – When a Minor is absorbed by a Major Company it inherits the Minor's liabilities. Loans suppress stock price making stock jumps easier but the interest rate increases as loans are taken, so a balance must be found.
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Paperclip Railways: Top left-hand corner of Wales
description:
Bonus station card. Base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

From the card:
"Whenever you make the sound of a steam train while building a link, gain 1 point. Maximum of 1 point per link."
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Sip and Strip
description:
"Sip and Strip is an exciting game designed for swinging adults of all ages" -- so says the instruction booklet that comes from the game.

This is a Frank Bresee game, similar to nearly everything else he made, it includes a Monopoly-like board, drinks, and this time stripping. The game includes a routine board, "sip" cards and "strip" cards (standing in for Community Chest and Chance). The game can be played by two to six players or even more if you want to play with couples as teams.

The roll of the dice moves your pieces around the board and you are required to do what the squares tell you to do. Mostly this involves taking sips of a beverage, sometimes taking a Sip or Strip card. Some of the Sip cards direct personal action like "take a sip and kiss any player" and other cards require all participants to take an action, usually involving another sip of a beverage.

Each complete round of the board includes more Sip cards and more Strip cards requiring you to remove a piece of clothing. The game proceeds until the sips catch up with you (which is the point of Bresee's more notorious game "Pass Out") or until everyone has removed all articles of clothing. The game suggests the last player to remove the last article of clothing is the winner, but local rules may suggest other winners may be declared.

The length of the game depends greatly on potency of beverages, how many articles of clothes players are wearing, and natural distractions that arise from game situations. Unless all participants are really committed, the games can easily break up from prudishness or embarrassment.

name: Escape & Evasion
description: An solitaire game placing the player in the role of a downed aircrew member behind enemy lines. Utilizes the paragraph-driven RANGER game system. A team of active duty military pilots helped during the development of this game. It can also be linked with RANGER with one player leading a patrol to locate and recover the other player.

name: Anima Tactics: Anna Never
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The young merchant Anna Never is a complete mystery. As she travels around Gaia she seems to unconsciously position herself to be involved with major issues and problems facing the world. Additionally she has exhibited martial abilities unheard of for a girl of her age an apparent lack of training to possess. With no known connection to any established power block, one can't help but wonder that maybe there is more to her than she is letting on ...

Light Wanderer Warrior — Lv. 45
Innate Abilities: Critical Mastery.
Destiny's Chosen: After seeing the roll for an attack that targets Anna, you may spend one Gnosis Point to have your opponent to reroll the attack.
The One: You cannot spend Gnosis to improve any roll made by Anna. However, Anna rolls an additional dice an keeps the highest when making any roll.
Stubborn: Anna cannot be included in a party that has more Dark units than Light units in it.
Void God (Ki, Attack) +3 Attack.
Libera Me (Ki, Dodge) +3 Defense.
Infinity Requiem (Ki, Attack) +1 Attack / +2 Damage. You may spend any amount of Gnosis that you wish when making the attack. Anna makes an additional Infinity Requiem attack with the same target as the first one for each Gnosis point spent when making this attack (up to 2 Gnosis points).

name: Tradeoff
description:
TradeOff is the game of stock market supremacy. It pits two to six players against each other in one simple challenge - to make the most money on the stock market so as to out-bid each other for luxury items. However the stock market is volatile and unpredictable. Take-over bids, profit warnings, insider trading and much more, all contribute to make TradeOff an exciting and strategic roller-coaster ride from beginning to end.

HOW IT WORKS: The mat acts as the stock market and consists of four stocks. During the course of the game each stock's value independently rises and falls as dictated by the cards that players collect. Players can predict these rises and falls by studying their own cards and watching how their opponents are investing.

Making an investment is easy. Players select a stock they think will rise in value and simply place a number of their chips on the mat next to the stock's share price marker. Profit and losses are easily calculated by either using the numbers printed on the mat or by using the free app available on our website. But it's not only the cards that determine how the stock's values will change. When players invest in, or sell an investment, the stock's value rises or falls accordingly. This gives players the chance to be nasty to each other by reducing the value of their opponents investments!

Throughout the course of the game auctions are held for luxury items. During these auctions players must out-bid each other to secure the purchase of the item. The first player to obtain the requisite number of luxury items wins the game.

1945 is an easy to learn, fun to play strategic card game of world conquest for 2-6 people. Players collect armed forces cards and use them to conquer territories. Battles can be changed dramatically by special action cards that have a variety of effects, from helping your troops to bombing your enemies to smithereens. Ultimately, whoever gathers enough points by conquering territories and collecting victory point cards is declared the winner!

Players take turns drawing cards from the deck. When a territory is drawn, all the players join in to battle for it. The player who drew it declares a Theater of War -- Air, Land, or Sea -- and players deploy troops from their hands face down to hide their strength. (Individual troop cards range in strength from 1 to 5, so while other players can see how many cards you've laid down, they don't know how strong your forces are.)

Players can also play special cards, which increase the strength of one's forces, allow one to see other players' cards, let a player play a card from the discard pile, drop an A-Bomb on a territory to remove it from play altogether, or various other effects. When all players have committed as many forces they wish, all of the cards are revealed, special cards are resolved, and the player with the strongest remaining forces wins the territory.

The number of Victory Points required to win the game varies with the number of players participating. One gains a Victory Point for each territory held, as well as for each Victory Point card held in one's hand. The first player to accumulate the required number of Victory Points wins the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, World War II
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Dispatches from the Bunker #35
description:
A magazine dedicated to Advanced Squad Leader. This issue has an article on gun duels, tournament review and preview, Tactical Tips and perspectives on four scenarios. This issue also marks the 100th scenario. Also included are four scenarios:

DB099 Gin Drinkers Line - After the fall of the Shing Mum Redoubt, the Japanese 38th division set about the task of clearing out the last of the Commonwealth forces from the 'Gin Drinkers Line' and assault Hong Kong proper.

DB100 The Gateway - As Operation Nordwind proceeded, Panzergrenadier Division 25 had its mission to break through the American defenses on the old Maginot Line.

DB101 A Willingness to Die - On day two of Operation Barbarossa, Kampfgruppe Raus of the 6th Panzer Division set off to take Rossienie, but was held up by the Russian 48th Rifle Division at Paislinus.

DB102 Les Hommes de Neige - With Narvik still beyond Allied reach, French Alpine troops would replace the British at Ankenes and make an overland assault to take the heights there.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Fight Club: Project Mayhem
description:
If you could fight anyone, who would you fight?

Fight Club: Project Mayhem is an unofficial, non-profit card game based on Fight Club (both the book, and the movie). Two players struggle to control the outcome of Project Mayhem tasks by controlling the members of the project (also known as space monkeys).

Jack and Tyler can use their actions to play cards (such as Homework, Cigarette Burns, House on Paper Street, or Ikea Nesting Instinct), recruit space monkeys, assign them to various tasks, or bid for control over the Jack/Tyler pawn. Whoever has the most space monkeys on a task when it is triggered collects victory points and the first one to have 10 points wins the game!

It's time to learn who's in control!

You can get the files here: Fight Club: Project Mayhem available!
or print the game on Artscow: If you don't like cutting your fingers - Fight Club available on Artscow!
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Print & Play

name: Queen's Blade: Grimoire
description:
The Setting: Queen's Blade Universe expands to a land of endless summer. A foe who calls himself a "devil of winter" appears, trying to put an end to the summer. Prophecy says that the woman who wields the Queen's Blade is the only one who can defeat this devil.

„ÇØ„Ç§„Éº„É≥„Ç∫„Éñ„É¨„Ç§„Éâ„ÄÄ„Ç∞„É™„É†„ÉØ„Éº„É´ - Queen's Blade Grimoire is a licensed Series: Lost Worlds (Nova Game Designs) series, so it is compatible with all other Series: Lost Worlds (Nova Game Designs) books.

name: White Star Rising Tournament Pack
description:
A pack of 4 scenarios for the Nations at War series, previously released only to those who participated in the WBC WSR tournament. Requires both White Star Rising and the Operation Cobra expansion to play all of the scenarios.

The scenarios are...

Swap Meet -pits Easy Eights against Panthers.

Clash at the Crossroads -pits paratroopers against Tigers.

Trouble with Bridges -Pits Canadians, and their French allies, against the Fallschirmjager.

Break on Through -pits the Free Polish against the Germans (who else?)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Columba: The Pond
description:
The Pond: Special Card for Columba

Carrier pigeons stop there before flying to the nearest dovecote...

Rule
This card is shuffled with the others and is placed accordingly on the board. However, the players may not cover up this card or place domesticated pigeons or falcons on it.

The player who has just played this card randomly draws a pigeon tile from the four different tiles and places it on the pond square matching the color of the tile.

Then have a closer look at the territory:

If there is no estate (remember: a part of the territory where there is a dovecote) corresponding to the drawn tile color, the tile remains on the pond until a dovecote is built.
If there is one estate of the color of the drawn tile, the player who owns that estate takes the tile and uses it immediately to extend his estate.
If there are several estates of the color of the drawn tile, the pigeon flies to the nearest dovecote. In the case of a tie, the pigeon will choose the largest estate.
If the estate can't be extended, the pigeon flies to the next one (or stays on the pond if there is none).


This procedure is repeated at the end of each turn of the player who has placed the pond.

During final scoring, whenever possible, the squares of this card are taken into account and considered like squares from the estate.

Source: The Pond rules insert.

name: The Sword and the Flame: Supplement 1
description:
In 1979, Yaquinto Publications released Supplement 1, which went along with their edition of the game. This first variant included answers to frequently asked questions, optional rules and three alternate gaming periods, including: The Boxer Rebellion, French and Indian War, and French Foreign Legion periods.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Sword and The Flame", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Expands:

The Sword and the Flame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: BattleTech: Total Chaos
description:
From the publisher:

In late 3067, the Word of Blake unleashed its Jihad, fanning the flames of violence and spreading it across the Inner Sphere. Three mercenary commands struggled to find their footing and profit from the all-encompassing warfare. As they navigated their way through the conflicts erupting on hundreds of worlds, these mercenaries grew in power, prestige, and character. Facing adversity, victory, defeat, and enemies within and without, they were typical of many commands touched — for ill or for good—by the Jihad. As the Jihad unfolded through the Jihad Hot Spots plotbooks, players were introduced to the Chaos Campaign, a new game play system that gave players the opportunity to craft their own games around specific battles and events of the Jihad. Now that campaign, spanning fourteen years of conflict, has been collected and updated. Presented here are all of the Chaos Campaign tracks from the Hot Spots plotbooks and interwoven with select tracks from the Jihad Turning Points e-publication series and several all-new tracks and mini-campaigns.



This volume also includes detailed reports on nearly forty planetary campaigns, providing context and details previously clouded by interstellar media, local reports, and personal journals. With an updated and streamlined core ruleset for the Chaos Campaign and new Jihad era Random Availability Tables for the Word of Blake, Mercenaries, and Militias, this book has everything players and gamemasters need to recreate the pivotal campaigns of the Jihad and lead their forces to victory.


The Total Chaos expansion for BattleTech provides dozens of scenarios for BattleTech games set within the timeframe of the Jihad; in addition to collecting together those already published within various of the Jihad sourcebooks, Total Chaos adds more than 60 completely new tracks, all of which can be fought as one-off games or which can be linked together to provide long-running campaigns for groups of players.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Field Manual SLDF
description:
From the Publisher's Website:

THE GRANDEST ARMY



It was the middle of the twenty-eighth century. Two hundred years after the Age of War, all of mankind now lived, united, under one flag: the Star League. Defending and policing this vast realm nearly 3,000 worlds strong was the largest army ever known to humanity: the Star League Defense Force. Harnessing the largest fleet of WarShips ever assembled, the most advanced technologies in BattleMech and aerospace design, and the finest, most disciplined training regimens in known space, the SLDF was the invincible might that kept the feuding Houses of the Inner Sphere in line.



Field Manual: SLDF describes the single greatest military force the Inner Sphere has ever seen: the Star League Defense Force. Including a brief history and overview of the SLDF, its formation, organization, and training programs, this book provides the most detailed look ever at the army that protected the Inner Sphere before the treachery of Stefan Amaris and the Succession Wars that soon followed. Special rules are also included, enabling players to create Star League forces for use in campaigns set in one of BattleTech's most storied eras.


The Field Manual: SLDF supplement for BattleTech provides details of the organization of the Star League Defense Force at the height of the Star League, providing descriptions on many of the major and minor units as well as optional rules to reflect the character and capabilities of those units, details of unit deployment and locations and other aspects of the SLDF to allow players to stage games and campaigns to be fought during this era.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Puppet Master: Puppet Wars Game
description:
Based off hit film series, the classic horror puppets are ready for you to control... are you ready?

Players choose 3 characters and battle each other using dice till there is only one player left.

Each player take turns moving their characters around the board and battling other player's characters using their character's special abilities.

Objective of the game is to be first player defeat all over players characters.
categories: Fighting, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Plenty of Fish in the Sea?
description:
In Plenty of Fish in the Sea? players take on the role of a shoal of fish trying to survive on a Coral Reef.

With a limited amount of fish and actions to perform, they must try to shoal their fish to avoid starvation, predators and also remember to spawn and thus increase the gene pool. Players may place tiles, rotate them or move fish to attempt to maximize their final score at the game end.

In Plenty of Fish in the Sea? you're not paranoid, everyone is out to get you!

name: The Rough Riders: A Volley, Bayonet, & Glory Supplement, volume 1
description:
From the Introduction

The Spanish American War is a most interesting "little" war for the miniatures gamer. Machine guns, smokeless powder, barbed wire, dynamite guns, magazine rifles, and all sorts of exciting items first came to the attention of the American public in this war, while war correspondents became public figures as they covered the war in detail. It is also the war that would cause the formation of the 1st U.S. Volunteer Cavalry, a most interesting amalgamation of western frontiersmen, Indians, and eastern dudes, all drawn together by the personal magnetism of the former Assistant Secretary of the Navy and future President, one Theodore Roosevelt. It was the war that would serve as the introduction of the United States onto the world stage, and make the 20th Century the "American Century".

Volume One Contains:

The historical background of the Spanish American War in Cuba and Puerto Rico
The Cuban Army in historical context
The Spanish Army in historical context
The Prewar Regular Army of the U.S. in historical context
The Volunteer Army of the U.S. in historical context
San Juan Heights Scenario & Order of Battle for Volley, Bayonet, & Glory
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The Rough Riders: A Volley, Bayonet, & Glory Supplement, volume 2
description:
From the Introduction

The use of Volley, Bayonet, and Glory 'Battalion Scale' as a suggested set of rules for this period came about as Frank Chadwick and Greg Novak discussed how to portray the Spanish American War. It is a 'modern' war in that the majority of the weapons will be used to usher in the First World War. Yet on the other hand it is one of the last black powder wars of the 19th Century. As this war did not last long enough to evolve tactics of its own, and was in many ways a rerun of the American Civil War in regard to the American Army, they decided to treat it as the end point of the Volley, Bayonet, & Glory rules, and offer a two volume supplement for those rules as part of this booklet.

Volume Two Contains:

A Miniatures Campaign for Western Cuba
The Uniforms of the Spanish Army
The Uniforms of the American Army
The Uniforms of the Cuban Army
Volley, Bayonet, & Glory for the Spanish American War
Las Guasimas & El Caney Scenario's & Orders of Battle for Volley, Bayonet, & Glory
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Lords and Vassals
description:
My design goals for this game were to mitigate the weaknesses found in ancient games using custodian capture, games like Dai Hasami Shogi and Latrunculorum.

Features:

1) Random setup
2) Four moves per turn
3) Two special forms of Custodian capture

I believe I came close to succeeding but I'll let you be the judge of that.

Introduction:

Lords and Vassals is a 2 player game that's played on an 8x8 board. Black and white. A player starts with 8 pawns and 8 checkers randomly placed on their respective last two rows.

Definitions:

Lords – pawns
Vassals – checkers
Pin – Is when a lord sits on top of his vassals or his opponents vassals
Custodian – an ancient form of capturing enemy pieces by sandwiching an enemy piece between two friendly pieces
Adjacent – means orthogonally adjacent

Play:

In Lords and Vassals the playing pieces move orthogonally across the board.

Black moves first then players alternate.

Each player must make four moves per turn and can be done by the same or different pieces. Each move can be 1 of 3 types:


to an adjacent empty space.



jumping over an enemy piece of the same type to an empty space on the other side of the jumped piece.(Note: After the jump the piece doing the jumping becomes immobile during the current turn and the remaining moves are divided to other pieces.) Please reference the section entitled Jumping in the Rules PDF.



moving a lord onto an adjacent vassal, pinning it.


Friendly lords may Pin an enemy vassal or a friendly one by moving onto them, also that same lord during a turn may not move onto another vassal until he unpins the current one. Pinned vassals are unable to move until they are unpinned and a lord unpins a vassal by moving onto an empty adjacent space. (Note: when a lord unpins a vassal the lord doing the unpinning becomes immobile during the current turn and the remaining moves are divided to other pieces.) Only two Lords per player at any one time during the game may have a pinned vassal.


Friendly pieces may capture like enemy pieces. Captures are custodian.(Note: when a lord or vassal makes a capturing move that lord or vassal becomes immobile during the current turn and the remaining moves are divided to other pieces.) Please reference the section entitled Capturing in the Rules PDF.

Winning Conditions:

When you capture five of either of your opponents lords or vassals.

When your opponent has no legal moves.

Copyright (c) 2012 Rey Alicea

name: Operation: Barbarossa
description:
Summer 1941: Operation Barbarossa has begun. The impressive Nazi war machine has set it sights on the East and has begun rolling toward the gates of Moscow. The Russian defenses are caught off guard and must organize quickly to make a stand and proudly defend the Mother Land. Many brave soldiers must answer the call to duty, and many will pay with their lives before either side may claim… victory.

Operation: Barbarossa recreates this epic battle using a turn-based, area-movement and capture system similar to Axis & Allies. This game does however, use its own unit types, combat rules, D12 combat system, and victory system.

As the German player, you have a set length of time to capture key Russian cities to cripple their production. As Russia, you must find a way to hold out long enough to turn back the advancing Nazis.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Line of Fire #13
description:
At the vanguard of this magazine is the Nations at War series of games. Included are articles on the future of the series, on the forthcoming Stalin’s Triumph, and on strategies for the campaign in Operation Cobra, plus four new scenarios by veteran designer Matt Lohse: two on Operation Market Garden and two on Operation Goodwood. In addition to the four Nations at War scenarios, there are plenty more:


The World at War modulette Jungle Blood & Sweat, started in Line of Fire #12, concludes with three more scenarios in Southeast Asia, utilizing 33 new 5/8” die-cut counters.
British and Soviet Recon formations meet near Bitterfeld, the crucial town featured in World at War: Battles within Battles.
The Swedes attempt to strike down a Soviet push inland from the town of Nynäsham, south of Stockholm, in another aspect of Operation Garbo.
In two Honneur et Patrie scenarios, the Belgians launch a vital counterattack and the French and the Soviets take on each other as well as a whole new type of enemy—a rogue lunatic who’s on the lam.
Two hot-spots in Heroes of the Gap are illuminated: one in Bavaria (on maps from Band of Heroes); the other in Libya (on the A Day of Heroes map).
Also, a new Space Infantry Enemies Variant introduces a new sense of doom to your extra-terrestrial gaming.



On top of this, the magazine contains the game Blood on the Alma, designed by Tom Russell, with art by Gabriel Gendron, depicting the September 20th, 1854, Battle of the Alma, in Crimea, in which an Allied force of British, French and Turks met the Russians.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Exasott
description:
An abstract game played on a grid of 8 X 8 intersections.
Each player has a set of 16 sticks of varying length. On their turn a player places a stick from one intersection, diagonally, to another intersection, on an immediately adjacent row or column. The two intersections and the stick used are removed from further play. Play passes to the other player. The winner is the last player able to perform a legal move.

name: Scramble for Britain
description:
From the website:

Scramble for Britain is part of the Wings at War series of wargames rules from Tumbling Dice. Scramble is designed for recreating World War II air combat using Tumbling Dice's 1/600th scale aircraft models.

The games are designed to last around one or two hours. As the sky tends to be a lot less cluttered than the ground, games can be set up quickly and fewer models are required - making for a cheaper night out.

Any number of people can play. As the victory target is dependant on the size of a force, opposing sides don't have to be equally balanced, a smaller or less sophisticated mix of planes can defeat a larger or more advanced enemy by reaching their (lower) victory target first.

Each model represents an individual aircraft or balloon. Elevation is abstracted using 4 levels, and the game uses D6 and D3 (a d6 numbered 1,1,2,2,3,3) for combat resolution.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: UGGU
description:
UGGU is the acronym for "ungleich-gleich/gleich-ungleich" (different-equal/equal-different)

Material:

A square of wood with a 9x9 grid. Alternatively, for a shorter playing time or else to learn the game, the 7x7 bright-colored area can be used
14 light-colored wooden pieces in three different heights, for a total of 42 cube units
14 dark-colored wooden pieces in three different heights, for a total of 42 cube units


Rules:

Bright starts and sets any of its pieces on a square of the playing field except for those on all four board sides
Then dark sets any of its pieces on any square not adjacent to the bright piece and also not on the board edges
Both players now place their pieces alternatively so that every new piece is placed adjacent (orthogonally, not diagonally) to an already placed piece, no matter the color.
The following two rules must be observed:


a) If the adjacent pieces have different heights, they must have the same color
b) If the adjacent pieces have the same height, they must have different colors

The player unable to add a new piece during his turn loses the game

name: Age of Man
description:
From the designer;

Age of Man is a civilization building game where each player represents one of the first civilizations to emerge from the Stone age. Age of Man captures the elements of territorial control, technological development, cultural influence and empire management found in classic civilization games and distills them down to their essence.

Players lead their civilizations to greatness by expanding control into new regions, building cities, discovering new technology all the while maintaining an ever growing empire.

The goal of the game is to become the greatest civilization of all time and be immortalized in history forever; victory being achieved through a combination Domination(territory control), Diplomacy(cities all over the world) or Assimilation(empire size).

The game features modular boards, variable paths to victory and multiple victory conditions create a dynamic gaming experience.

name: Hour of Glory: Die Zombies!
description:
War-torn Europe in 1945 is about to experience a new kind of horror.
Even as the Third Reich crumbles beneath the Soviet onslaught, Allied spies have been dispatched to investigate a new threat.
In a last, desperate attempt to protect the Fatherland, Axis scientists are about to unleash a terrible supernatural weapon…
Hour of Glory: Die Zombies! is an expansion for the WW2 miniature board game Hour of Glory.

Hour of Glory: Die Zombies! is a 17 pages expansion that add new mission and a new menace to any game of Hour of Glory. The agents must now recover data regarding a new "Formula Z" from the scientist in the Stronghold, but a Soviet Artillery strike cause a leakage of an experemental gas in the complex, reanimating the dead.
Now any sentry killed by the agents may come back for a vengeange, or to snack on some of his ex-comrades.

The rulebook also contain rules for zombies in the Bunkerstorm game.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame, World War II, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: ASL Comp: Platoon Leader 3.0 ‚Äì Campaign Game Rules
description:
Platoon Leader 3.0 CG rules for ASLComp with color cover and CEMETERY HILL campaign game and overlays.

Platoon Leader 3.0 is a system for playing tactical-level battles using a series of Scenarios referred to as a "campaign game" or CG. This campaign game lets players recreate, in detail, the fighting of various great battles. Players take up the part of both the overall commanders, choosing which units will reinforce the initial troops, as well as the local commanders, fighting it out for each objective of the campaign. Players use a 'purchase' method to select troops for the first Scenario for the campaign. They set up their troops, determine who will attack and defend in that action then play that Scenario. The end of the Scenario brings the players to the Reorganization Phase, where they resolve the location of the front lines, determine the fate of disorganized and damaged units, and then purchase new units for the next Scenario.

PL 3.0 aims to provide a concise, enjoyable campaign experience, playable by the average gamer over a couple of evenings. Critical Hit regularly releases new CG's for use with Platoon Leader. The latest version of PL is available at Critical Hit as a free download. This new version supersedes versions 1.0 and 2.0 and all errata. PL 3.0 remains compatible with all previously-released campaigns.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Power Rangers Samurai Pop 'N' Race
description:
Players have four pegs in your base and you need get them to HOME. HOME is only place (and base) where your safe from other players from landing on your peg and knocking you back to base. To move; players pop the middle dome and move the number indicated on the die.

The game supports four players. Players can choose to be (the male characters from series) Red Ranger, Blue Ranger, Green Ranger or Gold Ranger. Players need to pop a 6 in order to move one of their four pegs from base to start and they get another turn. Players get another turn whenever a 6 is popped.

Players will spend about 15mins playing and having fun getting your Power Ranger pegs into HOME (safety from other players) and knocking other player's Power Ranger pegs back to their base!

Objective of the game: Be the first player to get all four of your Power Ranger pegs into HOME.

Seems like a themed version of Trouble

name: Kurios√Øt
description:
You go around the city several times with your pawn to get Aliens tokens which score most points of influence, so you can become the Master of Kuriosït.

Each player will have to move cunningly his pawn around the edge of the board to get Aliens tokens scoring most points, without neglecting the others, that can be used to make some special moves (see in front page, the special actions).

On every turn, the players will necessarily have to move their pawns from at least one space to be able to get an Alien token. If you think it is not interesting to take the token, you don’t have to. Because every time a token is taken, another one is going to move on to its space and if this last one is very interesting it is the player behind who may get it.

name: Power Rangers Super Samurai Make A Match Memory Game
description:
Find the most matching pairs to win! The Power Rangers are scattered around as you try to find matching pairs to collect.

On your turn pick any two cards. If they are the same, you get to keep them. Find a pair of the special Take Red Ranger cards and you get to take the Red Ranger figure. Be the one who has it at the end of the game and you'll get bonus points.

Game objective: Be the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Angry Birds: Western Round-Up
description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

Build, launch and destroy with this Angry Birds Western Round-Up Game by Mattel. Create structures based on mission cards. Shoot down your opponent's structures to score points. Reach 1,000 points first to win.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Zombie Shot Glass
description:
This shot glass has the artwork from Zombie Dice but does not have any in-game rules for that game. It does, however, have a special rule for all Munchkin games:




You may drink one complete Potion of Zombie Immunity from the Zombie Shot Glass to dodge a Curse (or Trap or Disaster) or a monster's Bad Stuff. You must declare that that you are FEELING NO PAAAAAAAAAAIN. You may only do this once per game.





Note that the "shot" can be any liquid and does not have to contain alcohol.Part of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Telka
description:
Telka, invented by George S. Parker, is played by 2, 3, or 4 players on an 18x18 board of interconnected circles, with the 26 circles in each of four corners replaced with art. Each side of the board then features 38 circles with a background of green, red, blue, or yellow, with the 12 circles nearest the outer edge highlighted. Circles in the middle of the board and between each colored side have a white background, known as Danger Territory. Players begin with their pieces (green, red, blue, or yellow) on the highlighted circles nearest them on the appropriately colored parts of the board. Players then take turns moving their pieces in an attempt to get three of them to the highlighted circles on the opposite side of the board.

Player movements are very similar to Chinese Checkers, with the exception that while in the white area, pieces jumped are removed from the board rather than being left in place. Some later versions of Telka include rules for playing Chinese Checkers (a.k.a. Peg Chow in some editions) on the Telka board, but these differ from the more commonly known versions of Chinese Checkers (including those published by Parker Brothers) by virtue of the different board and number of pieces.
publishers: (Public Domain), Parker Brothers, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Quest: Zeit der Helden ‚Äì Wolkenw√§chter Linart
description:
This mini-expansion consists of a new hero: cloudkeeper Linart.
Pegasus has given out this expansion only to their support employees. The print run is 1000 pcs..

See images for more information.

name: Fall of the Goblin Empire
description:
User Discription

The Fall of the Goblin Empire is a set of miniatures fantasy air wargames rules.

The rules background are about after the Goblin Empire which has fallen and now the Goblins have retreated to their floating isles. They defend their islands against their enemies (other goblin tribes and races) with their flying craft.

Each player have at least one flying vehicle crewed by a number of characters (mainly goblins), through there are rules for actions on the ground. Each turn Characters must crew their craft, but those who not crewing can perform other actions like entering combat or shooting at their enemies.

The rules are background based so a scenario will need to be devised before play with victory conditions.

The rules suggest miniature scale is 25/28mm (Through I can see that 15mm could be used) and a number of six sided and one eight sided dice are needed.

The Fall of the Goblin Empire was published in the Ragnarok magazine, issue 59, which won the 2011 SFSFW rules writing competition on fantasy air wargamming.

name: The Association: A Deed Restricted Game
description:
Welcome to The Association!

Develop the neighborhood, build common property, increase membership, and take control of the community, molding it in your image.

Players act as board members of their own individual associations attempting to establish a master association. Canvas the neighborhood with your volunteers to gain support for your initiatives and work hard to increase the satisfaction of the property owners. The more members to an association mean the more money that can be collected and spent.

Work on your own or in a committee with your fellow board members to change the neighborhood for the better but be careful – only one player can be president of the master association.
Are you ready to play?
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Voting

name: Pack Up! Game
description:
Publisher's Description:
An entertaining game of sorting items into the correct containers using lists. This is a great way to encourage your child to think quickly and improve organisational skills.

In this game 24 tiles are placed face-down and players are each given a list of items to find. Players on their turn look at a tile to see if it matches an item on their list, taking the tile if it does.

name: Anima Tactics: Kudoi
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Wacky and unstoppable, even by the standards of his race, the young Daimah Kudoi is one of the newest members of Samael. He traveled from the east to protect the Aoi Inukai, but in the Old World he has found much more than he expected. An endless adventure that will put his skills to the test! Miniatures are supplied unpainted and assembly may be required.

Light Samael Warrior/Prowler — Lv. 40

Innate Abilities: Open Movement.
Acrobat: Kudoi gets +2 to his Escape rolls.
oooo — Flying Crane (Ki, Charge)
This attack gets +1 Attack / +1 Damage for each 4 inches between Kudoi and the target when he begins moving for this Charge.
oooo — Court Mantis (Ki, Attack)
+8 Attack.
ooo — Howling Wolf (Ki, Ranged Attack)
Distance (16 inches). +4 Attack / +4 Damage. This attack gets -1 Attack / -1 Damage for each 4 inches between Kudoi and his target.

name: Gordon Solie's Championship Wrestling Trivia Game
description: The object of Gordon Solie's Championship Wrestling Trivia Game, which includes 1,200 trivia questions, is for players to move their respective marker once around the game board and diagonally up the Championship Match spaces into the center of the Championship Belt. Players move around the board and attempt to answer trivia questions along the way, earning additional rolls of the die and thus advancing more quickly to their home corner and the Championship Match. The first player correctly answering the appropriate trivia question after moving inside the Championship Belt wins.

name: Wer kennt Hannover?
description:
"Who knows Hannover - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Hannover.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

name: After the Fall
description:
With civilization decimated, you and your fellow survivors struggle to eke out subsistence and build self-sufficiency before the harsh winter sets in. Can you survive after the fall?

Each player has established an outpost in one of five home bases, from the scrap yard to the mansion. They begin the game with a leader character who has a special ability plus six community members. Each turn the players' improvements produce resources. Then, everyone allocates their people to either scavenge for resources and equipment or build new improvements. Players can also trade to improve the overall community's chance of survival. Finally, resources must be spent to keep the members alive. Over the course of the game, winter sets in. After the fall, the winner is the player whose base is best equipped to survive, and the overall community score determines the fate of the entire human race.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Exploration, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Donald Featherstone's Wargaming Pike and Shot Revised Edition
description:
From the back cover:

"Each battle described in this book is a significant and outstanding example of the art of war and the
development of military tactics period. They are highly suitable for scaling-down to realistic table-top proportions because of the size of the armies and the area of the battlefield

By refighting them, the wargamer can transform themselves into an
historical commander, savour his excitement and triumphs and suffer failure in judgements and disappointments.

This book contains:

An introduction to wargaming the period,
fifteen battles, each illustrated with maps,
notes on suitable rules and wargaming figures,
an updated bibliography and
a previously unpublished set of English Civil War rules by Donald Featherstone

The History of Wargaming Project is edited by John Curry.
It aims to present the very best of classic wargaming books and rules to a modern audience."
categories: Book, Civil War, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Kasta
description:
Kasta is an Old Norse word, meaning to throw away, discard or dispose of.

A dice game for 2,3 or 4 players.

You don't roll the dice in Kasta you discard them; this makes the gameplay similar to games like Rummy, Dominoes, and Uno the exception being that in Kasta there is no hidden information.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Bump Bump Pig
description:
In Bump Bump Pig, piggies with many different characteristics live in a peaceful town, and if they "bump" against someone, they bring a change of fortune to the other individual, possibly good, possibly not so good.

Players take turns acting as the Master, and in each round the Master receives piggy cards from other players. Some piggies will allow both players to score or take some special action, while others might have bad effects. The Master can use piggy cards in front of himself to avoid harm or seek out the highest reward.

name: Anima Tactics: Wolfgang Metzger
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Mercenary, executioner, murderer ... there isn't an infamous title that Wolfgang hasn't taken to heart. His great physical prowess isn't the only reason that he has become part Gaul's personal forces. The blood of the Naga runs through his veins, making him able to poison his enemies with just a touch of his skin.

Dark Azur Alliance Warrior — Lv. 40

Poison Ramalen: Any unit that comes into contact with Wolfgang for the first time suffers Blind Lv2. Effect 14.
Son of the Naga: Enemy units within Wolfgang's Control Zone suffer double damage due to the Poison state.
Poisoned Weapons: If any attack made by Wolfgang causes damage, the target suffers Poison Lv 2. Effect 14.
ooo — Cupra (Ki, Attack)
+4 Attack. If this attack causes damage, the effect of the Poison state is 16 instead of 14.

name: Anima Tactics: Type-009 Deathhead
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Type-009 is Black Sun's latest evolution of elite unstoppable necromantic weapons. They have no qualms with destroying themselves to destroy their designated target.

Neutral Black Sun Warrior Undead — Lv. 25+

Whip of Bones: The Type-009 may make close combat basic Attacks on enemy units within 2 inches of itself.
Neuronal Poison: If any Attack (basic or special) made by the Type-009 causes damage, the target suffers Slow Lv. 1. Effect 15.
o — Implosion (Special Attack)
+3 Attack. This attack affects all enemy units that are within 4 inches of its target. The Type-009 is eliminated after resolving this attack.
o — Core (Special Effect)
An enemy unit engaged with the Type-009 suffers Paralysed Lv. 1 and Slow Lv. 1. The Type-009 is eliminated after resolving this ability. Effect 18.

name: Anima Tactics: Juliette Kaime
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Juliette is the ultimate messenger, a woman able to become one with her leaders and transmit any command to their subordinates as an extension of themselves. Even if she works for the Azur Alliance, her heart only serves the High Arbiter Arkeid, who she considers her big sister.

Neutral Azur Alliance Prowler — Lv. 25

Control Nexus: At the beginning of the game, choose an arbiter in your party, to whom Juliette is allocated.
As long as Juliette's in play, this arbiter receives one additional Order Point per turn. Furthermore, as long as the arbiter has Line of Sight to Juliette, they can use her control area as an extension of their Influence Zone.
Extension of Will: Juliette can, if desired, be activated simultaneously with her Arbiter. This ability doesn't allow her to activate twice per turn.
oo — Stealth (Subterfuge, Effect)
Juliette becomes Hidden. Upkeep: o
oo — Reign of Chaos (Subterfuge, Effect)
An enemy Unit inside Juliette's Control Zone loses one Action Point. Effect 16.
oo — Whisper (Subterfuge, Effect, Reactive)
A friendly Unit inside Juliette's Control Zone gets +1 Attack and +1 Defense until end of turn. This ability can only be used if Juliette is hidden.

name: Anima Tactics: Kira
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Thanks to her legendary aim and her unparalleled agility, Kira was one of the first people to become an Aria of Wissenschaft. Her love of money and volatile nature keep her volunteering for mission after mission. This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

Neutral Wissenschaft Prowler — Lv. 40

oo — Impure Shot (Subterfuge, Ranged Attack)
Distance (4 inches). After this attack is resolved, Kira may move up to 8 inches, even if she has already moved this turn.
ooo — Buster Shot (Subterfuge, Ranged Attack)
Distance (8 inches). +2 Attack / +3 Damage. After this attack is resolved Kira moves 4 inches directly away from her target (this can't cause collisions), even if she has already moved this turn.
oo+ — Buckshot (Subterfuge, Ranged Attack)
Distance (8 inches). Kira may spend any number of additional AP when paying for this attack. For each additional AP spent in this way she makes an additional attack against the same target.
ooo — Valkyrie (Subterfuge, Dodge, Ranged Attack)
Distance (4 inches). If Kira successfully Dodges, she may move up to 2 inches, even if she has already move this turn. If Kira is engaged she automatically Escapes. After she moves due to this ability, she may then make a Ranged Attack against her attacker is she is in range.

name: Smile & Like It
description:
Smile and Like It is a family-friendly card game for 3 - 8 players with a unique twist. On your turn, play a card and do what it says, simple as that. Generally the card will instruct you to claim chips (some face up, some face down, all of which have smiley faces of differing levels of happiness on one side) from the center pot, trade chips you've already collected with other players, and so on.

Here's the twist: you don't automatically get to draw a card at the end of your turn. Instead, you have to claim a special "draw" chip (differently colored than all the other chips in the pot) and have it remain in your score pile until your next turn, at which point you can replenish your hand of cards... but that's all you can do on that turn. Of course, there aren't enough draw chips in the pot for everyone.

So the tension builds: how long do you dare wait to take the draw chip? If you run out of cards, you lose chips from your pot to the players seated on either side of you... but if you happen to have a draw chip in your score pile at the end of the game, you take a massive penalty to your final score.

The game comes with three unique methods of scoring right in the box. One scoring system simply gives more points for happier smiley faces (very family friendly), one scores points for sets of different types of smileys (a bit more strategic, but still family friendly), and one uses patterns of smileys printed right on the cards, giving the players another option on how to play a card: playing it as a scoring card by spending the specific pattern of smileys in the score pile (introducing a hand management aspect to the game suitable for more hardcore gamers).

All in all, Smile and Like It is a game that is simple to learn and play, and yet difficult to master in any of its incarnations, making it a game you'll come back to again and again.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Aristo'zzle
description:
A classic game of happy families with a twist, comprising 7 aristocratic animals, each attired in the sartorial splendour of the Victorian era. An exciting game for all the family.

Contents : 42 cards wich combined together, create the seven "Aristo" characters :
- Dog, Cat, Hare, Ferret, Giraffe and Wolf.
Each character is divided into six parts, which when reconstitued forms the word A-R-I-S-T-O.

The seven "Aristo-Animals" come together to form the Aristo'zzle, a tableau in the manner of a jigsaw puzzle.

From 2 players to 6.
Minimum age 4 years old.

name: Polygon
description: In this abstract strategy game, each turn you add a tile to the table matching up at least one section with the previously laid tiles. Each section on the outer perimeter is worth a point so try to surround your opponents tiles to reduce their score, or try to create an enclosed area where scores are doubled. Place your tiles carefully, to out maneuver your opponents, and get the highest score in Polygon!
mechanics: Enclosure, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: quroma
description:
quroma is an abstact game played on a 4×4 grid.
48 squares in 12 different colors are randomly placed on the grid (3 on each space)
Then, each turn, you have 3 actions points that you must use. Select a square, then use the action points to flip its stack over, or to move the top square in its stack to an adjacent space, or any combination along the way.

Furthermore, on your turn, the square you select must be the same color as revealed by the prevous player's first action. If the previous player's first action revealed the table, then you can select any square for your move (just like at the start of the game).

If you have stacked two squares of the same color at the end of your third action, you collect these squares, removing them from play.

As soon as there are only single squares left (no more stacks), the game is over. The player with the most quartets (4 squares of the same color) is the winner. If there is a tie, the player with the most pairs wins.
mechanics: Action Points, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Innovations in Wargaming Vol. 1 Developments in professional and hobby wargames
description:
From the back cover:
"The Art of Wargaming has never been static over the first two centuries of its history. In both the professional and hobby sides of wargaming, there has been a desire to strive to perfect and develop the many sets of rules into the best possible wargaming system. This book is about some of the key innovations in wargaming. It includes chapters on: Designing Wargaming Rules The Hunt for Weapons of Mass Destruction: A Committee Game An introduction to Kriegsspiel by Paddy Griffith A Naval Kriegsspiel by Paddy Griffith TEWTS Tactical Exercises Without Troops Space Invaders on the Rhine: A Hall Game Hijack! An anti-terrorism wargame Sen Toku A World War 2 Japanese Imperial Naval Staff Game. An extended discussion on How to Design and Play Historical War Council Games by Paddy Griffith The History of Wargaming Project is edited by John Curry. "

name: Raygunz & Rednecks: Incident at Spanky Bottom
description:
Each player plays one of three alien races that have landed in a tiny Appalachian village. The object of the game is to kidnap as many humans as possible for “research” and get them back to the saucers. As a representative of a race of “visitors”, you want your group of aliens to get more victims back into the saucer than the others!

Designed as an introduction to miniatures gaming for new players, R&R uses the basic principles of miniature gaming in an easy to digest, simple form. The alien figures move by a ruler (but can teleport over the entire board) and engage the human figures by appearing in front of them or making contact. A deck of reaction cards drive the human quarry without the need for a referee and generate much of the humor.

The game premiered at PentaCon in 1998 as a non-threating, humor game for the non-grognard attendees. It became a hit and was played there and at a few other regional conventions. A PDF of the basic rules , the deck of reaction cards and a primer on making your own version were freely distributed. A play-at-home version was offered in 2005 at PentaCon through the R&R/GuffeyConRevue booth. The production version of the game came in a plastic clamshell containing cardstock figures and buildings. It also included a single d6, d10, d12 and custom scatter die used for teleporting. In May 2011, a generous review of the game was offered in the Lost Game Safari column of the 'Knights of the Dinner Table' (issue 175) by Andy Miller.

name: Nonpoint
description:
Nonpoint is an abstract strategy game for 2–3 players, with a solitaire variant. It is to be played with a 37-hex-hex board and a XATS set.

Your score is the product of the numbers of your pieces in contiguous groups (as in OMEGA), minus the number of points (i.e. the tips) on your pieces you haven’t played. Maximize your score! The solitaire rules are the same, except that all same-colored contiguous groups are factors in your score, and all colors' leftover points penalize you.

On your turn, place one of your pieces on the board according to the following rules:

Pieces are not allowed to point at their own color in an adjacent space!
No two adjacent pieces are allowed to point at each other!
You must place it in a space already pointed to by an adjacent piece belonging to an opponent.
It is not allowed to point out of the edge of the board. If there is no valid play for you, you simply pass your turn. If all players pass consecutively, the game is over.

name: AirFrame
description:
A standalone miniatures wargame of future air superiority from One Pound Wargames, AirFrame allows players to assemble and customize their formation using existing air combat models from their collection. The game focuses on tactical manoeuvre and resource management in the 3-dimensional battlespace. AirFrame can also be combined with MechaWar for combined arms battles.

Each airframe comes with a variable number of stat points depending upon their value. These are allocated by the player across four stats covering speed, firepower, armour and defence. Each airframe performs two manoeuvres a turn, with enemy airframes able to react with responsive manoeuvres.

Damage will degrades your ability to stay in the air, but a critical hit may blow your opponent out of the sky in a single, devastating strike!

Key features:


Miniatures wargame of future aerial combat.
Integrated turn sequence.
Action-based turns.
d12s for shooting.
Customizable statlines.
Fully compatible with MechaWar from One Pound Wargames.
Designed for use with any range of modern or science fiction aircraft, and compatible with scales from 1/805 (2mm) to 1/161 (10mm)

name: Road Wolf
description:
Road Wolf is a free, home made, tabletop, turn based game of highway combat. Players choose vehicles, crew, and components and engage each other in high-speed scenarios on the road.

Physical components include a road (easy to make your own), vehicles (modified Matchbox or Hot Wheels cars work fine), dice, measuring sticks, record sheets for vehicles, and counters for crew and equipment (downloadable for free).

Players choose a scenario and purchase vehicles as described by the scenario. Most scenarios pit one player (or team of players) against another, with different win conditions depending on the scenario.

Unlike many vehicle games that rely on arena combat, Road Wolf follows vehicles traveling down a long, dangerous road. Movement is relative to the other vehicles, as all vehicles are assumed to be hurtling forward down the road, represented by a "road" move at the end of each turn. Hazards such as bridges or debris can move "towards" the vehicles during the road move, as can immobilized vehicles.

Each turn, vehicles get two actions to spend moving, shooting, or other actions. Vehicles may Ram or Melee each other as part of a move action, encouraging close combat. Degrees of success can damage or destroy vehicles or crew, or cause wipeout checks that can lead to lost ground or even chain reaction crashes.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Imperialism: Victorian Era Wargame Rules
description:
Microbadge:


User Summary

This set of rules was in constant use for the better part of two decades by the Western Washington Wargamers (W3). Imperialism is an eminently playable and reasonably realistic set of miniatures rules.

The game is a simultaneous movement wargame, utilizing paper maps (or overlays and grease pencils) to plot movement. The game also uses casualty record sheets to record "damage" prior to a stand being eliminated. Six sided dice are used for combat randomization and modified according to a unit's type and morale.

The rules were originally written for use with 20mm/25mm figures, however the game is easily scaled to 15mm (and even 6mm or 2mm).

Appendices include army lists and values (so that custom armies can be created), suggested reading and viewing lists, and sources of miniature figures (several of which are still valid 30 years later).

name: Bit Shift
description:
Bit Shift is a game of wits and bits. Each player‚Äã‚Äã gets a handful of cards with a combination of 0's and 1's and must get the central board, which also consists of 0's and 1's, to match the cards in their hand.

Each player takes turns modifying the board to try and either score or try to prevent their opponents from scoring!

name: Runes and Bones
description:
Runes and Bones have been sources of power and divination for Tribal Orc Spirit Talkers for countless generations. As the wisdom of the few remaining spirit talkers fell to the blood lust that consumes the race, the Runes and Bones once used to guide the strategy of the warriors now serve only to entertain them. What once was an honored system of divination, now serves as a campfire game for Orcish warriors everywhere.

From the Creator:
Runes and Bones was created in the summer of 2006 as I was preparing for a 10 day trip to meet up with my Orcish horde for Ragnarok XXI. Ragnorok is the most popular annual event for Dagorhir Battle Games Association. It is a week of camping, characterization, and warfare. I wanted something that felt tribal and could accommodate many players, thus, Runes and Bones was born. I have created many sets since then for other camping trips and cons.

Gameplay:
When playing Runes and Bones you go around the circle and bid bones in exchange for runes from the bag, which you then play to attempt to win the pot. Runes have a variety of characteristics which determine which runes they beat and vice-versa. You are also able to barter runes and/or bones from other players on your turn. If, on your turn, the rune you played last turn is still the winning rune, you win the pot.

name: Asteroid Junkies! 5-6 player expansion
description:
This expansion requires the Asteroid Junkies! game to play, but includes all parts needed to play with five or six players!
BONUS: A new set of rules provides different variants for more options when playing Asteroid Junkies.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Viy
description:
"Viy" is a card game based on the story of Nikolay Gogol. The game is in development.

The players will take a role of one of special orthodox monks fighting the evil spirits. Their task is to send the witch to the hell. It requires joint efforts to serve three nights for the repose of the "dead" witch and to do not allow her to return to the living world.

At the same time the monks have to constantly clean the temple from arriving evil spirits, sending them back to the underworld. During the night the monk can be affected by one or more demons. If the brothers don't conduct an exorcism in a proper time, affected monk moves to the side of evil forces. Such player gets a special assignment. His sole victory depends on this exercise.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Medieval, Novel-based, Religious
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Triple Delight
description: Nudge out the other players to snag the best position on the table to show off your award winning desserts. In this flicking, flipping dexterity game you will flick your tokens on the table to surround and capture opponents’ pieces while you try to defend your own desserts. Keep an eye out for dessert eating creeps, don’t get raw egg on your desserts and, if you can, claim the trophy to protect your desserts for a time.
publishers: Friendly Menace Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: √Ålmok
description:
Álmok is a game about deep buried memories in the mind. It is a journey between dreams and nightmares. It is an experience based on the unconscious perceptions of the oniric mind.

In Álmok, the players are in deep sleep, trying to collect parts of their dreams to scape an eternal nightmare. Use your memory, find your way to the wakening, tap in sleeping powers of the unconscious mind, be the first to get free from your dreams.

Álmok uses the classic Memory Game mechanic with some twists to make the game more dynamic and enjoyable. In your turn, you turn cards face up and check if they are a group, like the classic game, but here, the groups must have 3 cards, but you can combine then using their color or their number, much like a rummy game. Each group you form, give you points and also a special dream ability that you can use later to gain even more points or save for bonus points in the end of the game.

The player who reaches a certain amount of points first (based on the number of players), is the winner.

name: Ultima 1: The Boardgame
description:
A remake of the original Ultima 1 computer game by Richard Garriott but in Print & Play boardgame format. For [1] player/solitaire gaming.

The game will consist of all [4] map board continents with each map containing four quadrants printed on 11x17 sheets, which allows you to play on one board at a time or put them all together for one big gameboard.

You can play as one of four character types: THIEF, MAGE, FIGHTER or CLERIC who adventures across the lands of Sosaria, ie gameboards, to accomplish goals, gather gold, gather gems, weapons, armor, spells and scrolls, travelling aids, and equipment. Adventure into Dark Dungeons, Castles, and Towns for Supplies, Equipment and information. Speak with Kings to gather information about the location of all four gems, Fight wandering monsters and evil individuals, open chest to find riches, plus level up and increase your characters abilities and win the game by discovering secret information, finding lost treasures, and defeating the evil overlord "Big Boss" Mondain.

All the fun of the original Ultima 1 but with more challenges, more monsters, more riches, and more fame... plus in a Print & Play board game format.

I've taken some liberty with the game since a board game can't do everything a computer can do but should keep the original play as close to the PC game as possible.

For those of you who have played through the original PC game, you will find that this board game will be similar experience with you traveling, searching, and fighting your way across Sosaria. Just remember that you are now the computer and will be tracking all your stats and information.

I will also try to add as many random elements to the game so each time you play it will be the same Ultima 1 but with a little different experience.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Far from Home
description:
Far from Home is a SCIFI board game where two space crews vie for survival. Only the destruction of the enemy capital ship will ensure the future of your crew. Out thinking your enemy and the successful allocation of your resources are your only means of success. The timely deployment and upgrading of your ships may provide a necessary advantage but watch out, your enemy will do whatever it takes to survive. You do have an ace up your sleeve, the powerful Capital Laser. But its success is dependent on a roll of the die and your opponent’s resolve to shield it. Do you have what it takes to survive far from home?

Far from Home is a Print and Play SCIFI wargame for an audience looking to scratch the SCIFI wargame itch in under an hour.
The game itself prints on two 8 1/2 x 11 sheets of paper: 1 sheet with Map and the other sheet with ships-double sided, required tokens, and a tech tree.

Pennies are used for action points.

The rule book is 5 pages long.
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Leopard Tracks
description:
These rules are for use with Modern micro armor miniatures in 1/285th and 1/300th scale. The rules are suitable for use with HO scale models if adjustments are made to the sizes of the artillery and bomb grids.

Ground scale is 1"=50 yds (1:1800) and each turn represents about 1 minute. 6, 12 and 20 sided dice, rulers and playing pieces are required for play. Sighting distances in unobstructed areas range from 40" to 80", so the playing area should take this into account. Players provide their own terrain as required by their scenario instuctions.

The rules concisely cover movement, sighting, vehicles, infantry, artillery, chemical weapons, smoke, minefields, aircraft, helicopters and antiaircraft artillery.

Using the information in the military organization section, players can deploy a military force based on a country's actual military practices.

name: Donelson Breakout
description:
Donelson Breakout covers the Confederate attempt to escape from Grant's siege of Fort Donelson. It uses the Age of Rifles system, for a fast, low to moderate complexity, brigade-level game of ACW battles. Interactive Sequence of play, orders, and a modern, fire-based combat system (no odds optimising!). To win, you have to use your army like a 19th century commander. Maintaining morale is the key. Running away will inspire defeatism in your troops just as heavy losses, but no side will emerge unscratched when encountering the enemy. Among all this you have to contend with multiple subordinates on a battlefield where no information can be sent faster than a rider can go. How you are able to orchestrate your leaders to enable effective concentration of force will decide the battle.

The system combines a grand tactical perspective (battle strategy, not micromanagement) with a focus on a historically sound use of your units. Four pages of basic rules aim at an easy entry into the world of pre-industiral command and combined arms with four types of orders and assault combat, cavalry charges, and artillery bombardment. Nine pages of full rules add concepts such as additional order types, written orders (although markers are available for those who do not wish to write), reaction charges, and enfilading fire. Finally, 2 pages of Advanced and Optional rules add hidden movement, division level doctrine, and others.

Scale:
400m per hex
1 hour per turn
brigade level units
Individual army and division commanders
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Haunted Dungeon
description:
Each player acts as a friend, relative, or associate of one of the greatest heroes in the land. The characters have all been kidnapped by the Jagjit, the Dark King of Aloion, and taken to a place known only as the Haunted Dungeon to be used as sacrifices. Jagjit hopes to bring about the return of Artamog the Butcher, an ancient dark god. Artamog the Butcher once ruled over all the world before Rachna, the Goddess of Creation, sealed Artamog and his children away from the world.
The characters must rescue themselves from the Haunted Dungeon. If the characters die while within the confines of the dungeon, Artamog will return to the world. If even one character escapes alive, the world will be safe, for now.
This is a tile based fantasy dungeon crawl. The goal is to fight through the rooms, collect items for defense, find and defeat the dungeon boss (a powerful enemy guarding the only exit), and escape.
As a twist, dead characters become ghosts and are still capable of influencing the game.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Medieval, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Melancholy Media, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: On Wings: World War II Aerial Combat
description:
This is a rule set of aerial combat set in WW2, Dynamic cartoon style aircraft capture the prominent features of the real planes. Though the aircraft are comic book drawn the maneuvers and abilities are based on reported aircraft performance both anecdotal and charted.

During a game players control from 2 to 12 aircraft by selecting an maneuver on their aircraft information cards, using a dry erase marker. the considerations in selecting a maneuver gaining advantage on the enemy position, and altitude, The maneuvers are then translated into the models movement on the table via a single maneuver template. various speeds of flight are handled in what maneuvers are available to a given aircraft. After moving, aircraft have opportunity to fire at valid targets. Fire combat uses a simple dice system and each craft has its own damage chart encompassing it's special strengths and weaknesses.

The game design features an uncluttered tabletop, squadron building, and aerial terrain and built in altitude rules. Basic and advanced rules allow you to choose what level of detail you prefer.
Scenarios including ground attack, bomber interception, meeting engagements and more. Each with their own criteria for victory: every thing from hit the target hard and get away, to total control of the skies, to protect your valuable bombers or airbase.

The rules are now available via War game vault, and include elevated paper counters to represent the aircraft models.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Fishin' Holes
description: Fishin' Holes is a family-style tile and token game designed for people of all ages. Players take turns casting out to explore tiles, then reeling in by claiming tiles with their tokens. The game has elements of memorization, poker-like bluffing, and some risk taking. The goal is to capture the most fish while staying away from hazards like old tires, boots, or weeds. The game contains 60 pond tiles, wooden player tokens and bonus fish pieces, a score pad and instruction booklet. Rules are simple enough for children as young as age 8, but there is enough strategy to make this enjoyable for adults as well. The game works well for 2-5 players and takes about 30 minutes to play.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Memory, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Erie
description:
A set collection and negotiation game centered around the early days of the Erie Canal. Players move along the canal collecting cards depicting the various cities along the waterway. Players use a rondel to move, draw cards, and trade cards with other players. Specific numbers of City cards are then traded in to allow placement of a warehouses in one of the two good types depicted on a specific city.

A fluctuating economic chart, based on the number of total goods on the board, determines the current price of a warehouse in each good. The player with the most total value in goods at the end of the game wins.

name: AT-43 Army Box: Red Blok
description:
Contains a complete Red Block company for AT-43 the ready assembled and painted miniatures game.
• 1 unit of 12 Krasnye Soldaty: regular infantry containing three grenade launchers, two medics and an officer
• 1 unit of 8 Krasnye Soldaty: regular infantry containing one grenade launcher, two mechanics and an officer
• 6 Dragonov Kommandos: elite infantry with one sniper rifle, an electronic warfare specialist, a medic and an officer
• Odin O-1 and Manon O-2: the Red Blok’s two greatest heroes
• 1 Urod: Odin O-1’s and Manon O-2’s combat strider
• 1 Dotch Yaga: the most heavily armored combat strider to ever grace the battlefield
• 6 low walls
• 1 container
• Introductory Rules
• 1 Red Blok revolutionary forces tactical manual
• 1 game poster
• 12 dice
• 1“Red Blok” ruler
• 1 explosion template
• 26 game cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Black Plague Blind Date
description:
Dating is hard in the 14th century, and as a matchmaker, business is slim. The plague has most folks too afraid to leave their homes, let alone go out looking for romance. Literacy is very low, so the letters you receive from clients are oftten difficult to make out. To make matters worse, you're not the only match-maker in town.

To come out on top of your rival matchmakers you will have to go with what little information you can decipher and find matches for your clients. At times it will be in your best interest you to work with your opponents, at others it will benefit you to set devious traps for them.

Love is in the air! But so is the plague...

In Black Plague Blind Date, players take turns choosing a card from their hands to play face down as a "blind date". They then must truthfully describe their card with 1-3 colored "info cubes" (blue = male, pink = female, black = infected, white = healthy, green = high class, brown = low class). Cards change hands during the exchange phase, then each player plays a second card face up next to any blind date. Blind dates are revealed and reputation points are scored based upon the best/worst dates.
