SET UP: starting position is for a standard game, 12 pieces per side, moving one space forward diagonally, obligatory captures. Kings are made whenever a friendly piece is landed on, and move forward or backward per the norm.

GOING TO HELL (or back to Heaven): when an enemy piece is jumped over, it is moved to the left (of the jumping player) to the nearest empty or friendly occupied square in the same row. If landing on a friendly piece it becomes a king. If there are no such spaces left in a row the jumped piece is removed from the game. Movement rules on light squares are the same for dark.

name: Gothic Line: The Campaign in Northern Italy ‚Äì August to October, 1944
description: Gothic Line: The Campaign in Northern Italy – AUGUST TO OCTOBER, 1944 is a simulation of the battles in the Northern Apennines mountains fought to cross the Po River and end the war in Italy by Christmas 1944. This game simulates the campaign at the battalion/division level. Each combat strength point of Divisions/brigades/regiments are represented by standard military unit symbols (with a few exceptions) and each combat strength point is equivalent to one combat maneuver battalion, while units represented by armoured vehicles consist primarily of battalions of tanks (or armoured cars, in the case of the cavalry/armoured car units)(armoured divisions, though having tanks, are still at least half infantry battalion units). The combat system is based on differential, rather than odds, as each combat unit fights one against one as opposed to a hex(es) unit aggregate vs unit aggregate. Corps/army artillery and air are separate components added to combat, as both played an important part in the struggle and really could not be factored into unit value. Gothic Line: The Campaign in Northern Italy – AUGUST TO OCTOBER, 1944 is a desk top publishing type of game, with a self-sticking countersheet mountable on standard 1/2 inch counters, rulebook, charts, and full color map.

name: Sabotage!
description: Be the first player to play a run, 1 through 5, without having two cards of the same color next to each other, in this fast paced card game of swapping, skipping, sabotaging, and strategizing for 2-4 players.

name: Hunny Hunters
description: In this game, players take on the role of grizzly bears who are trying to collect their beloved honey. Yet, they can never get their precious without taking some risks. Not only are there furious wasps and bees ready for revenge but also their bear buddies may be casting a covetous eye and trying to snatch each others’ honey with their bear hands (no pun intended). There are different types of function cards in the game which allow the players to do different things such as finding out what is hidden in the beehives or taking another player’s tile. Players can use their memory and deception skills to make full use of the different functions and turn it into a mind game, in which the winner will have outdone the others by tricking their opponents and earning the most honey. At the end of game, players score points for each honey tile that they own. The honey bee and wasps cause no instant harm to the players during the game, however if the players still have them in their baskets when the game ends, they will be penalized. The player with the highest score wins the game.
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Hitler Turns South
description:
Hitler Turns South is an effort to link several Europa games into a single Campaign encompassing the entire Mediterranean Theater of Operations of World War II. In this instance, the Campaign is based on the hypothesis that the Axis powers have turned their attention in 1941 not to invading the Soviet Union, but to securing their southern flank and simultaneously depriving Britain of vital interests: Gibraltar, the Nile delta, the Suez canal, the Near Eastern oilfields, and the head of the Persian Gulf.


Rules - 20 pages
National Data Sheets - 54 pages (UK, USSR, Germany, Italy, Vichy France, French North Africa, The Levant, Spain, Portugal, Rumania, Bulgaria, Hungary, Greece, Yugoslavia, Turkey, Egypt, Iraq, Iran)

name: Kaputt!
description:
Kaputt is a strategy wargame -sort of 'postmodern soccerchess'– with the essencial difference that the board itself is always changing, giving a completely different experience each time you play this hilarious and surprising battle.

Configure your soldiers. Attack and/or move with them and carry the time-bomb to the enemy's headquarters. Do it carefully, so the opponent can't stole it from you and make your strategy a nightmare!

Walk on a battlefield composed by 133 mixed pieces full of surprises: mines, tunnels (they transport you to other tunnels!), ruins, barricades and incognito fields. Ruins and incognito fields which make you draw the most bizarre cards you've ever heard of.

Winning will be the most hilarious experience with «Kaputt».
categories: Exploration, Humor, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Mothership
description:
Humans have become the cheapest and most dependable sources of labor in the Deep Intersect, a far-out sector of the Polystellar Intersystem. And the outer system Space Law, the code of order that makes it illegal to abduct Humans, is poorly enforced.

Each player plays as one of four Alien species, each with a special power that will help them expand their control of the galaxy. Players must collect Flux Cores and abduct as many Humans as they can while expanding and maintaining their control of the galaxy.

On a turn, each player plays an Action card and assigns its Action Points. Then, the player rolls three Energy Cubes (dice) and 'burns' the Energy Value (pips) at the various Power Cores around the board or Species card. Players must collect Flux Cores (+1VP), which are needed to abduct Humans (+2VP) and explore the galaxy (+VP), in order to earn VPs and win the game.

Action Cards also have a Combat Bonus that can be applied in a Space Battle, where the struggle for control is most apparent. Each Alien species also has a unique species trait that is also applied in a Space Battle. Players also struggle for control of the galaxy in a tug-of-war fashion on the Control track.

When the last Human has been abducted, the game is over. The player with the most VPs wins. Ties are settled with one last Space Battle, with the current VPs included as a combat bonus.

Requires 3 (or more) dice, 4 tokens, and all included files.
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #13
description:
The Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #13 is composed of 2 expansions:

Lords of Vegas: Skybridge / Building Boom / Card Sharp
This adds a bridge to connect two regions together. The Sky Bridge ruleset begins the game with a connection, whereas the Building Boom allows for players to add Sky Bridges as an action.

Villainy: Turf War
After defeating the other villains, your team takes control of a key location in the city. This location gives your team some additional rewards.

This is available in Game Trade Magazine (Issue 178 - Dec 2014).

name: Nation Builder
description:
Nation Builder is a game that puts players in the position of administering a small nation that is struggling to survive in the shadow of the world's super powers. The world has been shaken by an economic meltdown. The power void left over has given your nation the ability to grow without the usual pressure caused by the larger powers. But they will not be idle for long.

Part of the challenge is running against the clock. You have a limited time to build up your own country and defend it against the political interference of your fellow gamers, as well as the constant meddling of the super nations of USA, China, Russia, and the European Bloc.

This Deck-Builder game brings in all the elements of managing Populations, Technology, Military, Social issues, Infrastructure, and Economics. By the time you have played this game to the end you will have a much deeper understanding of the problems facing real world leaders. Smaller countries of the world often struggle against the odds to become successful and independent in the face of outside interference. Can you take on the task? It is a difficult balancing act. One wrong move and the game can be your enemy just as easily as the people sitting next to you.

name: Planes: Bravo
description:
Expansion kit for Planes: High Pilotage game.

Kit includes 1 Bravo model (which you assemble snapfit) and 1 Bravo Plane card for the game.

There is no additional flight stand included.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Goal: The Match
description:
Plan, Play and Goal!

Description
Goal: the Match is a thrilling Collectible Football Card Game that simulates a soccer match using an strategic view between two players, from now on they’re gonna be called Managers to distinguish them from football players.

You could play a complete game of modern football: Goals, fouls, yellow/red cards, set pieces, tackles, waste of time, etc. in a game of 40 minutes approximately.

In Goal: the Match you could assemble a team, the cards that will lead your style and the action cards that your team will deploy. All those cards will be get through a basic box and random card packs.

Football players allows you to play cards, style cards will mark the general path about how they will be played and the action deck will determine what and how the team plays the match.

A brief summary

At the beginning of the turn. The manager with initiative will choose to realize one of the following turns: Move Turn or Highlight Turn.

1) Move turn: Represents the major and boring part of the match and normally doesn’t appear in the highlights of the news. In this turn teams deploy their game. It’s divided in two phases: Initiative and Replica.

In this type of turn, the manager will start the Initiative phase by playing cards from hand (cost of cards is paid by field players), activating player special abilities and/or interacting with strategy cards previously deployed and style cards(They are deployed from the beginning). What is more, the cost in minutes of every played card will be increase the total minutes of the match. The Initiative phase ends when he stops playing cards or abilities.

After that the opponent Manager will play a replica phase, in which he could carry a similar phase up to the maximum of minutes played in the Initiative phase by the opponent. Taking into account that some of the cards can only be played in the initiative phase(marked with an icon in the cost). This phase means the opponent is playing and deploying its strategy, not just waiting looking at the match.

2) Highlight turn: It represents what is amazing in a match , those scenes we watch in the TV match summaries. Contains up to two phases, attack phase and a possible counterattack phase(or even more than one).

Phase attack begins with the manager with initiative increasing the time in one minute. Beginning from him the following possibilities are gonna be played. a) Fast action card from hand b) Abilities from strategy card previously deployed c) Player abilities. When no one wants to continue, Both will throw 3 dices of 6 faces. Also the defending manager will throw two incidence dices (they signal possible fouls,yellow/red cards, injuries, set pieces, etc) the difference after bonuses will mark what has happened: Goal, Dangerous play, good defence and CounterAttack.

At the end of replica turn or Highlight turn both Managers untap players and cards in the field and draw two more cards 2 (with a hand limit of 8 cards).

QR Code
Each one of the game cards has a qr code QR that redirect to our database directly to this card page where any manager could solve doubts and everything about that card.

Manager ID
Manager ID (MID) cames along with each copy of Goal: The Match. It’s used to measure your level as a manager. After being registered you may annotate results of your matches with other Managers with MID in order to follow statistics. At the end of season you may win amazing prizes!!

name: The Task of Ezrok: Courage of the Companions
description: Courage of the Companions is an expansion for The Task of Ezrok solitaire card game; set in a heroic fantasy world that revolves around druids. The player oversees Ezrok and his companions as they travel northward to destroy the Chest of Seth. This expansion provides greater game depth by adding character roster cards, ‘Druid Blessings’ cards, and enhancements for side-quests. In addition, new encounters are introduced via the ‘Necroheim Emerges’ and ‘Wandering Threats’ decks. This expansion includes a total of 32 new cards along with a 2-page set of rules.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: The Task of Ezrok: Ezrok Unleashed
description: Ezrok Unleashed is an expansion for The Task of Ezrok solitaire card game; set in a heroic fantasy world that revolves around druids. The player oversees Ezrok and his companions as they travel northward to destroy the Chest of Seth. This expansion provides greater game depth by adding Power Cards, Battle Surge cards, and enhancements for side quests. In addition, new encounters are introduced via the ‘Necroheim Emerges’ and ‘Wandering Threats’ decks. This expansion includes a total of 32 new cards along with a 2-page set of rules.

name: The Task of Ezrok: The Journey Home
description: The Journey Home is an expansion for The Task of Ezrok solitaire card game; set in a heroic fantasy world that revolves around druids. The player oversees Ezrok and his companions as they travel northward to destroy the Chest of Seth. This expansion provides a greater game experience for the return-trip variant outlined in the core game rules. It adds cards designed to boost your success, press your luck, and provide enhancements for side-quests. In addition, new encounters are introduced via the ‘Necroheim Emerges’ and ‘Wandering Threats’ decks. This expansion includes a total of 32 new cards along with a 2-page set of rules.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Princess Matchup Game and Puzzle
description:
There are two ways to play this fun matching game – Face Up Match Up for the youngest players and Memory Match Up for kids 3+. In Face Up Match Up place all cards face up on a table or smooth surface. Have an adult request a match. For instance, “can you find the “7s?” Children can take turns or compete to see who finds the most matches. Or have the child pick up twelve cards in numeric order. For a more challenging game, turn the cards face down and play a memory matching game. Try to make matches by turning over two cards on each turn. If the cards match, take the cards. If they do not match turn them back over in the same place in the game. A challenging puzzle keeps the fun going for years to come.

Why families love this item:
Make learning numbers fun with a girl’s favorite theme – princesses! Colorful dancing princesses adorn each card. Each card includes the numeral, the number word, and a physical representation of the number in symbol. The compact box makes this a terrific take-along item.

name: Rainbow Volcano
description: Players attempt to empty their hands by extending the paths of an erupting volcano. Every card has to match the prior color, but most cards change the color of that path. The paths will branch, change colors, and sometimes be blocked entirely. Furthermore, colored villagers are fleeing from the volcano, and cards can also be played to match their colors. Players play up to 3 cards each turn, so it is important to plan ahead and build ‘combos’ by saving up sets of cards that can chain off of each other.

name: ATS Core Module: Bulge ‚Äì The Battle of the Bulge at Hotton/Melines/Quatre-Bras Crossroads
description:
Small-unit tactical treatment of the battles in and around Hotton, Melines and Quatre Bras during The Battle of the Bulge, using the Advanced Tobruk System rules.
These battles can be re-enacted in twenty all-new scenarios for Advanced Tobruk System, partnered up with four all-new cardstock maps with winter terrain, AFV cards and the usual Battlefield Walkaround with historical notes and all the special rules for this module. Additionally, 2½ sheets of combat unit counters are included, representing the German and American soldiers and weapons in play during this crucial struggle.

Requires ATS Rules, playaids, and standard ATS markers, sold separately.

name: Empire
description:
In an age of exploration, rival nations battle for dominance. Discover new lands. Amass great wealth. Gather support. Above all, ensure imperial stability in a time of chaos.

Empire is a board game of strategy, commerce, diplomacy, and power. Two to six players play as 18th century colonial nations competing to inspire the support of their people by providing them with valuable goods. Nations produce goods by working their people on territories gained in a shifting array of ongoing wars. Goods are also sold to an open market where players set the price to finance more armies.

Players can also trade any of their resources with any other player at any time. Empire offers completely free, open and unfettered trading and diplomacy. Empire's turn-less simultaneous action selection system allows negotiation and exchange to integrate smoothly into the game flow.

Empire is fast-paced and filled with tense decisions, negotiation, and trading. The game lasts around 30 minutes, has no dice or similar randomness, and takes about 5 minutes to explain.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Grimdark Racing
description:
Grimdark Racing is an action packed and explosive game inspired by video-games like Mario Kart and Crash Team Racing. Up to 8 players take part in a deadly race full of items, hazards and crazy tracks to see who is the king of the road.

Grimdark Racing is a single-page ruleset played with Warhammer 40.000 miniatures that was designed to be fast to learn and simple to play.

The system allows you to challenge your friends in an explosive race full of crazy gadgets and hilarious accidents waiting to happen around the very next corner.

We recommend going all out with this! Create an awesome track littered with hazards and made of many twists, turns, jumps, etc. We also recommend taking some time and converting your vehicles into mad racers full of personality!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Golf: A game of Mathing through Hazards
description:
Golf is a simple fast paced card game for 2-7 people in which players take turns solving problems using the four basic arithmetic operators; addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.

Golf is designed to be versatile to fit your play group, with simultaneous or sequential play which will help to keep even the most easily distracted player from becoming distracted.

This game has some great educational potential, and is a fantastic game for the in-between times during your board game night. Much like many other filler games in this time range (~30min), the joy is in the exercise and this exercise keeps the downtime low and your mind always active.

name: Bounty Hunter: A Game of Adventure in the Old West.
description:
Bounty Hunter is a game where players assume the roles of Bounty Hunters in the Wild West. Your Bounty Hunter must track down and defeat Wanted and desperate Outlaws and turn them in for reward money. The more Outlaws your Hunter turns in, the greater his or her Fame or Stature will be, which, may make it more difficult to apprehend Outlaws. There will be plenty of obstacles and hazards to hinder your Hunters progress including hostile Indians, bandits, highwaymen, harsh climates, hazardous terrain and much more.

Game Objective: The objective in Bounty Hunter is to be the Player with the highest Stature Rating at the end of the Game. The Game ends when all Outlaws have been captured and Victory conditions have been compared. Players can choose to play a Short Game with 11 Outlaws, a Medium Game with 15 Outlaws or a Long Game with 21 Outlaws.

Game Features: Bounty Hunter contains many colorful counters featuring Outlaws, Cowboys, Townfolk, Gunslingers, Soldiers and Native American Warriors. The game includes a large, 6 sheet map with large hexes, representing various terrain of the Western Territories of the United States. There is a nice variety of weapons and items to equip your Bounty Hunter with in order for him or her to bring justice to Wild West.

Combat can be played out on the Game Map or on the Combat Mat provided.

BOUNTY HUNTER can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Gulag
description:
In Gulag, you take on the role of a loyal or disloyal worker in a totalitarian regime, the former trying to complete a Canal and the latter trying to sabotage the same.

As a loyal worker, you win by finding other loyal workers and play work cards to add work to the Canal. As a disloyal worker, you win by finding other disloyal workers and play strike cards to prevent work from being added. The Canal is completed if enough work cards are played.

The game starts with each player drawing one worker card, looking at it and giving it to the player to the right. Each player knows the loyalty of one other.

The workers secretly select one work card or one strike card each. The supervisor then decides whether to supervise one of them. If supervised, the worker must replace the selected card and select the other (opposite) card instead.

The commissar shuffles and discloses the cards and add the played work cards (if any) to the Canal. When all players have played the role of the commissar, the game ends.

The semi-hidden information where each player knows one player and is known by another player creates a paranoid gameplay. "He knows my loyalty but which is his loyalty?" "Should I play according to my goal and hope to escape supervision or should I play against my goal and hope to get corrected?"

There are many questions but whom can you trust to answer?

name: Like the Tide into a Breach: The Battle of Neville's Cross
description:
Like the tide into a breach: the Battle of Neville’s Cross is a simulation of the battle that took place between the armies of England and Scotland in 1346, during the Medieval period. The battle forms part of both the Hundred Years’ War and the Second War of Scottish Independence.

The game is played over ten turns. Chronologically, a turn corresponds to about half an hour. At the end of the 10th turn the battle ends and the situation will be assessed using a scoring system. The resulting score will determine the outcome.

Combat results are resolved by the rolling of two six-sided dice, with various modifiers applied as detailed in the rules. Different types of unit have different characteristics, with terrain affecting how far a unit can move, how easy it is to break and its ability to either engage in melee or attack using archery.

name: Brandywine
description:
This is a low complexity game of the Battle of Brandywine using the Two Buck games AWI rules but with a little more complexity added. Leaders are featured in this game and the map is twice as large as a normal Two Buck Game.

Set up is quick and plays in under an hour and as a wonderful teaching tool for young gamers but has enough what if options to have a lot of replay value.

name: Demi: Labyrinth of the Gods
description:
Demi: Labyrinth of the Gods is a cooperative game where each player takes on the role of a modern day demigod (there are eight to choose from). These 2-4 players must then work together to navigate a labyrinth that shifts and changes as you play, while trying to accomplish the task of finding three ancient artifacts the gods have demanded in order to prove your worth and gain access to the exit - but there's a catch! This labyrinth is filled with mythic monsters and traps...

This is a tile-based game. A grid of thirty face-down tiles represent rooms within the labyrinth. Players move together as one, flipping over a room to move into it, one room at a time. To represent the fact that the Labyrinth is always in motion, when the players enter a new room they choose the orientation of that room (provided one entrance/exit points back the way they came). They then replace the room they came from with a room from the next difficulty tier.

Within each room they draw from an encounter deck and face off against monsters out of Greek mythology, traps, or if lucky - a pile of resources they can use to upgrade their gear or utilize their special abilities.

Each of the eight demigods has three special abilities: A Free Ability they can utilize anytime the text applies, a Cost Ability they can pay resources they've gathered to activate, and a Coin-Flip ability they receive later in the game, letting them tempt the fates for a positive or potentially negative outcome.

Winning means reaching opposite corners three times to gather the three artifacts, then back once more to find the exit - the shifting rooms that are constantly replaced as you progress means player tactics in room orientation to determine the route become a deciding factor in the group's ability to make it out alive.

name: Werewolf: All Hallows' Eve Expansion
description:
Werewolf: All Hallows' Eve Expansion added 11 new cards to Corey Fields' version of Werewolf.


22 cards, 2 each of the following
White Wolf
Artist
Devil
Cleric
Lunatic
Scarecrow
Monster
Banshee
Jack
Creature
Death

name: Werewolf: Silent Night Expansion
description:
Werewolf: Silent Night Expansion adds 23 Christmas themed cards to Corey Fields Kickstarter Werewolf deck.


23 Cards, 2 each of the following cards
Santa
Krampus
Naughty
Nice
Elf
Reindeer
Spriggan
Esteru
Winter
Gryla
Boreas
Yeti (bonus card, one copy)

name: Viaje de Espa√±a al Japon en Globo, Bicicleta, Vapor y Diligencia
description:
Viaje de España al Japon en Globo, Bicicleta, Vapor y Diligencia (eng. Travel from Spain to Japan with Balloon, Bicycle, Steamboat and Stagecoach) is a vintage spin and move game published in Spain. Players spin the spinning die with 4 paintings on the sides: Balloon, Bicycle, Steamboat and Stagecoach. Player could travel around the board only with that vehicle, which picture he see on the top of the spinning die.
The first player, who cross all route, wins the game.

name: Director's Cut: The Card Game
description:
In Director's Cut: The Card Game, players are Hollywood movie producers in the early 20th century. Each player will try to put together the best movie-making teams in order to maximise the profit from each movie they make.

As movie producers, players will hire cast and crew from a central shared market, while trying to deny their opponent access to key cast and crew members. Once a player has assembled a set of cast and crew cards, they will play these cards to produce a movie from a shared set of screenplays. Each screenplay has its own set of cast requirements and awards cash and other bonuses, based on the quality of the production. The richest player at the end of the game is the winner.

Director's Cut: The Card Game is a game about set collection and resource management. It's suitable for 2 players and takes around 15 minutes to play.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Themisto
description:
Make a 5 in a row in any color for the win!

Materials
8x8 checkerboard
28 Reversi (Othello) disks

Setup
The 28 disks are placed on the border spaces of the board in an alternating pattern of black and white.

Play
Decide who goes first in any convenient manner, turns then alternate.

On a turn, you must either,

1) Move a piece (black or white) any distance in a straight line, orthogonally or diagonally, without jumping over other pieces, then flipping the moved piece over and ending the move in an empty space that is adjacent (orthogonally or diagonally) to at least one other piece on the board or

2) Move a piece (following the movement rule above) from a row consisting of three or four like-colored adjacent (orthogonal or diagonal) pieces, but in doing so, you lose your next turn or

3) After moving a piece, on the same turn, you may perform a custodian Capture by having the moved piece, and another like colored piece on either side of at least one straight (orthogonal or diagonal) occupied line of opposed colored pieces (1-3 pieces if you are player one or 1 or more if player two). The trapped piece(s) are then flipped over.

Restrictions
A player may not repeat the board position of the previous turn.

Object
The game ends, and a win is made, when player one makes a five in a row (orthogonally or diagonally) in either color or player two a row of five or more in either color.

name: hex6d
description:
Hex6d is a scale-able strategy/family game for 2-6 players that takes, on average, 10-20 minutes to play. Manage your cards and playing pieces to win!

The playing field consists of blank (black) hexes and numbered/lettered (purple) hexes that represent cards from a standard playing card deck. Be the first player (at the end of your turn) to properly align your pawns on the playing field hexes so they individually match every card in your hand.
Ex: If a player has a 4, 5, and 9 in their hand, their pawns must be on a 4, 5, and 9. If a players has a 6, 6, and J in their hand, their pawns must be on a 6, 6, and J.

Set-Up:
Standard game: Place the starting hex in the middle and then around that, the same number of Playing Field hexes as there are players. The Playing Field hexes are oriented so the middle playing line is connected to the Starting hex and additional playing lines are able to connect to Playing Field hexes to the right and left (if they are being used).
Modified game (Number and/or Placement of Playing Field hexes): To make the game harder or easier, you can use less or more Playing Field hexes than the number of players. Additionally, Playing Field hexes need not be connected to each other. Example (on back page): You could have three Playing Field Hexes and neither of them connect. Note: It is recommended the number of Playing Field hexes should not be more or less than one, from the numbers of players. Example: If there are 6 players and only 3 Playing Field hexes, the game could get congested.

Modified game (Number of Pawns/Cards per Person): To make the game harder or easier, players can start off with more or less than 3 pawns. Each player must be dealt the same number of cards as they have pawns.

Pawn Movement:
Ace through 10, move one pawn a respective number of hexes: A = 1 hex, 2 = 2 hexes, 3 = 3 hexes, 4 = 4 hexes, …. 9 = 9 hexes, 10 = 10 hexes.
Jack = Move an opponent’s pawn 5 hexes.
Queen = Move one or more of your pawns a total of 5 hexes.
King = Move one of your pawns anywhere from 1 to 5 hexes.
Joker = Everyone’s cards/hand are passed to the right. Note: No pawns are moved.

name: Every Round Counts: The Dice Game
description:
A push your luck dice game

You are a bartender serving drinks in the bar, the more you serve the bigger your chance of you getting the tips

The one with the most tips wins the game

name: Greyhound vs. Bear: The Raid on Astrakhan, 1942
description:
The German raid on Astrakhan marks the eastern-most limit of the Axis invasion of the Soviet Union during WWII. What is remarkable is the small number of German units assigned to this sector, just the 16th Motorized Infantry (Greyhound) division, given the frontage and lack of substantial information regarding the Soviet’s forces. It was due to this lack of intelligence about the Soviet’s intentions and movements that the division’s reconnaissance battalion, along with some sympathetic Cossacks, was sent out from Elista on September 13th. The unit’s four day raid took them 90 miles beyond the Axis occupied village to the outskirts of Astrakhan during which they destroyed a fuel train, gathered intelligence about the nature of the Soviet’s forces, and set off alarms in the region that sent STAVKA scrambling to deal with the threat.

Greyhound vs. Bear portrays the German raid and Soviet response in a quick playing and easy to learn mini-game. Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their units and resolve combats. The game is also easy to play solitaire.

name: Dinisaurusi
description: Board game Dinosaurusi is a simple game for 2 to 4 players. Each player has one figurine. The aim is to get to the finish as soon as possible. Paths which are moving figurines on are mutually intersect. In addition to the path are arranged markers (food) that players collect. Longer paths have more markers. The player whose figurine first reaches the finish receives 6 points, second 4 and third place 2 points. It is also important to collect as many markers. Each marker delivers one point. The winner is the player who at the end of the game has the most points.
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Prehistoric, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Zombie Twist
description:
User summary:
„Çæ„É≥„Éì„ÉÑ„Ç§„Çπ„Éà (Zombie Twist) is a quick card game from the Japanese dojin circle ÂìÄÊÑÅÊóÖÈ§®„Åç„Åü„Åê„Å´ (Aisyu Ryokan Kitaguni). The game is published in an English / Japanese edition.

The players take turns to play cards from their hands to a central discard pile (as in the game UNO). The cards have instructions, such as "Make circular motions with your arms" and so on. If a player is unable to play any card, they must continue to perform the action written on the top card on the discard pile, while continuing to play the game. The first player who empties their hand is the winner, and the last player holding cards is the loser.

Publisher summary:
„ÄåÊâã„ÇíÂõû„Åô„Äç„Å™„Å©Êßò„ÄÖ„Å™Ë°åÂãï„ÅåÊõ∏„Åã„Çå„ÅüÊâãÊú≠„Çí„Ç¶„Éé„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´Â†¥„Å´Âá∫„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÊâãÊú≠„ÇíÂ†¥„Å´Âá∫„Åõ„Å™„Åè„Å™„Å£„Åü„Éó„É¨„Ç§„É§„Éº„ÅØÂ†¥„Å´ÊúÄÂàù„Å´Âá∫„ÅüÊú≠„Å´Êõ∏„Åã„Çå„ÅüÂãï„Åç„Çí„Å®„Çä„Å™„Åå„Çâ„Ç≤„Éº„É†„ÇíÁ∂ö„Åë„Å™„Åë„Çå„Å∞„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„ÄÇÊâãÊú≠„Åå„Å™„Åè„Å™„Å£„Åü„Éó„É¨„Ç§„É§„Éº„Åã„ÇâÂãùËÄÖ„Å®„Å™„Çä„ÄÅÊúÄÂæå„Åæ„ÅßÂ†¥„Å´ÊÆã„Å£„Åü„Éó„É¨„Ç§„É§„Éº„ÅåÊïóËÄÖ„Å®„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

name: Sergeants D-Day: Jagdtiger expansion
description:
For everyone willing to back D-Day Sergeants at the $250+ dollar "Heavyweight" Level, they will receive a KickStarter Exclusive Reward of being the only people ever allowed to purchase the Jagdtiger and Pershing Tank expansions.
Expansion is called Sergeants Hell on Wheels Jagdtiger. A special signed copy of the Hell on wheels rules and a certificate allowing you to buy additional Jagdtigers and persihing tanks is included.

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Parachute Infiltration Tactics expansion
description:
The Sergeants Tactics Modules are usable with both Sergeants Miniatures Game and D-Day Sergeants.
First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

Contains: 16 cards and 6 panels

name: Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry Infiltration Tactics expansion
description:
The Sergeants Tactics Modules are usable with both Sergeants Miniatures Game and D-Day Sergeants.

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

Contains; 16 cards and 6 panels

name: Tigar u lovu
description:
Tiger in hunt is a simple game for children. Each player has one figurine representing a tiger. On the board are counters where are pictures of various animals that are food for tigers.

Players collect counters by standing on marked field next to counter. Players need to collect as many counters as possbile.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Parasite
description:
Parasites have invaded a zoo in a small town. They are moving from host to host trying to exploit all the different animals. Players will take on the role of parasites and their respective hosts in an attempt to gain or steal the most points by the end of the game.

The game is played with a deck of cards containing a set of colored host cards for each player numbered 2,3,4 and 5. The deck also contains special action cards, one for each player.

Players will also receive four parasite tokens of their selected color valued 1,2,3 and 4. The players colored host cards and parasite tokens represent potential points.

The game starts with one card turned face up next to the draw pile. Drawn cards will be placed next to this card. A new row will start after five cards have been drawn.

On your turn players can (1) place a parasite on a host card, (2) move a parasite to an adjacent host or action card, (3) draw a card to place in play or (4) pass.

Drawing a card will activate a scoring phase. All previous cards are then evaluated for scoring condition. Cards of your color without any parasite tokens score the full value for the player. Cards with parasites where the value of the parasites are of less than value that the host card it is on will score points for the owner of the parasite and card owner. EXAMPLE: A three green parasite on a five blue host card will score three points for green and two points for blue.

Cards where the total of the parasites is equal to or more than the host card total, will NOT score for either player. Action cards allow players to perform a special action like move other players tokens or look through the deck.

The game is over when all the cards have been drawn and placed into the play area. The player with the highest point after all the cards have been drawn is the winner.

name: Wipeout
description: Wipeout is played on a vertical plastic tower with rows and columns of slots into which plastic surfers can be inserted. Each player starts with one surfer at the top edge of the tower. A "wave" made of green slime is loaded into a "regulator" at the top of the tower, which dispenses it to pour down the tower at a preselected speed. Players then race their surfers down the tower by rolling a die which controls movement. They try to reach the bottom of the tower first while avoiding being engulfed by the slime and "wiping out".

name: Sergeants D-Day: German Fusilier Assault Team expansion
description:
The German Fusilier Assault Team brings to bear awesome automatic firepower for assaults on the enemy. Featuring a STG44 and MP40 armed soldiers, this team is a welcome addition to any assault. These soldiers come with their basic playing cards but also 8 new Specialist cards that may include Story, Command, React and all new Equipment cards.

CONTENTS:
1 - German STG44 armed Standee with base and markers
1 - German MP40 armed Standee with base and markers
2 - sets of Soldier, Core, Rank and Specialist Cards (16 cards)

name: Archaeologia: The Goodies
description: New discovery tiles for the base game : 9 simple discovery tiles showing references to TricTracTV, Indiana Jones, Cthulhu, Terminator, a double discovery tile showing a Moai and more...
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Sirena 1793 / Ifigenia 1795
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Sirena 1793 was a frigate of the Spanish Armada that had previously served in the French Navy under the name Elene. Captured in May 1793 by frigates Santa Casilda and Perla, it returned to active service with the fleet based in Havana, doing mostly escorting service. In 1807, it was wrecked on the coast of Campeche (Mexico). This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Frigate "Ifigenia 1795". Each Sails of Glory Ship Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other Sails of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the ship: a special base with gaming stats, a ship log and a specific deck of maneuver cards. The ship base, ship card and ship log are printed on two sides - The game data of a second ship is printed on the back.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Aero reli
description:
Sport pilots compete in various disciplines. They take off from the start (base) airport and fly to the target airport. On their way they can land on 3 auxiliary airfields. On each of the airfield they can take a cargo: flyers, paratroopers or chemicals. They transport the load to a certain place and drop it from the air.

Every successful delivered load brings one point. Each player has 3 aircraft. Every plane that successfully reach airport also brings one point. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.

The game board is covered with a net of equilateral triangles. Vertices of these triangles are points at which the players hold position and move figurines by the number rolled on dice.

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Argonauta 1806 / Heroe 1808
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The 74-guns Argonauta was a ship-of-the-line of the Spanish Armada that had previously served in the French Navy under the name Argonaute and participated to the battle of Trafalgar. She was transferred to the Spanish fleet in 1806 in exchange for the Vencedor. After a short career, it was used as prison ship in Cádiz during the French siege of the city. On 26th of May, French prisoners broke their mooring lines and ship went adrift and wrecked. In order to prevent the French from using it, British and Spanish sent gunners boats to set fire to the ship: Argonauta was destroyed by flames and sunk on 29th of May 1810. This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Téméraire Class ship-of-the-line "Heroe 1808". Each Sails of Glory Ship Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other Sails of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the ship: a special base with gaming stats, a ship log and a specific deck of maneuver cards. The ship base, ship card and ship log are printed on two sides - The game data of a second ship is printed on the back.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Wild West Exodus: Female Dark Council miniature
description: This figure is a Kickstarter exclusive miniature. It was included at most of the pledge levels during the 2015 Kickstarter campaign for Wild West Exodus: Unfinished Business - Faction Bundles.

name: Wild West Exodus: H-BOT 44 Mercenary miniature
description: This miniature was included at most of the pledge levels during the 2015 Kickstarter campaign for Wild West Exodus: Unfinished Business - Faction Bundles.

name: Malifaux: Hired Swords ‚Äì Viktoria Box Set
description: Why have one Master when you could have two? Viktoria comes along with her sister Viktoria, one's good at swords and guns, one's good at just swords. Viktorias buff other "sisters", which is normally each other but there are a couple models like Ronin that have the characteristic as well. Picture some twins leaping across a crowded bar, jumping from target to target. There. That's Viks.

name: Malifaux: The Bayou Boss ‚Äì Som'er Box Set
description: Somer bring the boys to the yard. Except the yard is a swamp. And the boys are rowdy Gremlins. He walks loudly and still carries a big (boom)stick. He's a bit of everything, he can summon, he can shoot and he can buff. His ability to out activate his opponents with hordes of pigs and expendable gremlins is legendary.

name: Gem Mayhem
description: Puzzle-themed game where the players switch, destroy or modify the gem cards in the gamezone in order to fulfill their objectives and score the most points.

name: A Twisted Tea Party
description: This twisted tea time party game was inspired by Lewis Carol's "Alice's Adventure in Wonderland." Who will out wit whom in this zany tea party? This mixed up game has two to five players trading seats and switching cards in an attempt to be the player who can score the most points in a round before one player completes a full tea setting.
categories: Card Game, Novel-based, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Mario Super Star Boardwalk Game
description:
Starting the Game: Players choose a playing piece and place it on Start Space. Roll the die to choose player rank, if a tie youngest player goes first. Each player starts the game with 10 Coins. Place Bowser Cards and Event Cards in marked areas on the game board. Place the Coins within reach of all players. Place one Star in pawn holder and follow diagram below under Buying a Star for placement. Place all remaining unused stars off to the side of the board until needed.

Objective: Be the player with the most collected Stars at the end of the game to be the winner of the Mushroom Kingdom!

Winner: Player with the most collected Stars after 20 Rounds. After each player has taken a turn a round has finished. Keep track of which round you are on by moving the round counter after each round finishes.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Print & Play, Video Game Theme

name: The Brain Game
description:
The Brain Game is a fun game that is the creation of 8 year old Orion Jordan. The game is designed to be travel size so you can take it with you anywhere, to be enjoyed at any time. We want to promote spending time with family and friends through gaming and The Brain Game is our way of making that happen.

The game is simple, easy to learn and fun to play. We think anyone from the age of five or older can learn and play. The base game is set for two players. With two sets you can play with up to 3 or 4 players.

The goal of the game is to be the first zombie to collect all the brains, but be careful, other zombies will try and steal what you've got while they also collect the brains! Each game can take anywhere from a minute or two or up to ten minutes or more (depending on the number of players). It's designed to be a quick fun boost to your day!

The game consists of 4 Brain tokens (Red, Blue, Purple and Green); 8 dice (2 Red, 2 Blue, 2 Purple and 2 Green); 4 Character cards to represent the player(s) and an instructions card. The game will come in a box the size of a deck of playing cards to easily fit in your pocket, bag or centre console of your car!

name: Pop for Sight Words 2
description:
How to Play:

Place the popcorn box in the middle of the table.

Take a popcorn card out of the box and read it.

If you read the word correctly, keep the card. If you read the word incorrectly, place the card in a separate pile of "un-popped" words to be read later.

If you draw "POP!" card, return all of your cards to the box and move that "POP!" card from play.

Take turns playing until the popcorn box is empty. The player who has the most popcorn cards at the end of the game wins.

name: American XMAS Dinner
description:
A murder mystery dinner-style party game in which each player is assigned a role and players try to find out who the murderer is. Each player has his/her own information booklet, and five game rounds are spent discussing clues and inconsistencies until players vote on who to accuse of the murder.

This case takes place at an almost deserted college campus during the Christmas holidays. All remaining inhabitants of the campus have been invited to a Christmas dinner, but the last guest arrives with horrible news: Stewart White, janitor, has been found murdered in his room, and the killer is among the guests.
Roles include the campus cop, a football player, a cheerleader and an exchange student.

name: Die Allianz der Unterwelt
description:
A murder mystery dinner-style party game in which each player is assigned a role and players try to find out who the murderer is. Each player has his/her own information booklet, and five game rounds are spent discussing clues and inconsistencies until players vote on who to accuse of the murder.

This case offers a cast of 8 particularly bizarre characters, among them a power-hungry conductor, an extreme eco-terrorist, a genius inventor, an old lady suffering from actinic dermatitis and a man in a kangaroo costume. The 8 craziest gangsters of the world have met to capture their common arch-enemy Major Sunshine, whose secrets would grant them world dominance. But then a bomb goes off in the cell in which the Major is kept, and now they have to find out who betrayed their alliance and killed the Major.

name: Regatta-Spiel
description:
Players roll dice and move their wooden boats toward the finish line. There are 24 squares to move along. The first player to reach the finish line is the winner.
Complete game comes with 6 wooden boats (3 in blue and 3 in yellow colors), dice, some coins (made of paper) and a plate for components.

name: Vuelo 747
description:
Vuelo 747 ("Flight 747") is a game about traveling the world, Flight aboard the worldwide famous Jumbo 747 Airplaine;, each player begins with an amount of money and takes its turn by spining the airplaine, placing the flag and taking the country card landed if its the first arrived or paying to the country card location owner the amount of the fee.

Like a fast monopoly version where you win by having more money at the end, or by eliminating other players before the last country is taken.

Good way for teaching kids (and late kids) about countries flags, currency and several 70s facts.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Educational, Travel

name: Wood Wars 3D
description:
3D-print-and-play your own set on Sourceforge: https://sourceforge.net/projects/woodwars3d/

Wood Wars 3D is a highly accessible table top strategy game for all developed by Joe Larson. In Wood Wars 3D, players build armies by taking race heads and putting them on class bodies to mix-and-match pawns. Then players take turns moving herds of pawns using measured distances, and attacking each other, simulating artillery attacks with marble rolls. It extends the rules of the original Wood Wars with detailed 3D printed modular minis.

Wood Wars 3D is an open sourced, light, strategy game, rooted in classic strategy game and manufacture by the future with 3D printing.

At the dawn of time in an enchanted woods where no man lives there was a spring of sweet water. The animals that drank from that spring found themselves possessed of intelligence. But an evil saw this and tainted the water so that the creatures would also gain pride, greed, and form similar to man. And by so doing, soon the woods knew war.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Galaxy Zento: Chessmen
description:
Galaxy Zento is a game in which players choose to be good or evil, become a player character type at random, and must be first to obtain a randomly issued goal to win.

Players take turns in movement on the board. Each move causes a card to be revealed from the top of the main deck. Players face characters, creatures, and traps, but also obtain rewards and character building cards to make them stronger.

The game employs a d20 system for combat and other card tasks.

Galaxy Zento: Chessmen is based on the fantasy novel, Chessmen: Opening Moves. Galaxy Zento is a complete universe of adventure.

name: Moments Card Game
description:
Moments Card Game is a solo or multi-player game that let the player decide the events that will occur in their lifetime. Players must choose their actions and decide the use of their time. Players are given different choices represented by different types of cards and time pieces to play these actions. Players go through the game choosing their own path. They can get an education, start a career or business, seek adventure, focus on art and music, seeks happiness through health/fitness or humor. The objective of the game is to score the most points before time runs out. Players acquire skills, make friend/partners and collect moments to score points.

Gameplay

The objective of the game is to collect points and capture moments in life before time runs out. Each player receives 12 physical time pieces. The time pieces can be used for actions, gain skills, or make friends.

There are 7 types of cards:

Moments Cards: (Worth 2 or 3 points)

You need a specific skill or or attribute, use an action card or hosts event to capture the Moment card.
For example: The Graduation moments card can be scored with two education skills.

Skills/ Education card: (Worth 1 point)

You will need to spend time pieces to acquire skills. This card is a permanent gained card that you place in front of you.

For example: The music skill card can be acquired with two time pieces.

Friend/ Partner card: (Worth 1 or 2 points)

You will need to spend one time piece to gain a friend. You will need to have the same skill or interest to gain a partner. This card is placed in the center when it is a friend. Another player can also be their friend. Players can gain a partner after they are friends. Partners are placed in front of the player. Player acquire the partner's skills.

For example: The Audrey friend card can be gain as a friend using one time piece. In order to make Audrey a partner, you would need to have the music skill or money or use a music or money action card.

Action card: (No points)

You will need one time piece to use the action card. However, action card can only be used once and can be used with any other cards.

For example: The graduation moments card can be scored by using a education action card if the player already acquired an education skill card. Players can use an education action card

Event card: (No Points)

You will need to have the skills of the event to use this card. You can have the skills, use an action card, use a partner's skill to score the event for yourself. You can also use other player's skills to hosts this event. The other player will be invited to the event and can score moments card as well. Event can score moments cards with event icons.

For example: The Musical festival event card can be scored with professional skill, music skill, and money. Players that attended the event can score a moments card that require an event.

Time card: (Gain two time pieces)

You will need to have the skills of the time card to use this card. This card is a one time use card and players can gain time pieces if they score this card.

For Example: the start new company time card can be used if player have the music, humor/happiness and the money attributes. People will gain two time pieces.

Situation Card: (Minus time pieces)

If players draw situation cards, all players must lose time pieces.

Goal of the game is to score the most points are the end of the game.

name: Zaljubljene podmornice
description:
Zaljubljene podmornice is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players. Board has 3D elements.

Each player has one submarine. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles that slow down the submarines. The winner is the player whose submarine first gets to the finish line.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Disco girl
description: Four girls want to dance with boys in discotheque. Players move figurines along paths and collect counters by stopping on field next to it.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Demonic Toys vs. Blood Dolls Game:  Battle of the Tiny Terrors
description:
Demonic Toys vs. Blood Dolls: Battle of the Tiny Terrors Game!

Play as your favorite Tiny Terror from the popular film franchise in this classic style board game of dice rolling melee battles!

Roll the die and move your character around the game board fighting the other player's Tiny Terror’s. Use special abilities on your character’s game card to perform range or melee attacks when in battles offensively or defensively attacks against them.

How the game works: Defeat the other player's Tiny Terror’s to win. Each player (in a standard game; two players) picks 4 characters to play as. In a 3+ player game, players only choose 3 characters. Players can also choose to do a Team Battle game; two vs. two. Players work as a team controlling 2 Tiny Terrors to defeat their opponent.

Game Objective: Players choose their Tiny Terrors and battle each other till one player has defeated all of other the other player’s characters!
categories: Fighting, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 5150: Urban Renewal
description:
From the website:

5150: Urban Renewal is our Sci-Fi RPG. Players adventure in and around New Hope City gaining Fame and Fortune while increasing their abilities. NHC is a complete Blade Runnereque urban environment inhabited by over 50 professions, with humans and aliens alike.

The game includes a low bookkeeping complete campaign system to link your adventures and track your progress. Urban Renewal generates your adventures with no two ever being the same!

Urban Renewal is playable solo, cooperatively and competitively, head to head and playable with any figures in any scale

Urban Renewal is the core rules for a long line of supplements to follow, starting with our first, New Hope City PI.



A sandbox style game, play a one-off standard miniatures game with your opponent on one side of a city block as a group of gangers and yours on the other as the police and have at! (Or step things up and include cybernetics and "Cyndees" and smuggled Star Army weapons to add to the carnage) Last man standing wins!Add Attributes and skills to make the game more RPG-like, letting your figures advance between games, adding more goals like finding lost technology, raiding corporate headquarters or simply going gambling for an evening and making it out of the casino alive!

Several pre-made scenarios are included in the book allowing you to customize your games to the complexity you desire.

Use whatever miniatures you have around!

If you liked 5150:Star Army, this merely takes that world and narrows the focus down to 1 figure and one city.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Check Your 6!: Guadalcanal ‚Äì Floatplane Hell
description:
From the cover:

Guadalcanal: Floatplane Hell is a scenario and campaign book for the popular CHECK YOUR 6! Air Combat and Campaign Rules. This book provides three mini-campaigns and 10 scenarios under one cover.

The first campaign follows the initial Japanese efforts to reinforce Guadalcanal in early October 1942 including the IJN Nisshin's runs down the slot and combat between US B-17s and Japanese Floatplanes. The second campaign, recreates the fighting over the slot between 9-14 October including floatplane defense of Japanese destroyers and US Navy and Cactus Air Force attacks on shipping. The third campaign focuses on desperate US attacks including a PBY torpedo-bombing attack between 15-19 October 1942. The book also features some of this campaign's legendary pilots including Kiyomi Katsuki, David Everitt, Elisha T. Stover, Jack Cram, Harold Bauer, and Leonard 'Duke' Davis.

HISTORICAL RESEARCH: This book includes several introduction sections containing campaign historical background, plus a bibliography for further reading. A campaign map is included that displays campaign targets and airfield locations.

AIRCRAFT STATISTICS and CAMPAIGN INFORMATION: This book contains aircraft statistics for 11 Allied and Japanese aircraft (including US B-17E, P-39K, and Japanese Hamp fighters, and Pete and Rufe floatplanes) in CHECK YOUR 6! format for use in the scenarios. The book also contains detailed notes and rare pictures of the various aircraft featured in the campaign.

CHECK YOUR 6! SPECIAL EVENT CAMPAIGN SYSTEM: This book includes an innovative CHECK YOUR 6! campaign system that provides special victory conditions for both sides in each scenario. By accomplishing special conditions, players earn Campaign Events, similar to action cards, which are played during the scenarios. This new campaign mechanic allows players to make real-time decisions that shape the battles while adding extra dimension to the scenarios.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Smoking Aces
description:
A Poker Hybrid Strategy game that will leave your Aces Smoking!

Following a simple turn sequence, players will need to balance playing cards that advance scoring and cards that help or hinder in an ever changing game. Destroy, reclaim, draw, search and even mimic other cards to build the best hand of five while preventing others from doing the same. A "Dead Man's Hand" will have you eliminated if you don't pay close attention. The player that assembles the best five card Poker hand by the time all the cards have been played wins!

Deuce’s wild! Let the game begin!

name: Medieval Campaign and Battle Rules (One-to-One)
description: These are 25mm scale skirmish level rules sold by Lamming Miniatures which include both campaign rules and man to man battle rules encompassing sieges and naval combat. The campaign rules are interesting in that each army begins by sailing their forces to an unexplored island where they explore and expand, manage finances, handle supplies and exports, deal with treachery and eventually the conquest of the other player's territories.

name: Loaded Up & Truckin'
description:
All across America trucks rumble across the interstate carrying products from manufacturers to retailers. As a small start-up company with a truck, an office and a dream you are throwing you hat into the ring to challenge the big boys. The freight has to be moved and there is competition for who can get to loads first and who can make the most profitable routes. But watch out, Smokey is on the prowl. So put the hammer down and let it all hang out. You have to get loaded up & truckin’.

As a player, you represent a small but growing trucking company seeking to pick up and deliver goods in the most efficient manner possible. Amassing money is one way to achieve victory, but there are other ways to score as well. It is important to dominate a region or two with the most deliveries while not ignoring the other regions. In the end, your deliveries will be compared to the other players to determine which company has the best overall presence in the US.

Players gain presence by moving their trucks from city to city across the United States picking up and dropping off deliveries along the way. You can specialize in high profit cross-country runs or you can make numerous short routes. On each turn the vagaries of the business will be determined by a deck of event cards. Each player will then get to buy new hubs and trucks before setting out to scoop up goods before a rival comes along and 'steals' the load.

name: Hot Pursuit
description:
The card passing, hand trading game of playing matchmaker in 1940’s New York. Great for 1 – 10 players, taking about 10 minutes per game. Hot Pursuit uses 3 cards per player and only needs your hands. New cards aren’t drawn or played – no table needed!

A modern man, done with his day’s work, steps out of his office tower’s lobby into the busy bustle of a city sidewalk. Just as he is getting his bearings set towards home, he collides with someone. He apologizes profusely. She politely excuses herself. He tries to ask if she’s alright but she just scurries off again. Who was that lovely lady and why was she in such a hurry? Now, it’s time for you to be a true friend and help this modern man find his missing beauty.

GAMEPLAY: 3 cards are dealt to each player. Whomever is dealt the Pink card becomes the Jealous Ex bent on sabotaging the game, the person who receives the Blue card is the Modern Man, and everyone else is a friend. All of the friendly players earn a joint victory by passing and trading until the Pink and Blue cards are both in the Modern Man's hand, facing him. However, the Jealous Ex wins if he/she can manipulate the Pink and Blue cards together, facing anyone who is not the Modern Man. ***Extra rules and story for solitaire, 2 players, and team play with player elimination, included!

name: Fell
description: Fell is a cooperative board game pitting 2-4 players against the randomly generated Chimeris: gigantic misshapen Beasts that require many men to bring down. The players will hire a group of ruthless mercenaries, equip them carefully and then send them to hunt these gigantic Beasts. Each game will involve teamwork, strategy and risk management to focus on the most important areas of the Beast and bring it down either by taking out the head or by crippling enough limbs that it is crushed by its own weight!

name: Kockatoo
description:
How do a pig sound? A zebra? A saw? A gardner? In Kockatoo you need to be good at making sounds, so others can guess which card you're holding. You need to sit on your hands, so you can't use hands and feet to mime.

One player takes a card from the stack, and tries to make the sound. The other players have to guess among the 30 cards visible on the table. But be careful! You only have one guess per round. The one who guesses correctly and the sound maker gets one point. if no one guesses correctly then no gets point.

As the play goes on, the options are limited, so the games get easier, so you need to be very fast in the end.

name: Flippin Monsters
description:
Flippin Monsters is a card game that employs both deck-building and memory mechanics. Players are given 10 starter cards and cards will be in the middle to capture.

The starter cards are placed faced down and apart from each other. On the player's turn, they can flip over any 5 of these cards they wish to help them purchase new cards or to earn points.

While some Monsters allow you to purchase other Monster cards, others give you actions like being able to flip over another card or flip over an opponent's card. The trick is remembering where you left that one Monster that allows you to do that one action you really need.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Memory, Set Collection

name: Netherworld's Edge: Keystone
description:
Set deep in the enchanted forests of the Netherwood, the inhabitants of the mouse kingdom wage a constant war against their adversaries, both from the vermin outside their guarded borders and the secretive conspirators within. This first adventure within the Netherwood explores the mouse rangers of the Northern Waywatch Chapters. Hailing from within the slate walls of the Keystone Fortress, they maintain eternal vigil over their sacred wardens. The legendary hero of the Watch, Chaptermaster Gorix Stormfeather, is preparing plans in the candlelit chambers of his fortress for the defense of his realm. His brave rangers patrol the borders, bracing for a clash that will inevitably come. The fist tightening its grip around their way of life is that of the Shadow King himself, the pale rat Vermithrang, and his legion of rodent warriors.

The Shieldbash system narrows its vision towards the small-scale conflicts of 5-15 fighters per side, involved in Skirmishes depicting a particular encounter between warbands. These encounters may be isolated or part of a Tale, a linked series of encounters where characters and conditions carry over from one fight to the next. Bash can be played on a battlefield as small as 2’x2’. A fighter is usually a single warrior on a 20mm (or 40mm) base, but it can also be a beast or group of lesser warriors. Defined by a few, simple attributes and abilities, each fighter is uniquely suited to his role on the battlefield, without bogging down the commander with unnecessary complication.

During a Round of battle each player will take turns as the active commander. His opponent will draw a Stone for him on his turn, allowing him to assign Surges to his fighters. These Surges allow the fighters to perform actions, which include moving about the battlefield, attacking enemy fighters, or other tasks performed in pursuit of victory. In addition, each commander has access to the resource Mischief. Mischief allows a commander to perform extra movement, modify a die roll, or execute other minor actions that enable him to bend the rules to his favor. However, the active commander’s opponent must agree upon the expenditure of Mischief, creating a dynamic of haggling and compromise.

name: Sky Dynasty
description:
Lead your dynasty to control the skies over planet Lumia IV, a critical choke point for intergalactic commerce. With strategic use of force and resources, rise above your foes and grow the most influential dynasty.

Sky Dynasty is a deck builder game where players draw a 10 card hand at the beginning of each round from their decks. Players compete for control over seven different locations which each offer unique advantages such as purchasing cards, gaining money, or earning influence (victory points).

In addition to the tradition strategy associated with deck building games, Sky Dynasty is unique in that players must make decisions on where and when to dispatch their cards without knowledge of other players decisions. In this way Sky Dynasty involves much higher player interaction then other games of the sort.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Viaje a la luna
description: The object of the players in this easy game is to be the first to go from Earth to the Moon and back. You move your rocket the mumber of boxes equal to the dice roll. Some boxes can delay or speed your rocket.

name: Shadowfist: Netherworld
description:
Netherworld was the first expansion to Shadowfist. This booster-only set included cards from the first five factions and also fleshed out the Monarchs and Jammers, though they would remain the less well-rounded of the seven. These cards also bear the gold foil Ting Ting logo.

The set contains 136 total cards. 46 rares, 40 uncommons, 48 commons.

Each pack has contains 12 random cards which include 1 rare, 3 uncommon, and 8 common.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: CIFRA Code81
description:
User summary:
In this game, players advance 1-9 pieces to their opponent's side to compete with all their pieces.

The movement of pieces is determined by the pattern of the tiles making up the board. Prior to playing the game, players randomly shuffle the tiles and create a 9x9 board. This is the most distinguishing feature of the game.

As in Chess, players are able to remove„ÄÄtheir opponent's pieces from the board, so the strategy involves moving pieces along the board in coordination with one another. A player is able to gain control over the game by reading the pattern of the board and competing in a location that is advantageous to themselves.

Like all games produced by Logy Games, this game is made with ceramic pieces which results in it weighing nearly 2kg.

Publisher's summary:
1ÔΩû9ÁÇπ„ÅÆÈßí„ÇíÊïµÈô£Âú∞„Åæ„ÅßÂà∞ÈÅî„Åï„Åõ„Å¶„Åù„ÅÆÈßí„ÅÆÂêàË®àÁÇπ„ÇíÁ´∂„ÅÜ„Ç≤„Éº„É†„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
