name: Hello Kitty Story Telling Dice
description:
A set of nine multi-purpose dice featuring Hello Kitty and friends. Use the dice for learning activities or memory and story-telling games. Similar to Rory's Story Cubes

Learn a word:
In this most basic play, players roll the dice and call out who or what they see.

Build a Sentence:
On your turn roll any two dice and make up a sentence that uses both images.

Tell a story:
Roll all the dice. The youngest player takes any die and starts a story that uses the image on the die. Moving to the left, each player takes any remaining die and adds on to the story.

Memory:
Roll all the dice. Players look at the face-up images for 20
seconds; the dice are then hidden from the players’ view. Players call out the images they remember while the host tells whether they are correct or not.

Past/Present/Future:
For older kids – players roll one or more dice and build a sentence using a variety of tenses. “Hello Kitty scored a point playing soccer.” “If it’s sunny tomorrow, Hello Kitty will play soccer.”

Contents:
9 Story Telling Dice,
Storage bag

name: Hostage Chess
description: Hostage Chess is a two-player, abstract strategy board game based on Chess, but including drops of captured pieces similar to Shogi. Unlike shogi, the piece a player may drop is one of his own pieces previously captured by the opponent. In exchange, the player returns a previously captured enemy piece, of equal or greater value, which the opponent may drop on a future turn. This is the characteristic feature of the game. Hostage Chess can be played with an ordinary chess set.

name: Malifaux: Master of Puppets ‚Äì Collodi Box Set
description:
There are many old relics from humanity's first time through the Breach. Most of these are the usual variety- ruins, coins, books. But there are forgotten things as well, things that were imbued with magic and life.

Collodi is a living puppet, the size of a human adult. It was made to be an entertainer, a marionette that told stories through others of its kind. Collodi was a delight and a wonder of its age that was created to love its work, and so it did. At the closing of the Breach, after the mayhem that followed, the puppeteer was left alone in Malifaux, with no more children to share stories with. The next century passed slowly. To make up for its loneliness, Collodi began making new puppets from bits of wood it scavenged. These fake children became the audience for new shows and stories, but it was never quite the same. As time went on Collodi began to slowly drift away, losing its grip on itself.

When the Breach reopened, Collodi rushed to the newly arrived settlers, drawn by the laughter of children. The adults attacked the living puppet, forcing it away with torches and axes. Denied the ability to fulfill its purpose, Collodi learned to hate. It vowed to teach humanity the emptiness it had felt for so long in the absence of children. It started making a new kind of puppet, using the blood of stolen children as a template. Collodi wanders Malifaux in its painted wagon, hiding in plain sight behind the masks it wears, still committed to its now twisted purpose.

Collodi’s box comes with nine models, including Collodi himself. The Marionettes serve as Collodi’s totems, giving it fast, tough minions that are utterly loyal to the puppet’s evil will. The Wicked Dolls provide another variety of useful minion, in that they can repair other puppets and teleport next to an enemy in the blink of an eye. Vasilisa watches over all these puppets with a caring eye, but should an enemy catch up with its incredible speed, they will have to contend with its sharp needle and expert sewing skills.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Temple of Dawn ‚Äì Shenlong Box Set
description:
Even as a young monk in the temple of High River, Shenlong was considered exceptional. What surprised his instructors was the determination he showed to learn the other styles when exposed to them. His brutality was matched by a ruthless cunning that drove him to master every temple style. While he was fully aware of the political power this granted him in the valley, he was not prepared for what would follow.

As dusk fell one day, sunlight blazed from an isolated temple on the valley wall, said to house the Dragon. Shenlong, the only person capable of looking at the searing light, found himself drawn to the ancient building. He walked in alone, emerging the following sunrise as more than a man. He was covered head to toe in tattooed scales, sunlight blazing in his eyes. Where he trod, the ground scorched. A new era in the valley had begun; the Dragon had chosen a new host.

Although he doesn’t look it, Shenlong is thought to be more than eighty years old. The Dragon does not permit its hosts to age, holding them at their physical peak as long as it chooses to inhabit them. While this arrangement is never eternal, Dragonhosts are known to have lived for several centuries. As long as the Dragon has need of a host for his plans, Shenlong will be near immortal. With the Dragon now turning its ancient eyes to Malifaux, his current host has a great deal to do before he becomes tiresome and is cast aside.

Shenlong’s crew comes with seven models, including Shenlong himself. The Monks of High River are brutal combatants with flaming punches and kicks, and they serve Shenlong aside his totems, the less flashy but equally devoted Peasants. The towering Sensei Yu ensures that everyone, monk and peasant alike, is properly trained, no matter how many legs get broken in the process.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: Exodus: Edge of Extinction ‚Äì Kickstarter Limited Action Cards
description:
Kickstarter Limited Action Cards can be freely combined with the Exodus: Edge of Extinction expansion or just with the Exodus: Proxima Centauri base game.

They add more replay value to the game, by offering each player 3 additional unique action cards which are slightly more powerful than the regular action cards.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Exodus: Edge of Extinction ‚Äì Kickstarter Limited Political Cards
description:
Kickstarter Limited Political Cards can be freely combined with the Exodus: Edge of Extinction expansion or just with the Exodus: Proxima Centauri base game.

They add replay value to the game, by offering a greater pool of Political cards.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Exodus: Edge of Extinction ‚Äì Kickstarter Limited Combat Cards
description: Kickstarter Limited Combat Cards can be freely combined with the Exodus: Edge of Extinction expansion. They add replay value to the game, by offering a greater pool of Combat cards.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Nigeru tamashii, Nemuru oni
description:
User summary:
ÈÄÉ„Åí„ÇãÈ≠Ç„ÉªÁú†„ÇãÈ¨º (Nigeru tamashii, Nemuru oni) is also referred to as „Å´„Åí„Åü„Åæ (Nigetama) by the publisher. The game title literally means "Souls escape while ogre sleeping".

In this game, players are fallen souls in Hell, and try to escape from Hell while Oni (the guard of the Hell in this game) is sleeping. Each player has their own bag of advancement chips. There are three types of advancement chips: +1 space, -3 spaces when drawn twice, and -3 spaces when drawn once. You may continue drawing chips as you wish, but when you are forced to retreat three spaces, you may not advance any spaces.

As the game goes on, you will have more chips in your bag, changing draw probabilities. You should build your chip pool in your favor, but your bag may be swapped with another player's, so you need some strategy.

This game comes in scroll shape, and the game board is actually a picture with old Japanese style. It can be hung on the wall as an interior accessory.

Publisher's summary:
Âú∞ÁçÑ„Å´Â†ï„Å°„ÅüÈ≠Ç„Åü„Å°„Åå„ÄÅÂú∞ÁçÑ„ÅÆÈñÄÁï™„Åß„ÅÇ„ÇãÈ¨º„ÅåÁú†„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÇãÈöô„ÇíË¶ã„Å¶„ÄÅÂ§©ÂõΩ„Å∏„ÅÆËÑ±Âá∫„ÇíÁõÆÊåá„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Éó„É¨„Ç§„É§„Éº„ÅØ„Åù„Çå„Åû„Çå‰∏≠„ÅÆË¶ã„Åà„Å™„ÅÑË¢ã„ÇíÊâÄÊåÅ„Åó„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÆ‰∏≠„Å´ÂÖ•„Å£„Åü„ÉÅ„ÉÉ„Éó„ÇíÂºï„ÅÑ„Å¶ÈÄ≤„ÇÅ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„ÉÅ„ÉÉ„Éó„Å´„ÅØ‰∏Ä„Éû„ÇπÈÄ≤„ÇÅ„Çã„ÉÅ„ÉÉ„Éó„ÄÅ‰∫å„Å§Âºï„ÅÑ„Åü„Çâ‰∏â„Éû„ÇπÊàª„Åï„Çå„Çã„ÉÅ„ÉÉ„Éó„ÄÅÂºï„ÅÑ„ÅüÊôÇÁÇπ„Åß‰∏â„Éû„ÇπÊàª„Åï„Çå„Çã„ÉÅ„ÉÉ„Éó„ÅÆ‰∏âÁ®ÆÈ°û„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ‰∏â„Éû„ÇπÊàª„Åï„Çå„Çã„ÅãËá™ÂàÜ„ÅÆÈÅ∏Êäû„ÅßÂºï„Åè„ÅÆ„Çí„ÇÑ„ÇÅ„Çã„Åæ„Åß„ÅÑ„Åè„Çâ„Åß„ÇÇ„ÉÅ„ÉÉ„Éó„ÇíÂºï„Åè„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Ç≤„Éº„É†„ÅåÈÄ≤„ÇÄ„Åî„Å®„Å´Ë¢ã„ÅÆ‰∏≠„ÅÆ„ÉÅ„ÉÉ„Éó„ÅåÂ¢ó„Åà„ÄÅÁ¢∫Áéá„ÅåÂ§âÂãï„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÊúâÂà©„Å´„Å™„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´Ëá™ÂàÜ„ÅÆË¢ã„ÇíËÇ≤„Å¶„Åæ„Åô„Åå„ÄÅË¢ãËá™‰Ωì„Çí‰∫§Êèõ„Åï„Çå„Çã„Åì„Å®„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çã„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅÊà¶Áï•„ÇÇÂøÖË¶Å„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
„Åæ„Åü„ÄÅ„Åì„ÅÆ„Ç≤„Éº„É†„ÅÆÊúÄÂ§ß„ÅÆ„Ç¶„É™„ÅØ„ÄÅÂ∑ªÁâ©„ÅÆÂΩ¢„Çí„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„Åì„Å®„Åß„Åô„ÄÇÂíå„ÅÆ„ÉÜ„Ç§„Çπ„Éà„ÇíÊúÄÂ§ßÈôêÁîü„Åã„Åó„Åü„Éì„Ç∏„É•„Ç¢„É´„Åß„ÄÅÂ£Å„Å´È£æ„Çå„Å∞„Ç§„É≥„ÉÜ„É™„Ç¢„Å´„ÇÇ„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck

name: Flip Hop: Bonus 1
description: The Flip Hop Bonus Card is shuffled into the first 10 cards of the mission cards. When the Bonus Card appears the only difference is that only the visible snails has to be on the right place. The Flip Hop symbols can be represented by any other snail.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Under Both Flags: The American Navy in the Civil War
description: Rules for American Civil War naval battles in miniature. Scaled for 1/600 miniatures, but easily adaptable to other scales. Tactical level, 1 turn = approximately 3 minutes, with one miniature = one vessel. Includes historical and "what if" scenarios, as well as charts for most vessels in action during the ACW.
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: DONK!
description:
DONK! - the Samurai Duck, the computer game, was created by THE HIDDEN and released in 1993 on the Amiga / Amiga CD32 games console. In this 20th anniversary commemorative card game, Donk has to tackle 7 Zones in his arch enemy Eider Down's world (Con-Struct, Electro Moss, Hab, Hanic, Plasma, Rock, and Subaqua), seeking the Gems that unlock the Zones, destroy Eider Down's Fortress, and defeat Eider Down himself!

Each Zone is represented by a separate deck of cards. To complete a Zone, Donk must work his way through the deck, turning over cards which could be Enemies to defeat (by spending Spin Power or using Power Ups), Hazards to avoid (by using Power Ups), various Devices such as the Map (to reveal the next few cards and jump ahead), Teleport (to jump to another Zone), Blocks and Switches that can hinder or help progress. Ultimately, Donk needs to find the Gem card within the Zone deck that unlocks the Zone, and then get to the Exit card to complete the Zone.

Each time a Zone is completed, Donk will get a chance to attack the Fortress / Eider Down by spending what Spin Power they have left if it is enough. If all Zones are completed, and Donk has enough Spin Power left, they could get the chance to defeat Eider Down in the Final Battle!

Donk! can be played in 1 player mode, as a solitaire card game, or in 2 player mode where Donk and his fighting partner Judo Juggs team up (sharing Power Ups) / or go head to head to complete Zones and defeat Eider Down.
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: Punto 180
description:
It's year 1978 and in Italy on promulgate the law 180, which ratify the closing down of all psychiatric hospitals.
The idea of the game is to remember and relive the atmosphere of this important period...
Players identify themselves in a doctor releasing patients from their jails or in the severe guardians trying to repress this situation, moving the pieces on 8 different boards.
There's just one doctor to free all the patients, but the guardians can use their superior number to overwhelm him, so move carefully and try to reach the exit with planning and strategy.
Each board, representing original layout of real mental hospitals and asylums, is enriched by pictures of the author's photography-project "Persistenze".
Punto 180 is not just a game: it's a unique crossover and a way to let everybody know about a so important law, that had a worldwide impact and changed the life of many people.

Each turn players must move every active piece.
The doctor move his white piece first, horizontally or vertically how many spaces as he likes. The patients (yellow pieces) start the game in their jails and the doctor must stop in an adjacent space to free them; once free, a patient moves the same way of the doctor and must exit the board reaching the yellow arrows. Every patient get out this way scores 1 point for the doctor's player.
The guardians (black pieces) move again like the doctor, but can take the yellow pieces (the patients) moving on them.
Each yellow pieces taken this way is removed from the board and scores 1 point for the guardians player.
Important: a guardian can move on a patient only if black pieces has numerical superiority or tie on that line of the grid! Moreover, they can not overstep or jump the doctor white piece.
The player with more points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: The Spooks Journey Game
description:
Game objective: Make your way through the board encountering terrifying Spooks along your Journey to defeat toughest of Spooks; the Dragon King!
Plot: You have begun a journey full of Spooks. There are seven Spooks waiting to Spook YOU! Can you make it out alive? You are about to embark on the most terrifying Spook Journey ever.
There are various spaces on the board that you'll encounter. Tombstone Spaces, Pit Space, Vine Spaces and Item Spaces. Players may share spaces only on Exit Spaces or Battle Spaces. If you land on another player’s pawn at the end of your turn, the player occupying the space moves back to the next available space on the board.
categories: Children's Game, Fighting, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Grand Prix
description:
From the publisher´s website:
The first entry into the history of car racing, the victory of horsepower without horses. Go ahead gentlemen, the world awaits you! The racers speed along trackless roads and deserted landscapes to win the most exalted of prizes, and the glory for being the most daring of drivers. The first and greatest race in the annals of history can only be won by someone who, defying all odds, manages to drive his automobile through the finish line. We can admit though, that beside their skills the racers have to posses a small amount of luck as well.

Players play simultanously the cards with numbers 1-6. Now player reveal the cards and starting to move their cars in increasing numbers on their cards. If Your car ends the turn on the place where is another card or obstacle you must put Your car back to the space from which they started the movement.

Player who finishes first is the winner.

name: Far√°ndula
description:
Farándula is a central pool deck-building game where each player take the rol of a participant in a Yellow-Program. In this yellow program, Famous are willing to do anything for fame. False pregnancies, homophobic remarks, car accidents ... Nothing is too low or vile as to not use it either to score points for yourself or to try to sink the other players' score.

But do not let the subject scare you. In essence, Farándula is a deck-building game with more than enough complexity to keep you entertained. Build your deck from a central pool with juicy exclusives and fill other players' decks with everything you do not want. To win you just have to have more Fame points at the end of the game. With 6 different audiences to pamper, Farándula offers a variety of playstyles to try each game.

So, whether you have a dark sense of humor or you just like deck-building games, you should take a look at Farándula!
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Small City: Player boards Expansion #3 ‚Äì The Forests
description:
4 New Player boards printed both side (Easy and Expert) for the game Small City.
Players need to spend money to deforest the player boards, but they will earn Building Materials with the wood...
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Halo: Fleet Battles ‚Äì Covenant Commander Pack
description:
This boxed set is the ideal way for aspiring Covenant Commanders to start gaming the Halo: Fleet Battles tabletop miniatures game. Included in the box is a full colour, easy to learn 128-page Core Rulebook, Supreme Commander Rho 'Barutamee Data Sheet, 5 Covenant Command Dice, 2 Six-sided Dice, Token Sheets, Covenant Statistic Sheet and Reference Sheet.

1 128-page Rulebook
1 Reference Sheet
2 Covenant Token Sheets
5 Command Dice
2 standard six-sided dice
1 Fleet Commander Card
1 Statistics Sheet
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Halo: Fleet Battles ‚Äì UNSC Commander Pack
description:
This boxed set is the ideal way for aspiring UNSC Commanders to start gaming Halo: Fleet Battles tabletop miniatures game. Included in the box is a full colour, easy to learn 128-page Core Rulebook, Vice Admiral Michael Stanforth Data Sheet, 5 UNSC Command Dice, 2 Six Sided Dice, Token Sheets, UNSC Statistic Sheet and Reference Sheet.

1 128-page Rulebook
1 Reference Sheet
2 UNSC Token Sheets
5 Command Dice
2 standard six-sided dice
1 Fleet Commander Card
1 Statistics Sheet
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Barn Raiser
description:
Barn Raiser is a light, 2-4 player card drafting game designed by Aaron Frias (creator of En Passant and The Piker). It is a great filler game for large game groups or a good light game to play while your waiting for everyone to show up to game night.

The game's theme revolves around the -18th and -19th century rural North America practice of "barn raising" (also known as "raising bee"). In those times, and still today in Amish and other small communities, members of the community would come together to build up a family barn. A lot of preparation is done prior to the build out and the actual barn raising event only takes one or two days. Barn raising usually consists of a mix of experienced and inexperienced local men and the help of some paid specialists. Most of the tools and supplies were all shared and gathered by the community as well.

Based on this theme, the Barn Raiser card game was created.

name: Sad Panda
description:
A comedy card game (sharing a name with the famous internet meme) where you say nice (yet often creepy) things to your panda while poking fun at your friend's panda.

You take on the role of a Keeper whose sole concern is to make your Panda so blissfully happy they culminate in a Happy Ending. Unfortunately, the other (jealous) Keepers insist on making fun of your panda in the hopes that it will meet with a Tragic Ending instead.

How To Play

Keepers take it in turn using Flattery cards to increase their Panda's Happiness or Insult cards to increase other Pandas' Sadness. The deck also includes Therapy cards that can remove Insults from your panda, Zinger cards that make the Insults that little bit meaner, and Mischief cards that allow you to bend the rules.

If at the start of their Keeper's turn a Panda has a Sadness of 10, then the Keeper draws a Tragic Ending. If they manage to cheat death, survive and have a happiness of 10 then the Keeper draws a Happy Ending. The first Keeper to draw a winning Happy Ending or the last Keeper with a living Panda wins!

name: Iron & Brass
description:
Welcome to the colony of Dugbirch - not a sprawling city of splendor and spires and airships, but an almost forgotten place too far away from civilization and with not enough gold to attract the city dwellers. But, just enough gold to battle over.

Two rival towns are mining gold and hiring the able bodied to build their towns into cities and their militias into capable armies.

Iron & Brass (like its inspiration, the Warcraft PC games) challenges players to select the right strategy, then execute that strategy to defeat your opponent. Hoard resources, build up defenses, build up an army, or some of each - all while your opponent is doing the same.

Iron & Brass is a Print and Play game played on a 10x10 to 16x16 square grid game board. Each player has 14 structures and 24 military units available to build.

Each player starts with a Headquarters, Barracks, 8 Gold, 1 Crew, and 8 "Advantage" tokens which can each be used as an Attack, Range, Movement, or Heal bonus.

Each turn, a player may take up to 4 actions, any combination of: Mine Gold, Hire Crew, Move, Attack, Train Infantry, Build Structures or Vehicles.

Because of limited Gold in the game, players will need to decide how to balance gathering resources with building up defensive structures and building their army. In addition, their army can be built quickly with Infantry units, or more slowly by first building structures such as Foundries, Arsenals, and Steam Works to build up armored units, artillery, and tanks.

Attacks are resolved by comparing Attack Strength + dice roll (+ Surge "Advantage" if played) to Defense Strength + dice roll (+ Surge "Advantage" if played). Defending units may be destroyed, disabled, or sustain no damage.

A player wins the game by destroying their opponent's Headquarters or all of their opponent's army.

Cover art was created by Todd Sanders, winning the cover art design contest for this game. Some of the game piece art was created by BGG user "Skoll". He created images for: "Skirmisher Patrol" and "Iron Infantry", and because of those, really helped create the look and feel of the rest of the game piece images.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Little People Games: Pairs
description:
Memo with two levels of play, featuring George the Fireman to help.
Theme is based around occupations and related objects.

All the tiles are laid face down, each player takes it in turn to show two cards. In the first level the cards have to match i.e. Tennis player & Tennis player. In the second level, the players match the occupation with its object i.e. Tennis player & Racket.

Once a player has made a match they can place George on any tile to help them remember a tile. With each matched pair, George can be moved.

Once all the tiles have been claimed, the player with the most matched pairs wins!

name: Little People ABC
description:
Alphabet game with two levels of play, featuring Marie to help.

The mini game board is assembled and all the letter tokens are sorted into 4 matching coloured piles. Each player is dealt an even number of books. Players take it in turns to roll the die and move Marie around the track. Pick a coloured tile matching the space and call it out. In the first level the players can use the pictures and letters to recognise the letters. In the second level, only the letters can be used.

Once a player has completed all their books they win!

name: Golem Arcana: Zikia ‚Äì Tidal Lord
description:
From the publisher:

The Tidal Lord reigns supreme while standing in Water regions on the map. Enemies sharing its region suffer 10 damage each turn, while Allies seeking the Tidal Lord's protection recover 10 health each turn while in its region.

Like the non-elite Fen Lord, the Tidal Lord can slow down enemy units. The Riptide attack reduces enemy movement by 3 for one round, but if it shares a Water region with the Tidal Lord this duration is 2 rounds.

The Tidal Lord can also utilize a Pull attack like its non-elite brother -- but the Churning Sea has the option of targeting Allies, in which case it gains Accuracy and does zero damage. Combined with the Tidal Lord's passive ability, it can either pull enemy Golems to their watery doom, or re-position allies for healing.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Informants
description:
Thick as thieves they say but what happens when informants infiltrate your thieves' guild? What happens when they are your friends?

Informants is a strategic game made for 2 to 6 players. Compete with and against other players in an effort to collect all of the items you have been tasked to collect. Trade, steal and bluff your way to completing your mission but be careful helping out the wrong team could lose you the game. All you can trust is their word.

Players take the role of either a thief or an informant and are tasked with recovering a number of items.

Each turn you must decide between collecting tools to aid in your mission, trading with another player or attempt a robbery. The round ends when one player collects all of the items they have been tasked with collecting. Players are then rewarded with money for every item they have collected and the winning team is awarded bonus cash for completing their mission. The game ends after all rounds have been played and the player with the most money wins.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading

name: Element Circle
description:
Element Circle is the tactical, magical card game. The game is availlable to play digitally online and you can buy a paper version to play with your friends.

In Element Circle the players battle each other over the control over the four elements Earth, Water, Fire and Air. In the circle appear four elements at random that can be used by any player and the players obtain spells from the same deck. The players then choose their innate elements that only they can use and take turns to use their spells to beat the other players. Each element has their own signature effect.


Earth is a solid and cannot affect the elements.
Water is a fluid and alters the state of the game.
Fire is destruction and intense.
Air is motion and mobility.


Element Circle is played in rounds. Depending on how the players act, a round can be very short or relatively long. The trick to winning Element Circle is to be able to see how to play your hand best, predict the actions of your opponents and to best judge the strength of your own hand as well as those of your opponents. There is a lot of randomness in the rounds that keeps it interesting to play. Even the best players will lose some rounds, but will eventually win more rounds than others. Normally the first player to win three rounds wins the game, but when playing online each win increases your score and rating.

name: Dungeon War
description:
Dungeon War is a game for 2-4 players, where the player control groups of Heroes and Monsters in an expanding dungeon and must gather as much treasure as they can, while using their monsters to defeat the other treasure Hunters.

The game uses tiles to expand the dungeon so no two game will ever be exactly the same. Using a quick and simple turn based system, even with 4 players the game is so fast paced, no one will get bored waiting for their turn. The 62 Event cards add constant challenges to the expanding dungeon and will make even the most seasoned treasure hunter squirm as the dungeon deals its next deadly torment their way.

When the event deck is exhausted or if only one hero remains in the dungeon the game comes to an end and its time to count up the treasure and whom ever has the most will win the game.

name: Monopolis
description:
Monopolis (eng. Monopoly) game was made in Lithuania when this country was part of the Soviet Union, like the other Baltic states.

Just before the end of Soviet Union, politics became softer and allowed more things from the western culture like this game for example (not actual Monopoly version). Such things became popular among people, but the rule that everything had to be written in Russian remained, that's why this game's Rules are written in Russian.

The yellow lid of the game box only show the "shareholder cards" as well as some of the little "Chance cards".
Each side of the little game board has 3 company spaces, 1 railwaystation and a "destiny" space (showing a yellow circle with some image).

The 23 spaces on the board are from onwards:
Pepsi-Cola -10%-circle - Marlboro - Knïb (Kiev) - Las Vegas - a Jail corner - Philips - policeman in circle - Opel - Alma-Ata - Ford - cowboy on totem pole (Destiny corner) - Parker - sun and cube in circle - Toyota - New York - Asahi - judge corner - Atlantic - sun and cube in circle - Honda - London and Panam.

The instruction on the destiny spaces respectively reads:

side 1: pay 10% of your funds and put it in the "destiny pool".
side 2 with the policeman: pay a fine of 500 and put it in the "pool".
side 3 and 4: test your luck by taking a Chance card. It is remarkable to see that the "Destiny corner" is officially used as the "Free Parking corner" in the unofficial family rules in Parker Brother editions!


Besides, there is an inner circle in the center of the game board, called Klondike, being an essential part of the game. Klondike can be entered any moment, by paying the Bank 500. Starting point is the pointing hand as in the main part of the game. The Rules for this section are as follows:

Landing on each of the empty yellow spaces player receives 1000 from the Bank.
Landing on the space with the gold coin player receives 5000 and the right to return to the main game.
Landing on the space with the money bag player receives 10000 and the right to return to the main game.
Landing on the space with the pistol player loses all his money received in Klondike and has no right to leave the Klondike.
Landing on the space with the black cat player loses all his money received in Klondike and must return one of his most precious shareholder cards to the Bank as well as one of the cheapest he owns, but he still has the right to return to the main game.
Landing on the space with the pointing hand player must return to the main game with the money he collected in Klondike.
Philips shareholder card. Instead of property deeds players receive a shareholder card from the banker the moment they buy shares of a property or station.


How does that work? Let us take the Philips property to explain:
The first share, together with the "shareholders card" (like a "property deed" in Parker Bros. Monopoly) can be bought for 16 the moment you land on this free space. A next player landing on this space have to pay you 4.

When you are short of cash you can pawn this card with the Bank for 8.

A second share can be bought from the Bank for 160 after which a visitor must pay you 40. The value of this share however is 140. In order to remember how many shares you own on this property you place the blue plastic paperclip on line 2.

In this way one can collect up to 5 shares by finally paying 6400. That moment the value of your total shares is 3200 and any visitor has to pay you 1600 each time he lands on this property. Should you run out of cash you can pawn this card with the Bank for 3200.
There are 18 small (56x69 mm) yellow Chance cards, to be placed on the red dot in the centre of the board.

Some of the instructions on these Chance cards read:

Konkurentu dovana gangsteriui 1000$ = Player receives 1000 from each other player and he gets the right to throw the dice 3 times.


In addition he is allowed to rob another player, f.e. the moment he lands on a space owned by another player the owner must hand over all profit to this player.

Nenumatytos pajamos 50% = Player receives 50% of his own properties (stocks and stations) from the Bank.
Mafija 1000 $ = Player has to proceed to the Destiny corner and pay 1000 fine.
Air Mail = Player does not move per space but per board side. On doing so he is allowed to land on a space he likes, except on the corner spaces. However, he does receive 200 passing the Start corner.


Black cat = Player must return one of his shareholder cards to the Bank, without the right to redeem it.

The procedure with the stations is somewhat different: When buying a station player has to pay 800 to the Bank and in the same time he receives a hexagonal, plastic chip. The more stations a player owns the bigger profit he gets. The moment another player lands on your station he owes you 200 per station. Should an owner runs out of cash he can, like with the other properties, pawn a station with the Bank for 400 with the opportunity to redeem the station when he has enough money again.

The money consists of rather a number of plastic coins in various colors and diameters. The 11 denominations are: 1 - 2 - 5 - 10 - 20 - 50 - 100 - 500 - 1000 - 5000 and 15000.

name: Alpha
description:
IntroductionAlpha is a territory and connection game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the cells of a hexhex board, which is initially empty. The suggested board size is between 5 and 8 cells per side. Both players must have access to a sufficient number of black and white stones.



DefinitionsA group is a set of connected, like-colored stones. A single stone is also a group.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On their turn, a player must place one stone of any color on an empty cell.

The game ends when the board is full. A player's score is the product of the size of the largest group of their color and the number of distinct groups of their color. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. In the event of a tie, whoever has fewer stones of their color on the board wins.



Pie ruleThe pie rule is used to make the game fair. This means that White will have the option, on his first turn only, to change sides instead of making a regular move.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Connections, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition

name: Kittens and Rainbows and ______
description: Kittens and Rainbows and _____ is a party game of nice things and inspirational quotes. Players take turns judging other players' suggestions for how to complete an uplifting saying. Would it be better to say "Always aim for the moon. If you miss, you'll land among the bubble baths" -- or would you rather "land among the big burly bearded men having a tea party"?
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Halo: Fleet Battles ‚Äì Ensign Edition
description:
From the publisher:

Halo: Fleet Battles, Ensign Edition makes it even easier for players around the world to begin gaming exciting spaceship battles set in the fantastic Halo Universe. Inside this 2-player box set players will find all the models and rules they need to start playing. The set allows for six Battle Groups (four UNSC and two Covenant) of highly detailed spaceships to be fielded, providing players with a superb base for future fleet expansion.
The Ensign Edition consists of the following components:


128-page Core Rulebook
16x UNSC Plastic Ships
8x Covenant Plastic Ships
Plastic Formation Bases
Token, Statistic and Overlay Sheets
Punch-Out Scenery Sheet
2x Fleet Commander Data Sheets
30x Custom Halo Dice and 2x Standard D6
Reference Sheet
Assembly Instructions


Enough gaming pieces for hours of fun!
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame

name: Automobilov√° soutƒõ≈æ
description:
Czech board game about rally racing.
Players roll the dice and drive through track that consists of 3 stages. Every stage has speed trials, precise stops, failure traps and other tasks that can cause penalties to player. When all players finish stage, next one can start. Players count their penalties in the finish of race. Winner is player with the least penalties.

name: Ancient Conflict Treasure Chest
description:
Immerse yourself in the conflicts of the Ancient World.

A great collection of classic and contemporary abstract strategy games is waiting for you to explore. As you discover what’s inside, it takes you back in time and around the world. Travel to ancient Greece, through Assyria, then the Roman and Persian Empires, until you finally arrive by the great Yangtze River in the Middle Kingdom of China.

Unearth pieces inside the treasure chest to play popular and well-loved games such as Chess and Checkers (Draughts). Discover Greek and Roman classics like Seega and Latunculi that are still being enjoyed in parts of the world today. And as you dig deeper, you will also bring to light games with themes of ancient conflict created by contemporary game designers. You can join the battle for Troy in ILIOS, sink Viking warships in Journey Stones, or expand your kingdom in Cartography. King's Ransom is a lighter chess variant with a prince, a bit of luck and a lot of bluffing! In Quorsum you race your horsemen home while obstructing your opponent's in a tile flipping, dice game. Kush offers a fast moving tile stacking game with an unusual twist: you get to move either your opponent's or your own tiles! Yangtze seems like a simple tile matching game until you discover to master it both players need to think about the modern concerns of environmental conservation to prevent the river drying up.

Some of these games have also been offered as standalone box sets or Treasure Chest Jewels and some are only available is part of the basic Treasure Chest Crown Jewel. The Treasure Chest World Collection offers everything together with components for 11 classic and contemporary strategy games.

Game pieces are designed for use in multiple games, and can be stored in colorful handmade bags. All the games have simple rules that take 2 minutes to learn and 10-30 minutes to play. In some games, the length and complexity of the game can be adjusted.

Decorate your living room with the Treasure Chest, keep it in sight at all times and entice your guests into a world of Ancient Conflict. Let this classic collection entertain you and create wonderful memories for your family and friends for generations to come.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Tile Placement

name: Vortium: Enemigos Ancestrales
description: Enemigos ancestrales is the first expansion for Vortium CCG. Here you will find 195 new cards, new mechanics, many more draconians, the new civilization of Tzabekh and the first glimpse at the vidians from Nishtya.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Legends of the Ancient World: Upon the Wind
description:
Upon the Wind is a programmed adventure using Dark City Games Legends of the Ancient World rule set. These rules provide gameplay very similar to that of Melee and Wizard from Metagaming. This adventure is compatible with those games as well.

Battles are fought with counters on a hex map that is included with the game.

From the publisher:
"...You surmise that you have been transported to none other than the fabled Ships Graveyard, the place where the wrecks of ships lost in the air are said to go..."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Arachne
description:
In the dark tunnels and caves far below the surface of our world, evil creatures lurk in the shadows.
Some of them, such as the cunning dark elves, have developed a civilization – and in every successful civilization games are played, so the masterminds can sharpen their wits, while the lower townsmen have their share of distraction.

Arachne is such a game: While you can find some elements of the chess game played by the surface dwellers, there are quite a lot of differences, too:
First of all, as a devotion to the Spider Goddess, Arachne is played on the strands of a spider web. Also, the cruel and traitorous nature of the dark elves is reflected in Arachne, too: Aside from being able to capture his own playing pieces, each turn, a player gets the option to move and to capture with an opposing playing piece.
So, whatever you plan; always be aware, that the true enemy strikes from within!

The game has been created during the 2016 One Page PNP Contest.

name: Dystopian Wars: Battle for Iceland 2 Player Box Set
description:
A Prussian empire strike force is heading for Iceland, its mission a simple one: at all costs discover what the Covenant of Antarctica is up to on the frozen wastelands of this small island. This exciting boxed is the first to feature the new Dystopian Wars: Fleet Action fast play rules and the box contents include an array of CoA and Prussian naval models, scenery, rules, dice and tokens.

Fleet Action Fast Play Rulebook
Statistics & Template Sheets
Acrylic Tokens
Dice
11 Prussian Empire Models
10 Covenant of Antarctica Models
Highly Detailed Scenery
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Kashindan
description:
From the designer:

A "Kashindan" (Â£´Ê•≠ÊÑõ) was a feudal Japanese Daimyo's band of retainers, something similar to a small elite company or a unit of faithful bodyguards. Consequently, Kashindan is not a game for mass battles, but was designed to play skirmish fights in an hour, in which the loyal vassals of a hero fight each other for fame, honour, prestige, personal feuds or because they favour opposite sides in a larger political/military confrontation. From the lowest peasants to the most prestigious Samurai lords -- the composition of an army depends only on the hero's capabilities to convince and inspire followers, i.e. it is entirely up to the player's tactical decisions.

Kashindan takes place in feudal Japan before a Portuguese ship stranded off the Japanese coast in 1543 and introduced the people of Nippon to the Arquebus (gun). During those times, honour meant a lot to «the ones who serve» (Samurai) and warriors would often ride up to the enemy ranks before a battle, challenging a worthy opponent to a duel. Duels could also be fought by appointment or over the smallest of insults. It was a time when life could come to an end very suddenly, be it by disease, famine or war, and this uncertainty partially shaped the attitude towards death and an honourable way to face it. Nevertheless, it was also a period during which social barriers were not yet as fixed and impenetrable as Toyotomi Hideyoshi would make them by the end of the 16th century -- an ambitious, driven man with some loyal retainers could conquer a province or even forge an empire.

The game does not require a lot of miniature figures, dice, rule books and expansions. To get started, 10-50 Ashigaru, Ninja, Peasants, Samurai and Sohei to represent a hero's Kashindan, about 10 six-sided dice (D6) and the aforementioned rules and game accessories are enough to drench your Katanas (Japanese swords) in blood. The army creation process allows a wide variety of styles to be played and the opportunity to adapt the commander to a player's personal style, whether you prefer to shoot arrows from a distance or to wield a Naginata in close combat. Although the author had the Heian/Kamakura period from 1000-1300 AD in mind, figures from up to the Sengoku Jidai (warring states) era should work as well with some historic laxity, as long as no firearms or face masks with beards are used.

The game was written by a gamer for gamers, and while the use of a turn deck may not be unheard of, a small random factor and not always being able to move all figures add a level of tactics that offers challenges similar to the unforeseen influences that affect the outcome of every battle in real life. The game mechanics are deliberately kept reasonably simple to allow both new and veteran players alike to get into the game quickly. Not having to read through half a dozen Warhammer tomes means that scenarios can be played in different ways to allow for the improvement of one's approach or a revanche after switching sides within a reasonable amount of time, usually around an hour.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Fleets and Fortunes
description:
Fleets and Fortunes is a turn based, strategic conquest board game.

Each player commands a fleet of ships and attempts to conquer territories, capture privateers, battle giant squids, and defeat rival players.

As the game begins, the randomized destinations within the board are unexplored and waiting be discovered. As players capture or destroy any territories, giant squids or privateers they reveal, the game’s rules automatically shift from Explore and Expand to Take No Prisoners. With the Take No Prisoners rules in effect, the truce amongst all players ends and players are freely able to attack, sabotage, and engage one another.

Players battle with a simple rolling mechanic that’s easy to learn and exciting to execute, upgrading victorious ships along the way building a strong, formidable fleet.

Each player can also play epic, card-based abilities to modify enemy attacks or improve their odds in battle. Many maneuvers can be played during enemy player turns, encouraging alliances between rivals to take down common enemies with powerful maneuver combinations.

A player might annihilate their rivals with Coordinated Assault, send enemy ships to the far side of the world with Siren’s Call, or Release the Kraken and sink any enemy ship they wish. Brutal combinations of maneuvers await any player with a sharp eye and strategic mind.

Make strategic alliances or embrace your inner pirate and backstab your neighbors. With 3 ways to win and no ties allowed, Fleets & Fortunes is the ultimate experience for any cunning strategist and aspiring pirate.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Metalfest
description: You are a up and coming music promoter looking to make your name on the metal scene by putting together a band that can win the Metalfest. Over 3 days you will build your band by drafting band members and gimmicks, but no one works for free. You will have to balance hiring with selling cards from your hand as merch. The only way to sell merch is to attract members of the crowd to your merch table, but they are picky. You will have to talior your bands sound and look to the crowds liking if you want to make fans out of them. At the end of the feastival the band that has made the most money and grown their fan base the most is the winner of the Metalfest.

name: All or Nothing
description: In All or Nothing you bid just that. You're going to take all of the tricks, or none. If you succeed, you're rewarded with a lower score and the first to zero (from 100) wins. If you fail, your score goes in the wrong direction. The goal is to succeed while making the other players fail. They're out to get you, so keep your eyes open for opportunities to meet your bid.

name: Just the Ticket
description:
You're an entrepreneur in the "Golden Age of Steam" building trains for international customers; the only problem is you're not alone!

Just the Ticket is a fast-moving card game where you're tasked with creating a faster, more powerful, more comfortable and bigger train than anyone else!

This is a 2 - 5 player game, for all ages, taking 10-30 minutes to play depending on the number of players. It only takes a few minutes to learn or to demo!

The game is set in the Golden Age of Steam where a number of entrepreneurs have set out to supply trains to their international clientèle: you are one of these entrepreneurs and you'll do everything you can to make sure your train is the best of the best!

Your train will be made up of the cards that you collect during the game including 1 crew, 1 engine, 1 tender, 1 fuel and as many carriages as you think you need to win.

name: Hammers & Anvils
description:
Hammers & Anvils is a craft and bash, 4 player, 5-15 minute card game where players attempt to take on the coveted role of the realm's greatest blacksmith.
Players compete over resources to be the first to forge a crown for their future Queen of Miramoun, but be careful as not every player plays nice. Players can steal, burn, destroy and even use a little bit of magic to put the game in their favor. But fear not, for you can too.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Battle Chefs
description: Culinary themed, lightly competitive card game that rewards creativity. Collect ingredient cards to complete order cards and score points that increase as more ingredients are used. Tempt other players with your description of the orders you complete for bonus yum tokens that can help you win if it is a tied game.

name: Gnomos
description:
The Gnomes are the protectors of minerals. They live in rocks, precious and semi-precious, conveying to them all their enormous energy. As children, the gnomes love to have fun. The game plays with all the magic that surrounds the fascinating world of these amazing creatures.
The game has 60 natural stones of 6 different types, a gnome resin and illustrated scenarios. At the beginning of the game each player receives a card indicating which of the six types of stones he or she should make the gnome collect 7 units. Using numbered cards, players can move the gnome in the stone path, always picking up the stone from where he finished the movement. But the trolls, their tradionais enemies will try to stop him. Will he get all 7 stones you need?

Os Gnomos são os protetores dos minerais. Moram em rochas e nas pedras preciosas e semi-preciosas, transmitindo para elas toda a sua enorme energia. Como as crianças, os gnomos adoram se divertir. O jogo brinca com toda a magia que envolve o fascinante mundo destas incríveis criaturas.
O jogo tem 60 pedras naturais de 6 diferentes tipos, um gnomo de resina e cenários ilustrados.
No início do jogo cada jogador recebe uma carta indicando qual dos seis tipos de pedras deverá fazer com que o gnomo recolha 7 exemplares. Usando cartas numeradas os jogadores movem o gnomo na trilha de pedras, sempre recolhendo a pedra do local onde finalizou seu movimento. Mas os trolls, seus tradionais inimigos, vão tentar impedi-lo. Será que ele vai conseguir todas as 7 pedras que você precisa?

name: Adding Play
description:
Adding play is a 52 card deck game design toolkit game for 1-4 players, play a game while making one. Use adding play to generate new game ideas or improve existing ones. It's a great introduction to game design and makes for the perfect gift for any budding game or user experience designer.

Gameplay begins with players choosing a theme for their game, followed by the game type; infinite or finite. Then in order, players choose from the four suites; motivators, victory conditions, game mechanics and social mechanics. Each card selected is read aloud, once there is, at least, one card from each suit the player can then begin to piece together their game idea. A session should last between 10-15 minutes, it's recommended to repeat 3 times, keeping each session set aside.

To increase the challenge of each game sessions, optional rules such as a time limit for ideas or set quantities picked from each suit.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: A Distant Thunder
description:
…the naval battles of the Dutch Wars were unlike any that had been fought before in terms of the number of ships engaged in the rival fleets and the extraordinary and unprecedented firepower they carried into battle. The sonorous sounds of those distant encounters were heard fearfully by awed and wondering folk on the coasts of England, the Netherlands and France, drifting in like a distant thunder. (Hainsworth and Churches, 1998)

A Distant Thunder is a Historical Simulation of the Anglo-Dutch wars at Sea of the Mid-Seventeenth Century. The bitter commercial rivalry between England and the Dutch Republic sparked a series of three wars fought in the span of just over two decades. These hard-fought conflicts spurred innovations in the art and science of war at sea and would serve as the template for maritime conflict for the next two centuries.

A Distant Thunder examines war at sea at the dawn of the age of fighting sail at both the Battle (tactical) and Campaign levels. In the Battle Game, players recreate single historical engagements between fleets. The simple initiative and control system allows players to select maneuvers and move groups of ships in a way that models the inherent friction of command and control of the time. Maneuvers are executed using counters representing groups of 3-4 ships, allowing players to easily recreate the often very large (~90 ships in each fleet) battles of these wars.

Campaign Game Scenarios focus on important portions (approximately 2 months) of each of these wars. In a Campaign, players strive to secure control of the sea, while denying it to their opponent. Players must pay close attention to logistics, weather and tides to ensure their battle-fleets are in the proper condition and position to prevail. Fog of war models the limited intelligence available to the commanders. Players provide orders to their fleets on a Campaign map, and when opposing forces meet, battle is resolved on the Battle Map as with the tactical game.

A Distant Thunder covers a number of historical Battle and Campaign scenarios including:

First Anglo Dutch War(1652-1654):
Dover‚óèPlymouth‚óèKentish Knock‚óèDungeness‚óèPortland‚óèGabbard Shoal‚óèScheveningen

Second Anglo Dutch War(1665-1667):
Lowestoft‚óèThe Four Days Battle‚óèSt. James Day Fight

Third Anglo Dutch War(1672-1674)
Solebay‚óèFirst Battle of Schooneveld‚óèSecond Battle of Schooneveld‚óèTexel

Battles range from relatively small engagements (~20 ships per side) to very large (~100 ships per side). Battle scenarios can be played in a few hours and the tactical system is highly suitable for solitaire play.

Campaign scenarios range from approximately 6 to more than 20 hours to play.

name: Mettle
description:
2315 – It's 200 years since the Global Nuclear War and the following nuclear winter on planet Earth. The New Earth League, headed by the new super-power, the Xian, has ordered exploration of Alpha Centauri, with the prime mission to discover habitable planets and new forms of energy. Currently, the energy for propulsion, plasma from Helium-3 fusion, maxes out space ship thrusters at one-tenth the speed of light.

After mining Helium-3 on Mars and the Moon, it has taken over 50 years and three space bases to traverse the 40 trillion kilometres to reach AC. The pioneers spend their days charting and mining the planets and moons of the 3-star system.

On a routine mining trip to super-hot planet, Sir Isaac Newton, a new type of lava is discovered. Rumours soon spread throughout the factions of a new volatile fuel for propulsion. Admirals are alerted, suspicions are raised and treaties are broken.

Five competing factions: the Freelanders, New Brittany, the Nairobi, the Xian (Sian) and the Mozzies vie for control of the newly discovered resource. It's unstable properties could be harnessed to allow mankind to finally reach it’s long-sought-after goal – to travel at the speed of light!

You are the captain of your faction. Lead your sky-bots and miners into the fray against cunning adversaries in a winner-take-all, pell-mell battle. Will your people share in the staggering discovery, and glory – or be left far, far behind.

METTLE, is a 2-player space combat game, played with fantastic miniatures on 124 two inch tiles. Your goal is to fight past enemy bots, including a cloaked one, knock out laser towers and destroy the opposition fortress. Along the way you must collect lava-X and titanium which can be traded for reinforcements.

METTLE is a fast-paced game where both players are immersed in the action at all times.

name: Pirate Attack!
description:
The basic strategy of Pirate Attack! is to build up your ships while sinking your opponent's ships. Meanwhile other players are trying to do the same thing to you.

After sending your ship to sea, you can play Blacksmith cards to increase your cannons or decrease another players cannons, Carpenter cards to increase your strength or decrease another players strength. Draw an Attack Card and then destroy an opponent's ship (if you can). When a ship is sunk, receive gold which can be spent at The Market on Witch Doctor Cards so you can curse your opponent's ships. Buy some Fortune Teller Cards to protect yourself from others placing Witch Doctor Cards on your ships.

Summon a Sea Creature to attack other player's ships. Force two other players to attack each other. Anything you can do to destroy your enemies and become the ruler of the seas.

Use a Spy to remove useful cards from other players or a Thieving Monkey to take a card from an opponent and keep it. Better keep a good watch on your gold with a Guard or someone may try to steal it with a Thief.

Lower the prices at the Market so you can buy more items or close the Market so your opponents cannot buy items to hurt you with.

Once you have several ships at your command, use the Armada Card to join them all together and fight as one to destroy your enemies.

Force your opponents to Walk The Plank or strand them on an island so they lose a turn.

The play is simple. Draw 1 card, play 1 card (some cards can alter this). Play a ship, increase your ship, decrease another players ship, open/ close a market, steal cards or if you draw an attack card then attack a player with your ship. Receive gold and buy items to make you stronger or hurt your opponents.

Each expansion pack adds more things you can do and more markets to buy from to help you on your quest to rule the seas.

The main game includes 350 cards. There are 6 expansion packs ranging from 50 to 100 cards each. Each expansion pack adds a new level of play to the game.

The first expansion pack of 50 cards "Pirate Attack- The Magic Shop" adds a Magic Shop full of things to help your ships and hurt your enemies. Double your ships cannons or strength, reincarnate ships, confuse where a ship attacks, and some main deck cards like Royal Navy to attack all ships and Hurricanes.

The second expansion pack of 50 cards "Pirate Attack- Raise The Dead" adds bigger ships, cards to steal Magic Shop cards, more Sea Creatures, larger Royal Navy, Raise the Dead cards, Duplicate a ship, Spirit of Good Fortune, Eliminate Cards and Sails of Invisibility.

The third expansion pack of 50 cards "Pirate Attack- Miss-Direction" adds more Ships, more Sea Creatures, Whirlpools, Windstorms, Stranded On An Island, Exploding Cannons, and Miss Direction.

The forth expansion pack of 100 cards and 2 Dice "Pirate Attack- Walk The Plank" adds another Ship, Walk The Plank, The Trap, Smoke Screen, Power Play, The Magician, Damn Pirates, Insurance, Ship Bonus, Card Bonus, Into The Sea, Davy Jones Locker, End Of The World, Force Fields, Visions, Return To Port and The Gambler. So many more ways to mess with other players.

The fifth expansion pack of 100 cards and 1 Chip "Pirate Attack- The Tavern" adds a whole new market. The Tavern is a place where you can bribe a drunk sailor into telling you secrets and info, some good, some bad. Get Double Play, Sneak Thief, Pick Pockets, add cannons and strength to all of your ships, give away your hand, make someone lose their gold, mix all cards and re-deal, give all ships a Witch Doctor, hurt another player with minus cannons and strength to all their ships.

The sixth expansion pack of 50 cards and 2 dice "Pirate Attack- Special Abilities" gives players (who chose to) a Special Ability, but only if they are willing to Sell Their Soul to get it. Get a bad item like no ships bigger than 7/7, overcharged at markets, no gold when killing a ship. But then get a good item like Black Market, The Vault, or Money Master. This deck also includes The Blockade so you can stop cards from being played and 20 new ships with abilities.
The main game can be played as a stand alone and expansion packs can be added to give the players more things to do during the game. Best when played with 3 to 10 players. Ages 8 and up.
This is a high quality game. It comes in a nice, sturdy 9" x 12" x 3" game box with plastic insert to hold all the cards from the main game and each expansion pack, so all the cards are together. Expansion pack boxes can be folded and placed under the plastic insert for keeping.

The game has great replay ability. Not the same old game every time. Certain cards make things different every game. You can even remove cards to give the game a different play. Play with or without expansion packs. You can play to a certain number of Fame Points, play for a specified amount of time and most Fame Points at that time wins or play all the cards and go for last ship standing wins.

name: Dust Tactics: Taskforce Rhino
description:
Welcome to the new version of Dust Tactics! Whether you’re a new player or a veteran who wants to get into the Allied faction, this starter set is made for you!
Inside this Starter Set you’ll discover the new Dust Tactics rules and a complete army that will allow for countless games. This army is also a strong base to build a larger force upon, or to add to another Starter Set to field an even larger force! Everything you need to play is in the box, you just need to find an opponent!

CONTENT OF THIS BOX:

one hero, Rhino
one squad of three Hammers
one Wildfire walker
one rule booklet with the introductions rules to Dust Tactics
twelve Dust dice
one tank trap
one ammo crate
six terrain tile
one gaming mat
one catalog
one leaflet


These miniatures come with their unit cards, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules.
Like all regular Dust miniatures, these are already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as wish! You can paint directly on them, since the priming serve as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mushroom Mania
description:
You are a mushroom mania!
You find a new mushroom!!
Make a great name for the new mushroom.
Other players try to be the second discoverer, try to find one from many mushrooms by the name!

--

Ë≤¥Êñπ„Åü„Å°„ÅØ„Ç≠„Éé„Ç≥„Éû„Éã„Ç¢„Åß„ÅôÔºÅ
„Åì„ÅÆ„Åü„Å≥Êñ∞Á®Æ„ÅÆ„Åç„ÅÆ„Åì„ÇíÁô∫Ë¶ã„Åó„Åæ„Åó„ÅüÔºÅ
„Åì„ÅÆ„Åç„ÅÆ„Åì„Å´„ÅÑ„ÅÑÊÑü„Åò„ÅÆÂêçÂâç„Çí„Å§„Åë„Å¶„ÅÇ„Åí„Å¶„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ
