name: Contagion
description:
A bluffing card game for 3-6 players.

Players secretly choose role cards and play as disease causing agents. Players bluff and try to play cards to change the moisture and temperature conditions in the body. When a player believes conditions are right, he plays an infection card to take over the body and win the game. Penalties and rewards come with the bluffing system so that it is in players' best interest to bluff and call out other players' bluffs.

Coming to Kickstarter summer 2016!

name: Picnic Panic
description: In Picnic Panic command a tribe of warrior ants fight other tribes for control of a stash of candy that has fallen on the ground. The game is easy to learn and quick to play. Best of all, you get to eat the candy that you capture!

name: Herr Kompositor Card Game: Comporre √® un gioco
description:
Description from the publisher:

Herr Kompositor Card Game. A composing game allows you to enjoy the thrill of musical creation even if you don't know notes and chords. In this strategy game, you challenge your opponent, gain chords, complete your song, then listen to it!

AIM OF THE GAME
- 2 players game
Each player is a composer and has to compose a song of 16 bars before the opponent. Any direct fight with his/her opponent, if won, gives a player the right to draw one or more cards and win (or lose) one or more bars. The player who finishes all 16 bars first is the winner.
- 1 player game
Do you want to write the best love song ever? Or do you want to become the greatest composer in the world? Each time you play, you will compose a new song in AAA, ABA, AAB, ABAA form... You have no limits!

Components


56 cards
Rules (in italian / in english: downloadable from http://bit.ly/28MUkG3)
Videotutorials (in italian: http://bit.ly/28LfPIv)
mechanics: Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Tile Placement, Trick-taking

name: Reisepass-Quartett
description:
From the publisher:

We developed a special cardgame: Passport Quartets! The goal is to win all the passports of your opponents by comparing their power indexes. By this game we want to draw attention to the global power imbalance and the discriminatory practice of visa issuance. Visa applications from people coming from the Global South are rejected above average and mostly on the grounds of the insufficient “intent to return”. Hereby, the visa allocation is used as a way of racist and power-motivated exclusion of people who want to come to Europe for professional or private reasons. The visa allocation manifests the power and privileges of the Global North.

The game includes 28 passport-cards and 6 action cards.

A critical and informative game for the whole family!

--------------------------------------------------------------

Wir haben ein Kartenspiel der besonderen Art entwickelt: das Reisepass-Quartett! Mit dem Ausspielen verschiedener Reisepässe gegeneinander, wollen wir die Problematik des globalen Machtungleichgewichts und der unfairen Visavergabepraxis auf spielerische Art und Weise in die Öffentlichkeit bringen. Visaanträge von Menschen aus Ländern des Globalen Südens werden überdurchschnittlich häufig und meist mit der Begründung angeblich fehlender „Rückkehrbereitschaft“ abgelehnt. Die Visavergabe wird so als Mittel zur rassistischen und machtmotivierten Ausgrenzung von Menschen, die aus beruflichen oder privaten Gründen die Grenze nach Europa überschreiten möchten, benutzt.

Das Reisepass-Quartett klärt auf, führt zu Selbstreflexion und macht vor allem eine Menge Spielspaß mit Freund*innen und Familie!

28 Reisepass-Karten – authentische Spielatmosphäre!
- Frei ausgewählte Länder
- Aufklappbar, handliches Format, doppelseitig bedruckt
- Außen: Abbild des Reisepasses
- Innen: Länderinformationen und Spielwerte
- Eingeteilt in 7 Ländergruppen zur Quartett-Bildung
- Werte aus fünf Kategorien: Macht, Visabewilligungsquote, Bürokratie, Auslandsvertretung und Schutz vor Willkür
- Trümpfe: individuell in bestimmten Duellen, erhöht die Chance auch mit einem „schwachem“ Pass zu gewinnen

6 Aktionskarten – bringen Schwung in die Partie!
- 3 unterschiedliche Aktionskarten je 2mal im Spiel
- Kreativität, Schlagfertigkeit und taktisches Ausspielen der Machtposition im globalen Kontext gefordert
- Beispiel „Rückkehrbereitschaft“: entscheide willkürlich über die Einreise deiner Mitspieler*in in dein Land

name: Bulwark: The Liars' Court
description:
A new foe deck for Bulwark.

Contains the following cards:

1x cover
5x Beastling Rabble
5x Beastling Troop
2x Beastling Master
2x Great Arrano
2x Great Otsoa
2x Dracoraptor
2x Tusked Basurde
3x Punji Sticks
2x Beastling Druid
1x Lechies, Demon of the Wood
1x Alazne Lehoia, Beastling Queen of Lughnasadh
1x Sendoa Hartza, Beastling King of Imbolc
1x Itxaro Untxia, Beastling Beltane Princess
1x Itzal Zaldia, Beastling Samhain Prince
1x Dance of the Thorns
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Bulwark: Calendar of the Ancients
description:
A new location deck for Bulwark.

Contains the following cards:

1x cover
1x Udaberri
1x Udan
1x Udazken
1x Negua
1x Koanga Manuru
1x Raumati
1x Ngaruhu
1x Hotoke
4x Field of Honour
4x Mask Dance
8x Company of Rangers
4x Beastling Chorus
4x Mossy Trilithon
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Strada
description: The players have to move two cars from their garage at the corners of the game board around the track and back to their garage. Movement is determined by a die. Two traffic lights are operated by the roll of a 3 or a 5. Two event spaces (breakdown and restaurant/stadion) hinder the movement of the cars. The first player to return his two cars to his garage wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Stratego Legends: Celams and Noslrac
description:
Typically given away at conventions as a set, these promotional pieces for Stratego Legends add two new units with unique abilities to the game. Each piece comes with a game piece sticker and a rules reference sticker.


207 Celams (10) - Dragon - light army - Valorians (gold)


Ability: Reveal Celams when a piece flies over her to destroy the piece that flew over Celams.
Action: Flying. Reveal Celams to jump her over any number of pieces or water spaces vertically or horizontally. Celams must land on the first empty space when flying.


208 Noslrac (10) - Mutant - dark army - Qa'ans (purple)


Ability: Reveal Noslrac and an adjacent Mutant to give that Mutant +2 until the end of turn. Use this ability only once per turn.
Death Curse: When this Death Curse ends, chosen opponent destroys 5 pieces under his control simultaneously. Then choose and destroy 3 pieces under your control simultaneously.
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Deeper Darkness
description:
Deeper Darkness is an asymmetrical esoteric horror board game for two players.

The game pits the combined might of a highly trained division of troopers against Nithodeus the unclean as he stalks his prey through the labyrinthine passages of an ancient Himalayan temple. Frightened, and facing humanity’s darkest imagination manifest, the troopers will be tested to their limit, having to stave off madness as they are hunted by the diabolical Nithodeus and his sinister magic.

The game play experience is unique dependant on which side each player chooses. The troopers objective is to find and repair a generator. This will allow them to power a radio and call in an air strike to destroy the temple and the evil within it.

As Nithodeus and his army of vermin, the goal is to drive the troopers insane and feed on their madness to grow strong enough to destroy them outright. To do this he will use powerful spells to bend the game to his will.

name: Red Flags Run
description:
Red Flags Run (Á¥ÖÊóó‰∫Ç) is a operational solitaire wargame to simulate the Encirclement Campaigns from 1930 to 1934 in Jiangxi.

Player controls the CCP (‰∏≠ÂúãÂÖ±Áî¢Èª®) Red Army (Á¥ÖËªç) to defend the HQ in Ruijin (ÁëûÈáë) and to defeat the KMT(‰∏≠ÂúãÂúãÊ∞ëÈª®) National Revolutionary Army (ÂúãÊ∞ëÈù©ÂëΩËªç) from four directions. Player uses a set of normal poker to activate the KMT forces and special event. Every card represents 2-3 months. Every counter represents forces, defense, or tactics. Player needs to survive five stages of military encirclements or increase the political prestige to 10 to win the game.

Contents:

1 A4 Color Map
11 die-cut counters (5/8 inch)


NOTES:
Map printed on two sides: one in English, the other in Chinese.
Rules in Chinese translated in English.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: Clusterfight!: And Whose Army? Expansion Pack
description:
From the publisher:

Clusterfight is a party game of hypothetical battles for 3-12 players. If you've ever stayed up into the wee hours debating the finer points of Freddy vs. Jason, or Kirk vs. Picard, this game's for you. And seriously, who really thinks that the landmark case of Alien vs. Predator settled anything? Nobody even stopped to ask, "What if Predator had laser eyes?" Each round in Clusterfight, players throw combatants into the ring, then change the dynamics of the fight with "battle cards". Sure, Batman could beat up the Pope, but what if Batman was "Vomiting Uncontrollably" and the Pope was "Fighting Mad"? Everyone has a chance to bet on the outcome, then a judge decides the winner and bets are settled. When all players have judged twice, the player with the most points wins!

50 card expansion to the popular party game Clusterfight! New Battlegrounds, Items, Actions & Statuses and Fighters. All cards created by our Kickstarter backers.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Storytelling, Take That

name: Malifaux Second Edition:  Take Back the Night ‚Äì Molly Box Set
description:
The Box Set for Molly. Contains Molly, Necrotic Machine (Totem), Phillip and the Nanny (Henchman), and three Crooligans.

Miniatures are unassembled on plastic sprues with associated character cards and upgrades. It differs substantially from the first edition in that, there are new plastic sculpts, 2nd edition cards and it contains Phillip and the Nanny and the Necrotic Machine, but does not contain a rogue necromancy.

Molly is a resurrectionist master and former belle of Seamus. She works well with Belle models and can summon them and either Horrors or Spirits with the appropriate upgrade.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: TennisMania
description:
TennisMania simulates a tennis match with dice and cards for the individual players. Choose your favorite champion among the four available, studies the opponent's weaknesses, choose whether to play on the ground, grass or concrete.

Each player receives 1 tactical card and 10 actions cards (service, volée, back, smash, etc) of his champion, then shuffle each deck of Reaction, Challenge and Event cards.

Before each match determine who goes first by rolling the D12. The person serving gets 3 ball cards, these determine which direction(or lane) you are attempting to hit the ball into. The other player gets two ball cards. Whoever is serving then chooses an Action card to attempt and rolls the D12. The card will tell you what each Die result will mean remembering to take into consideration any modifiers the tactics card grants you. You might fail by missing the ball, hitting the net, or even hitting it out on the opponents side. Or you might succeed by merely hitting it in, lobbing it in or ACE smashing it in. you then drag the Ball token to the appropriate spot on the board and the other player gets a chance to respond based on the type of success was achieved, attempting to hit it back in a similar manner. The Player go back and forth like this until some one misses or all 5 balls are used. Points are awarded the same way they are in real tennis and win conditions are also identical.

name: Zomburbs
description:
Zomburbs is the zombie apocalypse if it were to happen in your idyllic neighborhood. It is also an interactive deck-building game in which you shoot zombies, build your fort, buy loot, and ...ahem... "help" your neighbors, in order to thrive during the zombie apocalypse. We felt that the deck-building genre too often felt like a 4 person game of solitaire. Our aim is to evolve the genre and create a game where you might be scratching your opponent's back...just to stab it later.

The objective of the game is to accumulate the most victory points in both your deck and your fort by the end of the game. Cards will have varying number of victory points and weapon cards are worth no victory points since you use them to earn higher victory point cards called cure cards. The game ends when either the wound or cure cards are exhausted.

At the end of each turn an increasing number of zombies will be added to a player's walls. Creatures stay behind your walls until they are either shot or if they overcome the strength of your wall. When creatures come over you walls you can end up taking wound cards which are worth a negative one victory point and they will hinder your deck a bit. There are ways to remove wound cards and there are not that many in a game so your deck will not be adversely affected by them.

There is a resource in the game that you can collect called scrap. It can be used in one of two ways. One you can use it to reinforce your walls, therefore preventing zombies from coming over and giving you wounds. You can also use it to construct buildings. Buildings are essentially abilities that you can use at least once per turn since they don't have to drawn from your deck, they are also worth a good amount of victory points. An example of one building is the zombie catapult which you can use to fling zombies on your walls towards other players.

If you help other players you can earn two different types of cards. One type is called consumables and they are one time burn cards that can either help you or mess with the other players. The other card you can earn are cure cards which are worth a decent number of victory points and provide the ability to easily kill creatures on your walls, therefore allowing you to continue to "help" other players.

The game is a "take that" game so players who prefer coop games might not enjoy the mechanics of messing with the other players. I spent a significant amount of time in making the cards that affect other players in a mild and fun way versus king maker or knocking somebody out. The game was intended to be very interactive so most abilities are centered on that. Alliances will be formed and broken throughout the game which makes it very dynamic each time.

There really is no trashing in this game so you only start with 5 cards. This allows a player to get to making fun card combos much sooner in the game. This also allows you to focus more on the type of strategy that you are going for in the game.

The cards for purchase in the tableau area are fairly unique with a maximum of 2 copies versus 10 of the same card that normal deck builders have. This gives each player a unique feel/identity each game. It also makes the replay value fun and fresh each time you play the game.

name: WeQu
description:
WeQu is a fun card game to get to know people in minutes while revealing the best qualities about yourself – for relationship and work. Players win the game by obtaining higher WeQu Scores between players based few factors. They are common qualities they share together and the level of understanding between each players. Players use WeQu app to unlock scores and record the score.

In weQu app there is a leaderboard where player can compare scores and see the development of one's play history.

The WeQu deck is composed of cards describing essential virtues and characteristics. Players take turns drawing two cards and selecting the card that best fits their playing partner. As you draw cards and learn about others, you also discover how the world sees you, all in a positive game.

When players completed the card deck, you will get a unique arrangement of cards that represent your personality and characteristics. Use WeQu app to capture the results and unlock the WeQu score.

name: Malifaux Second Edition: Smoke and Mirrors
description:
Second edition box set for Colette. Contains Collette, three Mechanical Doves (totems), Cassandra (Henchman), two Performers, two Mannequins. Box is in plastic and must be assembled. Contains relevant character and upgrade cards.

Collette is an Arcanist master who concentrates on dropping scheme markers and manipulating markers. She is a showgirl model and works well with showgirls.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Immortal Warriors
description:
In Immortal Warriors, players take on the roles of warriors cursed with immortality. They fight forever against the hidden evils of the land, playing throughout the ages of history and into the future.

In this turn-based game, players roll their dice up to three times in hope of matching the enemy before them, in the guise of a symbol on the card. They are fighting through battlegrounds in different time periods, to face off the boss at the end of each era in a final confrontation. If the boss is defeated, the player is awarded extra battle prowess (in the form of a reserve die) that they take with them to the next era.

With each foe the player manages to defeat, their score increases handsomely. With each loss the player takes, they are weakened and a die is removed from their pool.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: TaRocca Castle
description:
Although TaRocca employs hexagonal cards that look like cubes both to extend the traditional French card game, Tarot, and to enhance the layout and experience of using the deck for divination, most importantly, the game comes with instructions to play TaRocca Castle („Çø„É≠„ÉÉ„Ç´„Éª„Ç≠„É£„ÉÉ„Çπ„É´). As with a number of games from Rocca Spiele, the goal of the game is to empty your hand of cards. In this game, however, the minor and major arcana cards have distinct rules dictating how they must be played to build the titular castle. For a minor arcana example, cards of the same suit must be laid out to form a path, but cards of the same number must be laid out as if you were stacking the depicted cubes atop one another. Major arcana cards are placed as rooms at the ends of such paths. Additionally, each minor arcana suit has cards that provide special effects, such as forcing the next player to draw, or allowing you to forcibly give cards to another player.

As is traditional with Rocca Spiele games, the rules are fairly simple, with the focus being on producing an artistic 3D layout on the table.

name: IBETCHA
description:
Overview

IBETCHA is a highly interactive mix of Cards Against Humanity and Never Have I Ever. Guess what your friends have done, hear their stories, then laugh your face off. You're gonna love IBETCHA, we guarantee it. The game is basically truth serum for people that aren't in the CIA (and some that are). See which of your friends can read people, dazzle them with your past mistakes, then crush them.

Game Rules

To start the game, each player draws eight random Betcha Cards that say things your friends may have done or are willing to do. All the cards are ranked by explicitness (1 to 3 points).

Each round has a different Victim. Everyone puts down a card (face-down) they think the Victim has done. Then, the Victim has to respond "yes" or "no" to each one. The group then screams which story they want the Victim to tell. Whoever submitted the chosen card, gets to keep it and receives the number of points on it. The first person to reach 10 points, wins!*


You can also play forever.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Print & Play

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle ‚Äì Anarchs Unbound
description:
Vampire: Elder Kindred Network's fourth expansion for Vampire: the Eternal Struggle is Anarchs Unbound, which focuses on the rabble-rousing revolutionaries of the Anarch Movement - those Kindred who reject the Traditions of the Camarilla and stifling order of their elders. The expansion is released in PDF format.

The set contains 24 crypt cards and 18 library cards. The crypt cards span Groups 1 through 6.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Icomega
description:
Icomega is a short and simple Paper and Pencil game derived from Omega, by the same designer, that is played on the faces of a regular polihedron (such as an icosahedron, a D30, a D60 or a D120).

2 players (White and Black) alternate turns placing one stone of each colour on any two empty faces of the polihedron.

When all faces have been occupied the game ends. Each player multiplies the sizes of all groups of her colour. The highest score wins. Icomega is very drawish for a small number of faces.

name: Lin
description:
IntroductionLin is a drawless territory game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the intersections (points) of an odd-sized, initially empty square board. The suggested sizes are between 9x9 and 19x19.



DefinitionsA domain of one color is a set of orthogonally adjacent points that includes no points occupied by the opposite color. In other words, a domain of one color can include zero or more stones of that color and zero or more empty points.

A domain is alive if it includes a line of six orthogonally adjacent points in the same row or column. When the game is played on tiny boards, the required line length can be reduced.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate.

On their turn, a player must place a stone of their own color on an empty point that is part of a living domain of their color.

After a placement, all enemy stones that are part of no living domains are removed from the board.



ObjectiveThe game ends when there are no points on the board belonging to living domains of both colors. The player with the highest score wins. A player's score is the number of board points that are part of living domains of their color in the final position, plus a komi in the case of White.



KomiThe komi is the even number of points which are added to White's score at the end of the game as a compensation for playing second. Before the game starts, the first player tells his opponent the even number which will be used as komi, and then the second player chooses which color to play.



AcknowledgementsLin was inspired by Rin and Loops.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Enclosure, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Social Cooking
description:
Think Iron Chef and Apples to Apples, only you're playing with the intent to really eat those apples!

Fast paced, party style, game of cooking and socializing. A judge reveals a secret ingredient for a dish. Cooking players create different dishes using ingredient cards they're dealt. Players with the best mixes, a dish the judge enjoys, win. Food items used in dish are collected as points for those who played them. At the end of all rounds, the player with the most food cards stored as points is the winner.

Social Cooking is picture based and has been successfully played by kids as young as 3 years old. If you eat food and have an opinion on what taste good or bad, you can play.

Game is 3-4 players but scales up +4 players per deck. Can be played with 2 players with the use of a couple dummy hands.

name: Motherland
description:
Motherland is a game of suspicion and accusation, paranoia and groupthink. Citizens must stay alert to the Spies among them, while Spies collectively conspire against the Citizens. All in the name of the glorious Motherland.

The dreaded Gulag awaits!

Motherland is a hidden role game where players secretly take on the role of either citizen or spy. Under the watch of the Block Captain, each round takes place in three phases: Gossip (players discuss who should be sent to the Gulag), Troika (a team of three players votes on who to send to the Gulag), and Darkness (Spies that have not already been sent to the Gulag secretly notify the Block Captain of an additional player that gets sent to the Gulag by force in the night). Gameplay continues repeating rounds until only two players remain outside of the Gulag. If only citizens remain, the citizens win the game. If even one spy remains free, the spies win.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: King & Parliament
description:
The conflict between King Charles I and Parliament had come to an irreparable breach by the time the King raised his royal standard at Nottingham. There was now war between the King and his Parliament and the country was divided in its loyalties. The Royalists, who favor the King’s cause, begin the war with many excellent troops and an advantage in cavalry troops, but have initial limited financial support from mostly towns and castles. Parliament starts with a somewhat reliable force in the London Trained Bands and a more solid financial backing from most of the kingdom’s cities, but initial cavalry and leaders do not inspire confidence. Of course, the fortunes of war can change these circumstances over time.


Two Player game refighting what is often referred to as the First English Civil War. This Renaissance conflict is often identified in the “Pike and Shot” category, since musketeers fought around blocks of pike men for protection from cavalry.
Troop Types are represented with abstract counters. Infantry counters denote up to 1500 men and cavalry units represent up to 1000 men. There are units of dragoons and artillery trains as well. Special and elite units are also represented, such as the Northern Horse, Cornish Infantry, Lifeguards, and Hasselrigg’s Lobsters. Both sides can also press Levies into service when necessary.
Game Boards display a map of England and most of Scotland. It is hex based with terrain within each and many prominent towns, cities, manor houses and castles are portrayed. Some of these locations have high fortification ratings and some do not. Necessary playing tables are located on the board for ease of play and necessary reference charts are provided to assist the players.
Noteworthy Commanders are represented in the game, with holding boxes for leaders of larger armies.
Multiple Scenarios to play depending on when players want to begin and how long they want to play.


Game Features


Leader Driven - Play is divided into turns, but players move alternately, sometimes one going before the other a few times depending on circumstances. Leaders are the core to the game system with all actions being mostly conducted by them. Leaders have ability ratings for strategy and battle. Some also have special characteristics peculiar to them such as Impetuous, Financial Resources, Cavalry Commander, etc.
Multiple Events Combination - These continuously have an effect on the game. This is provided by a combination of the turn chart, a random events table, and event counters. Event counters are played immediately on locations, leaders, or units and at times are deployed by the choice of a player.
Strategy Counters - These can be rolled for by leaders, and the larger their rating the better. This provides some uncertainty as well as advantages and disadvantages as appropriate to each case. Strategy counters can be played immediately or held for the duration of the turn for opportune moments.
Variable Combat System - Each side has a respective Battle Deck to add more panache to the Combat Result Table (CRT). The CRT gauges results based upon the size of the battle, so it is not one size fits all.
Scotland Shown - Many games on the English Civil War focus solely England and Wales. The necessary parts of Scotland are shown here to include the effects of Montrose’s campaign on the war.
Attractive Coin Counters - Provided to help track paying for the cost of war.

name: Andes Fleet
description:
This game by Technical Term Game Company of Japan comes packaged with Iron Lady's Fleet 2, a remake of the company's 2007 game on the Falklands war. Like others in the series (including Antarctic Fleet and 4th Fleet), it is based on the Victory Games Fleet System of tactical and operational naval warfare, using individual named naval ships, airplane squadrons, and smaller coastal patrol combatants.

This game deals with potential naval conflict between Ecuador and an allied Colombia and Peru. As a result, it has only a single sheet of counters, and splits an Antarctic Fleet-size map in half, with ILF2 on the other half.

name: Tease: The Liberating Game for Couples and Groups
description:
Tease combines a classic drinking game with an array of sexy and titillating features, such as massage, lap-dance and sexy fantasies. Designed to seduce the senses, this experimental game can be played between you and your loved one; or if you are feeling more adventurous it can also be played with up to two other like-minded couples or between 2 to 6 adult players. Tease warms you up with five levels of rewards and forfeits, releasing your inhibitions and removing your clothes as you progress around the board. Tease includes: 1 game board, 6 playing pieces, 150 Rewards, 150 Forfeits and 50 fantasies, including Fetish, Role Play, Massage, Voyeur and Threesome. Adults only.

Play consists of roll & move around a board marked with spaces representing various actions such as Drink, Massage, or Strip. Some spaces instruct you to draw from a deck of cards and perform the action described. These are sorted by intensity during setup and go from "truths" like describing your last crush, through physical and mental challenges, up to and including sexual acts with the other players.

Your prize for reaching the end first is first pick of the Fantasy cards. Each card is a scenario to played out by you and the other players after everyone has finished the game.

The rules have well thought out variations for different numbers and combinations of relationships between the player, from 2 to 6 players. The wide variety of action cards let you select an intensity level appropriate to your group.

name: Iron Lady's Fleet 2: Modern Naval Combat in Falkland '82
description:
This game is a remake of Japanese publisher Technical Term Game Company's 2007 title, Iron Lady's Fleet. Like its predecessor and others in the publisher's series of modern naval conflict games, it is based on the Victory Games Fleet System of tactical and operational naval warfare.

Iron Lady's Fleet 2 takes a fresh look at the Falklands War conflict between Britain and Argentina, with a new mapboard, a new strategic movement grid, some new units and counters, and rule updates to bring this nine-year-old game into line with the company's more recent titles.

The game comes in a ziplock package with Japanese rules, and Iron Lady's Fleet 2 is packaged with a new, smaller game, Andes Fleet, which looks at possible naval conflict among Peru, Colombia and Ecuador.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Life Sucks.  The Game.
description:
Life Sucks is a party bidding game where players expend future potential to avoid or embrace the worst life has to offer. In the end, only two players win: the one with the most points and the one with the fewest.

Each player begins the game with 15 points and 7 success cards. These cards are the best things a player might achieve if not for life getting in the way. They range in level of achievement and can include having once gotten a B+, becoming a local celebrity, writing a bestseller, or owning a private island.

During each of the 5 rounds, a number of life event cards will be revealed (one for each player). All life events are bad and they can manipulate a player's point total, cause on-going problematic effects, or effect end game scoring.

Players then secretly bid with their success cards (numbered 1 through 7). Once revealed, the players choose life events from the pool from the player that spent the highest card to the player that spent the lowest. When there's a tie, success card suits will determine the winner. The suits are Intelligence, Charisma, Wealth, Health, Creativity, Looks, and Charm.

Life events and which suits break ties will change across the rounds as the players get older. Young life events appear during the first and second rounds, adult life events appear during the third and fourth rounds, and elderly events appear during the last (fifth) round.

At the end of the game, life events permitting, each player adds the value of any unused life events to their point total. The player with the most points wins. The player with the least points shares in an equal (and often more difficult) victory.

name: The Streets of Commonville
description:
From the publisher:

Commonville. A dangerous place to be. Especially since a callous murderer has gone into hiding within its maze of streets. With a warning given to police that if they don’t call off their manhunt within an hour, another innocent civilian will pay the price. It’s up to you and your team to discover which of the 12 suspects is the offender, where they are hiding, which weapon was used on the victim, and arrest him/her before the time runs out.

In this game, each member of the team gets to play as one of Commonville's finest, exploring the city, consisting of tiles. Each tile contains either a suspect, evidence that can be used to eliminate suspects, or something to assist you in solving the case in time.

During each round, each player will roll a varying amount of dice up to 3 times. You may then use the dice for movement (by matching the number on the destination tile), for gathering evidence (with any 4 consecutive dice), and for getting assistance (with any 3 matching dice). Donuts can be used to perform special dice actions (such as passing a die to another player). There is also a special blue Investigation die that can be used to perform actions rapidly (but only by the lead detective). After performing any actions, the team must move the time marker down a number of spaces equal to the number shown on the time die plus 1 minute for every wild 6 that was used for an action.

There are 12 possible suspects in the game. Once you have collected enough evidence to eliminate 11 of them (and found the weapon that was used on the last victim), you must collect an Arrest Warrant from the Police Precinct and arrest the remaining suspect. If you can do all of this before time runs out, the team wins the game.

name: Squaremino
description:
The Squaremino board game is a challenging and addictive abstract game for 2-4 players that uses a unique set of domino-like tiles. Players take turns adding sets and sequences to a public network of tiles, attempting to be the first to play all of their tiles.

Players of various skill levels can all enjoy this game as more casual gamers will enjoy a relaxing social experience and more advanced players will enjoy exploring complex strategies. The game play is a blend of competition and cooperation as players pursue individual goals while jointly building upon a common structure.

The generously-sized game tiles feel delightful to the touch and are pleasing to the ear as they are shuffled together. As the game play progresses, beautiful patterns of colors emerge, creating an elegant work of art by game's end.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Carps & Angsty Manatee: Volume 2 (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
A third-party, unofficial parody expansion pack for Cards Against Humanity.

Includes 150 brand new, original cards (125 ridiculous white cards & 25 preposterous black cards).
categories: Card Game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Divided We Fall: The American Civil War
description:
Divided We Fall presents the events of the American Civil War. As part of our Strategic Decision Series of games, this is a game of skill for two players - there are no random events. Yet, each game is amazingly different from the others - this is because the two players focus their attention on the most crucial decisions, and there are many to be made! USA and CSA troops are scaled from brigades to corps, plus state militias. Forts, naval/riverine and leader counters (army, some corps) are included.

Players are limited to a fixed number of actions per turn - early, the Confederacy gets the most Command Points (actions), later in the war the Union does. Use the Command Points to move leaders - army commanders who can move the armies they're with - or to move individual units which usually move more quickly by themselves. Or use the Command Points to build your defensive works.
There are six turns per year: Winter (Dec-Apr), May, June, July-Aug15, Aug16-Sept, and Oct-Nov. These time frames were selected because the 135 most important civil war battles are spread equally across them.
Reinforcements and leader arrival/departure occurs each turn, and replacements are spread out across each combatant's territories - but the Union gets 11 replacements per turn, while the South gets 7. These 7 are spread among the 7 groups of key ("Flag") cities, which are grouped from the Trans-Mississippi, the Mississippi River, Alabama, Tennessee/Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina and Virginia. As the Union player takes the Flag Cities in each group, CSA replacements decline.

The Confederacy, however, can make a lightning strike into the North, either shooting for Washington DC or other targets which can end the war and the game immediately, or warrant intervention on their behalf from France and Britain.

Movement is point-to-point and is affected by weather and terrain. Access to the rivers and seas gives the Union a significant bonus and the CSA another headache. Sea and river invasions are a staple of Union attacks, but are expensive to conduct and limited in number.
Leaders permit large army movements, but also heavily affect combat, increasing unit effectiveness and reducing losses. Combat is dice-less, based on our algorithms of civil war combat, in which terrain, weather, force size, and leadership all play a role. The biggest army doesn't always win, nor does the one with the best leader!
The Union Navy threatens all the Confederate ports with blockades and invasions, but the CSA's ironclads can block them. The CSA also relies on fortifications to help out, and once these get big the Union must slowly (and expensively) reduce them to force the rebels out.

Political events are included: Missouri, Kentucky and West Virginia all have special considerations. Early occupation of these can provide bonuses to the Confederacy, or deny the Union additional troops.

Scenarios starting in 1862 and 1863 are also included.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Wargame

name: Bambino
description:
This 1930s baseball game, named after Babe Ruth, has a highly unusual gameplay mechanism. It may be the only boardgame where players actually hit a ball with a bat and see the outcome on the board.

The 2" diameter ball is mounted on the top of a foot-long stand ending in a spring fastened under the metal board. The foot-long wooden baseball bat is used to strike the ball, causing the ball stand to fall across the "umpire". This is a curved rubber barrier topped with 25 teeth and a string that runs horizontally through the teeth.

When the ball stand hits the umpire, it pushes into one of the 24 gaps, each of which is numbered. The gap it struck can be seen after the ball bounces back up because it kinks the string at that location. Each number is repeated along the outfield wall along with a result, from Ball or Strike to Home Run or Out.

Each team has a set of wooden peg players, and the play proceeds and is scored like a regular baseball game. There are dials on the board for recording balls, strikes, runs and outs during an inning, and paper scorecards for recording the results of each inning.

Later editions of this game did away with the umpire. Instead, the board had an outfield wall with three holes and a jagged top. The ball was on a string and if it went over the wall, each notch had an outcome like this first edition. In addition, players could score a home run or extra-base hit by getting the ball through one of the holes, but would be out if it hit the wall and bounced off.

name: Daedalus' Dungeon
description:
While exploring ancient Greek ruins on the Island of Crete your party discovered a portal gate. Being the curious and adventurous type your group did not hesitate to pass through the gate. You now find yourselves in a dark dungeon inhabited by a deadly minotaur from which you must escape.

Designed for 1-6 players, Daedalus' Dungeon is a cooperative RPG style dungeon crawler requiring no Game Master.

The object of Daedalus’ Dungeon is to obtain a combined team score of 28 points or exhaust the dungeon tile stack. Your team scores points by defeating the mighty minotaur’s henchmen. Your team shares a hit point poll. If this pool is reduced to zero or the minotaur kills all party members your team will lose the game.

At the start of the game each player chooses a champion and outfits them with gear. On your turn you may move, attack, power up, or share loot/gear with other champions. As the game progresses, you will discover new parts of a randomly generated dungeon while the might minotaur works to hunt you down.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: The Parent Quiz
description:
"The After Dinner Family Trivia Game"

Includes 50 trivia cards with a blank space in each answer block for you to enter your own answer (the questions are about you). Ask the question to your family, the person who correctly guesses gets to keep the card (one point). Highest point total wins.

name: Qenj
description:
The goal of Qenj is to align 4 different color pieces on a same plank.
The pieces can move 1, 2 or 3 planks away in the left-right direction and the player may place them on any empty arrow of the destination plank.

Some other rules must be followed :

There can't be several pieces of the same color on a plank.
The players must move pieces that are on the closest arrow to them.
Empty planks are removed from the game entirely.

name: Konflikt '47: German Army Starter Set
description:
As World War II continues beyond 1945, the battling countries have become even more desperate to develop new super weapons to give them a winning advantage. Exploiting new technologies revealed from the first nuclear explosions, the Axis and Allied forces quickly develop new tanks and strange armoured walkers to become the vanguard of their armies, supported by new highly equipped or terribly twisted troops. With the Soviet Union seceding from the Allies the war now becomes a three-way conflict!

Konflikt ’47 is a standalone game inspired by the hugely successful Bolt Action, designed by Clockwork Goblin Miniatures and produced by Warlord Games and Osprey Publishing. Adding to the core rules that many gamers are familiar with from Bolt Action, Konflikt ’47 allows the addition of completely new types of units and models to existing 28mm Bolt Action armies and the creation of completely new forces set in the alternate future of 1947.

Konflikt ’47 introduces ‘Weird War’ weaponry – including the stunning range of walkers and other mechanical monstrosities!

Contains:

A5 softback Konflikt '47 rulebook
1 Spinne Light Panzermech
1 PzIV-X medium tank
24 Grenadiers
8 Totenkorps
pin markers
6 six-sided dice
6 Orders dice
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Shibboleth
description: Shibboleth is a five round micro strategy game for 2-4 players. In Shibboleth you play as a member of one of eight socioeconomic classes living in a city that is in the middle of a bloody revolution. In each round just like in each revolution throughout history there is a class that leads the revolution, a class that does the dirty work, and a class that is blamed for the hardships of the past. These three classes will be random each round. With 512 different possible combinations each revolution may be similar to events from history, or completely original. Players will have to use deceit and cunning to bide their time and escape to freedom, or turn on one another and join the revolution. Each round takes 3-5 minutes to play and is completely unique.

name: Grand Fleets: Tsar & Emperor
description:
From the publisher:

Tsar & Emperor is the second scenario book for Grand Fleets, covering naval engagements during the first year of the Russo-Japanese War.

At the turn of the century, the idea that an upstart Asian nation could defeat one of the European Great Powers was laughable. Japan may have unexpectedly prevailed against China ten years earlier, but few had any doubts Russian battleships would make quick work of the Combined Fleet.

Admiral T≈çg≈ç largely answered those doubts with his surprise attack on Port Arthur. The war which followed was the first to translate the rapid technological advances of the late 19th century into massive casualty counts, presaging the killing fields of Flanders, leading many to dub it World War Zero.

In addition to eight historical scenarios, Tsar & Emperor contains a total of 160 individual ship cards, including more than 80 named ships from over 50 different classes of the Imperial Japanese and Russian Navies, alongside selected ships of the pre-World War period from the United States, Great Britain, France, Italy, Greece, Spain, the Chinese Beiyang Fleet, and the Ottoman Empire.

Can you preserve the honor of the Tsar against naked aggression? Or will you advance the Emperor's dream of a modern Japan, taking her rightful place on the world stage?
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Broskams
description:
An alien race known as the Broskams have just finished their annual winter hibernation and there is only one thing on their minds, to get out of the hibernation cave and get some warmth!

Broskams is a 2-4 player card drafting, simultaneous action selection, tile laying and tile manipulation game that takes place over four rounds. The player with the most warmth points (victory points) at the end of the fourth round is the winner of the game!

At the beginning of each round, every player receives 6 cards that represents the different Broskams and each of their special powers. The players will draft these cards one at a time and pass the remaining to the players on their left (and right depending on the round) until they have a new hand of 6 cards. After that, the players will choose one of their 6 cards and reveal them simultaneously. Then, starting with the first player, everyone will use the card they revealed to either place one of their Broskams onto the board (leave the cave) or use the special ability printed on the card, moving their Broskams closer to the sun for more warmth points!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Black Panther
description:
Description from the publisher:
T'Challa is a brilliant tactician, strategist, scientist, tracker and a master of all forms of unarmed combat whose unique hybrid fighting style incorporates acrobatics and aspects of animal mimicry. He fights to achieve his goals and protect the kingdom of Wakanda.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Hawkeye
description:
Description from the publisher:

Clinton Barton, code name Hawkeye, is a former S.H.I.E.L.D. agent and founding member of the Avengers. Barton has no real superpowers but is the world's greatest marksman armed with a recurve bow. Due to his work with shield, Hawkeye is has a very close friendship with Black Widow.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers
